Name: Cyber Security Analyst - SOC Lead
Description: Cyber Security Lead Analyst - SOC A client of Opus are searching for a 2IC to join their CSOC team, based in Sydney. This role supports the SOC Manager to maintain day to day operations within the CSOC and remains hands on across full SOC services (Vulnerability maangement, incident response, Threat intel etc.) You will mentor and coach junior members of the team, lead the technical response for incidents, identify and contribute to operational improvement initiatives and act as an escalation point within the SOC for technical matters.Experience: 3-4 years experience within a Security Operations Centre/or equivalentBAU security delivery positionKnowledge of TCP/IP protocols, network analysis and network/security applications and technical security solutionsStrong technical hands-on experience across a range of Security technologies; including Palo Alto Networks, Cisco, Splunk, Trend Micro, Carbon Black, Zscaler, Mimecast, Microsoft Sentinel or similarStrong communication skills and a hunger to learn, grow and mentor.Ability to co-ordinate with other internal SOC team membersAwesome company with a great team of Security professionals, allowing opportunities to grow and move across in other areas. If you would like to know more about this opportunity please apply now and your application will be handled ASAP. Interviews are happening this week for an ASAP start.

Name: Lead Cyber Security Operations Analyst
Description: AC3 are currently looking for a Lead Cyber Security Analyst/Lead SOC Analyst. You will be the Lead Cyber Analyst/SOC Analyst in our Blue team, reporting directly to the SOC Manager. Leading from the front managing the end-to-end incidents response lifecycle, pulling apart malware, responsible for defence tactics, techniques and procedures. Coaching and mentoring a team of 4 which is set to grow. AC3 supports a wide range of environments across Public and Private sector, giving you a broad exposure of customers and technology. Who are AC3? AC3 is a privately owned Australian ICT Managed Services Provider (MSP). Founded in 1999, our purpose is to make technology real and with over 14.000 virtual machines under management, we do this for more than half of the NSW State Government agencies and over 1000 commercial customers.    We are a growing business with a focus on three technology areas – Cloud, Infrastructure and DevOps, Cyber Security, and Applications & Data. We support our customers at every step of their technology journey, Change your business, Run your business in the cloud, Secure your business, Get more value from IT and Find the right people    AC3 is a business built on its people. We believe magic happens when we combine our people with the best technologies. We pride ourselves on the service we deliver every step of the way. Our people live by our purpose to “make technology real” and our vision “to have the opportunity to help every organisation in ANZ be a hero for their customers”.    Culture Voted 4th Best Place to work in 2021. Culture is a top priority at AC3. We approach business with family values, which means people here have real relationships that go beyond work. We believe it’s important that everyone is heard and treated with respect, whether you have the next big idea or simply a question. We keep it simple and live by our fours ways of being:    Own It: If I say I’m going to do it, I do it. And I give it my all. Better It: I take the current status quo and make it better. Brave It: I listen, say what needs to be said, and do the right thing. Especially when it’s tough. Enjoy It: I take my work seriously, but don’t take myself too seriously.    The role As a Cyber Security Operations SOC Lead, you will call the plays and direct the action at the very frontline of our Cyber Security Operations Centre (CSOC). You understand how to detect, respond and remediate security threats, have a good grasp of technology and the components that underpin modern ICT environments, and are comfortable working with a wide range of technologies. Your passion for cyber security across emerging tech and trends is unparalleled, and combined with your strong problem-solving skills, people management and leadership skills as well as an excellent organisational and communication skillset, you support a small, multidisciplinary operational team technical team.   As part of the Cyber Security Practice, this role works closely with the SOC Manager, other teams within the Practice and other technical operations teams to deliver quality cyber security services to our customers. This role supports the SOC Manager to maintain day to day operations within the CSOC and spans the delivery of SOC services including vulnerability management, security monitoring, incident response, threat intelligence and reporting, as well as other security related and ad hoc functions and tasks. You will mentor and coach junior members of the team, manage on call and operational rosters, lead the technical response for incidents, identify and contribute to operational improvement initiatives and act as an escalation point within the SOC for technical matters.    About you  At least 4 years experience across a broad range of technology streams, including Systems, Infrastructure, SaaS, Private and Public Cloud 1-2 years leadership experience 3-4 years experience within a Security Operations Centre/or equivalent BAU security delivery position Knowledge of TCP/IP protocols, network analysis and network/security applications and technical security solutions Strong technical hands-on experience across a range of Security technologies; including Palo Alto Networks, Cisco, Splunk, Trend Micro, Carbon Black, Zscaler, Mimecast, Microsoft Sentinel or similar Strong communication skills and a hunger to learn, grow and mentor.  Ability to co-ordinate with other internal SOC team members, handle escalations and direct follow up and response activities Ability to be a point of Incident escalation and provide guidance and sound advice to other SOC team members.  What’s in it for you?  Up to $150,000 P.A, 5% bonus, plus super Investment in your certifications (approx $5K) Offer you career development, choose your Cyber Security Career path Provide you with True Flexibility in the workplace Offer to purchase additional annual leave Personal and professional development. We offer a range of training, from access online learning portals to technical training, to custom-built in-house training programs. Our people are the backbone of our business and we believe in providing them every opportunity to grow and develop. Salary continuance insurance to every employee with our default Super provider, as well as discounted private health insurance from a major provider. Recognise and reward - when our team have done a great job, we want to make sure they know! We have several programs to recognise and reward our employees, such as our peer-to-peer recognition initiative (ACE of the Month/Year) and our manager recognition initiative (ACE'd IT). Celebrations! - We eagerly await our EOFY celebration and Christmas party every year. We also hold an additional family Christmas picnic to say thanks to your families/partners/friends/anyone who support you behind the scenes. We also host a bunch of other fun social activities throughout the year.  We're looking for someone who can mentor if needed and is technically exceptional! If you have a proven track record of success with identifying and managing cyber incidents and are looking for an opportunity to lead by example, then please apply and one of our consultants will be in touch to discuss further!

threats and ways to manage themPlan for disaster recovery and create contingency plans in the event of any security breachesMonitor for attacks, intrusions and unusual, unauthorized or illegal Name: Specialist - SOC Analyst
Description: Among Australia's earliest adopters of the Google platform and agile methodologies, we are continually investing in future-focused IT solutions. We seek curious, innovative, and resourceful technology experts to help us pave the way and to make the most valuable impact. About the role We currently have an opportunity for an experienced SOC Analyst  This role is part of the Security Operations Centre reporting to the Senior Manager - Incident Response. The Security Operations Centre (SOC) is responsible for the configuration and running of critical security tools as well as the monitoring and response of security related incidents across the Woolworths Group What you'll do As a SOC Analyst at Woolworths Group, you will be a part of a growing team of experts tasked with defending our iconic brands from cyber threats. Each team member is responsible for the full range of activities in the threat detection and incident response process. You will be using security tools to monitor and respond to attacks against the Woolworths Group.  As the Security Analyst you will:  Respond to and resolve security related requests, alerts, and incidents within agreed Service Level Agreements (SLA's) Conduct, participate, and provide suggestions for improvement opportunities in post incident reviews. Develop and maintain security detections using agile methodologies. Develop and maintain security related documentation. Participate in security drill exercises. Drive automation efficiencies.  About you  We are so much more than great supermarkets; we are a team of great people connected through our shared values. We innovate continually to meet the ever-evolving needs of protecting our customers. To be successful in this role, you will have developed analytical, communication, and interpersonal skills. Ideally, you will demonstrate a strong understanding of the following key areas:   Tertiary qualifications at degree level in an appropriate discipline, or equivalent industry relevant experience. Exposure to common security tools with SPLUNK (highly regarded). Experience in managing significant security incidents. Working knowledge of the kill chain methodology. Experience in the various stages of Incident Response. Strong understanding of information security. Strong understanding of networking and protocols. The ability to work in both a team environment and independently. Driving business outcomes. Effective verbal and written communication skills with an ability to manage multiple stakeholders during incidents. Appropriate current or recent qualifications from SANS, ITIL, and Vendor certifications.  Above all, we seek innovators and thought leaders who will help us bring a little good to everyone, every day.   Grow with the Group Woolworths Group has announced it will be requiring Australian team members to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 (subject to medical and religious exemptions). As an inclusive, team-first company, our people are at the core of everything we do.  We care deeply about creating a workplace where our team members feel valued, respected and empowered. We are committed to providing equal opportunity regardless of gender identity, ethnicity, disability, sexual orientation or life stage. We are proud to be recognised as a Gold Tier Employer in the Australian Workplace Equality Index for LGBTQ+ inclusion and as an Employer of Choice for Gender Equality by the Workplace Gender Equality Agency. As our Group continues to evolve, innovate and support our communities, we encourage our team members to do the same with their own careers, by providing ongoing opportunities to grow and make a real difference.  We value flexibility, and encourage our team members to work in ways that meet their work/life commitments and support their wellbeing.  We work hard to create a safe and inclusive environment for all, and most importantly, we're all about creating better experiences - for our customers and for each other. We'd love to hear from You If you meet a number of the requirements, but not all, we encourage you to submit your application. You can learn more about working with us on LinkedIn [link removed] or via www.wowcareers.com.au [link removed]. #LI #work180. Our Talent Acquisition Team and Hiring Leaders kindly request no unsolicited resumes or approaches from Recruitment Agencies. Woolworths Group is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.

Name: Cyber Security Advisor
Description: Cyber Security Advisor  Ongoing/Permanent - Clerk Grade 7/8  SYDNEY  About the Role  Cyber Security NSW is looking for a Cyber Security Advisor to join their team. This role is a great opportunity for those seeking to develop their skills and experience in the cyber security industry, being involved in important policy initiatives to help improve cyber security across NSW Government.  Reporting to the Manager in the Policy Development and Coordination team, you will be responsible for the following:Supporting the development of advice on cyber security issues within relevant strategies, programs, and policies across NSW GovernmentResearch and analysis of emerging issues, risks and opportunities impacting cyber security within NSW government, other States and Territories and Federal governmentEngage internal and external stakeholders to produce briefings, presentations, workshops and documents (e.g. guidance and templates) to support whole-of-government initiatives and assist Clusters and agencies with enhancing cyber security capabilitiesApplying technical and/or advisory skills and experience to help shape whole-of-government cyber security initiatives and support the ongoing improvement of the NSW Cyber Security Policy and supplementary resourcesAbout You To be successful in the role you will have:Experience and knowledge of cyber security or related fields (e.g. roles in professional services / consulting / ICT / digital / operations) and the ability to quickly develop this knowledgeGood verbal and written communication skills, including being able to communicate complex technical and/or strategic policy issues and advice to a wide range of stakeholdersAn ability to think critically and apply problem solving skills to complex challengesAn ability to work effectively on simultaneous projects within defined timeframes and in an environment of conflicting and changing prioritiesEssential RequirementsAustralian CitizenshipAbility to obtain and maintain a Baseline National Security ClearanceAbout Cyber Security NSW  Cyber Security NSW is a whole-of-government function located within Digital.NSW in the Department of Customer Service. We are responsible for ensuring a cyber safe NSW. The protection of our systems and digital information is important because of the many essential services NSW Government provides including health, emergency services, and transport. Furthermore, the exciting digital transformation being undertaken across NSW Government requires similarly enhanced cyber capabilities.  At the centre of this exciting and growing cyber capability, Cyber Security NSW is working across NSW Government to:Create a whole-of-government integrated approach to managing cyber risk and responding to cyber security threatsIncrease cyber skills and awarenessUnderstand the risks from cyber threats to our digital information and systemsSet cyber security standardsEnsure we know how to respond if a damaging cyber incident occurs Salary Grade 7/8, with the base salary for this role starting at 99,431 base plus superannuation  Click Here to access the Role Description. For enquiries relating to recruitment please contact Caitlin Birrell via caitlin.birrell@customerservice.nsw.gov.au.  Closing Date: Tuesday 19th July 2022 at 9:59am  Working at Department of Customer Service  The Department of Customer Service (DCS) is a great place to work! Our values of accountability, trust, service, and integrity drive our initiatives and culture. We support innovative programs in areas as broad as digital government, consumer protection and major public works. We are an inclusive organisation that celebrates diversity and flexible work practices and believe our people are our greatest asset.  Visit our Careers site to find out what it means to work for us.  Our Commitment to Diversity, Inclusion & Flexibility  We are committed to diversity, inclusion, and new ways of working.  The Department of Customer Service serves all the people of NSW and we want to reflect that diversity in our people. We welcome and encourage applications from people with disability, Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples, culturally and linguistically diverse groups, the LGBTIQA+ community, veterans, carers, refugees, people in regional NSW and people of all ages. We strive to be an inclusive workplace where all our people can bring their authentic selves to work without judgement.  We understand that there are different ways of getting the job done and offer flexible working arrangements where and when possible.  If you do require an adjustment during the recruitment process, please notify us on your application form or contact the recruiter via caitlin.birrell@customerservice.nsw.gov.au or 02 9566 8873.

Name: Senior Security Analyst
Description: About Breville Over the past 80+ years Breville has grown to become an iconic global brand, delivering kitchen products to over 70 countries around the globe. Breville enhances people's lives through the delivery of brilliant innovation and thoughtful design based on deep consumer insights, empowering people to do things more impressively or easily than they'd thought possible in their own home and ultimately allowing them to "Master Every Moment".   About the role  Reporting to the Group Security and Compliance Manager, the Senior Security Analyst is responsible for the management and ongoing development of the Modern Workplace Security Platforms and associated supporting systems and processes across the Breville Group.  This is a permanent, full-time position based in Alexandria, Sydney.Key responsibilities include:Manage process and best practices for information security including Email and Web Security, Microsoft Office 365 Security, Microsoft ATP, Azure Security Centre, firewalls, CASB, DLP, endpoint security and VPNReview identified security risks and breaches to ensure the organization's assets and information are always appropriately securedEvaluate and consult on new technology and security solutionsAdopt and implement security best practicesManaging, monitoring, responding and improving Breville security postureManage all security events and take lead responsibility in any major security incident response activityManage a range of security related services including operation, security incident and event management, breach investigation, virus and patch management, supporting system penetration testing and vulnerabilityManage security for on premise and Cloud services such as Office365, Microsoft Azure IAAS, SAAS platforms, Linux, etcDeploy and Support SIEM technologyBuild, implement and own complete security solutionsImplement security solutions as per agreed security roadmapAssist with the design and operational aspects of a cyber security framework/strategyManagement and ongoing development of Breville security awareness programProject management of both internal and external resources as required for Modern Workplace Security projectsDevelop and maintain an understanding of Cyber Security industry issues, trendsWe're Interested in Hearing from People Who Have:Tertiary qualifications in Information Technology, Business or related disciplines or equivalent relevant experienceITIL V3 Foundation or HigherCISSP Certified or equivalent (desirable)Technical security certifications in Microsoft Azure and/or Microsoft Office 365 (desirable)2 - 3 Years' experience in Cyber Security OperationsOperational experience in security systems, including, firewalls, CASB, Endpoint securityAn understanding of network security, network design, security architectureExperience in managing Cyber security in agile environmentsWorking knowledge/experience of Azure, Office 365Experience working with ITIL aligned processesKnowledge of modern network and cloud technologiesDemonstrated Enterprise SecurityExperience in firewall management, SIEM, DLP, dashboard creating and reportingCloud security operations will be highly regardedExperience in threat hunting and remediation solutions Breville Group is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer.

Name: Cyber Security Consultant

Name: Information Security Specialist - Splunk
Description: So, why Optus?At Optus, we don't sit back and let the future happen to us - we're out there making it. By expanding into new technology and relentlessly improving every day, we're creating a better tomorrow for all Australians. We believe in the strength of a vibrant, diverse and inclusive workforce where backgrounds, perspectives and life experiences of our people help us innovate and create strong connections with our customers. About the roleInformation Security Specialist (ISS) provides industry-leading security management, monitoring, administration, and support services to Optus Enterprise and clients (as required). This role will support the security solutions and services to meet the client's specific requirements; or to support Information Security Team in delivering desired outcomes that primarily include building, operating security monitoring solutions, emerging threats, dark web monitoring, review of technical solutions, infrastructure, design. This is a hands-on technical / analyst role providing configuration changes, technical analysis on data or products. This role does not provide direct consultancy to customers but may deliver reports to the customer directly or to internal Optus teams or working in collaboration with one or many security/delivery managers. The ISS need to work closely with various internal and external partners and provide observations and recommendations for key decisions in the area of security, which may include operational technical support, and other duties supporting the client and / or internal Optus environment. Key Responsibilities Analyse complex cases involving a pattern of security events from SIEM, and other security data sources. Splunk experience is preferred. Develop and tune use cases, alerts, reports, custom dashboards and further enhancement Build, improve, and document processes for the management and monitoring of security solutions. Work with technical teams on log onboarding. Baseline and improve threat detection thresholds and improve detection methods. Configure, manage, and upgrade Security Information and Event Monitoring (SIEM) platforms. Involve in the operational support of the environment to ensure platform availability. Act as a point of contact to the account management and delivery teams for all operational security related reporting for the customer account. On a periodic basis, meet with the security and account team to review security reports, status, review any risks, issues, incidents, and outstanding activities.  About you Minimum 3-5 years' experience as an Information Security Specialist, Analyst in Security operations especially in security monitoring and network security domains. Advanced Knowledge and experience of SIEM (Splunk) Technologies (Logging, monitoring, Triage, reporting of Security alerts and Incidents, and processes) is a must. Scripting knowledge is desired for reporting purposes. Self-motivated, proactive team player who can work to contribute to the Optus team success Experience in assessing information security solutions with working experience on Security products that will include some of the following: SIEM, IDS/IPS, Vulnerability Management, Proxies, End point protection Security Analysis experience to include incident classification, investigation and remediation Certification(s) in Security Sector (CISSP, CISM, CRISC or similar) preferred Awareness of ISO 27001 and SOC2 standard.  We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation. As a provider of essential services across Australia, Optus has a critical role in the community through keeping our customers connected to the people they love and the things that matter. It is also our priority to ensure we provide our amazing people and our customers with a healthy and safe workplace environment. In light of the significant risks posed by COVID-19, Optus expects all workers to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19, and will require vaccination for certain roles as well as access to Optus workplaces. Please speak to us if you have any questions about this policy or how it impacts you, including any concerns you might have about meeting this requirement. We understand that flexibility means different things to different people. We're proud to offer a variety of options to work in different ways, such as our Blended Ways of Working and job share. Our Blended Ways of Working lets our people work across home and our offices. Please talk to us about how we can make this role work for you. Curious about our culture? Go behind the scenes with our people by searching #OptusLife on LinkedIn. Please no recruitment agencies, we'll be managing this role in-house. Any resumes submitted outside of our process will be deemed the sole property of Optus.

Name: Senior Cyber Security Analyst
Description:
All Systems GO! Be part of the next generation of defence technology
Opportunity to contribute to programs of national significance whilst growing your skills in Cyber Security
Enjoy flexibility, engaging work and a culture that embraces diversity and open-mindedness

 
At BAE Systemswe are all systems go as we continue to drive innovation and seek passionate and talented people to join our business. We currently have a new opportunity as a Senior Cyber Security Analyst within our IM&T Cyber Governance Team based in Adelaide.
What this opportunity will mean for you:

Purposeful work where your efforts are recognized in an environment where you can thrive
Joining an organisation that is passionate about developing some of the most impressive careers in the world  
Industry-leading flexibility options to unlock the talent and diversity of every individual
A strong safety culture, inclusive teams and work to be proud of, underpinned by a compelling set of values

 
Your new role:
The Senior Cyber Security Analyst will be involved with the selection, implementation and production phase of an automated Governance, Risk and Compliance Toolset. This toolset will enable BAE Systems Australia to effectively capture, aggregate, share, and mitigate enterprise and operational risk, regulatory compliance, audit, and third-party risk in a single and centralised environment.
The role will be both GRC (Governance, Risk and Compliance) and Cyber technical in nature. The Senior Cyber Security Analyst is expected to operate with highly technical personnel in the deployment and assessment of Cyber solutions designed to meet both business and compliance objectives. 
More specifically, you will:

Assist with the management, development of operational risk policies and procedures, governance framework, risk assessment, risk screening and risk mitigation. 
Introduce gap analyses, business process analyses and strategic process improvements. 
Provide change management leadership; develop comprehensive internal audit plans including clear scope, objectives, and milestones to evaluate efficiency and effectiveness of the control infrastructure.
Strengthen processes, systems, governance controls and frameworks.

Assist with security design input in relation to Cloud, Web, Application, IT and OT Infrastructure.
Provide specialist technical security support to the Cyber Governance Team.
Suggest, and where appropriate, implement improvements to current assessment processes.
Comply with legislation and company policies, processes and instructions, including those relating to non-discrimination, safety and duty of care and the quality management system.
Where directed provide support with security operations such as vulnerability management, logging and monitoring, data loss prevention, annual penetration testing, auditing and incidents.
Support accreditation and compliance activities where directed by the Cyber Governance Manager.



 
About you
As an ideal applicant for this opportunity, you'll have:

Bachelor Degree in Computer Science, Engineering or equivalent.
Certifications are highly desired including CISSP, CEH, CCSP, SANS, etc.
Experience working with industry standards and compliance frameworks including PCI, SOX, ISO27001, NIST, CIS, ISM etc.
Working knowledge of information systems security policies, standards and practices (e.g., access control and system hardening, system audit and log file monitoring, security policies, and incident handling).
Demonstrated experience and security knowledge of one or more of the following platforms: Windows/Unix/Linux/Cisco IOS.
Working knowledge / experience of protocols and technologies such as TCP, UDP, and TLS.
Excellent stakeholder engagement and management skills, with a sound ability to leverage this into understanding ongoing customer value preferences.

 
Clearances 
As Defence security clearance is required for this role, applicants must be Australian citizens and eligible to obtain and maintain appropriate clearance. 
Further information regarding clearances is available at: https://careers.au.baesystems.com/opportunity.html
Applications should be addressed to: Calvin Ebenezer, Talent Acquisition Specialist - IM&T and made online here. Confidential enquiries are welcome via email: calvin.ebenezer@baesystems.com
We are a 2021 Circle Back Initiative Employer - we commit to respond to every applicant.
Our culture
We are committed to building a diverse and inclusive environment where our people can thrive. For us that means ensuring that the voices and talents of our employees are valued and that everyone has a sense of belonging. We do not tolerate discrimination because of differences, such as age, ability, ethnicity, gender, gender identity or expression, religion, or sexual orientation.
If you would like to know more information about how we are supporting our employees, you can view our policies and initiatives via this link.
To learn about other employment opportunities at BAE Systems, please visit: www.baesystemscareers.com.au

Name: Security Analyst
Description: Security Analyst CyberCX is Australia’s leading independent cyber security consultancy organisation. To support our rapid growth, we are looking motivated and passionate Security Analysts to work in our Brisbane office. In this role, you’ll work with your team to deliver great client outcomes and grow your career rapidly as a cyber security professional.    We’re looking for candidates that have a sound and relevant technical background. You don’t need extensive experience in security, but a passion to learn, a great attitude, and a keen interest in security is essential. You will receive formal and on the job training that will help you grow your career in the cyber security field.   This role is part of our Managed Security Services team and will require participation in a rotating shift schedule.  Key responsibilities:      Technical analysis of alerts and data from security products including (but not limited to) SIEMs, Intrusion detection and prevention systems, end point security solutions, web proxies and network security devices, and vulnerability scanning and management systems  Incident response, including liaising with customers and their ICT operations staff  Vulnerability analysis including triaging vulnerabilities and advising on associated remediation activities. Taking on a wide variety of security operations tasks on an as needed basis.       About you:      Ideally 2+ years’ experience or equivalent knowledge in Security Operations or an ICT technical team  A general technical understanding of contemporary ICT technologies achieved through real world experience (experience in system administration, network administration and/or software development all regarded highly)  Solid analytical, conceptual, and problem-solving abilities  Great written and verbal communications skills  Passionate about growth and learning. You’re continuously finding ways to grow your skills through self-study, technical projects, CTFs and engagement in technical forums  Programming or scripting experience strongly preferred, but not required  Academic background in CS or IT strongly preferred, but not required  Willing to take part in a rotation schedule and perform shift work  Australian Citizen or Permanent Resident      What’s in it for you:     Be part of an innovative, forward-thinking Security Operations team that is committed to excellence  Extensive on-the-job training and certification support  Continuous growth and professional development opportunities  You will be surrounded by technical security specialists, including some of Australia’s best security practitioners        About CyberCX   CyberCX has united Australia and New Zealand’s most trusted cyber security companies to deliver the most comprehensive end to end cyber security services offering to enterprises and governments. With a workforce of over 900 cyber security professionals and a footprint of over 20 offices across Australia and New Zealand and global presence in Europe and US, CyberCX offers a full suite of cyber security services.   This is a fantastic opportunity for an enthusiastic professional looking to spread their wings. If you’re looking to continuously grow and to embrace disruptive methods and technologies to protect customers, submit your CV by following the “Apply” button.

Name: Cyber Security Specialist
Description: Seeking Cyber Security Specialist with different level of experience for an independent statutory agency within Federal Government, that supports thousands of Australians with a significant and permanent disability and their families and careers. As The Cyber Security Specialist, you will apply an understanding of the functions to provide advice to senior management. You will be responsible for influencing and developing strategy, policies, priorities and operational practices in support of the client’s objectives.Responsibilities:Assessing the cyber security posture of external stakeholders to the client, and providing advice internally to mitigate risk.Provide advice and complete work to ensure that the Agency meets all legal and regulatory for Agency Information Technology security, including remaining up-to-date with amendments to the Information Security Manual (ISM) and PSPF;Consulting on, writing and providing oversight of the creation of policies and procedures;Provision of advice and guidance on cyber trends, most likely and dangerous threats, applicable security controls and standards;Oversight, peer review and completion of risk assessmentsAdditional Information:Reference Number: 365773Location: ACT or VictoriaRequirement: Australian CitizenIf this role is of interest to you, please APPLY NOW, or contact Sarah Plamio on 02 6113 7537 or via email on sarah.plamio@igniteco.com.

Name: Cyber Security Opportunities At All Levels
Description:
The Opportunities
Due to sustained growth Boeing Defence Australia (BDA) is rapidly growing its cyber security capabilities to meet the needs of an ever changing world.
We are now recruiting for a number of positions across multiple programs at both senior and junior levels:
1. Senior Cyber Security Specialists.2. Cyber Security Leads.3. Cyber Security Governance and Compliance specialists.4. Cyber Risk and Threat Analysts.5. Cyber Security Architects.6. Cyber Operations/Security Analysts.7. Network Security Specialists.8. Cyber Infrastructure.
We are committed to building a diverse and inclusive workplace.

Female applicants
People of Aboriginal or Torres Strait Island descent
Ex-defence personnel

Are encouraged to apply. 
Roles exist in Brisbane, Adelaide and Williamtown.

Boeing Defence Australia offers a flexible work/life balance including work from home opportunities; however employees must be able to attend the office on a weekly basis.
Relocation costs may be covered for successful applicants by Boeing Defence Australia.

Responsibilities
Working in the BDA Information & Cyber Security Capability you will have the opportunity to contribute to a number of exciting and innovative programs, working across air, land, sea and space, while bringing your information security expertise to bear on world class Defence capabilities.
Responsibilities might include:

Interfacing with our customer on all matters relating to information security and Cyberworthiness.
Evaluating and responding to emerging security issues. Identify cyber security risks/gaps and coordinating actions to meet objectives.
Participating in evaluation of process effectiveness and identifying areas for improvement.
Delivering sound and timely information security design advice. Recommending technological or procedural solutions to meet security control intent in support of engineering projects.
Analysing and documenting information security events. Identifying root causes, prioritising threats and recommending and/or implementing corrective actions. Testing and deploying risk mitigation processes and tools.
Close collaboration with the BDA Capabilities in particular the Mission Systems and Ground Segment Capability.
Contributing to and supporting information security operations, incident response and mitigation activities.

Experience/Qualifications
To be successful you will have expertise in some of the below:

Knowledge of (or ability to learn about) Australian Defence Security Policy Framework and associated standards such as Australian Cyber Security Centre Information Security Manual.
Understanding of developing and implementing information security practices in an engineering environment.
Expertise with Defence or Australian Intelligence Community (AIC) Information Security System design and architectures.
Strong written and verbal communications skills and the ability to clearly articulate complex security concepts to a broad and diverse audience.
Sound information security knowledge across some/all of the following environments is desirable:

Network Security.
Host based security.
Defence Accreditation and Certification process.
Threat risk analysis.
Container security.
Pentesting.



Applicants must be Australian Citizens to meet defence security requirements.
If you meet even some of these criteria we encourage you to apply due to the variety of different roles.
About Us
Boeing Defence Australia is shaping the future of aerospace and delivering some of the nation's most important programs for the Australian Defence Force. As a BDA employee, you will join other innovative, ethical people who have the critical skills required to develop and deliver world class capabilities and systems to protect Australia and its national interests. Joining us is a chance to make your mark, working with a diverse team that is united in pushing the boundaries of imagination and excellence.
At Boeing, we innovate and collaborate to make the world a better place. From the seabed to outer space, you can contribute to work that matters with a company where diversity, equity and inclusion are core values. We're committed to fostering an environment for every teammate that's welcoming, respectful and inclusive, with great opportunity for professional growth. Find your future with us.
Benefits

Flexible working options
Family friendly work life balance
Study assistance
Salary packaging
Employee Incentive Program
Global opportunities

Boeing has implemented a new COVID-19 Vaccination Policy in Australia that requires all new Boeing Australia hires to show proof of being fully vaccinated from COVID-19, or have an approved medical exemption. This role is categorised as Group 1 under the Boeing Australia COVID-19 Vaccination and Safety Controls Policy.
If you are ready to join an innovative industry leader and would like to register your interest in working for Boeing, please click Apply Now.

Name: Security Operations Center Technical Team Lead
Description: This national energy infrastructure business in solar, wind, hydrogen, electricity and gas sectors has an exciting new SOC Technical Team Lead position available to join the security operations group.  The position can be a full time work from home and hybrid home and office based in Melbourne.sThe SOC Technical Team Lead is responsible for managing the on-going operations and Cyber SOC operations team, in the detection and response to security threats.  To be successful, the SOC Technical Team Lead will have significant experience managing SOC Analysts and knowledge of security and threat intelligence tools and platforms such as SIEM.  You will have excellent stakeholder engagement along with great leadership and communication ability. This is a great opportunity for an experienced Senior SOC Analyst / SOC Team Lead move to the next step in their career. In return you will work with a skilled team and supportive management in a secure large national corporate organisation, excellent remuneration of up to $220k p.a excluding annual bonus, technical training, career development plans, employee benefits, work-life balance and employee assistance programs. This is unique opportunity to take your career to the next level so please don’t miss out, apply now

Name: Senior Security Analyst
Description: About the companyGlobal Financial Service OrganisationWork in their Global SOC teamTransition to leadership role in future About the role This role sits within the Global SOC team for a financial services organisation and will be responsible for level 3 analyst and Incident Response work. in a Managed SOC team, responsible for second and third level security analyst style work. The initial alert and triage work is handled by the team of less senior analysts, you will digging your teeth into more complicated IOC's and more advanced Incident Response tasks. There is all of the standard tools you would expect to find in the environment including a variety of SIEM, EDR and Vulnerability Management solutions. A somewhat unique aspect of this role is you will be involved with 'C' level briefing situations, a great way to develop your skills in this area for future leadership roles.Culture / BenefitsMature environment with well established processesA truly great manager for this teamCulture of thorough and high quality workMulti-cultural and flexible environment DutiesAct as an escalation point for the security analyst teamAdvanced triage and remediation work across IOC'sIncident ResponseLiaising with senior non-technical stakeholders Skills and experienceMinimum 5 years experience as a security analystExperience with a variety of tooling - SIEM, EDR, VMKnowledge across MITRE ATT&CK frameworkIT Security Control, OSI Model, TCP/IP experienceIncident Response skills and experienceUniversity Degree or Vendor certifications highly regarded

Name: Security Analyst
Description: Senior Security EngineerMultiple contract opportunity in security spaceExperience with Security Systems, IDS/IPS, WAF, SIEM, DLPGreat work environmentOur client is seeking for Security Analyst to join their amazing team!! Apply Now.  Key Responsibilities Assists with security assessments through vulnerability testing and risk analysis; generating reports for to evaluate the efficacy of the security policies in place; * monitors network traffic to detect potential threats and then responding to these threats promptly; * Analyses ongoing security events to detect the emergence of new security trends; * Security Analytics. * Experience in Security operations and incident response. * Experience analysing security logs and events, creating SIEM detection cases, responding to incidents, developing IR playbooks, and developing automation playbook * Proficiency with the following products: o Signal Sciences or similar Web application Firewall Enterprise firewall, e.g. Meraki/CiscoSkills & ExperienceProficiency with MS Office 365 o MS Defender ATP / MS Defender for cloud - MS Azure, MS Sentinel or similar SIEM o Signal Sciences or similar Web application Firewall, Enterprise firewall like Meraki/CiscoExperience with security technologies such as Firewalls, Web and Email Security Systems, IDS/IPS, WAF, SIEM, DLP, Vulnerability Management, Encryption, Security Monitoring, Threat Intelligence andHow to Apply  If you are interested and possess the right experience, please apply now via the link below Contact: Priyanka Shah - (08) 9423 1405 - (Job reference: 246510)

Name: Senior Business Analyst - Cyber Security
Description: Clarrow are working with a prestigious top 4 bank in Australia on their latest role looking for a Senior Business Analyst within the Group Security Domain. The program is focused on uplifting the companies security controls to establish an optimised and frictionless Cyber Security capability to protect customers and colleagues, support business growth and enable a cyber-resilient environment.The program will run projects across all of Group Security, including:  Data Protection Identity and Access Management Cyber Security Governance, Risk and Compliance Physical Security  Role: The deliveries will follow an agile methodology and the BA is expected to be flexible. The BA’s assignment will vary according to the individual initiatives being addressed by the domain. The BA may work on more than one project at a time. The range of activities may include:  Defining business, functional & non-functional requirements Decomposing work through the agile lifecycle down to user stories Process modelling and control design Defining governance frameworks Defining technical operating models Involvement in operational acceptance and BAU Handover activities Identifying and defining business value for initiatives and features Facilitate prioritisation in accordance with business need Input to/ documentation for an RFP. Analysis of vendor responses to RFP. Defining POC success criteria Traceability of requirements from discovery to implementation  Experience required:  5 years Business Analysis or transferrable work experience. IT degree or Technology experience Identity and access management BA's highly desired Experience within/Knowledge of the Security domain is highly desirable Experience within the banking/financial industry Strong understanding of Agile methodologies Advanced critical thinking and problem-solving skills Strong verbal and written communication skills Strong stakeholder management skills Ability to learn new knowledge quickly and come to terms with and apply principles and practices within a short timeframe   Personal attributes expected for the role include:  Proactive problem solver Strong team player and able to work within dynamic team structures focused on an end outcome Ability to work to a pre-agreed level of quality and detail within pre-determined timeframes Ability to work with ambiguity and changes in direction, including maintaining focus during times of lack of clarity Good engagement skills which can be utilised across a diverse group of stakeholders Willingness to learn  Benefits:  The company is committed to gender equality and are proud to be an equal opportunity employer and have a diverse and inclusive workforce. The company have committed $70bn in financing to help address climate change and also provide 2 days of paid leave each year through our employee volunteering program to support community organisations. The company support their colleagues to be their best by offering a wide range of flexible working arrangements, educational, financial, lifestyle, health & well-being benefits. 12 month contract with likely extension due to high volume of projects / programs running.

Name: Cloud Security Operations Lead
Description:
Opportunity to Lead and Scale the Security Operations Capability @ Judo Bank
Who are we?
We’re Judo Bank. A purpose-built challenger bank, built on old-fashioned values like integrity, trusted relationships and an enterprising spirit. Born out of a desire to reinvent the craft of relationship banking for the Small to Medium Enterprise (SME) market, and to challenge the status quo in a market dominated by the four major banks. 

We started from a PowerPoint and a bold vision to make a difference in Australian business banking. In a few short years we have grown significantly and with offices in each state Judo Bank is one of the fastest growing new banks in the world. We’re proud to support Australian SMEs and are a business built on trusted relationships, putting our people and customers in the centre of everything we do. 

Being agile and adaptive, we are purpose built to say yes, to make it easier for our customers to get the funding they need, when they need it. We pride ourselves on our personal relationships with customers, our diverse workforce and collaborative culture.
Now, about this role…
If you love:
Managing daily security operational activities and co-ordinating response to cyber security incidents across a broad range of stakeholders including the outsourced MSSP, internal teams and third-party service providers.
Being recognised as a subject matter expert (SME) for security tools, applications, and operational processes.
Working in a diverse workforce where you can bring your own capabilities, experiences, and knowledge to help build the foundations of Judo
Then this just might be…
Your dream job:
Lead the response and coordination of cyber security incidents and investigations across the enterprise
Working closely with Security Architects and other SME’s to ensure security operational requirements are addressed throughout the project lifecycle.
Advise leadership on current operational capability and contribute toward strategic planning
	 
A little bit about you…
The skills you’ve picked up along the way:
Solid understanding of Security Incident Response process, MITRE ATT&CK Framework add Cyber kill-chain
Ability to document and explain technical details clearly and concisely to both technical and non-technical audiences
Your life pre-Judo:
2-5 years’ experience in a SOC environment ideally in team leadership capacity or looking to take on a leadership role.
Experience in Security products such as Microsoft Sentinel & Defender suite, Intune. Other security products such as Tenable, Netskope are desirable. 
Australian working rights
Judo’s culture sets us apart…
Our Values
Accountability – make the decision and own it. Do what you say.
Performance – make today better, stronger and faster than yesterday.
Teamwork – we’re not a team of champions, we’re a champion team.
Trust – the foundation of our purpose and our relationships.
We are looking for people who are:
Resilient | Positive | Inquisitive | Hungry | Adaptive | Passionate | Courageous | Decisive | Hands on
What our team members say about us:
Our people are empowered to make decisions, take ownership, and have their say. Bureaucracy is left at the door and it’s all about the team. Judo encourages all manner of diversity (including nationalities, skills, capabilities etc.), as it is a crucial aspect of our culture. Our people work hard with our purpose in mind and have a lot of fun in the process – revolutionising Australian business banking and working in the best job they have ever had! 
Some of our Perks:
Annual incentive program 
6 weeks’ annual leave
Yearly happiness allowance to spend on your health, family, a charity or whatever makes you happy (not your gas bill!)
Education assistance
And much, much more!
If this is the perfect fit for you, please reach out – we’d love to hear from you!

Name: Viva Energy 2023 Graduate Program – Cyber Security
Description: Ours is a world that is transforming and evolving.  Our company purpose is to help people reach their destinations and in line with our sustainability aims, we plan to be part of the energy transition underway, which will involve the supply of the traditional fuels and products we use today while developing the energies and solutions needed for a lower carbon future. It requires people who want to grow and evolve with us. Bright minds, boundless energy, new perspectives and the determination to take us forward.  Someone like youTechnology and Digital – Cyber SecurityGreat opportunity to join our Technology and Digital team where you will get a unique opportunity to undertake cyber security analysis and operational services. You will support the Technology and Digital team in the following areas:Conduct risk assessments for cyber security related risksSecure testing of websites and public facing infrastructureConduct/coordinate security testing: vulnerability, web application and phishing testsDocument and report on cyber security related activitiesUndertake incident investigationsProvide support to AGILE project deliveryProvide support to vulnerability remediation and patchingSOE testing and hardeningYour Graduate experienceOur two year Graduate Program will enable you to deepen and develop your technical and professional competencies through meaningful and challenging work.  Your in role development will be complemented by professional development programs and you will have the support from leaders and mentors to coach and guide you through each stage of the program. Beyond the Graduate program, we believe in giving you the freedom to grow and create the career that you aspire.  Our inclusive culture and support from our leaders will enable you to discover new experiences and opportunities that energise you, stretch and challenge you to be the best version of yourself. Because, at Viva Energy, helping people reach their destination is at the heart of what we do best.Let’s get to know each otherThe recruitment process is an opportunity for us to get to know each other and assess if you are a good match for us and if we are a good match for you and it only takes 10 minutes.Online applicationStep 1.  Upload your resume, academic results and tell us about any previous work experience and extra-curricular activities. Step 2.  Complete a short online video and share why you applied, 1-2 key achievements and something about you.Interview and AssessmentThis is an opportunity to meet key business leaders and ask questions that are important to you! It also enables us to assess attributes like how you work with others, prioritise and deliver work, your willingness to learn and try new things and your ability to adapt and grow as our business evolves.A little bit more about Viva EnergyWe describe our company as being driven by people. We believe diversity in the workplace is every bit as important as it is in everyday life.  We have been awarded the WGEA Employer of Choice for Gender Equality for the past four years running. We welcome applicants from diverse backgrounds including Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people. We recognise that you may have commitments and interests outside of work and offer a variety of flexible and hybrid working arrangements to ensure your needs and aspirations are supported.To find out more go to Viva Energy AustraliaEligibility CriteriaYou will be an Australian or New Zealand citizen or hold permanent residency at the time of applicationYou will have completed the relevant undergraduate degree (within the past 3 years) and before commencing the programApplications close on 26 July 2022.  Good luck!

Name: Incident Response Specialist
Description: Security Incident Response SpecialistFull-time | Permanent | SydneyHybrid work from home and office  Your part in a changing worldAt QBE, our purpose is to enable a more resilient future.We’re an international insurer and reinsurer with a local presence in 27 countries.Leveraging our deep expertise and insights, QBE offers commercial, personal and specialty products and risk management solutions to help people and businesses manage risks, build strength and embrace change to their advantage.We’ve been cultivating resilience since 1886, when our founders started a marine insurance company in Townsville, Australia to give early pioneers a safeguard against uncertainty.Today, we employee more than 11,600 people around the world, and our product portfolio includes property, motor, crop, energy, marine and aviation insurance.The opportunitySitting in the global technology team, the Security Incident Response Specialist will be a key member of our rapidly growing Global Security Operations team. This is a truly exciting hands-on technical role with wide exposure in an ever-changing environment. You will perform advanced analysis on the collection of cyber threats through modern attacking methods and techniques.  Some of your day-to-day responsibilities will include:Perform deep-dive incident analysis of various data sources by analysing and investigating security-related logs against medium-term threats and IOCsActively manage and apply the phases of Incident Response (preparation, identification, containment, eradication, recovery and lessons learned)Perform advanced analysis on a collection of cyber threats using high-level proactive and reactive threat hunting methodsExecuting vulnerability and web application assessments, providing analysis and recommendationsMaking decisions on threats to QBE’s systems, assets, and business operationsProvide security guidance to technical and non-technical stakeholdersLiaising with senior leaders and executives on complex security mattersDelivering training to the wider QBE business in support of the QBE risk culture agendaManaging business continuity plan and information backup proceduresRecommending initiatives to continually improve existing infrastructureSupporting junior members of the team in an unofficial leadership capacity, sharing knowledge and best practiceYour story so farTo be successful in this role you will be an experienced technology professional with excellent communication skills. You will be working in a similar role currently or have a strong interest in security within a large complex environment.  Understanding the tools, techniques, and procedures that modern attackers use to compromise organisations and knowledge of security frameworks and methodologies are critical.Some of the best bitsThis role is part of a critical function for QBE and the work you complete will positively impact the entire global organisation. QBE offers you an environment to grow where new applications and features are continuously rolled out. Regardless of experience and level, any new addition to the Global Security Operations team will progress through a robust training and onboarding program to ensure best practice. Further study and formal training are also supported.We are here to support youWe offer a range of benefits to help provide holistic support for your work life, whatever your circumstances. As an QBE employee you will have access to and benefit from:‘Hybrid Working’ – a mix of working from home and in the office to enhance your work/life balanceOur ‘At My Best’ wellbeing program, including free holistic wellbeing coaching, nutritional, confidential counselling, financial and legal advice12 weeks’ gender-equal flexible leave for all new parents, including paid superThe ability to maximise retirement savings through voluntary super contributions and company matchingIncome protection insurance & reimbursed Death and Total Permanent Disability insurance premiumsAdditional leave and support through QBE’s Family Domestic Violence First Responder NetworkDiscounts on insurance products, car hire, hotels, goods and services including benefits through our various sports and arts sponsorship partners We value our employee’s experience with us and are proud to have been recognised for the following awards:2021 LinkedIn Top Employer & HRD Employer of Choice2020 Best Workplace Diversity & Inclusion and Excellence Award for Best Health & Wellbeing at the Australian HR AwardsGold Employer status for 2019, 2020 & 2021 Australian Workplace Equality Index (AWEI) – the definitive national benchmark on LGBTQ workplace inclusionRanked 6th place in the AAGE Top Graduate Employers 2021 as voted by graduatesTop 20 Workplaces for Dads in 2019 and 2020 (HBF Direct Advice for Dads)Join us.Click APPLY to submit your application. Successful applicants will need to complete work rights, police and credit checks through our online provider as a condition of employment.QBE recognise the value of diverse perspectives and experience. We are committed to an inclusive workplace where everyone feels valued and respected for who they are. If we can provide support with access requirements, alternative work arrangements or you would like to connect with one of our networks please contact us at recruitment@qbe.com.QBE takes a risk and compliance approach to vaccination and strongly encourages our employees to be vaccinated. All roles in Victoria and Northern Territory require full COVID-19 vaccination and for vaccination status to be maintained in line with government requirements. Other roles may also require full vaccination status be maintained. We will ask you to share your status as part of the application process. We won’t be able to progress with applications where candidates choose not to disclose their status for roles that require vaccination in line with our risk and compliance approach.

Name: Digital Technology Specialists | Multiple Positions
Description: Help us make a differenceCan digital technology specialists change lives? Yes they can. Albury Wodonga Health is looking for various specialists to deliver the solutions we need to improve the digital infrastructure of our organisation; infrastructure that is crucial to the work of our medical staff and contributes to the care we provide to our patients. Our aim is to be a digitally enabled health service, guided by Victoria’s digital health roadmap. You will be a key part of that plan as we look to optimise and transform the information and systems essential to our health service and the people who rely on them every day.As a key member of our team you will work collaboratively to provide high level digital expertise and advice in your specialty, help mentor junior and new staff and drive digital optimisation and transformation for our health service.Better yet, it is also a great career move as you join a thriving organisation that has big plans for the future. Outside of work, you will enjoy the fabulous region of Albury Wodonga, a picturesque regional location with big city perks.Available PositionsWe are keen to hear from digital technology professionals with suitable experience to apply for roles in the Information Management and Performance team;Service delivery technicians and management roles; management and delivery of IT end user services to enable AWH to get the most out of the infrastructure and application portfolio and enable a responsive, positive and inclusive user experience.Infrastructure technicians, leads and management roles; elevate and empower digital workplace services to enable new ways of work through adoption of digital workplace technologies.  Plan and perform the design, installation, and connectivity of computer systems and network infrastructure to meet service levels.Application specialists; implement, maintain and administer computer applications and clinical and corporate software to meet AWH’s needs including partnering with clinicians and corporate staff and external vendors to ensure we maximise our investment.Business analysts; engage with business leaders, clinicians and knowledge workers and system users to understand how changes to processes, services and software can deliver required organisational outcomes.  BA’s are the human factor in translating user requirements into system requirements and shaping the design and implementation of the requirements.Business Intelligence Engineers; provide research, data sourcing, analysis and report compilation support to stakeholder groups in the development and monitoring of organisational performance indicators.IT project/program coordinators; Using your IT technical skills to coordinate ICT contribution to health service projects, risk management, work with PO to identify demand and contribution and develop RFQ and RFP and scope documentation.Clinical informatics; to provide guidance from the clinical perspective within the digital technology team; to be the clinical interface into ICT to assist to deliver strategies that include redesigning workflows and digital optimization and transformation and ensuring optimal use of the existing platforms. Solutions architects; detailed solution architectural design at a system, product and/or technology level. Translation of requirements into a solution vision, high-level business and/or IT system specifications, and a portfolio of implementation tasksCyber security technician; improving the resilience of the health service through your previous experience in IT infrastructure and/or applications. Support the development and implementation of the health service’s cyber security controls, information security strategy and remediation plans.Digital enablement lead; driving adoption of digital workplace technologies to increase workforce digital dexterity and productivity. Focus on workplace enablement processes ensuring that employees have the motivation, permission and knowledge to fully exploit IT-supplied technologyWeb developer; Develop / design and maintains web based forms and workflows to assist in the capture and management of critical information. Using JavaScript best practices to build eForm solutions, with a focus on user and patient needs, with a focus on security and accessibility. Cloud engineer; identify, design and implement opportunities in cloud solutions and services.  Drive cloud adoption through enablement for the health service and reduce risks presented by current architecture.Business Intelligence Engineers; provide research, data sourcing, analysis and report compilation support to stakeholder groups in the development and monitoring of organisational performance indicatorsWhy you should join the Albury Wodonga Health TeamWe're the largest regional health service between Melbourne and SydneyIt's a great career move to Australia's only cross-border health serviceWe offer attractive remuneration packages with excellent benefits, including salary packaging, novated leasing and wellbeing programsYou'll enjoy wonderful employee benefits and development opportunitiesWe offer generous relocation and resettling supportBuild a life you love outside of work in the idyllic Albury Wodonga regionUse your skills to make a difference to the lives of our medical staff and our patientsAbout UsOur team of nearly 3,000 staff supports a population of 250,000 people throughout North-East Victoria and Southern NSW. AWH is a dynamic organisation undergoing significant growth, including the development of new state-of-the-art Emergency and Mental Health facilities as well as master planning for a new world-class regional hospital.Contact Name: Tanya Finnen Email: Tanya.Finnen@awh.org.au

Description: Business Analyst - Cyber Security Our client, a household financial services brand, is looking for a Cyber Security Business Analyst to join their team on a permanent basis. Name: Cyber Education & Reporting Analyst
Description:
The Organisation
Airservices Australia is a government-owned organisation responsible for the safe and efficient management of 11% of the world’s airspace and provision of aviation rescue firefighting services at Australia’s busiest airports.
Our people are our greatest asset with a dynamic and diverse team operating from locations across the country - from bustling cities to regional and remote locations, including an island. This team keep Australia’s aviation industry safe every day of the year, both in the air and on the ground.
We connect people with their world safely – linking family and friends, generating economic activity, creating jobs, and facilitating trade and tourism.
Airservices is committed to fostering a culture that is diverse, inclusive, and respectful.  We encourage motivated individuals who love what they do, value a service first mindset and embrace a challenge to explore a career with Airservices. In return you will be a valued team member, be offered flexibility and experience a meaningful career in an exciting, ever-evolving aviation industry.
The Role 
Working as the new Cyber Security Education and Reporting Analyst you will be responsible for two core functions:
Developing cyber education materials and programs for Airservices Australia. These materials take into consideration the needs of the aviation sector and the business, along with the latest developments in technology that impact on the sector.
The second core function will be the reporting elements for the cyber security team. The role will support and shape how reporting is coordinated and delivered to the business articulating business opportunities, risk and resilience objectives and overall cyber security effectiveness.
Please see the link below to view the full Position Description:
PD - Cyber Security Education and Reporting Analyst.pdf
The Person
As the new Cyber Security Education and Reporting Analyst, you will have:

Well-developed written and oral communication skills, including writing for a wide range of technical and non-technical audiences.
Ability to work independently or as a part of a team to conduct research and create content, tailored to Airservices, for a variety of communications channels such as print, digital, online and social media
Understanding of methods for gathering and analysing stakeholder feedback on content and campaigns, including collating and interpreting weekly data analytics for multiple reporting
Knowledge of cyber security best practices and Australian Government security standards, such as the Information Security Manual (ISM) and Protective Security Policy Framework (PSPF)
Demonstrated ability to build and maintain stakeholder relationships, both internally and externally
Demonstrated capability to work in a team with diverse skill sets to deliver outcomes against competing priorities and deadlines
Experience with data security, education, training and awareness - social engineering, phishing, hacking etc, strategies to prevent employees from becoming victims of hacking, knowledge of awareness program
Ability to suggest business process improvements and ideas for future internal and external education and reporting requirements
Desirable: Qualifications in cyber security, information technology or relevant education

Airservices Australia is a diverse and inclusive employer that recognises the benefits of having a workforce that reflects the communities in which we work. We encourage applications from diverse groups including Aboriginal and/or Torres Strait Islander people.
Security Clearance  
To be eligible to apply, you must be an Australian citizen as an Australian AGSVA NV1 security clearance is required for this role. Please refer to the security check requirements successful applicants will be required to undertake as part of the recruitment process.
Should you require any further information please contact Laura Ferguson – Talent Acquisition Partner on 0476 873 414 or Laura.Ferguson@airservicesaustralia.com  
How to Apply
To apply for this position please lodge an application online before Applications close 11:55pm (AEST) Thursday 30 June 2022.

Name: Cybersecurity Operations Analyst
Description:
Job no: 0054162Location: ParkvilleRole type: Full time; Continuing Department/School: Business ServicesSalary: Attractive remuneration based on your level of experience

Grow your career in the cybersecurity space – We are here to train, mentor and support you every step of the way
Join an experienced, collaborative team – We value professional development and knowledge sharing
Gain exposure to a diverse range of tasks safeguarding cybersecurity at Australia’s #1 University

Founded in 1853, the University of Melbourne is Australia’s #1 university and is consistently ranked amongst the leading universities in the world. We are proud of our people, our commitment to research and teaching excellence, and our global engagement.
About Business Services
Business Services provides a full range of class leading information technology, facilities management, finance, HR and health and safety services to all operating entities of the University. The Cybersecurity team works to reduce the University’s vulnerability to cyberthreats while balancing the need for openness, autonomy and collaboration using a risk-based approach to manage exposures.
About the RoleAs a Cybersecurity Operations Analyst, you will gain exposure to a breadth of tasks related to the successful delivery of cybersecurity services – giving you the opportunity to build and grow your skillset and career. Working alongside experienced colleagues, you will directly contribute to cybersecurity threat detection, response and remediation activities. You will operate systems to detect, analyse and respond to cybersecurity threats impacting University systems or users.
With a professional, confident and empathetic approach, you will assist the University community with their queries and present succinct briefings of key matters to senior team members.
In a typical week at work, you may:

Rapidly respond to user reports of anomalous activity and investigate the root cause and impact
Undertake the initial triage and end to end resolution of incidents and escalate quickly when warranted
Collect evidence and analyse the techniques, tactics and procedures used by the University’s cyber-adversaries
Contribute to Post Incident Reports to document cyber-incidents, enhance our team’s situational awareness and improve the University’s ability to anticipate cybersecurity threats

About YouWith 1 – 2 years' experience in IT or cybersecurity, you will be motivated to pursue a career in the cybersecurity space. You will have a high degree of curiosity, the ability to quickly pick up new skills and a good grasp of foundational technical concepts.
You will have strong attention to detail and a high level of integrity when dealing with confidential information. As a team player with strong communication skills, you build positive relationships within your team and across the division.
Ideally, you will further have:

Tertiary qualification or significant progress towards a tertiary qualification in information technology, cybersecurity or an equivalent combination of relevant experience and education/training
Experience working within a Cybersecurity Operations Centre or significant drive to quickly learn and adopt cybersecurity operations processes.
Attention to detail, an inquisitive nature and a methodical approach to the investigation of cybersecurity incidents
(Desirable but not essential): Experience in the operation of cybersecurity technologies such as security incident and event management (SIEM) platforms, vulnerability management platforms, endpoint detection and response platforms, penetration testing tools or advanced email threat detection platforms.

Benefits of Working with UsIn addition to having the opportunity to grow and be challenged, and to be part of a vibrant campus life, our people enjoy a range of rewarding benefits:

Flexible working arrangements and generous personal, parental and cultural leave
Competitive remuneration, 17% super, salary packaging and leave loading
Free and subsidised health and wellbeing services, and access to fitness and cultural clubs
Discounts on a wide range of products and services including Myki cards and Qantas Club
Career development opportunities and 25% off graduate courses for staff and their immediate families

To find out more, please visit https://about.unimelb.edu.au/careers/staff-benefits.
Be YourselfAt UoM, we value the unique backgrounds, experiences and contributions that each person brings to our community, and we encourage and celebrate diversity. Indigenous Australians, those identifying as LGBTQIA+, females, people of all ages, with disabilities or culturally diverse backgrounds are encouraged to apply for our roles. Our aim is to create a workforce that reflects the community in which we live.
Join Us!If you feel this role is right for you, please apply with your CV and cover letter outlining your interest and experience.  Please note that you are not required to provide responses against the selection criteria in the Position Description.
Please note, interviews may commence during the advertising period, please submit your applications at the earliest convenience.If a strong candidate pool is identified during the advertising period, the advert may be taken offline prior to the below closing date.
Should you require any reasonable adjustments with the recruitment process, please contact the Talent Acquisition team at hr-talent@unimelb.edu.au.
Due to the impacts of COVID-19, we are currently prioritising applications with current valid working rights in Australia and candidates who are not affected by travel restrictions. Please see the latest updates to Australia's immigration and border arrangements: https://covid19.homeaffairs.gov.au/
The University of Melbourne is required to comply with applicable health guidance and directions issued from the Victoria Health Minister. The University of Melbourne requires all University of Melbourne employees to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19, unless an exemption order applies. All applicants therefore must meet this requirement when submitting an application.
