Name: Principal Consultant - Threat Detection & Response Consulting
Description: As a recognized global cyber defender that stops cyber threats all day, every day – we enable our clients to conduct their business, securely.Trustwave detects threats that others can’t see, enabling us to respond quickly and protect our clients from the devastating impact of cyberattacks. We leverage our world-class team of security consultants, threat hunters and researchers, and our market-leading security operations platform, to relentlessly identify and isolate threats with the right telemetry at the right time for the right response.Trustwave is a leader in managed detection and response (MDR), managed security services (MSS), consulting and professional services, database security, and email security. Our elite Trustwave SpiderLabs team provides award-winning threat research and intelligence, which is infused into Trustwave services and products to fortify cyber resilience in the age of advanced threats. The Role:This is a principal level role in a project team with a focus on design and deployment of threat detection and response services, utilising our own internal platform, a third-party SIEM or a blend of both. This role is with Trustwave’s Cyber Architecture & Integration (CAI) team, which handles Professional Services within Trustwave. The role is client facing, operating from Trustwave offices, client sites and remotely on projects. This role involves advising our clients helping them develop threat resilience by improving their processes and tools, including SIEM and EDR. This position would suit an experienced SOC analyst, SOC manager or SIEM architect looking to get out from behind the monitors and consult with customers.We don’t have passengers at Trustwave. Everyone contributes to delivery, and ‘OK’ is not good enough for our quality standards. We have identified some of the key values that make our staff different: Client First - Be the trusted advisor to our clientResponsibility - Take ownership to get things doneExecution - Do your best workAct with Integrity - Integrity is the bedrock of what we doTransform - Drive InnovationExchange Ideas - Collaborate to win as ONE teamResponsibilitiesDevelops proposed solutions, addressing client business issues and objectives using a combination of the company standardised and customised services.Assesses customer SOC environments to provide recommendations.Designs and develops use cases for SOC technologies.Deploys SIEMs and EDR products in customer environments.Design, Integrate and implement the Splunk ES (Enterprise Security) platform. Develop and implement Multi cloud with Splunk technical efforts to design, build, and deploy AWS/Azure applications integration with Splunk, including large-scale data processing.Works independently or leads small teams on client projects.Constructs visual models/whiteboard during informal & formal commercial meetings.Coaches and supports individual clients focusing on their personal successes.Engages with sales to assist with scoping and communicating the value to clients.Mentors and coaches junior team members.Maintains a high level of knowledge in the latest security technologies and trends.Knowledge and experienceAt least five years of previous experience in a SOC Analyst or Incident Response role.Current hands-on experience of working with at least two of the following vendors:Microsoft SIEM and XDRSplunkAWSStrong & demonstrable analytical problem-solving skills.Strong communicator both in client facing situations and in professional writing.Interested to learn more and happy to attend workshops, training and continue upskilling.EducationEducational degree preferred.Industry recognised certifications will be highly desirable, in line with the above-mentioned vendors, especially Splunk Enterprise Security Certified Admin, Microsoft AZ-500.NOTE:  Only candidates who have Australian work rights in place will be considered for this role.Why join us?Trustwave is an Equal Opportunity Employer committed to providing a working environment that embraces and values diversity and inclusion.  When you join Trustwave, you join a unique global family with more than 25 years of history focused on helping you shape and grow your career. We have an entrepreneurial spirit and industry vision that has helped assure our products and services are always on the very forefront of technological development. When you ride the wave, you’ll work with a group of people who share common goals, are driven by a similar passion, and value the expertise of their peers. Want to know what’s it’s really like to work for us? Please check us out here: https://cutt.ly/life-at-tw To All Agencies:   Please, no phone calls or emails to any employee of Trustwave outside of the Talent Acquisition team. Trustwave’s policy is to only accept resumes from agencies via the Trustwave Agency Portal. Agencies must have a valid fee agreement in place and they must have been assigned the specific requisition to which they submit resumes, by the Talent Acquisition team. Any resume submitted outside of this process will be deemed the sole property of Trustwave and in the event a candidate is submitted outside of this policy is hired, no fee or payment of any kind will be paid.

Name: Cyber Security/GRC Analyst
Description: One of our premium government client based in Canberra or Melbourne is looking for multiple Cyber Governance, Risk and Compliance Officer. This is a multi year contract from July 2022 start.What will you be doing as a Cyber Governance, Risk and Compliance (GRC) Analyst?The Cyber GRC Officer role is responsible for supporting the development, delivery and management of ICT governance. The position will support ICT Risk identification, assessment and management on behalf of the Chief Security Officer and identify methods of compliance for ICT Governance. This role is crucial maintaining the security and integrity of information and systems.Skills and experience required:3- 5 years' experience in IT Governance, Risk & ComplianceUnderstanding of International and Australian GRC standards related to ICT preferredExperience of risk management principles and associated methodologiesProven ability to make sound pragmatic decisions and judgements under tight timelines.Strong interpersonal and influencing skills with the ability to influence and drive change in a collaborative way both internally and externally.Strong written communications skills.Please note: Only Australian Citizens are eligible to apply.Talented, committed, can-do individuals have always been the cornerstone of this dynamic business. If you have what it takes to thrive in this role and want to know more, please reach out to Ankit on 02 6103 1803 OR ankit.trikha@modis.comAbout UsModis delivers cross-industry IT and digital engineering expertise to accelerate innovation and digital transformation. By combining a unique service offering of Tech Consulting, Tech Talent Services and Tech Academy solutions Modis enables businesses to progress, scale and perform. Modis has a global footprint with 30,000+ consultants in over 20 countries focused on Cognitive Technologies, Digital Transformation, Cloud & Infrastructure, Smart Ecosystem, and Industry 4.0 across the key sectors of Automotive & Transportation, Environmental & Energy, Software, Internet & Communication, Financial Services and Industrial Manufacturing.Due to new privacy laws regarding the collection and handling of personal information, all applications must be submitted online. Once you click on the "apply for this job" button below you will be directed to our Online Centre where you will have the opportunity to read and agree to our Privacy and Consent statements and it will allow your details to be formally lodged and processed correctly."Modis is an Equal Opportunity employer, committed to all forms of workforce inclusion. We actively invite and encourage applications by candidates from diverse backgrounds"

Name: Cyber Threat Detection & Response Analys
Description:
Do you want your work to make a difference for NSW?
Together, we create thriving environments, communities and economies.
Cyber Threat Detection & Response Analyst - Disability Targeted role

Disability Targeted opportunity 
Permanent full-time opportunity, Work from anywhere in NSW
Salary relative to experience, and ranges from $87,493 to $96,540 + super

This is a targeted role for people with disability through the program: ElevateAbility. This program provides an opportunity for people with disability to gain an employment opportunity at the Department of Planning and Environment.  ElevateAbility provides the successful candidate with a buddy and mentor to help them with their onboarding and development journey. 
This is a targeted role under GSE Rule 26 and people with disability (as defined in Disability Discrimination Act 1992) are encouraged to apply. 
The Department of Planning & Environment’s Cyber Security team is growing, and our goal is to integrate cyber security into the digital and cultural DNA of the organisation. We are now on the lookout for passionate cyber security professionals to join us and be part of our exciting multi-year program of work to uplift the organisation’s security resilience.
The Cyber Threat Detection & Response Analyst is dedicated to detecting and monitoring cyber security threats in the Department of Planning & Environment (DPE) environment. You will be responsible for working with the team in collating and analysing information from various sources to minimise Cyber threats. This is a great opportunity if you are looking to move into the exciting world of cyber threat intelligence, threat hunting and security monitoring. You’ll collaborate on a day to day basis with DPE’s external Managed Security Services Provider (MSSP).
About You

Passionate about cyber security and making positive change.
Understanding of cyber security fundamentals.
Knowledge of common cyber threats and vulnerabilities.
Demonstrated specialised knowledge of security-related concepts, practices, and technologies.
Excellent analytical skills and capacity to process vast amounts of data and produce meaningful reports in tools.
Ability to be ‘on call’ for out of hours escalations from the MSSP.

Preferred Requirements
TAFE or tertiary qualifications in computer science, information and technology or related technical field and/or relevant experience.
For more information read the full Role Description: Cyber Threat Detection & Response Analyst
About UsThe Department of Planning and Environment’s (DPE) vision is to create thriving environments, communities and economies for the people of New South Wales. We strive to be a high-performing, world-class public service organisation that celebrates and reflects the full diversity of the community we serve and seeks to embed Aboriginal cultural awareness and knowledge throughout the department.
In our inclusive and accessible workplace, differences are embraced, contributions are valued, and everyone has a sense of connection and belonging. DPE supports various employee affinity groups, practice flexible working, offer job share and workplace adjustments. We are committed to the Premier’s Priorities and welcome applications from all. 
To ApplyIf excited by the information above, we look forward to receiving your application, including a copy of your resume and a one page cover letter expressing your interest and suitability for the role.
It is an essential requirement of the role that successful candidates are fully vaccinated by receiving an acceptable course of COVID-19 vaccination as defined by the Australian Technical Advisory Group on Immunisation (ATAGI) as a condition of employment.
Applications close Sunday 3 July  2022 at 11.55 pm.
Should you require further information about the role please contact Bianca Wirth via bianca.wirth@dpie.nsw.gov.au.
A recruitment pool may be created for ongoing and temporary opportunities of the same role or role type that may become available over the next 18 months.
Looking for more information or assistance in applying?
Our Diversity team can assist to:

provide alternative formats to apply
make adjustments to the recruitment process
offer information about workplace adjustments and support networks

We encourage people with disability to apply. If you have disability and require more information on adjustments and assistance to apply, contact the Diversity team on Diversity@DPIE.nsw.gov.au  (please include reference number). If you are an Aboriginal or Torres Strait Islander check out Our Mob on Country https://www.dpie.nsw.gov.au/premiers-priorities/our-mob-on-country to see the work we do and get assistance in applying.
Find us on Facebook, Instagram, and LinkedIn.
Find us here: https://www.facebook.com/NSWDPIEhttps://www.instagram.com/nswenviromedia/https://www.linkedin.com/company/nswdpie/

Name: Vacation Student Cyber Security
Description:
Vacation Student – Cyber Security
21 November 2022 to 17 February 2023
Make a better tomorrow.
When you join the team at Synergy over the summer, you’re becoming part of Western Australia’s intelligent energy future. We are proud to be the state’s largest energy provider, striving for an efficient and sustainable power supply with the latest innovations in energy usage and storage. Working for Synergy means you’ll play an important role in ensuring that WA is a world-leader in how our customers choose to use, store and trade energy for years to come.
Synergy’s focus is the health, safety and wellbeing of our people and the environment in which we operate. You’ll find our core values of innovation, collaboration, accountability, and trust are integrated into the culture of every team and the way we do business with our customers, our people and our suppliers. Building tomorrow’s energy future is a big job, and it’s why we only look for the very best people to join us.
Synergy’s Vacation Student program is a great starting point for your career. Synergy’s generation fleet covers a wide range of fossil and renewable technologies (coal, gas, solar, wind). Vacation Students will be presented with opportunities to engage in meaningful tasks and projects to ensure they are gaining valuable experience in the Energy Industry to further enhance your future career prospects.
To be eligible, it is essential you are currently studying a Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science and/or Data Security and will be entering your final year of study 2023.  Exposure to programming languages and technologies will also be highly regarded with a deep interest in Cyber Security.
Synergy is an equal opportunity employer, committed to developing an equitable and diverse workforce. We always encourage Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islanders, and people of all diverse backgrounds to apply.
To apply click on the “Apply” button below and submit your CV and a covering letter addressing the following question: -

Why you would like a Vacation Student role at Synergy and what would you like to achieve over the summer?

Also attached copies of your academic transcript and proof of working rights in Australia
Successful applicants will be required to submit a National Police Check dated within the past 12 months and complete a medical check. Applications close 12pm, 20th July 2022.
For technical assistance with your application, please email recruitment@synergy.net.au (Please note, applications will not be accepted via this email address). To find out more about our community projects and initiatives, please visit https://www.synergy.net.au/Our-energy/For-our-community
Synergy reserves the right to commence the shortlisting process at its discretion. Direct applicants only - we will not be accepting agency-referred applications.
Tomorrow can’t wait.

Name: Cyber Security Opportunities At All Levels
Description:
The Opportunities
Due to sustained growth Boeing Defence Australia (BDA) is rapidly growing its cyber security capabilities to meet the needs of an ever changing world.
We are now recruiting for a number of positions across multiple programs at both senior and junior levels:
1. Senior Cyber Security Specialists.2. Cyber Security Leads.3. Cyber Security Governance and Compliance specialists.4. Cyber Risk and Threat Analysts.5. Cyber Security Architects.6. Cyber Operations/Security Analysts.7. Network Security Specialists.8. Cyber Infrastructure.
We are committed to building a diverse and inclusive workplace.

Female applicants
People of Aboriginal or Torres Strait Island descent
Ex-defence personnel

Are encouraged to apply. 
Roles exist in Brisbane, Adelaide and Williamtown.

Boeing Defence Australia offers a flexible work/life balance including work from home opportunities; however employees must be able to attend the office on a weekly basis.
Relocation costs may be covered for successful applicants by Boeing Defence Australia.

Responsibilities
Working in the BDA Information & Cyber Security Capability you will have the opportunity to contribute to a number of exciting and innovative programs, working across air, land, sea and space, while bringing your information security expertise to bear on world class Defence capabilities.
Responsibilities might include:

Interfacing with our customer on all matters relating to information security and Cyberworthiness.
Evaluating and responding to emerging security issues. Identify cyber security risks/gaps and coordinating actions to meet objectives.
Participating in evaluation of process effectiveness and identifying areas for improvement.
Delivering sound and timely information security design advice. Recommending technological or procedural solutions to meet security control intent in support of engineering projects.
Analysing and documenting information security events. Identifying root causes, prioritising threats and recommending and/or implementing corrective actions. Testing and deploying risk mitigation processes and tools.
Close collaboration with the BDA Capabilities in particular the Mission Systems and Ground Segment Capability.
Contributing to and supporting information security operations, incident response and mitigation activities.

Experience/Qualifications
To be successful you will have expertise in some of the below:

Knowledge of (or ability to learn about) Australian Defence Security Policy Framework and associated standards such as Australian Cyber Security Centre Information Security Manual.
Understanding of developing and implementing information security practices in an engineering environment.
Expertise with Defence or Australian Intelligence Community (AIC) Information Security System design and architectures.
Strong written and verbal communications skills and the ability to clearly articulate complex security concepts to a broad and diverse audience.
Sound information security knowledge across some/all of the following environments is desirable:

Network Security.
Host based security.
Defence Accreditation and Certification process.
Threat risk analysis.
Container security.
Pentesting.



Applicants must be Australian Citizens to meet defence security requirements.
If you meet even some of these criteria we encourage you to apply due to the variety of different roles.
About Us
Boeing Defence Australia is shaping the future of aerospace and delivering some of the nation's most important programs for the Australian Defence Force. As a BDA employee, you will join other innovative, ethical people who have the critical skills required to develop and deliver world class capabilities and systems to protect Australia and its national interests. Joining us is a chance to make your mark, working with a diverse team that is united in pushing the boundaries of imagination and excellence.
At Boeing, we innovate and collaborate to make the world a better place. From the seabed to outer space, you can contribute to work that matters with a company where diversity, equity and inclusion are core values. We're committed to fostering an environment for every teammate that's welcoming, respectful and inclusive, with great opportunity for professional growth. Find your future with us.
Benefits

Flexible working options
Family friendly work life balance
Study assistance
Salary packaging
Employee Incentive Program
Global opportunities

Boeing has implemented a new COVID-19 Vaccination Policy in Australia that requires all new Boeing Australia hires to show proof of being fully vaccinated from COVID-19, or have an approved medical exemption. This role is categorised as Group 1 under the Boeing Australia COVID-19 Vaccination and Safety Controls Policy.
If you are ready to join an innovative industry leader and would like to register your interest in working for Boeing, please click Apply Now.

Name: Cyber Security Operations Lead Analyst
Description: The CompanyOur client is a leading MSP who's purpose is to make technology real working closely with the Government & Financial Services sector as well as Healthcare, Retail, Manufacturing & Media.You will be working in a growing Cyber Security team helping customers on their journey to realise tangible business outcomes.The RoleAs the Lead Cyber Security Operations Analyst you will be calling the plays and directing the action at the frontline of our clients CSOC. There is a 8 person team of SOC Analysts which you will take charge of, acting as the 2IC to the SOC Manager. You will mentor and coach junior members of the team, manage rosters, lead the technical response for incident and act as an escalation point within the SOC for technical matters. The successful candidate is expected to understand how to detect, respond and remediate security threats, and must have a good grasp of technology and the components that underpin modern ICT environments.You will be supporting the SOC Manager to maintain day-to-day operations within the CSOC and spans the delivery of SOC services including vulnerability management, security monitoring, incident response, threat intelligence and reporting.  Responsibilities Include:Lead a team of 8 SOC Analysts acting as the 2IC to the SOC ManagerDetect, analyse, respond to, report on, and prevent Security incidents within our clients systems as well as clientsProvide leadership, and cyber security guidance to team membersWork in a customer facing SOC environment Key Requirements:SIEM or log collection primarily Splunk or Microsoft Sentinel or QRadarExperience with vulnerability management platforms (e.g. Rapid7, InsightVM, Qualys)Programming skills is a bonus - Python & RubyTechnical hands-on experience across a range of technologies: Palo Alto, Cisco, Splunk, Trend Micro, Carbon Black, Zscaler, Mimecast, MicrosoftCISSP/OSCP/GSEC/GCED/GMON/GCIA or equivalent certifications. Benefits:BonusPhone Allowance130-160k + SuperFlexible Working ArrangementsHigh opportunity for progressionAboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Peoples are encouraged to apply. To apply please click apply or call Cody Berry on 02 8289 3123 for a confidential discussion.

About UsThe Department of Planning and Environment’s (DPE) vision is to create thriving environments, communities and economies for the people of New South Wales. We strive to be a high-performing, world-class public service organisation that celebrates and reflects the full diversity of the community we serve and seeks to embed Aboriginal cultural awareness and knowledge throughout the department.
In our inclusive and accessible workplace, differences are embraced, contributions are valued, and everyone has a sense of connection and belonging. DPE supports various employee affinity groups, practice flexible working, offer job share and workplace adjustments. We are committed to the Premier’s Priorities and welcome applications from all. 
To ApplyIf excited by the information above, we look forward to receiving your application, including a copy of your resume and a one page cover letter expressing your interest and suitability for the role.
It is an essential requirement of the role that successful candidates are fully vaccinated by receiving an acceptable course of COVID-19 vaccination as defined by the Australian Technical Advisory Group on Immunisation (ATAGI) as a condition of employment.
Applications close Sunday 3 July  2022 at 11.55 pm.
Should you require further information about the role please contact Bianca Wirth via bianca.wirth@dpie.nsw.gov.au.
A recruitment pool may be created for ongoing and temporary opportunities of the same role or role type that may become available over the next 18 months.
Looking for more information or assistance in applying?
Our Diversity team can assist to:

provide alternative formats to apply
make adjustments to the recruitment process
offer information about workplace adjustments and support networks

We encourage people with disability to apply. If you have disability and require more information on adjustments and assistance to apply, contact the Diversity team on Diversity@DPIE.nsw.gov.au  (please include reference number). If you are an Aboriginal or Torres Strait Islander check out Our Mob on Country https://www.dpie.nsw.gov.au/premiers-priorities/our-mob-on-country to see the work we do and get assistance in applying.
Find us on Facebook, Instagram, and LinkedIn.
Find us here: https://www.facebook.com/NSWDPIEhttps://www.instagram.com/nswenviromedia/https://www.linkedin.com/company/nswdpie/

Name: Cyber Security Specialist
Description: BenefitsJoin a highly regarded Australian owned Consultancy to deliver National Security initiatives within Government and DefenceAn amazing opportunity for a junior - mid level cyber security specialist Training, development, and career pathways on offer AGSVA security clearance - must be an Australian Citizen to apply The CompanyThis Australian owned and highly regarded consultancy delivers critical and complex projects across Cyber Security, Systems Engineering, Project Management, Test and Evaluation, Business Analysis and ILS for Defence and Federal Government nationally. The RoleThe Cyber Security Specialist will have a background and experience in network security, network monitoring, disaster recovery and vulnerability assessment. As part of the wider security team and autonomously, tasks will include:Conduct vulnerability assessments of key networks or operational technology in line with the CC, NIST or other standards.Provide technical advice on hardware and software hardening measures to enhance device or network security.Assist with the development of internal network policies, processes or procedures to gain and maintain ISO 270001.Assist with the preparation of cyber worthiness evaluations / assessment reports.Provide SME advice on network security, recovery, backup or preventative measures to support the security of the network.Assist with development of network documentation or other artefacts to achieve and maintain ICT Accreditation.Liaise with security vendors, suppliers and service providers to maintain contemporary knowledge of new security tools. Experience in some or all of the following is required:3 years of experience as a Systems or Network Administrator in either the public or private sector.Experience in databases, networks (LAN, WAN), CCNA routing and switching, virtualisation and encryption technologies.Graduate Qualification in ICT Security, Networking or Information Technology.Certification in CCNA, CompTIA Network+, CompTIA Security, CompTIA CySA+, CISM, CISSP, CISA, RHCSA or GSEC.Australian Information Security Association (AISA) membership or membership of an equivalent or similar professional body.Sound working knowledge of key ICT security practices, tools, techniques, methodologies, theory or standards.Demonstrated knowledge of the Common Criteria and NIST standards.A working ability to write and refine basic scripts in Python, JavaScript or C++.Effective oral and written communication skills. You must be an Australian Citizen to apply for this roleIf you think that you are ready for a unique challenge for a leading company, then please send me your CV - laurene@thenetworkit.com for a confidential discussion.

Name: Senior Cyber Security Analyst
Description: We are a business who is crazy about customers. We use disruptive thinking every day to ensure that we are capturing every opportunity to deliver the ultimate experience to our customers and people. We empower our people to Do it. Own it. Love it and that’s why they choose to work for us. Here, it’s never just a job – We care about what we do and the impact we have, and that’s what connects us. What’s the opportunity? This is a hands-on role for a Cyber Security Analyst, specializing in Systems and Infrastructure security. The candidate would be conducting hands-on security reviews and testing of Vocus Systems and Infrastructure (internal and external environments). The candidate will also assist with relevant information security knowledge sharing and training for Systems Engineers and Administrators.   What you’ll be doing in the role:  Performs security monitoring, threat hunting, security and data/log analysis, and forensic analysis, to detect security incidents, and mounts incident response.  Performs IPS/IDS tuning for increasing accuracy and performance  Investigate and utilize new technologies and processes to enhance security capabilities and implement improvements. Develop and maintain procedures to efficiently deliver Systems Security testing services Create new ways to solve existing production security issues Develop automation scripts to handle and track incidents Collaborate with colleagues on authentication, authorization and encryption solutions  Collaborate on the definition, implement and maintenance of corporate security policies Analyse and advise on new security technologies and program conformance Perform vulnerability testing, risk analyses and security assessments Proactively conduct hands-on security assessments on systems and infrastructure equipment, identify security vulnerability/weaknesses, evaluate countermeasures, and recommend best security practices to mitigate the vulnerabilities. Review the results and recommend effective remediation of vulnerability scan, penetration test and compliance reports. Participate and recommend security controls for IT and Systems related projects. Be a champion of effective security best practices and promote their acceptance, adoption and socialisation Collaborate and work effectively with other teams Participate in the information security incident management process Develop and maintain regular information security reports for managers and team.  Review and test (if required) security solutions using industry standard analysis criteria Assist with the development and promotion of a meaningful Systems Security Awareness Program Stay informed about the latest developments in the information security field, including new products and services. Other Information Security tasks as directed  What you will need to be successful in a team like this:  Understanding of secure systems architectures Knowledge of Identity and access management principles Complex problem-solving abilities Strong oral and communication skills Passionate about information security with a strong commitment to continuously improve user experience outcomes Experienced in incident handling for internal and advance threats Experienced in Open Source security solutions Good understanding of SIEM and integration with different security solutions, especially Elastic Experienced in NISD/NIPS, NSM, EDR, web proxy, vulnerability scanning, security monitoring, threat intelligence and security analytics tools  Infrastructure Security Hardening (Systems & Infrastructure) based on Industry Best Practices  Systems Security Experience, Strong understanding of operations systems (Windows, Unix, Linux, etc.) and communication protocols running on various layers of the OSI (Open Systems Interconnection) stack.) Understanding of network fundamentals (e.g. Knowledge of Local Area Networks, TCP/IP, IPSEC and high-level communication protocols Strong Understanding of Windows, UNIX and Linux operating systems Good understanding of security standards such as ISO27001, PCI-DSS, AusGov PSPF, ASD Top 8 and ISM (desirable) Skills in the presentation of technical information to system and network teams  4-6 years’ experience in IT, with 3+ years of IT security experience, coupled with a degree in Computer Science, Cyber Security or a related field.   In return Vocus commit to a fast paced and fun workplace that is committed to career development opportunities within the company nationally and across different areas. We have the best employee benefits such as Internet discounts, the ability to purchase leave, anniversary leave, awesome parental leave benefits. Best of all we believe in flexibility and fitting your job into your life - Vocus is quite simply just a great place to work! It’s a seriously exciting time to join Vocus and there’s even more to come. If you think you want to join us and be part of something great, do it and apply now!The extra stuff we know you want to know:  We know how to celebrate our wins and we know learning from our mistakes makes us better. We are all about flexible working and, hand on heart, we practise work life balance. We high five you on your work anniversary and give you a day off. We know time off is important for balance, so we have an option to buy more leave. We embrace your unique style and let you be a master of your own style with no dress code. This is just the tip of the iceberg, so jump on our careers site or LinkedIn to find out more!  Did I hear you say, “Who is Vocus?”  We are a challenger business in the Telco and Energy Industry. We listened to our customers and heard that they wanted more from a network, so that’s what we’ve given them.  We built the network thanks to our own team of highly skilled fibre engineers. We own our network giving us easier, straightforward access. We manage our network here in Australia out of our Melbourne offices.  We now have more than 20,000 km of fibre optic cable laid and operational throughout Australia, 5000 on-net buildings connected to our network.#LI-VOC#LI-Hybrid

Name: IT Security Analyst
Description: This Australian owned and operated company who pride themselves on their superior customer service, innovation, and extensive product range are looking to find an IT Security Analyst to join their team and work across the Security analysis of their current systems and environment, make suggestions for constant enhancements and conduct user access reviews across the full business.They are currently putting together a focussed IT Security team within their broader Infrastructure team so the role has a bunch of exciting prospects to look forward to. It is a welcoming, supportive, and engaging team with a wonderful comradery and the organisation pride themselves in developing their specialist and knowledgeable team, culture and capabilities.The role will be responsible for driving an organisation wide user access review as per audit requirements. The security team has oversight and responsibility for the group in IT security including security analysis and administration and to action any priority security incident response. The team manages vulnerabilities across systems & servers, applies threat intelligence, identifying and reporting cyber risks and recommends mitigations and remediations. The team also ensures compliance with relevant IT security and related policies and further develops the security environment.Must haves for the role:  A minimum of 2+ years’ experience in IT Security focussed roles within an enterprise environment. Experience in Stakeholder Engagement and Management. Proven experience in Security Incident Response, IAM, SIEMs. Familiarity with the Penetration Testing process (conducted by a vendor). Ability to read and write basic reporting scripts (PowerShell). Advanced spreadsheet experience. Good knowledge on ISO27001, Essential 8, COBIT, NIST or similar frameworks. Knowledge of network technologies.  The role is based in Mount Waverley, Melbourne, and has a hybrid working arrangement in place. The team is required to work from the office 3x per week, so commute needs to be considered for these days.The position will suit someone who is action and detail oriented, has strong organisation skills, is comfortable around senior management with strong interpersonal and communication skills (written and verbal) and has a genuine passion for IT Security, bringing their knowledge and experience to contribute value to the IT Security team. Apply online or email alecia.britz@affix.com.au

Name: Cyber Security Specialist
Description: Company OverviewCAE is a high technology company, at the leading edge of digital immersion, providing solutions to make the world a safer place. Backed by a record of more than 70 years of industry firsts, we continue to reimagine the customer experience and revolutionize training and operational support solutions in civil aviation, defence and security, and healthcare.CAE offers interesting, diverse and challenging work. Our multiple businesses and global sites create a highly dynamic and stimulating environment that offers ample opportunity for creativity, learning and growth.Our innovative technologies and services, and the people who collaborate every day to deliver exceptional service to our customers, are at the heart of what makes our organization successful and a great place to work.Full time permanent positionHomebush location (travel required)Role Overview The primary role of the Cyber Security Specialist is to assist IT Security Manager (ITSM) in Cyber security activities & implementing cyber security controls in multiple projects. The Cyber Security Specialist role involves the application and implementation of Information, Communication (Cyber) Technologies on Acquisition and Through Life Support projects as required to support CAE’s training devices. This role extends into Information and Communications technologies as required to support Distributed Mission Training. The role includes application of Systems Engineering principals, management and coordination of ICT/Cyber technologies, tools and network configurations for the application and maintenance of secure systems in a classified environment in compliance with Secure IT standards in the Defence domain. Roles & Responsibilities The applicant is ideally Cyber Security & IT Admin focused with the ability to work with engineering management system processes and procedures. Responsibilities include but are not limited to: Assist IT Security Manager (ITSM) to capture & develop ICT Cyber Security requirements for current and future projects. Provide Support to ICT Cyber security design reviews. Provide ICT Cyber security support to CAEs development laboratory, training platforms & products. Perform various Cyber security activities such as: ICT System Vulnerability scan and analysis (using Nessus and Nmap)System Event log monitoring and development (Splunk) Media management control Cyber Security Incident Response Ensure Information Security Policies & Procedures are adhered to. Assist IT Security Manager (ITSM) to design & develop Information Security Policies & Procedures, Cyber security awareness training. Assist IT Security Manager (ITSM) to identify vulnerabilities in the system and prepare mitigation plan. Assist the Cyber security team to prepare for Cyber Security Certification and Accreditation process. Assist IT Security Officer (ITSO) to implement various security controls in the system such as: Operating System & Network Devices Hardening as per Australian Cyber Security Centre’s (ACSC) Information Security Manual (ISM) Operating Systems, Applications and Network devices patching. Identity and Access Management Asset Management Risk Management Supply chain & Data security Qualifications and Experience/RequirementsAn undergraduate Degree in an Information Technology / Cyber Security discipline and/or relevant industry experience. Cyber Security certifications will be highly regarded but not essential. Good Understanding of NIST Cyber Security Framework and ACSC’s Information Security Manual (ISM) Experience with security technologies, including Cisco Firewalls/Switches, IDS, Splunk, Symantec Endpoint Protection, Nessus, Wireshark, Understanding of security concepts, including Encryption, CIA Triad, AAA Experience with Windows Operating System Linux and VMWare system knowledge is preferable but not essential. Splunk certification is highly desirable but not essential. Cisco CCNA certification is desirable but not essential. Understanding of Risk Management Methodologies. Excellent Analytical Skills; Currently holding a NV-1 clearance or ability to obtain NV-1 clearance. Note: as the Australian Department of Defence is a major client, you must be eligible for SECRET (NV1) level Defence security clearance, and preferably already hold a current SECRET (NV1) clearance. Australian citizens only.CAE Australia Offers· A supportive culture for all employees· Flexible working hours· The ability to work from home· Yearly reviews· Full Flight Simulator experiences· Birthday Leave· An exciting career path with potential global opportunities· Health & Wellness Subsidy along with other additional benefitsEEO StatementCAE is firmly committed to ensuring a positive and professional working environment in which all people are treated with dignity and respect. We aim to provide a fair and consistent method for filling job openings in support of equality of opportunity and cultural diversity within the company.ApplicationsPlease apply to this position by clicking ‘Apply Now’, along with your resume and cover letter.

Name: Cyber Education & Reporting Analyst
Description:
The Organisation
Airservices Australia is a government-owned organisation responsible for the safe and efficient management of 11% of the world’s airspace and provision of aviation rescue firefighting services at Australia’s busiest airports.
Our people are our greatest asset with a dynamic and diverse team operating from locations across the country - from bustling cities to regional and remote locations, including an island. This team keep Australia’s aviation industry safe every day of the year, both in the air and on the ground.
We connect people with their world safely – linking family and friends, generating economic activity, creating jobs, and facilitating trade and tourism.
Airservices is committed to fostering a culture that is diverse, inclusive, and respectful.  We encourage motivated individuals who love what they do, value a service first mindset and embrace a challenge to explore a career with Airservices. In return you will be a valued team member, be offered flexibility and experience a meaningful career in an exciting, ever-evolving aviation industry.
The Role 
Working as the new Cyber Security Education and Reporting Analyst you will be responsible for two core functions:
Developing cyber education materials and programs for Airservices Australia. These materials take into consideration the needs of the aviation sector and the business, along with the latest developments in technology that impact on the sector.
The second core function will be the reporting elements for the cyber security team. The role will support and shape how reporting is coordinated and delivered to the business articulating business opportunities, risk and resilience objectives and overall cyber security effectiveness.
Please see the link below to view the full Position Description:
PD - Cyber Security Education and Reporting Analyst.pdf
The Person
As the new Cyber Security Education and Reporting Analyst, you will have:

Well-developed written and oral communication skills, including writing for a wide range of technical and non-technical audiences.
Ability to work independently or as a part of a team to conduct research and create content, tailored to Airservices, for a variety of communications channels such as print, digital, online and social media
Understanding of methods for gathering and analysing stakeholder feedback on content and campaigns, including collating and interpreting weekly data analytics for multiple reporting
Knowledge of cyber security best practices and Australian Government security standards, such as the Information Security Manual (ISM) and Protective Security Policy Framework (PSPF)
Demonstrated ability to build and maintain stakeholder relationships, both internally and externally
Demonstrated capability to work in a team with diverse skill sets to deliver outcomes against competing priorities and deadlines
Experience with data security, education, training and awareness - social engineering, phishing, hacking etc, strategies to prevent employees from becoming victims of hacking, knowledge of awareness program
Ability to suggest business process improvements and ideas for future internal and external education and reporting requirements
Desirable: Qualifications in cyber security, information technology or relevant education

Airservices Australia is a diverse and inclusive employer that recognises the benefits of having a workforce that reflects the communities in which we work. We encourage applications from diverse groups including Aboriginal and/or Torres Strait Islander people.
Security Clearance  
To be eligible to apply, you must be an Australian citizen as an Australian AGSVA NV1 security clearance is required for this role. Please refer to the security check requirements successful applicants will be required to undertake as part of the recruitment process.
Should you require any further information please contact Laura Ferguson – Talent Acquisition Partner on 0476 873 414 or Laura.Ferguson@airservicesaustralia.com  
How to Apply
To apply for this position please lodge an application online before Applications close 11:55pm (AEST) Thursday 30 June 2022.

Name: Business Analyst - Cyber Security
Description: About the CompanyIconic brand in Australia with more than 100 years history. be part of a large cyber uplift project that has more than 12 months to run. The role does not need a technical subject matter expert but candidates would need to understand security services such as PAM , Data loss protection   About the RoleFacilitate workshops to elicit, clarify, and translate security requirements and processes to implement policies, standards, and tools.Lead requirements gathering activities to analyse existing processes and systems and determine if security changes can be accommodated through process change.Communicate and collaborate with both the business and program/projects to analyse information needs and functional requirements to deliver the security artefacts as needed.Understand the business ability to absorb security changes to enable the successful adoption of changed processes, products, and technologies.Capture and translate cybersecurity and business requirements to facilitate troubleshooting between the business and program/project delivery teams, where required.Review test plans and monitor the testing process to ensure that business results are tested with minimal risk.Participate in reviewing proposed technology solutions to ensure security requirements are considered and addressed.Perform gap analysis activities and capture treatment plans that can be implemented where to support BAU and the programs cyber outcomes.Key skills required:4+ years as a Business Analyst, including practical experience working with Cyber Security projects and stakeholders.Experience and knowledge across IT Security disciplines.Strong background in facilitating project inception and requirements workshops with multiple stakeholders.Vendor and stakeholder management experience with the ability to empathise with customer situations, working towards building and maintaining effective relationships.Excellent communication, business engagement and collaboration skills and experience. About YouBe part of a great company and get involved in exciting projects. Good long term contract opportunity.    To apply, click the link and upload your current resume in Microsoft Word format only (.doc or .docx). If you would like to have a confidential discussion, please contact Spencer Stirrat - 02 8093 0620, quoting ref no. JO-2206-111105. Want to know more about Davidson? Visit us at www.davidsonwp.com [link removed]

Name: Cyber Security Opportunities At All Levels
Description:
The Opportunities
Due to sustained growth Boeing Defence Australia (BDA) is rapidly growing its cyber security capabilities to meet the needs of an ever changing world.
We are now recruiting for a number of positions across multiple programs at both senior and junior levels:
1. Senior Cyber Security Specialists.2. Cyber Security Leads.3. Cyber Security Governance and Compliance specialists.4. Cyber Risk and Threat Analysts.5. Cyber Security Architects.6. Cyber Operations/Security Analysts.7. Network Security Specialists.8. Cyber Infrastructure.
We are committed to building a diverse and inclusive workplace.

Female applicants
People of Aboriginal or Torres Strait Island descent
Ex-defence personnel

Are encouraged to apply. 
Roles exist in Brisbane, Adelaide and Williamtown.

Boeing Defence Australia offers a flexible work/life balance including work from home opportunities; however employees must be able to attend the office on a weekly basis.
Relocation costs may be covered for successful applicants by Boeing Defence Australia.

Responsibilities
Working in the BDA Information & Cyber Security Capability you will have the opportunity to contribute to a number of exciting and innovative programs, working across air, land, sea and space, while bringing your information security expertise to bear on world class Defence capabilities.
Responsibilities might include:

Interfacing with our customer on all matters relating to information security and Cyberworthiness.
Evaluating and responding to emerging security issues. Identify cyber security risks/gaps and coordinating actions to meet objectives.
Participating in evaluation of process effectiveness and identifying areas for improvement.
Delivering sound and timely information security design advice. Recommending technological or procedural solutions to meet security control intent in support of engineering projects.
Analysing and documenting information security events. Identifying root causes, prioritising threats and recommending and/or implementing corrective actions. Testing and deploying risk mitigation processes and tools.
Close collaboration with the BDA Capabilities in particular the Mission Systems and Ground Segment Capability.
Contributing to and supporting information security operations, incident response and mitigation activities.

Experience/Qualifications
To be successful you will have expertise in some of the below:

Knowledge of (or ability to learn about) Australian Defence Security Policy Framework and associated standards such as Australian Cyber Security Centre Information Security Manual.
Understanding of developing and implementing information security practices in an engineering environment.
Expertise with Defence or Australian Intelligence Community (AIC) Information Security System design and architectures.
Strong written and verbal communications skills and the ability to clearly articulate complex security concepts to a broad and diverse audience.
Sound information security knowledge across some/all of the following environments is desirable:

Network Security.
Host based security.
Defence Accreditation and Certification process.
Threat risk analysis.
Container security.
Pentesting.



Applicants must be Australian Citizens to meet defence security requirements.
If you meet even some of these criteria we encourage you to apply due to the variety of different roles.
About Us
Boeing Defence Australia is shaping the future of aerospace and delivering some of the nation's most important programs for the Australian Defence Force. As a BDA employee, you will join other innovative, ethical people who have the critical skills required to develop and deliver world class capabilities and systems to protect Australia and its national interests. Joining us is a chance to make your mark, working with a diverse team that is united in pushing the boundaries of imagination and excellence.
At Boeing, we innovate and collaborate to make the world a better place. From the seabed to outer space, you can contribute to work that matters with a company where diversity, equity and inclusion are core values. We're committed to fostering an environment for every teammate that's welcoming, respectful and inclusive, with great opportunity for professional growth. Find your future with us.
Benefits

Flexible working options
Family friendly work life balance
Study assistance
Salary packaging
Employee Incentive Program
Global opportunities

Boeing has implemented a new COVID-19 Vaccination Policy in Australia that requires all new Boeing Australia hires to show proof of being fully vaccinated from COVID-19, or have an approved medical exemption. This role is categorised as Group 1 under the Boeing Australia COVID-19 Vaccination and Safety Controls Policy.
If you are ready to join an innovative industry leader and would like to register your interest in working for Boeing, please click Apply Now.
