Name: IT Security Analyst & Technical Writer
Description: IT Security Analyst & Technical WriterAbout the CompanyHerron Todd White is a respected market leader with a positive and focused future. Our people are the key to maintaining our strong reputation for providing high quality property valuations and exceptional customer service for key clients across Australia. We have an unrivalled national presence with a network of 65 offices and over 850 employees. It’s our people that make us great and we’re proud of our culture that prioritises teamwork, flexibility, challenge and endless opportunities.About the RoleAn exciting opportunity exists in our National Office (Chermside location) as part of a hybrid work team - come into the office on select days to catch up and collaborate with your team, and you choose if you would like to work in the office or from home for the rest of the week. Working in collaboration with a diverse and supportive team, you will contribute to developing, implementing, and managing information security policy, standards, and guidelines. This also includes assisting with third-party audits and external queries and creating content for security awareness training within the organisation. In addition to this, you will support Change Management activities, including drafting communications and end-user documentation and business impact assessments. As part of a team that develops all software in house, you will be instrumental in drafting product release notes and communications and ensuring user guides are updated to reflect product changes. Skills and ExperienceTo be successful in this role: You are analytical and enjoy problem-solving and thinking outside the box.  You are an excellent communicator, and you are comfortable conversing with both business and technical professionals. You have an eye for detail, are a quick learner and hold yourself to high standards.You are highly organised and manage priorities well in a fast-paced environment. About youYou desire to learn from a team that develops and manages its application builds in house. You have a passion for technology and a desire to develop and broaden your technical knowledge, specifically in product change and Information and Cyber Security.You have strong writing skills and ideally have >2 years of experience writing technical documentation and policies. You can take a technical concept or requirement and articulate it clearly for non-technical audiences. You enjoy social events at work and see this as a great way to build relationships with your colleagues and business stakeholders. You’ll have the opportunity to work with a professional team that supports and encourages members to realise their full potential. Enjoy flexible work options, including work from home, employee discounts and free onsite parking.  At HTW we’re committed to building an inclusive culture in which every individual feels respected and valued. A culture that embraces diversity, where employees feel appreciated for their unique characteristics and are comfortable sharing ideas and other aspects of their true and authentic selves. We encourage applicants of diverse backgrounds and identities, and all ages and abilities to apply.If you would like to make a valued contribution to a successful and growing team, apply online today!If you are interested in exploring other opportunities across Herron Todd White's national network, we would love to hear from you. Visit our website at https://www.htw.com.au/current-vacancies/ to view our current list of vacancies.

Name: Global Information Security Analyst - Sydney
Description: The RoleThe Information Security Analyst is one of several such Analyst roles  in the firm. Each Analyst is responsible for assisting with the day to  day operation of CISO office tasks. Analysts are also encouraged to  participate in proactively identifying sources of vulnerability and threat.The role will be part of a worldwide team that is empowered to  operate the activities within their assigned function. Daily  activities will focus heavily on request, event and incident  management and direction will be provided by the Information Security Manager.Norton Rose Fulbright is committed to the professional development of  its staff. There will be significant development opportunities for the  Information Security Analyst role, both through on-the-job learning  and targeted training. The CISO team also embrace a mentoring and  meritocratic approach.The success of this role is dependent upon building a lasting  alignment between information security provisions and business  requirements. In particular, the role must consider: The special requirements of the Firm with regard to client    confidentiality, as well as regulatory requirements such as data protection. Achieving a balance between protecting the firm and ensuring that    users can work effectively; being pragmatic but cognizant of risk.The Analyst can be based in either of our National offices. Key Objectives: Ensure that the Firm has the requisite capability to investigate,    prevent and remediate against security breaches, viruses and    deviations from security procedures. Act as a technical expert in the security field with a solid    understanding of Norton Rose Fulbright's Information Security    infrastructure and act as its champion in relation to Information Security. Be responsible for the operation of Information Security    monitoring and act as a technical point of escalation for any    alerted issues. Manage the global Information Security incident / request queue. Assist with a program of educational, procedural and technical    improvements aligned with the Information Security Management System. Be responsible for management of technical controls defined within    the Information Security Management System. Responsibilities include, but are not limited to: Operate and manage security incidents and requests to SLA    guidelines within ServiceNow, including escalation as necessary. Operate any daily / weekly / monthly checks as required and    provide standard reports as necessary. Review, escalate and action any unusual event behavior identified    by the security and data leak protection systems. Assist with the removal of regional / global obstacles to    information security requirements. Identify (and report) threats and vulnerabilities. Assist with development and maintenance of the Firm-wide security    infrastructure configuration, policies and procedures, identifying    improvements to procedures, and reporting on incidents. Actively promote security governance in support of the Firm-wide    IT security policies, to ensure appropriate measures are taken to    secure the Firm's records and data and minimizing IT security breaches. Support and monitor operational IT teams to ensure their on-going    maintenance and supportability of security infrastructure. Encourage cooperative working with all business functions to    achieve shared security goals, ensuring skills transfer and    technical security awareness within the teams. This includes writing    process documents and conducting training sessions for members of    the Global Information Security team and others within IT. Ability to fully utilize inbuilt security tools and in conjunction    with appropriate outside agencies conduct forensic investigations as    authorized through the security process. Work cooperatively with project teams when assigned and ensure    that new project and changes adhere to the security policies and    infrastructure governance standards and integrate into existing    procedures or refining them as appropriate. Identify and evaluate technical remedial measures as identified by    penetration tests, scanning and internal/external audits. Keep a technical industry awareness of security risks and    exposures and proactively promote effective counter-measures. Configure appropriate security parameters in monitoring systems    and act as a technical point of escalation for any alerted issues. Undertake or manage forensic analysis as required by the Firm or    by law. Support the global audit function, including but not limited to,    logging and tracking findings/non-conformities to resolution and    performing audits when required. Assist in the organization of penetration testing mandates, and to    ensure that the output is tracked and remediated. Perform document reviews and privileged account reviews at regular    intervals, as required. Work with the procurement team to ensure all vendors' security    posture has been assessed as part of the on boarding process. Undertake other reasonable duties as requested by the Information    Security Manager. Experience / Skills: Solid background in IT with experience in working within    Information Security infrastructure or vocation to move from another    technical discipline. Experience of participating in resolving technical security issues. Experience of introducing Information Security improvement through    effective deployment of technology and / or processes to move to a    proactive footing in security management or demonstrating similar in    current technical discipline. Proven ability to communicate IT proposals to senior management to    facilitate the introduction of new/additions to security systems and    processes into the operational environment. Working knowledge of endpoint security solutions and security infrastructure. An ability to learn quickly, solve problems and pragmatically    address risk. Technical bachelor's degree or equivalent IT experience (preferred). Security-related certification e.g. CompTIA Security+, GSEC, CISSP (preferred). Good understanding of security frameworks such as ISO 27001, NIST (preferred). Personal Attributes: Keen sense of responsibility, ability to set a professional    example and desire to adhere to defined security practices. Strong technical security understanding. Self-motivated and able to work calmly and methodically under pressure. Excellent interpersonal skills, exceptional levels of personal    integrity and the ability to communicate clearly at all levels    through reports, presentations and forming effective matrixed relationships. Flexible approach to incorporate changing priorities. Cooperative, service-orientated, individual and established team    worker, comfortable working in a geographically dispersed team. Good judgement when it comes to confidentiality and sensitivity of    information of which they may become aware through the course of    their duties. Adaptable and keen to learn new skills. The Team:The scope of the Information Security function includes all strategic  security planning and control oversight to ensure effective risk  mitigation takes place within the firm. The Information Security team  operates a number of security solutions directly, such as anti-malware  solutions, Internet security proxy servers, and the vulnerability  scanning platform, and rely on other departments (IT service delivery,  HR, Facilities) to operate all other security controls.The Information Security team is responsible for ensuring the overall  effectiveness of the control framework and managing security  incidents. The team work with unified principles and processes around  the world while maintaining regional stakeholder relationships. They  adhere to the international standard ISO 27001, and report to the  Firm's CISO. Norton Rose Fulbright values diversity and strives to create    an inclusive environment where all employees can bring their whole    selves to work. We embrace the opportunity to contribute to the    communities in which we work which underpins our strong Corporate    Social Responsibility (CSR) program. We provide a range of    opportunities in which our people can make a difference to their    local and global communities including through pro bono legal work,    charitable giving, volunteering and support for the environment. We are proud that Norton Rose Fulbright in Australia has been    recognised as an Employer of Choice for Gender Equality by the    Workplace Gender Equality Agency (WGEA) as well as a silver employer    for LGBTI Inclusion through the Australian Workplace Equality Index. We encourage Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander candidates    to apply. To apply online please click the 'Apply' button below. It is    the policy of NRFA Group to provide workplace adjustments for    qualified persons with disabilities who are employees or applicants    for employment. If you need assistance or adjustments to fully    participate in the application/interview process, or have any    additional queries regarding the position, please contact Laura    Madgwick, Senior HR Manager at laura.madgwick@nortonrosefulbright.com. If you are trans or gender diverse and would like a    confidential discussion before applying, please contact Eleanor Guy,    Talent Engagement Advisor on(02) 9330 8267. Note to recruitment agencies:Please note that we are not accepting applications submitted by  recruitment agencies for this position.

Name: Senior Security Analyst
Description: The Organisation:    This large Australian FS business is currently recruiting for a Senior Analyst to become a core part of their Security Operations Team.     They have a close-knit, collaborative culture with leaders who really care about their members development.     The Role:   This is an established and mature SOC team. You will have the opportunity to work across a range of technologies, IR tasks, threat hunting & intelligence driven activities.   Monitor, diagnose and resolving security events and incidents (IR, triaging) Identifying and recommending solutions that improve IR capabilities Manage and administer core cyber security systems including SIEM, DLP, Email Security etc Conduct threat hunting engagements + Threat Intel work Work in compliance with NIST, APRA CPS234  About You:  A number of years of experience supporting large environments in an analyst capacity Incident response experience Understanding of risk management frameworks and working in accordance with frameworks such as NIST, APRA CPS234 Strong soft skills and written communication  Salary circa - $130k - $140k + bonus.    Apply:    Please submit your CV or for further questions call James Soo (0466 663 363) or send an email to jsoo@fourquarters.com.au

2013, 2016) and Exchange Onlineo OneDrive for Business/Office 365 Groups/SharePoint Onlineo Microsoft Teamso Enterprise Mobility and Securityo Azure Active Directory including identity synchronisationo Active Directory Federation Services (ADFS)o PowerShell Scripting / Graph APIo Azure IAAS and PAASo Office365 Design and Implementation Projectso Single Sign Ono Security Center, OMS and Log Analyticso Active Directory Domain Services (ADDS) and AD Connect / DirSync Serviceso Wintel Server, Clustering and Active Directory Certificate Services (ADCS)

Name: Secure Configuration Specialist
Description: About the Business  Technology team is responsible for the world leading applications of technology and operations across every aspect of CommBank from innovative product platforms for our customers to essential tools within our business. We also use technology to drive efficient and timely processing, an essential component of great customer service.  The Cyber Security division protects the bank and our customers from theft, losses and risk events, through effective and proactive management of cyber security, privacy and operational risk. The Vulnerability Management team is responsible for identifying vulnerabilities through network-based vulnerability scanning and ensure vulnerability remediation through assessment and reporting.  Do Work that matters:This key position is tasked with deploying the Secure Configuration Management function within the Cyber Attack and Vulnerabilities Assessments team. You will:Manage the development of secure baselines for key IT assets (workstation, server, cloud, network)Report on the fleet wide adherence to these baseline, and deviation managementAutomate the end to end application of the SecCM control for the fleetChampion secure configuration with all levels of stakeholders throughout the organisationProactively manage risk, internal, and external obligations and responsibilities; create and manage policies, guidelines and standards;Actively contribute to the Cyber community; sharing knowledge and expertise.Analyse industry trends and apply knowledge of the industry to guide changes to policies, guidelines and standards.We're interested in hearing from people who have:Demonstrated experience in managing a large fleet of IT assetsHands on experience working with infrastructure management platforms like Puppet, SCCM, SCOMUnderstanding of industry frameworks and baselines including NIST, CISExperience implementing SecCM to meet upstream regulatory & compliance obligations is an advantageProven specialist experience in endpoint, network devices and/or cloud environments.Understanding of the ASD Essential 8 and the control mapping to VM and SecCMAn engineering or automation background is desirableThe health and safety of our people, customers and communities is our number one priority. This means that we require all of our employees to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19. Please speak to us if you have any questions about this based on your individual circumstances. Whether you're passionate about customer service, driven by data, or called by creativity, a career here is for you. Our people bring their diverse backgrounds and unique perspectives to build a respectful, inclusive and flexible workplace. One where we're driven by our values, and supported to share ideas, initiatives, and energy. One where making a positive impact for customers, communities and each other is part of our every day.Here, you'll thrive. You'll be supported when faced with challenges, and empowered to tackle new opportunities. We really love working here, and we think you will too.We're determined to make a real difference for Australia's first peoples. We encourage all interested applicants to apply. If you're already part of the Commonwealth Bank Group (including Bankwest), you'll need to apply through Sidekick [link removed] to submit a valid application. We're keen to support you with the next step in your career.

Name: Security / Compliance Analyst
Description:
The Lottery Corporation is the driving force behind Australia’s largest lottery games and one of the best-performing lottery businesses in the world.
We’re excited to make a better future, and we’ll do it by delivering winning moments to our people, our customers and our communities.
Come join the winning team at The Lottery Corporation.
Exciting opportunity to remain technically hands on while experiencing technical and team leadership.
Building the next digital generation platform for lotteries & keno retail.
What you’ll do
You are a Security Analyst and will assist quarterly user access reviews, policy enforcement, vendor security risk assessments, industry standard certification to PCI-DSS, WLA-SCS, ISO 27001 and actively participating in all regulatory assessments and internal/external audits
Other responsibilities will include: 

Develop and continually improve TLC’s information security policies, standards, processes, procedures and guidelines.  
Ensure that TLC’s maintains compliance with published information security policies to achieve compliance with AS/NZS 27001, WLA SCS & PCI-DSS.
Experience in User Access Review (UAR) using SailPoint and an understanding of IAM concepts.
Ensure that complete and accurate evidence are maintained for audit purposes across all the activities performed as part of UAR
Be a process owner for security exceptions, vendor security risk assessments, cascading knowledge to process participants. 
Deliver and contribute to the Security Awareness program to all Tabcorp business units with respect to compliance with Tabcorp security plans, policies and standards and security best practice.  
Remediate audit items from internal audits, regulators and other external parties where applicable.  
Be a champion of effective security best practices and promote their acceptance, adoption and socialisation. 
Be seen as an enabler, demonstrating leadership and help build a successful and respected team who add value and deliver services that make a difference  

What you’ll bring 

Relevant tertiary qualification or equivalent experience 


Industry recognised security accreditation or qualification (eg, CISM, CISSP) (desirable) 
Demonstrated experience implementing, maintaining and improving information security management systems, based on security standards such as, PCI-DSS (mandatory).  
Knowledge of third-party vendor governance or third-party risk management. 
Knowledge of cyber security frameworks such as NIST CSF and ISO 27000, COBIT.  
Knowledge of risk management frameworks.   
Experience of risk assessment, security best practice and practical application of security controls in an enterprise environment.  
Proficient written, oral communication skills required to effectively communicate to both technical and non-technical audiences. 
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills  

What you’ll get 
Not only will you receive an awesome candidate experience from our caring Talent team, the perks of working with us are pretty good too!
The list is extensive but here are a few:

A “say yes” approach to flexible working to meet your individual needs
A multitude of leave types such as cultural leave, volunteer leave and 18 weeks’ parental leave for all new parents, regardless of gender
We’re committed to Inclusion & Diversity with a range of initiatives such as our Gender Affirmation Statement of Support
We offer a comprehensive (and free) health and wellbeing app called The Arena to support you and your family’s mental and physical health
We’re committed to your learning and development with a dedicated platform with helpful resources from leadership to technology to upskill and cross train

About The Lottery Corporation
The Lottery Corporation is Australia’s largest lottery company and one of the best-performing lottery businesses in the world.
Even though we’re a new name, we continue the incredible history of Australian lotteries. The Lottery Corporation™ was created following the Tabcorp demerger in 2022 and is now home to The Lott and Keno – brands and games that have been adding excitement to Australians’ lives for decades.
Operating in every state and territory except Western Australia, The Lottery Corporation offers exciting games that not only deliver life-changing wins to our customers but make a meaningful difference to our community.
COVID  
The Lottery Corporation Is working closely monitoring Department of Health guidelines to ensure we continue to provide a safe working environment. You may be required to present evidence of Covid vaccination in order to comply with Public Health directions and fulfil the requirements of this role.

Name: Cyber Security Specialist
Description:
Cyber Security Specialist

 

Australian information and communications technology firm SYPAQ, are looking for consultants to support the rapid expansion of our cyber services team.

 

 

We are seeking engineering and ICT people who are considering a move into a Cyber Security Consultant role. This person will join our high performing team of specialists in a full-time and permanent capacity. You will have the ability to work autonomously with stakeholders from government and industry while being supported by SYPAQ’s cyber specialists that include personnel with extensive cyber experience in Government and Defence.

 

The successful candidate will have approximately three years’ experience with ICT/Engineering systems and have a desire to learn and work supporting cyber aspects of Government capability projects. This work can include a wide variety of tasking from the development of requirements, support to verification and validation, or support to certification and accreditation of capability.

 

With multiple locations across the country, you can work from Melbourne, Brisbane, and Canberra. Travel will likely be required at our clients request and we have multiple projects that require a dedicated professional to add their unique value and voice to the cyber conversation

 
About youAustralian Citizen with AGSVA clearanceApproximately three years’ experience in ICT/engineeringBachelor of Engineering. Can be in Systems, Electronics and Communications, Aerospace, Mechatronics, or SoftwareExcellent interpersonal communications skills (writing and speaking)Desire to learn cyber in the Defence Capability contextExperience with the Defence Capability Lifecycle (One Defence Capability System) is highly desirable but not necessary 
Question

In order for us to better understand you, please provide a brief explanation as to why you would like to move into the world of cyber.

 
About SYPAQ

SYPAQ is experienced in the design and management of secure networks, and in the development and management of information and cyber security governance architecture in a Federal Government and Defence context to the highest security classification levels.

SYPAQ has broad experience in the Certification and Accreditation of systems in Federal Government and guiding the maturity of governance frameworks in support of cyber worthiness directives in this environment.

 
Our Culture

We take pride in being a 100% Australian Veteran, family-owned business. Our culture and values are important to us; hence we encourage people with the same vision to come on board and collaborate for prolific outcomes.

 

We strongly believe in our VALUES:

See something. Do something!

Achieve more together – share success.

Courageous – be innovative! See the opportunity, manage the risk.

Strive for excellence – master your craft.

We are family – value honesty, respect and compassion.

 
Staff Benefits

Generous professional development and study options

Loyalty leave scheme

ADF reserve leave

Flexible work arrangements

Referral bonuses

Salary sacrifice and novated leasing

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

ACT License: LHL 00000102

Queensland License: LHL02458-W2B3Z

Victorian License: LHL 03075

Name: Cyber Security Analysts
Description: Job Overview     Provide specialist, technical and administrative support for the company’s Cyber Security functions, applying practical and procedural knowledge and understanding of Australian Government security standards. Apply well-developed data analytical skills to extract meaning from application and system logs. Monitoring, analysing, and contributing to the response of security events and threats. Providing support to ensure the company's products, systems and services manage security risks appropriately Responsible for managing competing requests, demands and priorities, monitoring and identifying emerging and potential security risks. Providing timely and relevant details of potential security incidents and risks to supervising security analysts as they are discovered. Work with Information Communications Technology (ICT) security and operational teams to ensure that the company’s security measures are implemented and operational Provide security operations support, including monitor, identification, protection, detection, response, and recovery from cyber security events Analyse, interpret and understand incoming threat intelligence feeds. Contribute to the formulation of outgoing threat intelligence to support company’s system, preparing security monitoring reports for Agency IT systems.  Job Location Brisbane       If you are interested in the above job, please forward your resume to, newman.ponniah@calleo.com.au   or call us on  0404 331 242  Due to the nature of this role, this job is open to Australian Citizens only. Candidates who currently hold or able to obtain Federal Government Security Clearances are highly desirable.  Follow Calleo on LinkedIn and visit our website to keep up to date on all our current job vacancies: www.linkedin.com/company/calleoresourcing www.calleo.com.au

Name: Cyber Security Engineer – Multiple Opportunities
Description: Company DescriptionAt Leidos, we deliver practical solutions to the Federal Government’s most complex IT engineering problems. And, as a Prime Systems Integrator, these are often on a scale and variety rarely seen by other organisations. Whether developing and supporting technology transformation projects for the Bureau of Meteorology, providing software applications for critical Defence missions, or improving the way the ATO supports its service delivery, our work has a direct impact on the lives of Australians, and will certainly impact on your career.Job DescriptionYour New RoleLeidos has been engaged by Defence to provide a leading cyber security capability for the environments that our deployed military personnel rely on. The team develops and delivers key cyber security services to directly support the Department’s mission. We are seeking highly motivated and appropriately experienced staff to help us deliver outstanding results. This role is an exciting opportunity to perform crucial high value work to support and protect our personnel in the Australian Defence Forces.This is a rare opportunity for driven and focused people to “Get Cybersecurity Right”. This engagement is still maturing and there is real scope for the right individual to put their stamp on how Cybersecurity is done within the engagement, the end goal is a leading edge Cybersecurity capability that is the envy of others and we need the right people to get there.Our cyber engineering roles include support of the security function for our customer ensuring systems are available, appropriately maintained and secured. This role allows you to utilise your broad experience in a supportive team environment.You will have the following responsibilities:Management and configuration of the security tooling our Deployed ADF personnel rely on;Perform troubleshooting in support of the ADF or our Security Operations Centre, such as why logs aren’t shipping from point A to point B;Assist with vulnerability management including config reviews and software versions;Assist with incident investigation including obtaining logs, reviewing firewall rules, etc;Assist with monitoring the network for changes that may affect cyber security;Be cross trained into supporting cyber security tools such as proxies, sandboxes, mail gateways, and end point security;Integration and functional testing; andWork with other teams to troubleshoot complex issues across multiple networks.QualificationsAbout You and What You'll BringAs a Cyber Security Engineer, you will bring your knowledge and expertise to support the team. You will be customer-focused, and enjoy working as part of a team. We have a number of open roles from mid-level through to Senior. Our list of desired technologies is lengthy, however we don't expect you to bring all of the below to the table. We offer cross training across the entire tool suite for the right candidates.You will have the following skills/knowledge:3+ years in enterprise IT system administration;Knowledge of how a typical Enterprise IT system fits togetherIntermediate to advanced troubleshooting skills in complex networksWorking knowledge in cybersecurity principles such as hardening standards and techniquesWorking knowledge of Windows operating systemsIdeally you will have experience in some of the following:Worked with SOC operational teams to support evidence gatheringWorking knowledge of operating systems such as LinuxWorking knowledge of:SplunkMcAfee ePOTenable.SCCisco ASAsBluecoat ProxySG,ForescoutElastic SIEMFortinetCarbon Black Response or similar EDR toolsCarbon Black App Control or similar whitelisting toolsFortigate firewallsFortimailFortiauthenticatorFortiNACFortisandboxForticlientFortianalyserNutanix FlowIvanti Device ControlYou will have the following attributes:Comfortable working in cross team environments;Comfortable interacting with a mixture of highly technical peers and partners as well as military staff;Willing to learn new technologies in the cyber security space;Willing to mentor other team members; andWilling to go the extra mile to ensure customer mission needs are met.Additional InformationIf you want the following as part of your next role, please get in touch today.Important and engaging workLeading edge technologyExcellent training and career developmentHappy and focused high performing teamWork with experienced peersWell-resourced operationEnhance national securitySuccessful candidates will be required to be Australian Citizens and be able to obtain and maintain an Australian Government Security Clearance. NV-2 Clearance preferred, but an NV-1 cleared candidate with strong experience and team fit will be considered. This role requires tasks to be performed onsite due to the nature of the networks used.The successful candidate may need to meet International Traffic in Arms Regulations (ITAR) requirements applicable to this role, and your nationality may be a factor in determining your suitability for this role.  At Leidos, you will be valued, included and supported. So if you are open-minded and keen to be the difference, we look forward to welcoming you.

Name: Security Threat & Engineering Lead
Description: Clarrow are working alongside a leading energy infrastructure business to help find them their next Security Threat & Engineering Lead. This position is a mid-level management role in their Security Operations division and is responsible for operations of Cyber SOC team for detecting, analyzing, and responding to security threats. It is expected to support the Head of Security Operations by managing the day-to-day operations, enabling an effective and robust security operating model.The perfect candidate will have:  6-7 years of experience in Cyber threat & Engineering with 2-3 years’ experience in a management role in a ASX 100 company, or equivalent Functional understanding of common threat analysis models such as the Diamond Model, Cyber Kill Chain, and MITRE ATT&CK Experience in Information Security, Threat Intelligence tools and Management platforms. Strong knowledge of attack vectors and tactics, techniques, and procedures (TTPs) employed by cyber threat actors Proven ability to converse complex/technical information effectively to technical and non-technical audiences Knowledge of at least one common scripting language (Python, Ruby, Go). Understanding of log collection and aggregation techniques, Elastic Search, Logstash, Kibana (ELK), Syslog-NG, etc. Security Certifications Preferred (Including but not limited to the following certifications): CTIA, GCTI, GCIH, GDAT, OSCP, CHFI, CEH. Broad knowledge of operating systems, networking, and cloud technologies, perhaps gained as a sysadmin, DevOps, or security engineer  Due to the nature of the work - this role is only open to people who hold Australian Permanent Residency or Citizenship.If you are keen to discuss this opportunity in more detail - please click apply or send your resume to tim.b@clarrow.com.au

Name: Cybersecurity Governance Analyst
Description:
Job no: 0056310Location: ParkvilleRole type: Full time; Continuing Department: Business ServicesRemuneration: Attractive remuneration based on your level of experience

Diverse role: Manage risk assessments end-to-end
Join a growing, motivated team – Opportunity to provide input in our way of working!
Engage with exciting stakeholders at Australia’s #1 University

Founded in 1853, the University of Melbourne is Australia’s #1 university and is consistently ranked amongst the leading universities in the world. We are proud of our people, our commitment to research and teaching excellence, and our global engagement.
About Business ServicesBusiness Services provides a full range of class leading information technology, facilities management, finance, HR and health and safety services to all operating entities of the University.The Cybersecurity team works to reduce the University’s vulnerability to cyberthreats while balancing the need for openness, autonomy and collaboration using a risk-based approach to manage exposures.
About the RoleAs a Cybersecurity Governance Analyst, you will join a growing team focused on continuously improving our Cybersecurity Governance, Risk, and Compliance posture. In this diverse role, you will perform hands-on risk assessment tasks, including compliance reviews, and will further provide input into our strategic framework to ensure University systems are compliant with policies and legal requirements.
Taking a consultative approach, you will work across the organisation to perform risk assessments, identify improvement opportunities, recommend appropriate remediation plans and monitor their implementation. By partnering with internal and external stakeholders and subject matter experts, you will help the University understand, measure and manage its cyber-risk posture.
This is a great opportunity for someone who is looking to broaden their cybersecurity-related skill set as part of a collaborative team that values new ideas.
In a typical week at work, you may:

Assist in the development of cybersecurity governance, risk management framework, and compliance tracking measures
Support management of cybersecurity risks including risk assessment, assurance review, and providing guidance and building awareness with University stakeholders to ensure compliance with University policies and standards
Develop and maintain the IT security controls library, and execute the assurance road map
Develop and report on key activities and risk indicators concerning security controls and processes 

About YouWith 3+ years' experience in a similar role, you have a good working knowledge of IT governance concepts, policy and standards development and documentation of risk management frameworks.
As a consultative communicator with high level interpersonal skills, you understand how to effectively communicate cybersecurity and risk concepts to technical and non-technical audiences. You also have a passion for continuous learning and growth, of both business and technical skills, and demonstrate sound judgment and discretion when dealing with highly sensitive information.
Ideally, you will further have:

Tertiary qualifications and/or an equivalent mix of relevant education and experience, preferably in cybersecurity, information technology, risk or other related area
Professional security certification is highly desirable; such as CRISC, CISM, CISSP, CISA, etc. 
Competencies in technology controls, emerging threats, information security and cybersecurity.
An understanding of cybersecurity risk in a complex University or research context
Exposure to industry control frameworks and standards, such as COBIT, NIST CSF, Australian Government ISM, CSA CCM, ISO 27001/2, SOC2 (Types 1, 2, & 3)
A working knowledge and experience with cybersecurity and IT services including both on-premise and cloud architectures, and relevant security threats and prevention measure

Benefits of Working with UsIn addition to having the opportunity to grow and be challenged, and to be part of a vibrant campus life, our people enjoy a range of rewarding benefits:

Flexible working arrangements and generous personal, parental and cultural leave
Competitive remuneration, 17% super, salary packaging and leave loading
Free and subsidised health and wellbeing services, and access to fitness and cultural clubs
Discounts on a wide range of products and services including Myki cards and Qantas Club
Career development opportunities and 25% off graduate courses for staff and their immediate families

To find out more, please visit https://about.unimelb.edu.au/careers/staff-benefits.
Be Yourself At UoM, we value the unique backgrounds, experiences and contributions that each person brings to our community, and we encourage and celebrate diversity. Indigenous Australians, those identifying as LGBTQIA+, females, people of all ages, with disabilities or culturally diverse backgrounds are encouraged to apply for our roles. Our aim is to create a workforce that reflects the community in which we live.
Join Us!If you feel this role is right for you, please apply with your CV and cover letter outlining your interest and experience.  Please note that you are not required to provide responses against the selection criteria in the Position Description.
Please note, interviews may commence during the advertising period, please submit your applications at the earliest convenience.
Should you require any reasonable adjustments with the recruitment process, please contact the Talent Acquisition team at hr-talent@unimelb.edu.au.
Due to the impacts of COVID-19, we are currently prioritising applications with current valid working rights in Australia and candidates who are not affected by travel restrictions. Please see the latest updates to Australia's immigration and border arrangements: https://covid19.homeaffairs.gov.au/
The University of Melbourne is required to comply with applicable health guidance and directions issued from the Victoria Health Minister. The University of Melbourne requires all University of Melbourne employees to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19, unless an exemption order applies. All applicants therefore must meet this requirement when submitting an application.

Applications close: 3 July 2022 11:55 PM AUS Eastern Standard Time

Name: Security Threat & Engineering Lead

It is expected to support the Head of Security Operations by managing the day-to-day operations, enabling an effective and robust security operating model.The perfect candidate will have:  6-7 years of experience in Cyber threat & Engineering with 2-3 years’ experience in a management role in a ASX 100 company, or equivalent Functional understanding of common threat analysis models such as the Diamond Model, Cyber Kill Chain, and MITRE ATT&CK Experience in Information Security, Threat Intelligence tools and Management platforms. Strong knowledge of attack vectors and tactics, techniques, and procedures (TTPs) employed by cyber threat actors Proven ability to converse complex/technical information effectively to technical and non-technical audiences Knowledge of at least one common scripting language (Python, Ruby, Go). Understanding of log collection and aggregation techniques, Elastic Search, Logstash, Kibana (ELK), Syslog-NG, etc. Security Certifications Preferred (Including but not limited to the following certifications): CTIA, GCTI, GCIH, GDAT, OSCP, CHFI, CEH. Broad knowledge of operating systems, networking, and cloud technologies, perhaps gained as a sysadmin, DevOps, or security engineer  Due to the nature of the work - this role is only open to people who hold Australian Permanent Residency or Citizenship.If you are keen to discuss this opportunity in more detail - please click apply or send your resume to tim.b@clarrow.com.au

Name: Cyber Security Specialist
Description: We are looking for an enthusiastic Cloud Security Specialist to join our Information security team based in Sydney. The Information Security team provides security capabilities and consultancy that enable the entire organisation to be successful in a safe and secure way.This is a newly created role reporting to the Information Security Advisory Lead to support ING Australia’s Cloud Transformation as the Cloud Security Specialist by working with the Information Security  team, Security Architecture team and other key stakeholders.You’ll be instrumental in managing the security risks related to Cloud by ensuring appropriate Cloud Security controls are identified, implemented and operated to ensure ING Australia Data, Systems remain secure in the Cloud environment, and business outcomes are achievedJoin us today to be a part of this amazing cloud transformation journey and have the flexibility to work across all of the Information Security advisory areas while being the Subject Matter Expert in some of them.What are you going to do? You will…Manage the Identification of regulatory, ING Group and Architecture requirements related to Cloud security and ensure they are considered as part of solution design.Work closely with all key stakeholders to influence and design the Cloud Security Architecture, frameworks and other guidelines.Collaborate with key stakeholders to identify the Cloud security capabilities required to effectively manage the environment.Assist with prioritization of the uplift activities required and identify any risks and issues.Support with operationalisation of all Cloud Security capabilities and ensure a smooth transition to Operations teams.Influence best practices and common security patterns for cloud and related security environment.Own and manage any Cloud Security related issues and findings, as deemed appropriate.What are we looking for? Someone who has…Proven experience in design and implementing Cloud Security capabilitiesExperience in security advisory work especially with enterprise wide project/initiative.Hands on experience with Cyber capability assessment initiative and incident response process.Experience with infrastructure, networking and security technologies will be beneficial.Hands on experience in effective communication, team management and senior management.The ability to priorities and delegate to achieve exceptional outcomes.Strong negotiation and influencing skills with a passion for solving complex ambiguous problems.If you meet a number of the requirements, but not all, we encourage you to submit your application.About UsAt ING, we want to make life simpler and more worthwhile – for everyone who banks with us, for the people who work with us, and the community at large, too.When you come to work at ING, you’re joining a team where individuality isn’t just accepted, it’s encouraged. We’ve built a culture that’s fun, friendly and supportive – it’s the kind of place where you can be yourself and make the most of whatever you have to offer.We give people the freedom to take risks, think differently, take ownership of their work, and make great things happen. We’re here to help you get ahead. And with our global network, there’s plenty of scope to take your career in new directions, perhaps even ones you’ve never considered.People of all ages, sexual orientations, cultures and backgrounds are welcome to apply – likewise if you’re an indigenous Australian, or you’re living with a disability, or you have family or caring responsibilities.Sound like the kind of place you’d feel at home? We’d love to hear from you.Please Contact Mia.annamalai@ing.com.au for more information.(One last thing, ING operates a direct talent-sourcing model. So no agency introductions, please)

Name: Cyber Engineer
Description: Our Client:Our client is an agency within the federal government, they are currently seeking a Cyber Engineer to join on an initial 12 -month contract.About the roleThis role looks to focus on supporting the design and assurance activities during the planning, design, development, and implementation phase of a solution and not the operational phase of a solution.Key Responsibilities/ Accountabilities:Provide general security guidance (e.g., initiate discussions to support security activity project planning) to the program.Develop and deliver security business requirements that meet the organisations security objectives.Review and analyse solution security controls that were planned for and designed to be implemented to validate and verify their inclusion and effectiveness.Perform a review and report on system or service configuration to identify potential security risks and recommendations on possible mitigations.Provide advice to project and/or solution teams on how to address security risk and compliance recommendations; andDevelop other security deliverables as directed. The successful applicant will have experience in:Experience in securing designs/solutions through implementation of security controlsSecuring configurationsEmbedding cyber security into team and organisational processesIntegration of cyber security into broader security related functionsExperience with logging, SIEM, ongoing security testing regimes, vulnerability management and incident response PLEASE NOTEThis is a security assessed position. Applicants must be an Australian citizen, with successful candidate holding a Negative Vetting 1 Australian Government security clearance and undertake a national police check prior to commencement.If you are seeking the next step in your career, please APPLY NOW. For any further questions or information, please contact Nakita Huynh on (03) 8080 7220 and quote job #247430

Name: Principal Cyber Security Specialist
Description: We are seeking an experienced Principal Cyber Security Specialist to join the Residential Tenancies Authority (RTA). This role is required to provide expert capabilities to the Digital Business Centre (DBC) division in the cyber security domain, in collaboration with our vendor partners to support DBC delivering outstanding technology services to the RTA. This position is a newly created permanent full-time role and is located in Brisbane CBD, with the opportunity to work up to 3-days from home.This role will be required to develop, maintain and promote an ICT Security Framework to facilitate appropriate ongoing attention to the security (confidentiality, integrity and availability) of the RTA’s information recourses and compliance obligations.About the RTAThe RTA is a self-funded, state government statutory authority that provides tenancy information and support, bond management, dispute resolution, investigation, and education services to Queenslanders. Our vision is “Renting that works for everyone”. The RTA administers the Residential Tenancies and Rooming Accommodation Act 2008 (the Act). The RTA works with all sector groups including tenants, property managers and owners, community and industry stakeholder groups and the Queensland Government.To be successful you will need:Proven experience in a similar roleDemonstrated ability to work under pressure within a high-functioning team Demonstrated ability in managing multiple tasks within strict deadlinesWhat we offer is:The flexibility to work from home up to 3 days per weekBrand new, beautifully designed offices at Midtown Centre on Mary St, Brisbane CBDA rewarding role with professional development opportunities on offerA highly supportive culture that values diversity and inclusion while contributing to team successAn employee Health & Wellbeing program that encompasses our four pillars of wellbeing - financial, mental, physical, and social.If this challenging and highly rewarding role sounds like an opportunity that compliments your current skills, experience and future career plan, we want to hear from you.Further informationPlease apply now by reviewing the position description and submitting your resume and cover letter.

Name: IT Security Analyst
Description: Asta is a leading full-service technology and consulting agency. Beyond our IT acumen in software, web and mobile app development, our fit-for-purpose managed service solutions and our ground-breaking AI and blockchain technologies, there is something more.Our relentless commitment to people. And not just our customers, but our team.About the role:The IT Security Administrator is a role with the purpose of ensuring that best practices for security are implemented, maintained and monitored, across and between our managed environments. Asta is a leading managed services provider with a large client base, offering a diverse range of security scenarios, environments and implementations. Your ability to work, both in a team and autonomously, providing positive outcomes within the role will ensure success for both yourself and Asta.Ideally you will have worked in an MSP and be familiar with the responsibilities of a Security Analyst.What will you be doing?Installing, administering, and troubleshooting security solutions. Incident response to immediate threats, investigation of security incidents, root cause analysis and vulnerability propagation defence.Ensuring that security processes are governed according to the principles outlined in the IT Security FrameworkMonitoring compliance within the organisations security policies and procedures among employees, contractors, alliances and other third parties and takes corrective actionMonitoring secured environments to ensure that appropriate information access levels and security clearances are maintainedConsulting with staff, managers, and executives about the best security practices and providing technical adviceNaturally your responsibilities will extend to all clients, where consideration of customer-based security frameworks will need to be maintained and validated against the internal security framework. Where either framework lacks sufficient security, your role will be to provide recommendations for improvement.What can we offer you?Our people are at the heart of everything we do, so if our team is happy, we are happy!Happy Birthday To You! - Once you pass your probation period with us, you get to enjoy your birthday off, fully paid by us. It is our birthday gift to you.Save, Save, Save - Our HR Platform gives you access to hundreds of savings every day, from money off top brand items, to supermarket and travel savings.Employee Assistance Program - Free assistance is on hand 24 hours a day, 365 days a year. That goes for your immediate family as well because your family is our family too.Referral Scheme - Know the perfect person to join the team, or the perfect client we can assist? You could pocket $800 for putting in the good word.Flexibility - We know that some people thrive in an office environment and others work better from home. The choice will always be yours to mix up your work environment however you decide.Training - We know you do not want to stand still in your career, so we create a personalised training plan specifically focused on your career growth, reviewed and updated every quarter.Get Paid In Bitcoin - We love all things IT and technology and so all of our Asta employees have the option to receive a % of their salary in Bitcoin.Please only apply if you can answer yes to the following:You have:Extended knowledge of network and operating systems (i.e., Linux, Windows)An associate's or bachelor's degree in computer science, cyber security, or a related field.Advanced training certifications A strong understanding of security standards and common frameworksStrong analytical, critical thinking, and problem-solving skillsAttention to detail and meticulous work ethicEvidence of clear focus on security in previous rolesGood teaching, interpersonal, and communication skillsPrevious experience working for an MSPAt Asta we know that an organisation, no matter how well designed, is only as good as the people who live and work in it. Our people are passionate about delivering outstanding customer service in a fast paced, professional, IT environment.Everything we do at Asta is driven by our core values: One Team, Relentless Client Focus, Trust, Loyalty & Honesty. Our people love what they do, enjoy working together and thrive in our culture of growth and development.Head over to our website if you would like to know more about who we are and what we do, and if you like what you see, apply! Please note:You must have the right to live and work in AustraliaAll short-listed candidates will be subject to a National Police Check

Name: Cyber Security Systems Engineer
Advertiser: Talent – SEEK Recruitment Agency of the Year | 7 Time Winner
Description: Due to a busy period, our federal government client requires the services of an experienced Cyber Security Engineer. Based in the South Eastern suburbs of Melbourne and some WFH, you will work closely with teams in securing designs/solutions through implementation of security controls, secure configuration, and helping to embed cyber security into team processes as well as integration into broader IMT security related functions such as logging, SIEM, ongoing security testing regimes, vulnerability management, and Incident response. You will be someone who will take what the Cyber Solution Architects produce (high-end designs etc) and translate that into more technical aspects (take it from the logical level into the physical level).This is not a traditional SOC engineering role. This role looks to focus on supporting the design and assurance activities during the planning, design, development, and implementation phase of a solution and not the operational phase of a solution.To perform this role, you will need the following:Provide general security guidance (e.g., initiate discussions to support security activity project planning) to the ESD program.Develop and deliver security business requirements that meet the clients security objectives.Review and analyse solution security controls that were planned for and designed to be implemented to validate and verify their inclusion and effectiveness.Perform a review and report on system or service configuration to identify potential security risks and recommendations on possible mitigations.Provide advice to project and/or solution teams on how to address security risk and compliance recommendations; andDevelop other security deliverables as directed. Be Cyber Tool AgnosticHave a NV1 Security Clearance preference however Baseline will be considered.To apply: Please send your confidential resume to shelley.harrison@talentinternational.com for more information please call Shelley 0418 572 482. Short listed candidates will be contacted.

Name: GRC Analyst
Description:
Overview

Our client is a national provider or cyber security services across OT and IT environments. With a strong emphasis on the integration of robust and resilient IT, ICS, and OT Solutions, they differentiate themselves by offering their customers access to experts in the network and security domains. They are looking for a GRC analyst to join their team due to company expansion. The ideal candidate will possess experience in any security frameworks including  ISO27001, ESS8, NIST (OT Frameworks), CPS234 (Finance industry), AESCSF, SOC, CIS, CCM, or COBIT.
Duties and Responsibilities

Work with business stakeholders and IT teams to present, discuss and analyse risksWork with business stakeholders to understand problems, provide advice, and define solutions to meet business requirementsPerform risk assessment, privacy impact assessment and threat and vulnerability assessmentsMaintain schedule of compliance and assurance activities.Coordinate and collate content for risk forumsLog and maintain IT and OT risks, controls and actions Perform governance, risk and compliance reportingProvide advice and collaborate with departmental projects in relation to best security practicesProvide and transfer governance, risk and compliance knowledge to upskill other team membersSupport governance, risk and compliance, audit and other assurance activitiesAdvise on and support IT security matters
Benefits

Competitive commission and bonus structureQuarterly staff events WFH up to 3 weeks per monthStrong growth and career paths available

Name: Senior Security Analyst
Description: Senior Security Analyst  CyberCX is Australia’s leading independent cyber security consultancy organisation. To support our rapid growth, we are looking motivated and passionate Senior Security Analysts to work in our Brisbane office. In this role, you’ll work with your team to deliver great client outcomes and grow your career rapidly as a cyber security professional.   This role is responsible for providing advanced security operations, project leadership and management, capability development and thought leadership, and Tier 2 and 3 analytical supports for MSS clients and capabilities.   CyberCX has an increasing Women in Cyber network internally and we value this diversity in our teams. Key responsibilities:       Perform SIEM-based event analysis and incident triage and perform coordination and management of security incidents and projects, remotely and onsite, with internal and external stakeholders. Lead and coordinate threat hunting activities, perform and lead vulnerability assessment activities, and develop new detection capabilities and concepts through the creation and tuning of alerts Provide end to end support for customer and internal systems Provide operational support and project support with clients, taking the initiative to drive improvement and deliver successful outcomes for customers Conduct internal and client communications around security issues Provide mentoring and operational guidance to less experienced team members Actively collaborate across CyberCX, and continuously look for ways to add value. Facilitate communication, partnerships, and cross-pollination across the business to allow teams to better engage and service customers Participate in a 7am - 7pm shift roster, as required     About you:      Tertiary qualification in information technology or similar field (preferred) Industry recognised qualifications (e.g. SANS, OSCP, ISC2) (preferred) Suitable vendor certifications preferred Minimum 3 years’ experience in an operational security role In-depth understanding of security and analytical concepts Experience with incident response and incident management methodologies Exposure to IT security operations in a large or complex organisation In-depth experience or understanding of IT security tools and controls including SIEM, IDS/IPS, Anti-Virus, WAF (preferred) Strong stakeholder engagement and communication skills Strong analytical and problem-solving skills Skilled in responding to setbacks in an agile and resilient manner       What’s in it for you:      Be part of an innovative, forward-thinking Security Operations team that is committed to excellence  Extensive on-the-job training and certification support  Continuous growth and professional development opportunities  You will be surrounded by technical security specialists, including some of Australia’s best security practitioners         About CyberCX   CyberCX has united Australia and New Zealand’s most trusted cyber security companies to deliver the most comprehensive end to end cyber security services offering to enterprises and governments. With a workforce of over 900 cyber security professionals and a footprint of over 20 offices across Australia and New Zealand and global presence in Europe and US, CyberCX offers a full suite of cyber security services.   This is a fantastic opportunity for an enthusiastic professional looking to spread their wings. If you’re looking to continuously grow and to embrace disruptive methods and technologies to protect customers, submit your CV by following the “Apply” button.

Name: Cyber Security Engineer – Multiple Opportunities
Description: Company DescriptionAt Leidos, we deliver practical solutions to the Federal Government’s most complex IT engineering problems. And, as a Prime Systems Integrator, these are often on a scale and variety rarely seen by other organisations. Whether developing and supporting technology transformation projects for the Bureau of Meteorology, providing software applications for critical Defence missions, or improving the way the ATO supports its service delivery, our work has a direct impact on the lives of Australians, and will certainly impact on your career.Job DescriptionYour New RoleLeidos has been engaged by Defence to provide a leading cyber security capability for the environments that our deployed military personnel rely on. The team develops and delivers key cyber security services to directly support the Department’s mission. We are seeking highly motivated and appropriately experienced staff to help us deliver outstanding results. This role is an exciting opportunity to perform crucial high value work to support and protect our personnel in the Australian Defence Forces.This is a rare opportunity for driven and focused people to “Get Cybersecurity Right”. This engagement is still maturing and there is real scope for the right individual to put their stamp on how Cybersecurity is done within the engagement, the end goal is a leading edge Cybersecurity capability that is the envy of others and we need the right people to get there.Our cyber engineering roles include support of the security function for our customer ensuring systems are available, appropriately maintained and secured. This role allows you to utilise your broad experience in a supportive team environment.You will have the following responsibilities:Management and configuration of the security tooling our Deployed ADF personnel rely on;Perform troubleshooting in support of the ADF or our Security Operations Centre, such as why logs aren’t shipping from point A to point B;Assist with vulnerability management including config reviews and software versions;Assist with incident investigation including obtaining logs, reviewing firewall rules, etc;Assist with monitoring the network for changes that may affect cyber security;Be cross trained into supporting cyber security tools such as proxies, sandboxes, mail gateways, and end point security;Integration and functional testing; andWork with other teams to troubleshoot complex issues across multiple networks.QualificationsAbout You and What You'll BringAs a Cyber Security Engineer, you will bring your knowledge and expertise to support the team. You will be customer-focused, and enjoy working as part of a team. We have a number of open roles from mid-level through to Senior. Our list of desired technologies is lengthy, however we don't expect you to bring all of the below to the table. We offer cross training across the entire tool suite for the right candidates.You will have the following skills/knowledge:3+ years in enterprise IT system administration;Knowledge of how a typical Enterprise IT system fits togetherIntermediate to advanced troubleshooting skills in complex networksWorking knowledge in cybersecurity principles such as hardening standards and techniquesWorking knowledge of Windows operating systemsIdeally you will have experience in some of the following:Worked with SOC operational teams to support evidence gatheringWorking knowledge of operating systems such as LinuxWorking knowledge of:SplunkMcAfee ePOTenable.SCCisco ASAsBluecoat ProxySG,ForescoutElastic SIEMFortinetCarbon Black Response or similar EDR toolsCarbon Black App Control or similar whitelisting toolsFortigate firewallsFortimailFortiauthenticatorFortiNACFortisandboxForticlientFortianalyserNutanix FlowIvanti Device ControlYou will have the following attributes:Comfortable working in cross team environments;Comfortable interacting with a mixture of highly technical peers and partners as well as military staff;Willing to learn new technologies in the cyber security space;Willing to mentor other team members; andWilling to go the extra mile to ensure customer mission needs are met.Additional InformationIf you want the following as part of your next role, please get in touch today.Important and engaging workLeading edge technologyExcellent training and career developmentHappy and focused high performing teamWork with experienced peersWell-resourced operationEnhance national securitySuccessful candidates will be required to be Australian Citizens and be able to obtain and maintain an Australian Government Security Clearance. NV-2 Clearance preferred, but an NV-1 cleared candidate with strong experience and team fit will be considered. This role requires tasks to be performed onsite due to the nature of the networks used.The successful candidate may need to meet International Traffic in Arms Regulations (ITAR) requirements applicable to this role, and your nationality may be a factor in determining your suitability for this role.  At Leidos, you will be valued, included and supported. So if you are open-minded and keen to be the difference, we look forward to welcoming you.

Name: Senior Cybersecurity Engineer

Working knowledge in cybersecurity principles such as hardening standards and techniques Ability to direct and guide responses to threat and actively participate in a hands on matter if needed. Name: Cyber Security Defence Centre Manager

The CSDM is responsible for building and managing the Bureau's cyber security operations centre called Cyber Security Defence Centre (CSDC) and incident response and reporting capability.The CSDCM is the technical and people leader for the security operational staff, while partnering with other Bureau and external stakeholders to manage cyber risk. Name: Cyber Security Specialist
Description: Leading Government Client is looking for Cyber Security Specialist (Essential 8 experience) at Sydney for a 6 months contract + possible extension. APPLY NOW!  The Role The Cyber Security Specialist Practitioner is responsible for the coordination and delivery of a range of specialised cyber security services resulting in Safe and Secure implementation of ICT projects.  Key ResponsibilitiesProvide Information Security Services (ISS) within in the Service Delivery directorate specialised cyber security subject matter expertise to NSW Government Department and Health organisations.Ensure that ICT products and their product teams meet cyber security maturity levels of organisation.Undertake and communicate the outcome of risk assessments, ensuring that cyber security risks are identified, owned and are being met with appropriate risk treatment plans.Support the development and implementation of Information Security Management Systems (ISMS) that ensure compliance with cyber security strategies, frameworks, policies, guidelines and directives.Maintain expertise in emerging cybersecurity risks, trends and technologies as well as provide a broad and thorough understanding of all business risks and threats to inform high quality, expert advice to key stakeholders.Follow Departments standard project management and administrative procedures that support efficient, customer centric delivery for cyber security services.Ensure meetings and contracts are scheduled in a timely manner to facilitate ongoing compliance of cyber security reporting, policy, audits, certifications and related legislation.Negotiate, influence and collaborate with other teams, NSW clients and vendors to create positive engagement and ensure appropriate expectations and deadlines are met.Support the Cyber Security Management team and the Chief Information Security Officer in exercising their duties. Key Specialisations  A Senior Cyber Security Specialist Practitioner will be accountable for one or more of the key focus areas in ISS. These currently include the following areas of Cyber Security specialisation: 1) Incident Handling and Digital Forensics 2) Vulnerable Management 3) Governance, Risks, Compliance (GRC) and Policy 4) Advisory and Privacy, Security Assurance 5) Education and Awareness 6) Cloud Services 7) ACSC's Essential Eight Mitigation Controls  Key challengesFacilitate engagement on providing cyber security specialist services across the organisations system, balance competing demands to achieve business objectives, establish effective stakeholder relationships and arrangements that ensure customer input to all decisions, and balance state-wide needs with local innovation and national directions.Work within an environment where technologies are subject to rapid evolution and change and identify technology solutions and platforms that improve the efficiency and effectiveness of the overall service offering for customers and drive improved value and stay at the leading edge of knowledge in the trends in cybersecurity risks and threats to ensure delivery of unbiased, risk-based analysis to ensure pragmatic solutions.Establish collaborative and influential relationships with stakeholders, customers and colleagues, to ensure easy and effective achievement of team / project / business goals.Create and maintain a constructive workplace culture in a rapidly changing and demanding service provision.If this sounds like you, APPLY NOW!Umema NetterwalaRecruitment SpecialistLet's ConnectManpowerGroup is committed to being a Diversity Confident Recruiter and encourages applications from people from a diverse range of backgrounds, including people with a disability. Name: Principal SOC Specialist
Description: Among Australia's earliest adopters of the Google platform and agile methodologies, we are continually investing in future-focused IT solutions. We seek curious, innovative and resourceful technology experts to help us pave the way and to make the most valuable impact. We currently have an opportunity for an experienced Principal SOC Specialist -Security Operations Centre. This role is part of the Security Operations Centre reporting to the Head of IT - Security Operations. The Security Operations Centre (SOC) is responsible for the configuration and running of critical security tools as well as the monitoring and response of security related incidents across the Woolworths Group. About the Role  In this role you will be focused on a future view of the critical systems, to monitor and ensure adequate logs are collected to support a pipeline of detection development. You will assist in identifying and uplifting controls to prevent, detect and respond to security incidents. In addition to this, you will develop splunk based detections for attacker TTPs and security alerts along with playbooks for triage and response, you will also be responsible for:  SOC SME for all the relevant related projects  Work closely with Threat Management to understand IoC's collected from threat intelligence  Work closely with Security Engineering to design meaningful alerts based on IoC's   Assist in identifying potential trends in events, alerts and incidents.  Provide input into Incident Handling documentation including processes and playbooks and ensure they are adopted across the organisation  Participate in PIR's  Drive efficiencies through process improvement, automation and tooling  Encourage continual innovation to increase visibility and reduce incident identification time  Provide effective communication to the Head of IT - Security Operations  Collect and maintain detection metrics on a regular basis  About you  You will be an inquisitive self-starter, with exceptional communication skills across all mediums, with an ability to translate technical information to a wide range of audiences and adapt your message to fit.  You have at least 6 years of SOC and Security experience, with a broad knowledge and confidence in a number of Security applications and tools.  You will also have:  Experience with SPLUNK (highly regarded) Experience in managing significant security incidents  A working knowledge of the kill chain methodology  Experience in the various stages of Incident Response  Strong understanding of information security  Strong understanding of networking and protocols  The ability to work in both a team environment and independently  Driving business outcomes   Grow with the Group Woolworths Group has announced it will be requiring Australian team members to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 (subject to medical and religious exemptions). As an inclusive, team-first company, our people are at the core of everything we do.  We care deeply about creating a workplace where our team members feel valued, respected and empowered. We are committed to providing equal opportunity regardless of gender identity, ethnicity, disability, sexual orientation or life stage. We are proud to be recognised as a Gold Tier Employer in the Australian Workplace Equality Index for LGBTQ+ inclusion and as an Employer of Choice for Gender Equality by the Workplace Gender Equality Agency. As our Group continues to evolve, innovate and support our communities, we encourage our team members to do the same with their own careers, by providing ongoing opportunities to grow and make a real difference.  We value flexibility, and encourage our team members to work in ways that meet their work/life commitments and support their wellbeing.  We work hard to create a safe and inclusive environment for all, and most importantly, we're all about creating better experiences - for our customers and for each other. We'd love to hear from You If you meet a number of the requirements, but not all, we encourage you to submit your application. You can learn more about working with us on LinkedIn [link removed] or via www.wowcareers.com.au [link removed]. #LI #work180. Our Talent Acquisition Team and Hiring Leaders kindly request no unsolicited resumes or approaches from Recruitment Agencies. Woolworths Group is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.
