Name: Security Adviser
Description:
Security Adviser  
Department of Parliamentary Services
At the Parliament, our employees are the key to our success. Together we deliver innovative, professional, and apolitical services to support our elected representatives and the democratic process. 
Our Parliament should be reflective of the community, and that's why we seek to recruit the best, regardless of gender, age, disability, religion, sexual orientation, or cultural background.
 
About the role 
As a Security Adviser you will be responsible for managing the day-to-day security function of a select group of Electorate Offices within Victoria. This includes incident response, threat & risk assessments and attending Parliament House on a rotational basis to manage security when the Parliament sits.
Providing specialist security advice to a members and Electorate Offices, developing and maintaining relationships is key to the success of this role. 
 
About you
With experience in security or security related industry, you have a working knowledge of security systems, incident management and security requirements for buildings and events.
Your communication skills and ability to manage sensitive situations in a confidential environment are vital to this role, coupled with your strong problem-solving skills and ability work collaboratively under pressure and to tight timelines
 
Why join us?
We offer flexible work, come to the iconic heritage listed Parliament House building or our adjacent modern offices and collaborate with the team one day, work from home the next. The nature and scope of flexible options available will depend on the nature of the position. You are encouraged to discuss flexible arrangements with the hiring manager during the recruitment process.
Your professional development is important to us, that's why we have a dedicated learning and development framework, along with leadership development programs and targeted in-house training.
When you excel at your work and initiate innovative solutions or go above and beyond to demonstrate our values, you will be recognised for your efforts through our reward and recognition program. 
For more information about a career at Parliament visit our website.
 
How to apply
Using the "Apply Now" button, please include your resume and a brief cover letter (1-2 pages) broadly outlining your experience and how it directly relates to the position.
The process from here:
Shortlisted candidates will be invited to an interview conducted by a selection panel. This interview may take place in our offices located in the Melbourne CBD or online.
 
Accessibility
If you require assistance or adjustments to fully participate in the application or interview process for this role, please contact Parliament's Recruitment Team via email recruitment@parliament.vic.gov.au  or on (03) 8682 2918
COVID-19 compliance
The Department of Parliamentary Services is committed to providing a safe and healthy workplace for its employees, visitors and the general public. This includes complying with the Chief Health Officers' directions, including the collection of COVID-19 vaccination information from employees. Successful candidates will be required to provide evidence of their COVID-19 vaccination status or medical exemption prior to commencing employment.

Name: Product Security Engineer
Description: Be a part of a high profile Security ProgramJoin one of the most advanced Cyber Security teams in AustraliaThe Cyber Security Team protects the bank and our customers from theft, losses and risk events, through effective and proactive management of cyber security, privacy and operational risk. The Digital Assurance team is responsible for vulnerability assessment, penetration testing, and ethical hacking services. The team provides security leadership and expertise through direct interaction with business stakeholders to enable innovation to the Group and its customers.  Do Work that Matters  You will be responsible for delivering Product Security services to our key delivery streams. Providing technical consulting, application security and penetration testing activities designed to ensure that the bank maintains its risk and security posture at desired levels, you will be responsible for communicating security issues to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.  Your responsibilities Work closely with scrum teams and project managers to provide penetration testing and application security services. This will include delivering targeted web application, mobile application security tests, source code review and analysis.Document and report results and scope of assurance activities to our customers, including project managers, service owners, developers and risk managers.Champion security initiatives and new ways of working to ensure systems in the portfolio continue to be safe, sound and secure. This will involve pitching security initiatives, and assisting in the implementation of industry leading secure development practices such as code scanning and bug bounties.Provide subject matter expertise to key stakeholders, including pro-active efforts to reduce the likelihood that vulnerabilities ship in our retail products before go-live.Your experienceDemonstrated experience in Penetration Testing/Application Security /Product Security .Exposure in code review to assist with proactively reducing vulnerabilities before code is deployed.Have a sound understanding of web and mobile application vulnerabilities identification, penetration testing processes and methodologies.Have worked in (or with) development teams.The health and safety of our people, customers and communities is our number one priority. This means that we require all of our employees to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19. Please speak to us if you have any questions about this based on your individual circumstances. Whether you're passionate about customer service, driven by data, or called by creativity, a career here is for you. Our people bring their diverse backgrounds and unique perspectives to build a respectful, inclusive and flexible workplace. One where we're driven by our values, and supported to share ideas, initiatives, and energy. One where making a positive impact for customers, communities and each other is part of our every day.Here, you'll thrive. You'll be supported when faced with challenges, and empowered to tackle new opportunities. We really love working here, and we think you will too.We're determined to make a real difference for Australia's first peoples. We encourage all interested applicants to apply. If you're already part of the Commonwealth Bank Group (including Bankwest), you'll need to apply through Sidekick [link removed] to submit a valid application. We're keen to support you with the next step in your career.

Name: IT Business Analyst
Description: We are currently seeking multiple Business Analysts to work on a mutli year Cyber Security project for a Federal Government Department. You will have experience in IT or cyber security programs that required the interpretation of security operations and the changing of processes and technology to meet new capabilities.  The role will perform business analysis and process review to identify and develop business and functional requirements specifications. Business Analysts may be allocated to other projects as required to support ad-hoc analysis or process modelling tasks.Location: Canberra, Brisbane, Melbourne - **3 days required in the office per week**Ability to obtain Baseline clearance requiredContract length: 12 months + 2x 12 months ResponsibilitiesDemonstrated experience and skills in requirements elicitation and definition, business process reengineering and process mappingDemonstrated experience facilitating workshopsDemonstrated experience in technical writing and producing high quality documentation including requirements, guidelines, and operation proceduresExperience delivering multi-faceted artefacts for government programs and/or projectsKey requirements5+ years' experience in an IT Business Analyst role working in the IT and/or Cyber Security industryExperience working in the Cyber Security field, with a strong understanding of the Australian Cyber Security Centre's (ACSCs) Information Security Manual (ISM), particularly the Essential 8 Mitigation StrategiesExperience working on Cyber Security (preferred) projects and in program management in multi IT vendor arrangementsStrong business stakeholder experience, particularly with cyber security, risk and compliance Reference: 256749To be considered for the role click the 'apply' button or for more information about this and other opportunities please contact Antonia Levantis on 02 61519211 or email: alevantis@paxus.com.au and quote the above job reference number. Paxus values diversity and welcomes applications from Indigenous Australians, people from diverse cultural and linguistic backgrounds and people living with a disability. If you require an adjustment to the recruitment process please contact me on the above contact details.

Name: Senior Lecturer, Cyber Security
Description:
Based at our Burwood Campus
Full time and Continuing
Level C $122,950 + 17% Superannuation

Founded in 1974, Deakin is a public university in Victoria with 61,000 students across five campuses: Melbourne Burwood, Geelong Waurn Ponds, Geelong Waterfront, Warrnambool, and the online Cloud Campus. We are a progressive and open-minded university, with the highest student satisfaction in Victoria and consistently ranked in the top 1% of the world’s universities.
The Senior Lecturer will be responsible for providing leadership in research, teaching and engagement in the area of Cyber Security. The role will promote the School and maintain links and partnerships with relevant academic, industry and professional communities.
Your key responsibilities will include:

Integrating industry and research practice into unit/course design in the area of Cyber Security and applications
Leading teaching teams to develop effective unit and course curricula and learning material (including through course leadership roles)
Leading the development and/or adoption of new innovation in curriculum design within a course
Delivering learner-centric, research and industry-informed active learning teaching practices across different levels / modes of delivery
Leading unit and course teaching teams and working collaboratively with other teaching teams in the faculty
Leading the review of units and courses and implementing refinements and updates
Providing clear assessment rubrics and timely feedback to learners to demonstrate learning outcomes
Developing effective assessment tasks and rubrics at unit and course level
Leading the moderation of assessment tasks at the course level and adapting practices to improve learning outcomes
Applying leading industry and research practice into student learning experiences and resources
Supporting diverse learners by designing accessible and inclusive unit and course material and practices.

To be successful, you’ll have:

A PhD in a relevant discipline and/or advanced qualifications and experience in the relevant discipline area
An excellent record of scholarly learning and teaching in undergraduate and/or postgraduate programs, including innovative curriculum design and research supervision
A nationally recognised research reputation underpinned by publications in quality journals and/or exhibitions and/or success in obtaining external research grants
Positive engagement with research, community, industry and government to enhance the national standing of the discipline
Demonstrated capacity and passion for leadership of teaching, research and/or administration
Excellent interpersonal skills and a proven ability to establish good working relationships with colleagues.

Deakin is a Victorian university with a global impact. We are an agile, dynamic and innovative university committed to making a positive impact through our excellence in education, research and innovation and the contributions we make to the wider community.
We understand that our reputation has been built on the dedication and expertise of our staff and we offer a dynamic and diverse working environment with opportunities to grow and develop careers. Name: Consultant Protective Security
IT Risk and Compliance Analyst
Description: MessageXchange is seeking an enthusiastic and motivated IT Risk and Compliance Analyst to join our rapidly growing and innovative team to ensure the platform used by some of Australia’s largest retailers and brands are secure and reliable.About the roleIT Risk is all around us the moment we wake up and start looking at our phones. From vulnerabilities like phishing and malware to human behaviour and processes, you will have a wide range of knowledge to detect and minimise any adverse impacts to the company these may have. You will work closely with all teams and levels of management to identify any potential risks and educate other stakeholders on the relevant changes to processes to tackle these risks. Your task may include:Manage, review and maintain security documentationAssist in the design, development and implementation of  security standards, guidelines, policies and proceduresEnsure IT security, IT Risk and IT Service Continuity controls are appropriately implementedEnsure compliance against internal standards as well as industry standards and legal frameworksAssist in the management and governance of IT Security VendorsWork with other teams to monitor the environment for security issues and applying treatments where appropriateAbout youAs someone looking at taking on new challenges, you are passionate about the latest technologies and trends as well as understanding the overall impact they can have. You will be bringing your experience across to strengthen our current ISMS and should be able to demonstrate:Tertiary qualification in Information Technology or equivalent professional experienceSecurity analysis and risk management skillsUnderstanding and experience in ISO27001Understanding of risk management principles and best practices with an IT Security Operations focusExcellent oral and written communication skills to write company Policies and educate staff on themAbility to adjust and adapt to changing priorities in a dynamic environmentTechnical acumen and the ability to understand and interpret technical requirementsProblem solving skillsAbout the companyMessageXchange has been leading the way in B2B integration technology for the last 20 years. We work with some of Australia’s largest companies in Retail, Logistics, Finance, Government and more.You’ll join a supportive team located in the heart of Melbourne CBD. MessageXchange is a workplace where you can be challenged and efforts recognised and rewarded.  Ready to apply?If this sounds like the job for you, please apply with your resume and a cover letter. We’d love to know a bit about you and why you’re interested in the role.

Name: Security Engineer
Description: Competitive REM | $120k+ | 15% Super | Fortnightly RDOPower up your career at a leading energy organisation Flexible working arrangements  It is an exciting time to work at Ausgrid and be part of an organisation that is transforming in an industry which is evolving. Ausgrid's commitment to Cyber Security is to future proof Ausgrid, and be a leader in our industry, by creating and embedding world-class cyber policies, procedures and standards in everything that we do. Your role at AusgridWith the increasing importance of cyber security this role is pivotal in ensuring the safety of information and data across the organisation. You will be responsible for building, supporting and maintaining Ausgrid’s Cyber Identity & Access Mgmt. services and capabilities to prevent and protect Ausgrid’s digital identities and solutions from internal and external cyber threats.You will be working within a friendly team and performing not only BAU work, but project work as we implement identity solution features. We are seeking interest from anyone who might be:Experience cyber engineers/professionalsCyber ‘newbies’ with tertiary qualifications who want to kick off their career in CyberCyber Security Project exposure to move across into the world of Cyber EngineeringWhat we are looking forThe successful candidate will hold tertiary level qualifications in IT, Telecommunications or related discipline, ideally, you will have qualifications in Cyber Security (AZ-500, CISM, CCSP).  You are experienced with programming languages (Python, Power Shell, Batch) and experience with maintaining the following Cyber Technologies:  (DLP, Azure Information Protection, Vulnerability Mgt, PKI, IAM/PAM, Web Proxy and Secure Email SAAS, MS Defender Suite).  You are a strong communicator who thrives on building strong stakeholder relationships.Proven experience in adapting to technologies other than Windows, i.e., LinuxDemonstrated skills in problem-solving.Proven skills in exceptional time management and organisational skills with the ability to multitask in a fast-paced environment.Role Statement Why work for us?Our people are the most important part of our business. We offer professional and technical positions, from apprenticeships & traineeships to senior leadership roles, across a broad range of disciplines.  We offer excellent employee benefits, including: Nine-day fortnight (RDO every second week)Flexible working arrangements 15% superannuationPay for performance cultureStaff clubCorporate Health plan Health and Wellness fitness programAnnual Flu vaccineEmployee Assistance Program (EAP)Strong focus on mental health and much moreTo deliver the best possible service to our customers we strive towards a workforce that reflects the diverse community that we serve. Ausgrid is committed to creating a diverse and inclusive workforce and we encourage applications from women, people from culturally diverse backgrounds, people with disabilities, people from the LGBTQI+ community and Indigenous Australians. About AusgridAusgrid is an energy services business that operates the largest electricity network in Australia. We deliver a safe and reliable electricity supply to more than 1.7 million homes and businesses and connect communities across more than 22,000 square kilometres. Our operations include infrastructure construction and maintenance, customer connections, street lighting and metering and testing services.Ausgrid's vision is to be a leading energy solutions provider, recognised both locally and globally. To achieve this vision, all Ausgrid employees commit to living our values in all they do. Work safe, live safe - Customer-focused – Collaborative - Commercially minded - Honest and accountable – Respect Interested?  Apply now! Please review the role statement and apply addressing your suitability for the role via a cover letter and attach your resume.  Successful candidates will be notified regarding an interview.For further information on this job please contact recruitment@ausgrid.com.au Please note, our vacancy close dates may be subject to change, we will assess applications as they are receivedPlease note – Unsolicited resumes/applications from agencies will not be accepted by Ausgrid  Ausgrid – An Equal Opportunity Employer

Name: Cyber Security Culture and Awareness Lead
Description: About WoodsideWoodside is the pioneer of the LNG industry in Australia, producing 6% of global LNG supply. We have an outstanding base business of world-class assets and strong growth prospects - plus the experience, capability and vision to make things happen.  Our global headquarters are based in Perth, Australia's fourth largest city. Our state-of-the-art headquarters reflects the quality of life Perth is known for - with a six Green Star rating, advanced wellness features and flexibility in how you work. Woodside CultureWe recognise that a key contributor to our success is an inclusive culture that promotes diversity and a sense of belonging.  Flexible and remote work arrangements are considered About the Role:As Woodside forges ahead with industry-leading innovation, our Digital function continues to challenge traditional ways of working to transform our operations, targeting 30% efficiency improvement for operated assets over 3 years. By augmenting our workforce with fit-for-purpose technology solutions, Woodside's operations are reaching new heights of safety, efficiency and productivity. Technology is crucial to our business, allowing us to perform at the highest level and stay ahead in a fast-changing world  Our digital transformation means we are evolving into a technologically advanced organisation with unparalleled opportunities for technically minded individuals. We are embracing robotics, artificial intelligence, and advanced analytics to drive innovation and optimise our ways of working. We are also collaborating with NASA on cutting edge computer capabilities for use hundreds of kilometres offshore, towards even the moon in future.  As a Cyber Security Culture and Awareness Lead you will be responsible for driving positive cyber security behaviour across Woodside and maintaining the integrity and operational success of the cyber culture and awareness program. Duties & Responsibilities:In this role you will have the opportunity to define, lead and continuously improve the cyber culture and awareness program to effectively educate our organisation.  Other duties and responsibilities include: Develop and maintain cyber security basics training to be delivered to the entire companyDevelop and implement role-based training for high-risk users of systems and applications.Liaise with key business areas to analyse user knowledge and determine gaps.Assist with developing and leading internal education programs for cyber threats, e.g., phishing, malware.Communicate, schedule and lead area/role specific awareness programsAct as the focal point for decisions/escalations in awareness programsWork and collaborate with teams internal and external to cyber to improve cyber security awareness and reduce the risk of non-complianceSkills & Experience:The preferred candidate will have a variety of the following: 5+ years in education, training and awareness, or communication role3+ years of cyber security exposureInformation Technology/Computer Science or related Degree at an Australian or Industry-recognised University or equivalent industry qualifications and experienceUnderstanding of current cyber security risks and threats and the potential impact to the energy resourcing sectorExcellent communication skills to develop and deliver cyber training and awareness programStrong people skills with the ability to engage both technical and non-technical audiences at all levels of a global organisationAbility to translate complex information into straightforward languageExcellent attention to detail to ensure accuracy of training and awareness contentAbility to foster collaborative relationships with internal and external stakeholdersManage service providers through scopes, define service levels for BAU servicesCovid 19 Vaccination RequirementsEveryone accessing a Woodside office, site or facility is subject to mandatory COVID-19 vaccination requirements, as updated from time to time.  If your role requires you to access our remote sites or facilities (including our Port Facilities and Remote Operating Centre) you will be required to comply with any applicable government directions. Currently, these directions also require you to have received 3 TGA approved COVID-19 vaccinations, unless you hold an exemption granted under the direction. Please see below for further information.  Resources sector workers (restrictions access directions) [link removed]  Port Worker and At Risk Port Workers (restrictions access directions) [link removed]  Booster Vaccination (restrictions access directions) [link removed]  The Woodside COVID-19 Vaccination Procedure requires all persons accessing our other offices, sites or facilities (including our Perth office) to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 unless an exemption applies. Currently, 'fully vaccinated' means 3 TGA approved COVID-19 vaccinations.  Please consider these requirements when submitting your application. Recognition & Reward:What you can expect from us: Commitment to your ongoing development, including on-the-job opportunities, formal programs, coaching and mentoringIndustry-leading 18 weeks' paid parental leave for primary carer, and maintenance of superannuation or retirement benefits at the current rate during any period of unpaid parental leave for up to 24 months (plus secondary carer leave entitlements)Possibility of educational assistance to support your career developmentOpportunities to undertake interesting work on world-class projectsActive employee community groups for gender equality, reconciliation between Indigenous and non-Indigenous Australians, and LGBTI+ staff and allies, and NeurodiversityCommunity volunteering opportunitiesRelocation assistance (if required)A competitive remuneration package, featuring performance-based incentives, above-industry superannuation contributions and a health insurance allowanceOnsite gym and swimming pool Woodside is committed to fostering an inclusive and diverse workforce culture, which is supported by our Compass values. Our aim is to attract, develop and retain a truly diverse and high-performing workforce.  We encourage diversity of age, nationality, ethnicity, religious beliefs, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, physical ability, cultural background, thinking styles, experience, family background, including carer commitments and education. Inclusion centres on all employees creating a climate of trust and belonging, where people feel comfortable to bring their whole self to work. We offer supportive pathways for all employees to grow and develop leadership skills. We encourage applications from Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people and those seeking a more flexible working environment, including part-time opportunities  Applications close at 11:59pm AWST on 16 June 2022.  Click APPLY to submit your application

Name: IT Change & Communications Analyst
Description:
Campus Location: North Sydney, Australia | Brisbane, Australia | Melbourne, Australia
Job No: APTAV116066#004

Join a University ranked in the top 2% worldwide and bring your change expertise to a significant cyber security project
Full time, fixed term role (8 months) based at the North Sydney, Brisbane or Melbourne campus

About ACU:
Australian Catholic University (ACU) is an inclusive community which welcomes students and staff of all beliefs. ACU has over 2,500 staff supporting more than 34,000 students across eight campuses - Ballarat, Brisbane, Canberra, Melbourne, North Sydney, Strathfield, Blacktown and Rome. As valued members of our community, all staff members are expected to have an understanding of ACU's mission and values and to demonstrate an active contribution to them.
About Information Technology:
Operating within ACU's Corporate Services Portfolio, Information Technology Directorate is a strategic partner in delivering technology enabled change and excellent IT services to support learning, teaching, research and business functions across ACU. The Directorate is led by the Chief Information Officer (CIO) and three Associate Directors; comprising of: Innovation & Transformation, Enterprise Services, and Client Services.
About the role:
Bring your significant change management and communications expertise to this role to increase the success of key IT projects at ACU, which include but not limited to: a high impact Cyber Security Project (Multi-Factor Authentication for Students). More specifically the role entails:

Change and communications strategy for projects
Developing project communications materials
Collaborating with project teams on change and communication best practices
Managing relationships with project senior stakeholders
Problem-solving and designing interventions to facilitate change
Reporting and data metrics.

You will need to have:

Significant experience working in a change management capacity with complex, organisation-wide projects, including assessing change impact, and designing and executing effective change management plans to mitigate risk.
Experience and skills in designing and creating effective communications materials and tailored strategies for different stakeholders.
Highly effective stakeholder management skills including at senior levels of the organisation.
Ability to work independently under limited supervision while maintaining close partnership with project manager and IT Change Manager.
Creative and insightful approach to change management, able to demonstrate out-of-the-box thinking and identify opportunities to further deliver project outcomes.
Demonstrated ability to lead change by displaying openness and resilience, inspiring others to change and acting to make change happen.
Exposure to Prosci framework advantageous but not required.

What we Offer:

The University pursues an excellence agenda and offers an environment where staff are welcomed and safe, and valued through development, participation and involvement.
A competitive remuneration package (HEW 8 classification).
17% employer superannuation contributions to eligible continuing and fixed-term staff (we provide choice of fund in accordance with relevant legislation, with the University’s nominated default superannuation provider as UniSuper).
Annual leave loading of an equivalent to 17.5% of four weeks’ salary pro rata payable, dependent on your commencement date.
As an ACU staff member, you will have access to generous working conditions and benefits which include but not limited to: Staff Rewards; Flexible Working Arrangements; a variety of leave provisions (recreation, personal, parental, compassionate etc); and salary packaging.

How to Apply:
Obtain the Position Description from the website. Applicants are expected to address all selection criteria listed in the position description and outline how they would support the mission of the university. To apply for this role click the 'View Position Description and Apply' buttons above or below. Visit Hints and Tips on how to apply.
General enquiries can be sent to Rebecca Newton, IT Change Manager, Information Technology at: Rebecca.Newton@acu.edu.au
Candidates must hold Australian work rights to apply for this position. For permanent/ continuing roles, applicants must have permanent work rights.
Equal Opportunity and Privacy of personal information is University policy. For more details visit: www.acu.edu.au/careers
Find out more information on the benefits of working at ACU at: www.acu.edu.au/about-acu/careers-at-acu/why-work-at-acu
ACU is committed to diversity and social inclusion in its employment practices. Applications from Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people, people with disabilities and people from culturally diverse groups are encouraged.
Previous applicants need not re-apply
Advertised: 21-JUN-2022
Applications close: 05-JUL-2022 at 11:59pm AUS Eastern Standard Time

Name: Senior Lecturer, Cyber Security
Description:
Based at our Burwood Campus
Full time and Continuing
Level C $122,950 + 17% Superannuation

Founded in 1974, Deakin is a public university in Victoria with 61,000 students across five campuses: Melbourne Burwood, Geelong Waurn Ponds, Geelong Waterfront, Warrnambool, and the online Cloud Campus. We are a progressive and open-minded university, with the highest student satisfaction in Victoria and consistently ranked in the top 1% of the world’s universities.
The Senior Lecturer will be responsible for providing leadership in research, teaching and engagement in the area of Cyber Security. The role will promote the School and maintain links and partnerships with relevant academic, industry and professional communities.
Your key responsibilities will include:

Integrating industry and research practice into unit/course design in the area of Cyber Security and applications
Leading teaching teams to develop effective unit and course curricula and learning material (including through course leadership roles)
Leading the development and/or adoption of new innovation in curriculum design within a course
Delivering learner-centric, research and industry-informed active learning teaching practices across different levels / modes of delivery
Leading unit and course teaching teams and working collaboratively with other teaching teams in the faculty
Leading the review of units and courses and implementing refinements and updates
Providing clear assessment rubrics and timely feedback to learners to demonstrate learning outcomes
Developing effective assessment tasks and rubrics at unit and course level
Leading the moderation of assessment tasks at the course level and adapting practices to improve learning outcomes
Applying leading industry and research practice into student learning experiences and resources
Supporting diverse learners by designing accessible and inclusive unit and course material and practices.

To be successful, you’ll have:

A PhD in a relevant discipline and/or advanced qualifications and experience in the relevant discipline area
An excellent record of scholarly learning and teaching in undergraduate and/or postgraduate programs, including innovative curriculum design and research supervision
A nationally recognised research reputation underpinned by publications in quality journals and/or exhibitions and/or success in obtaining external research grants
Positive engagement with research, community, industry and government to enhance the national standing of the discipline
Demonstrated capacity and passion for leadership of teaching, research and/or administration
Excellent interpersonal skills and a proven ability to establish good working relationships with colleagues.

For a copy of the position description, please see below:
 PD-Senior Lecturer, Cyber Security.pdf
Please submit your resume, a short cover letter and responses to the Key Selection Criteria by 17 July 2022
For a confidential discussion regarding this position, please contact John Yearwood, Head of School on john.yearwood@deakin.edu.au
Please note that whilst we still accept applications from any persons interested in our roles, we are currently prioritising applications from those with current working rights in Australia and who are not affected by travel restrictions. 
Offers of employment from Deakin University are conditional upon the applicant being fully vaccinated against COVID-19 or medically exempt and providing satisfactory evidence of the same. You can view a copy of the University’s COVID-19 Vaccination Procedure. 
Are You Ready?
Deakin is a Victorian university with a global impact. We are an agile, dynamic and innovative university committed to making a positive impact through our excellence in education, research and innovation and the contributions we make to the wider community.
We understand that our reputation has been built on the dedication and expertise of our staff and we offer a dynamic and diverse working environment with opportunities to grow and develop careers. We believe that a progressive, thriving culture will ensure that people choose to come, and stay at Deakin and contribute to our ongoing success.
We value diversity and aim to build an inclusive environment that champions, embraces and respects differences. We support and encourage applications from Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people, and people of all abilities, cultures, sexual orientation, and genders.
We understand that our academic workforce is increasingly diverse, and we recognise academic careers may be placed on hold throughout many life circumstances. Achievement relative to opportunity places more emphasis on the quality, as opposed to the quantity of research outputs. In your application, we strongly encourage you to comment on your achievements relative to opportunity.

Name: Consultant
Description: About CyberCX CyberCX is the leading independent cyber security services organisation in Australia and NewZealand. CyberCX is Australia’s greatest force of cyber security professionals. CyberCX has united the country’s most trusted cyber security companies to deliver the most comprehensive end to end cyber security services offering to Australian enterprises and governments.    We are cyber security experts first and foremost. We’re a unified team of highly qualified, certified and skilled professionals working together on the same mission: to protect and defend Australian organisations from cyber threats.    About the role Reporting to the Managing Consultant, the Consultant will deliver tailored high-quality solutions for CyberCX clients. The Consultant is responsible for ensuring that project work that is delivered to the client is outcome focused and remains appropriate for their business requirements. Key Responsibilities:  Contribute to the delivery of cyber security projects aligned with the service catalogue Manage and develop relationships with clients, stakeholders and third parties/vendors Work with clients to assist them in identifying and effectively managing problems that can be solved through the value provided by the NIS practice Support development and implementation of new technologies within a systems environment by advising on design concepts and changes, implementation strategies, and deployment timelines. Design and develop high quality business solutions and other projects Liaise with customers during preliminary installation and testing of developed software solutions or products Recognise and promptly advise leadership of potential issues and potential follow-on business opportunities Ensure consulting services are delivered on time, within scope and within budget Write detailed reports that document work completed and ensure that proposed system(s) and architecture(s) are consistent with client organisation's architecture guidelines and requirements Continuously develop skills and knowledge around the relevant technologies and solutions in market Actively collaborate across CyberCX, and look for ways to add value. Facilitate communication, partnerships and cross-pollination across the business to better engage and service customers  Preferred Qualifications, Experience & Skills  Tertiary qualification in computer science, computer engineering or related field, or equivalent experience Professional level vendor certifications with CyberCX’s core technology partners A minimum of 3 years gained from working in professional services, cyber security and/or technology industry is preferred, with experience in security integration and engineering Exposure to architecture, design, implementation and integration of security, network and mobility solutions. Including endpoint, firewall, WAF, NAC, data centre, wireless, SD-WAN,internet connectivity, unified communications, and remote access Effective stakeholder engagement and communication skills Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, and the ability to build sustainable, scalable solutions and processes to meet complex operational problems Skilled in responding to setbacks in an agile and resilient manner  Submit your application soon!

Name: CyberArk Business Analyst
Description: Work with Australia’s leading Cybersecurity experts  Close knit team, inclusive culture, nameded LinkedIn’s #1 Australian workplaceFlexible base location: any major Australian capital city   With PwC, you’ll ignite a meaningful career while being supported by a flexible working culture, innovative learning and development opportunities and progressive policies and benefits, such as 18 weeks paid parental leave for mums, dads and foster carers (no minimum service!)What will you create?You’ll help Australian businesses, not-for-profits and governments create value and improve the way they work. From digitising healthcare, to creating smarter cities and igniting our start-up industry, together we build trust in society and solve important problems.PwC Cybersecurity & Digital Trust builds trust in Australian organisations by securing their digital future and developing the nation's leading cybersecurity workforce. We are looking for x2 skilled Senior CyberArk Business Analysts to help develop strategic roadmaps and shape the vision for our clients.Joining our world class Digital Identity team, your impact will be seen by:Delivering high quality outcomes to clients across the entire delivery lifecycle.Requirement gathering, analysis, completing documentation and conducting business analyst discoveries in collaboration with our clients.Developing and delivering technical training designed to enable/educate implementation.Combine your technical skills and problem solving ability to create a unique experience for clients in a rapidly growing area of the security industry Identifying methods, processes and techniques in your work area which may need improvement as well as familiarising yourself with client standards and policies in order to deliver reliable, high quality outcomes About You2-3 years proven experience using CyberArk platform and features. You’re passionate about the cyber security mission and take pride in contributing to a great team, whose performance is critical to the success of the business.You’re collaborative and enjoy working in an innovative environment. You’re a problem solver by nature and want to join a firm that values the kind of people who reimagine the possible for their clients and stakeholders. Most importantly, you act with integrity and show care for the people you work with.Life at PwCOur culture and benefits are something we’re proud of, and also the reason we’ve been named LinkedIn’s #1 Australian workplace. With PwC, you’ll belong to an inclusive community where differences are both embraced and the underlying driver in everything we create together.We empower you with the technology, coaching, flexibility and trust needed to make a meaningful difference, while supporting you in bringing your whole self to work each day. We’re committed to building and maintaining a diverse workforce because we know it’s only by working together that we can realise the potential of our people, clients and society around us.We’re living this commitment through initiatives including our Reconciliation Action Plan to increase Indigenous employment and employee-led diversity networks promoting cultural, disability, LGBTI and gender equality. At our core we’re a people business, which means you’ll be supported not just in your professional development but your personal growth as well.As the team experience high volumes of applications, we appreciate your patience to allow for a timely and fair process for all. #LI-PWCLMT  PwC is committed to the health, safety and wellbeing of our people, as well as visitors to our offices and events.PwC has introduced a COVID-19 Vaccination policy that requires all staff, contractors, clients and visitors to be fully vaccinated before they can access our offices, attend client sites, undertake work-related travel, or attend work-related events, subject to limited exemptions. Name: Security Penetration Testing Analyst
Description: The Cecuri Team are looking for an experienced Security Penetration Testing Analyst to join our Adelaide team. Overview:Locally owned and operatedNational and international client baseGreat exposure to a range of technologiesHighly experienced team What the role entails:Working with a diverse range of customers to identify and solve security problems, both in person and remotely.Delivering a wide range of security assurance services, including but not limited to web application penetration tests, network and infrastructure penetration tests and vulnerability assessments.Performing social engineering engagements and physical security assessments and/or undertaking secure code reviews, where appropriate.Design, implement and deliver penetration and vulnerability assessment engagementsDocument and articulate both the risk and technical aspects of outcomesPreparing high quality reports detailing security issues, making recommendations and identifying solutions.Working collaboratively with your team and clients to continuously grow and share knowledgePersonal Attributes and technical qualifications:5+ years information security experience - 2+ in penetration testing.  Ideally with some experience in a consulting environment (note: this level of experience is a guide, not a requirement).Passionate about offensive security and security assurance. You must genuinely love your craft and want to excel.Able to work collaboratively and independently, depending on project and team requirements.Strong understanding of Cyber Security Frameworks (NIST, ASD8, ISO 27001, CPS234, NDB)Continuously looking to grow and develop your technical and professional skills – a proven track record of self-initiated learning and involvement in the pen testing/hacking community is highly regarded.Industry recognised certifications in penetration testing (CREST CCT or CRT, OSCP, SANS, etc) are regarded highly, but not required.AGSVA clearance regarded highly, but not required.Demonstrated ability to plan effectively and work autonomously and intuitively.A willingness and drive to remain up to date with industry trends, issues and news. The Company:Cecuri are a company dedicated to auditing our customers environments to help them understand their current security posture and align with industry specific frameworks. We have developed a suit of products and services that we deliver both nationally and internationally for all types of clientele. We have built strong industry relationships that has made us the “go-to” partner for audit and risk services and our delivery capability is highly regarded amongst our piers. We are excited by the growth opportunity the industry is experiencing and are looking to continue our strong growth trajectory. Please Note:Must be an Australian resident living in the Adelaide region with a current drivers license. All applications to include a cover letter and quote Job ID C50002206. Further details only provided to candidates who meet this criteria. Employees of Cecuri are required to work in a range of environments supporting our clients across many sectors of the business community. Many of our clients work in industries that can potentially present risks to the health and safety of our employees and/or members of the client’s community. Employee risk factors associated with some illnesses are further elevated due to the mere fact they work across multiple sites. Cecuri have in place policies designed to protect the health and safety of employees whilst at work including a requirement for employees to avail themselves of appropriate medical intervention (eg vaccinations) to minimise their chance of infection and/or serious complications of any illness (eg influenza or COVID-19). As a result, applicants who are not able to comply with relevant vaccination requirements will not be considered for this role.   No agencies please

Name: Cyber Security Lead
Description: Key role leading enterprise wide security governance and complianceFlexible, supportive hybrid working environmentAttractive salary package including RDOAbout Us - We’re looking to give customers great experiencesWe are committed to becoming a truly customer-centric organisation. To do this we have established the Transforming Boroondara program, through which we are is striving to make significant improvements to how we deliver customer experiences. Transforming Boroondara is a complex, multi-year program that touches much of our operating model, including people, process and technology and will offer the right candidate plenty of development opportunities.We are known as leaders in the technology space in our sector. We offer flexible hybrid working arrangements helping our people balance work and life, along with being in a prime Camberwell location surrounded by leading cafes, restaurants and other key amenities. We are focused on providing a workplace that is rewarding, enjoyable, healthy and productive for all employees, making this a fantastic work lifestyle opportunity. To support this we provide various wellbeing programs, generous parental leave supports, purchased leave options and onsite parking when you are at our offices amongst other staff programs.About the roleWorking within the Transformation and Technology Department, you will report directly to our Chief Transformation and Technology Officer to ensure the security of all Council ICT systems and information. You will lead the design, development and ongoing improvement of our information security strategy, policies and controls. You will play a key role in the ongoing governance of Council’s security compliance posture in line with policies and regulatory obligations within the Cyber Security domain.As the Cyber Security Lead you will work at the heart of an exciting transformation agenda in a fast paced environment. You will utilise your skills manage a small team of employees, contractors and vendors executing core information security functions.You have knowledge, expertise and understanding of Cyber threats, risks, related laws, regulations and industry practices. Your experience will ensure Councils systems, networks, and data are protected and that the organisation is best positioned to defend and minimise the risk of cyber-attacksThis is a fantastic role to showcase your existing knowledge, experience and enthusiasm, and develop your skills further. To find out more review our position description.Employment requirementsApplicants must have the right to work in Australia.Preferred applicants will be required to undergo a National Police Record CheckAll local government employees must be fully vaccinated from 26 November, 2021 onwards to perform work outside of their place of residence.Appointment of the successful candidate will be subject to provision of evidence of vaccination status or medical exemption prior to commencement.How to applyPlease submit your application online via the ‘Apply’ button by 11:59pm Thursday 7th July 2022. All applications must be made via the online portal; no applications direct to the hiring manager or from recruitment agencies will be considered.For a confidential discussion about this position please contact Sonny Shah, Head of IT Services on 0433 132 017.If you want to know more about the benefits of working for the City of Boroondara, please visit our careers website boroondara.vic.gov.au/careersCouncil recognises the benefits of a diverse workforce for its employees and customers. To ensure equity of access to employment opportunities, Council encourages applications from underrepresented groups including people who are from an Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander background, people from different ages, abilities, gender identities, sexual orientation and cultural backgrounds. If you require any additional support or adjustments regarding interview arrangements, please advise the contact listed above in advance. Council is a child safe organisation and as such, some positions may require the incumbent to hold a Working with Children Check.Working togetherWe are currently undertaking an exciting project that will see a transformation in the way we work and the way we serve our customers. Implementation of the Boroondara Customer First Program will provide a customer centric model of service delivery that includes technological innovation, process improvement and business system renewal - we value your input and look forward to our journey ahead.

Name: Security Support Engineer
Description: Founded in 2014, and listed on the ASX since 2015, Superloop’s purpose is to enable better internet for Australian homes and businesses, by enabling challenger retail brands (including our own Superloop and Exetel brands) to take a larger share of the market, leveraging Superloop’s Infrastructure-on-Demand platform. Superloop operates in three segments of the market: consumer connectivity, business network and security solutions, and wholesale connectivity, all of which leverage Superloop’s investments in physical infrastructure assets including fibre, subsea cables and fixed wireless, as well as Superloop’s software platforms. Hundreds of thousands of homes and businesses rely on Superloop and Exetel everyday for their connectivity needs.Visit www.superloop.com to learn more.Our IT Security Support Engineers are responsible for providing level 2/3 support to our customers of our cyber-safety products. The Security Support Engineer provides a hybrid of systems and networking expertise to ensure timely resolution of technical issues, implementation of our cyber-safety products, proactive consultation, and continued high quality services to our customers. CyberHound, is a Next Generation Firewall that is one of the most advanced sets of multi-layered ‘defence in depth’ security platforms to deliver reliable cybersecurity for schools. Our platform assists to secure a network as well as protect it from ransomware, malware, zero-day threats, phishing and more.This platform sets the benchmark for K12 security coupled with the extensive set of additional features that are part of our Advanced Threat Protection Suite – ensuring peace of mind for school communities.Visit www.cyberhound.com to learn more What will you do?Receive and manage security support queries and issues, providing technical expertise and timely resolution. Update and maintain internal knowledge bases to facilitate a better understanding of recurring issues. Build, image and configure cyber-safety hardware for customers. Contribute to product documentation and identify areas to improve the customer experience. Liaise with our sales team to qualify customer requirements and product specifications, and process technical orders.  Assist with software testing and quality assurance. Proactively monitor, action, manage and resolve alerts. Who do we want to apply?The successful candidate will have:Strong networking knowledge, in areas such as switching and routing. Broad technical knowledge (including TCP/IP, DNS, HTTP, SMTP, POP3, IMAP, XMPP). Familiarity with wired and wireless networking, centralised authentication systems (Active Directory, eDirectory, Open Directory), operating systems (Windows client and server, OS X, iOS, Android and Linux), VMware, Hyper-V, and server hardware. General understanding of MS Office tools, G Suite, hardware, and CRMs (Salesforce). Knowledge of server authentication integration (e.g. AD and/or RADIUS). Experience with network firewalls, and; Ability to diagnose issues through troubleshooting and investigation, and provide an excellent customer experience.  What can we do for you?As we grow and evolve, we want you to as well. We’re progressive. We understand that life exists outside of work which is why we have a flexible approach to the way we work. We’re innovators. Innovation is part of our identity, which is why we celebrate the uniqueness of yours. We’re easy-going. We pride ourselves on creating a fun, casual and relaxed environment. Ditch the corporate attire if you want to - embrace it if that’s your thing. What matters most is that you’re comfortable when you come to work. We welcome diversity. We encourage and seek out diversity of backgrounds and opinions, because we know differences challenge us and help us grow.We give back. In addition to annual and sick leave, we give you the opportunity to spend some paid time away from work doing something meaningful with five personal development days per year. You can use these to help out in the school tuckshop, attend training for your own personal development, or lend a hand to a meaningful charity if you would like to. We stand by our product. We’re confident we have the best connectivity product on the market so we offer our employees free connection to our home broadband service. You have an opportunity to be part of the next exciting part of our journey. What are you waiting for?

Name: Managing Consultant - AppSec
Description: About CyberCX  CyberCX is the leading independent cyber security services organisation in Australia and New Zealand.  CyberCX is Australia’s greatest force of cyber security professionals. CyberCX has united the country’s most trusted cyber security companies to deliver the most comprehensive end to end cyber security services offering to Australian enterprises and governments.  About the role  Reporting to the Capability Director – AppSec within the Security Testing & Assurance (STA) practice of CyberCX, you will be responsible for leading the Application Security capability build out as well as a team of consultants (both within the Application Security team, the STA practice and external practices) to deliver high quality application security and assurance activities for CyberCX customers, positioning CyberCX as Australia’s greatest force of cyber security professionals.   The position will play a critical role in the continued development of an Application Security program of works and a software assurance-focused team and culture that fosters personal growth and high employee engagement.    You’ll be responsible for:   Build out of Application Security strategy focused on upskilling consultants internally at CyberCX to create delivery specialists and identify new ways of delivering Application Security Services to clients  Delivering Application Security services such as Secure Code Reviews, Threat Modelling, Software Assurance Maturity Reviews to a high standard, specifically those with large or complex testing requirements  Developing strong, long-lasting relationships with a diverse range of internal and external customers, identifying new and enhanced opportunities, as well as engaging internal teams such as Customer Sales and Customer Solutions team in a presales-capacity to assist with technical methodology aspects, costing scoping, standardised proposal methodologies, RFQs and tenders  Acting as a subject matter expert and technical leader both within the Security Testing & Assurance practice and across other CyberCX practices for Application Security services  Leading and coaching a high performing team as well as other members of external practices to enable and drive learning, development, and capability uplift  Provide support to the Capability Director – AppSec with people and business-related matters such as workforce planning, budgeting and reporting    About you:   Tertiary qualification in information systems, cyber security, software development or a similar field, as well as relevant industry experience  6+ years of experience in application security services  Strong stakeholder engagement and communication skills and proven ability to build credibility with senior leaders and internal teams  Strong analytical and problem-solving skills  Skill and resilience to respond to setbacks in an agile and productive manner      Interested? Apply now!

Name: Security Solutions Expert
Description: Security Solutions Expert  Main Responsibilities The Pre-Sales Consultant is responsible for aiding the Sales department in selling Orange Cyberdefense solutions, centred on Orange Cyberdefense services and its portfolio, as well as assisting the Sales department in providing a technical and commercial overview Orange Cyberdefense offerings. The Pre-Sales Consultant has a technical background with very strong business and commercial affinities and the focus is on promoting and positioning Orange Cyberdefense solutions and other technologies and/or services through telephone calls, conference calls, on-site visits to potential customers and existing customers. The Solution Specialist is a corner stone in developing and answering technical Solution designs and technical descriptions for RFI’s & RFP’s, drafting cost sheets and assists in closing deals with the Account Manager.  Key responsibilities are as follows: Understand all Orange Cyberdefense service offerings and stay abreast of changes and enhancements Inform Account Managers of service offerings and changes Attend and arrange customer meetings Respond to tender, RFQ, RFP and RFI requirementsWrite proposals and scope of work Assist Account Managers in closing deals Facilitate the delivery of proof of concepts services and solutions Attend training sessions, both in-house, vendor specific and external Provide a monthly spread sheet detailing meeting attended, conference calls made, training days attended, proof of concepts delivered Result: Extend professional and sustainable relationships with clients, distribution and vendor with eye on maximum sales figures.  Experience / Knowledge Required Demonstrable experience as a security engineer/consultant, preferably presales experience Extensive experience of the security industry Experience with Managed Security Services portfolios specifically Security Operations Centres as well as Cyber Security Operation Centres Experience with security consulting, including penetration testing Customer facing experience with strong presentation skills Language Skills (at least 2 languages whereof minimal English) Experience in writing proposals and scopes, responding to tenders/RFQ/RFP/RFI Knowledge of SIEM technologies including Splunk and LogRhythm Understanding of security technologies from at least 3 of the following vendors: Checkpoint, Palo Alto, Fortinet, Symantec, Pulse Secure, Cisco, Zscaler Good understanding of TCP/IP networking and security fundamentals Strong communication skills, both written and verbal Confidence, tenacity, creativity and flexibility in thinking  Technical Competencies Information Security Cloud technologies and SecurityOffensive Security Defensive Security OT Security Network architecture IP Routing Operating systems (Windows, *nix)  Level of Education Bachelor’s degree or Master’s degree or equal by experience Security industry recognized certification: CISSP, CISA/CISM, OSCP/OSCE, CEH, CREST certification Minimum Work Experience 4 years of experience in a comparable function

Name: Business Analyst
Description: Job Requirements:  Contract: 12 months plus a 12 month option Eligibility: This role is in a Federal Government environment and the client is limited to accepting Australian Citizens who hold an AGSVA NV1 or higher security clearance. Location: Canberra or remote/WFH  The role:  Are you interested in the world of cyber? This is a unique opportunity to contribute to building Australia’s cyber awareness and resilience. Our client aims to undertake a range of activities to make Australia the safest country in the world to connect and conduct business on-line. Your responsibilities will include the creation, iteration, and maintenance of business analysis artefacts that describe the organisation's future state, business goals and drivers. Experience needed:  Managing diverse stakeholder groups Understand, analyse and map/model business processes Human Centred Design and User Based Design techniques Advanced desktop software skills to document business analysis Excellent communication skills to and engage with stakeholders Conduct workshops, stakeholder interviews and meetings Self-management skills, strong time management  Does this sound like you? If so, we will be pleased to receive your application. Click Apply Now! If you require further information please contact Keith 0386139902 or our Consultants on 0262010100. www.gmtpeople.com.au

Name: CyberArk Business Analyst
Description: Work with Australia’s leading Cybersecurity experts  Close knit team, inclusive culture, nameded LinkedIn’s #1 Australian workplaceFlexible base location: any major Australian capital city   With PwC, you’ll ignite a meaningful career while being supported by a flexible working culture, innovative learning and development opportunities and progressive policies and benefits, such as 18 weeks paid parental leave for mums, dads and foster carers (no minimum service!)What will you create?You’ll help Australian businesses, not-for-profits and governments create value and improve the way they work. From digitising healthcare, to creating smarter cities and igniting our start-up industry, together we build trust in society and solve important problems.PwC Cybersecurity & Digital Trust builds trust in Australian organisations by securing their digital future and developing the nation's leading cybersecurity workforce. We are looking for x2 skilled Senior CyberArk Business Analysts to help develop strategic roadmaps and shape the vision for our clients.Joining our world class Digital Identity team, your impact will be seen by:Delivering high quality outcomes to clients across the entire delivery lifecycle.Requirement gathering, analysis, completing documentation and conducting business analyst discoveries in collaboration with our clients.Developing and delivering technical training designed to enable/educate implementation.Combine your technical skills and problem solving ability to create a unique experience for clients in a rapidly growing area of the security industry Identifying methods, processes and techniques in your work area which may need improvement as well as familiarising yourself with client standards and policies in order to deliver reliable, high quality outcomes About You2-3 years proven experience using CyberArk platform and features. You’re passionate about the cyber security mission and take pride in contributing to a great team, whose performance is critical to the success of the business.You’re collaborative and enjoy working in an innovative environment. You’re a problem solver by nature and want to join a firm that values the kind of people who reimagine the possible for their clients and stakeholders. Most importantly, you act with integrity and show care for the people you work with.Life at PwCOur culture and benefits are something we’re proud of, and also the reason we’ve been named LinkedIn’s #1 Australian workplace. With PwC, you’ll belong to an inclusive community where differences are both embraced and the underlying driver in everything we create together.We empower you with the technology, coaching, flexibility and trust needed to make a meaningful difference, while supporting you in bringing your whole self to work each day. We’re committed to building and maintaining a diverse workforce because we know it’s only by working together that we can realise the potential of our people, clients and society around us.We’re living this commitment through initiatives including our Reconciliation Action Plan to increase Indigenous employment and employee-led diversity networks promoting cultural, disability, LGBTI and gender equality. At our core we’re a people business, which means you’ll be supported not just in your professional development but your personal growth as well.As the team experience high volumes of applications, we appreciate your patience to allow for a timely and fair process for all. #LI-PWCLMT  PwC is committed to the health, safety and wellbeing of our people, as well as visitors to our offices and events.PwC has introduced a COVID-19 Vaccination policy that requires all staff, contractors, clients and visitors to be fully vaccinated before they can access our offices, attend client sites, undertake work-related travel, or attend work-related events, subject to limited exemptions. For more information:  https://www.pwc.com.au/about-us/notices/coronavirus.html
