Name: Security Engineer, Threat Analysis
Description: At Google, we have a vision of empowerment and equitable opportunity for all Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples and commit to building reconciliation through Google’s technology, platforms and people and we welcome Indigenous applicants. Please see our Reconciliation Action Plan for more information.Minimum qualifications:Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, a related field, or equivalent practical experience.3 years of experience in a threat intelligence, reverse engineering, or a related role.Experience in programming in Python, C/C++, or Go.Preferred qualifications:Experience in identifying and understanding modern cyber operations.Experience with network and web browser fundamentals, techniques for lateral machine movement, malware persistence mechanisms, covert channels, and command and control techniques.Experience in logs and intrusion detection systems.Excellent communication and documentation skills.About the jobOur Security team works to create and maintain the safest operating environment for Google's users and developers. Security Engineers work with network equipment and actively monitor our systems for attacks and intrusions. In this role, you will also work with software engineers to proactively identify and fix security flaws and vulnerabilities.The Threat Analysis Group uses traditional research methods, creative engineering and computing resources to keep Google, but more importantly our users, safe from sophisticated adversaries. As a Security Engineer, you will provide Google’s operational/product teams with the necessary intelligence to ensure our users are protected, informed, and aware of relevant security/privacy issues. In this role, you will work within a team to make significant advancement in security research.At Google, our users come first, and the Systems Infrastructure team is at the heart of that promise. We build the technologies that transform the way we think about doing business. Whether working on our cloud systems, researching the latest in computer technology or keeping Google's internal systems humming, Googlers and users alike rely on us to keep things running. We're back-end experts: protecting your privacy and ensuring your security.ResponsibilitiesIdentify, analyze, and document network signals, malware behaviors, and threat reports related to trends and developments in adversary tactics, techniques, and procedures (TTPs).Build and improve tools for analyzing malware, identifying threats, and tracking adversaries.Provide clear, actionable, and structured intelligence to product and security teams. Assist in ensuring corporate and production systems are safeguarded.Manage the analysis efforts of threat actors and provide knowledge on how those actors might affect Google and our users.Identify personal and team priorities and work on assignments with minimal supervision while maintaining quality and deadlines.Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form.To all recruitment agencies: Google does not accept agency resumes. Please do not forward resumes to our jobs alias, Google employees or any other organization location. Google is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.

Name: Senior Manager - Secure Configuration
Description: About the Business  Technology team is responsible for the world leading applications of technology and operations across every aspect of CommBank from innovative product platforms for our customers to essential tools within our business. We also use technology to drive efficient and timely processing, an essential component of great customer service.  The Cyber Security division protects the bank and our customers from theft, losses and risk events, through effective and proactive management of cyber security, privacy and operational risk. The Vulnerability Management team is responsible for identifying vulnerabilities through network-based vulnerability scanning and ensure vulnerability remediation through assessment and reporting.  Do work that matters This key position is tasked with the leadership of the Secure Configuration Management function within the Cyber Attack and Vulnerabilities Assessments team. You will:Lead the team to deliver on the strategic roadmap; translates roadmap into key deliverables to enable effective execution and build strategic relationships and partnerships, as well as foster a collaborative environment that supports the achievement of deliverables.Develop and maintain a high performance team culture, through visible leadership, coaching and mentoring of the team.Champion secure configuration with all levels of stakeholders throughout the organisationProactively manage risk, internal ,external obligations and responsibilities ; own and manage the control framework; ensures the framework meets obligations and mitigates riskEvaluate policies, guidelines and standards; make suggestions on improvementsManage and control budget, look for opportunities to optimise expenses in line with organisational policy.Actively contribute to the Cyber community; sharing knowledge and expertise.Analyse industry trends and apply knowledge of the industry to guide changes to policies, guidelines and standards.​We're interested in hearing from people who have: Proven experience in cyber security, ideally with experience and knowledge in the field of Secure Configuration and/or Vulnerability Management in large complex environmentsStrong understanding and experience with ITIL , ASD Essential 8 and the control mapping to VM and SecCMStrong understanding of compliance and regulatory policies including CPS 234, RITS, SWIFT CSP and PCI DSSA strong understanding of system security principles, including both technical security and secure design.Proven stakeholder management and influencing skillsThe ability to convey complex technical information to non-technical peopleDemonstrated ability to lead a team of technical SME's and foster an environment of continuous improvementA formal education or certification in information/cyber security, information technology, risk management or an equivalent discipline is desirable.The health and safety of our people, customers and communities is our number one priority. This means that we require all of our employees to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19. Please speak to us if you have any questions about this based on your individual circumstances Whether you're passionate about customer service, driven by data, or called by creativity, a career here is for you. Our people bring their diverse backgrounds and unique perspectives to build a respectful, inclusive and flexible workplace. One where we're driven by our values, and supported to share ideas, initiatives, and energy. One where making a positive impact for customers, communities and each other is part of our every day.Here, you'll thrive. You'll be supported when faced with challenges, and empowered to tackle new opportunities. We really love working here, and we think you will too.We're determined to make a real difference for Australia's first peoples. We encourage all interested applicants to apply. If you're already part of the Commonwealth Bank Group (including Bankwest), you'll need to apply through Sidekick [link removed] to submit a valid application. We're keen to support you with the next step in your career.

Name: Security Engineer, Incident Management and Digital Forensics
Description: At Google, we have a vision of empowerment and equitable opportunity for all Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples and commit to building reconciliation through Google’s technology, platforms and people and we welcome Indigenous applicants. Please see our Reconciliation Action Plan for more information.Minimum qualifications:Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, or equivalent practical experience.3 years of experience with incident or emergency response coordination.Experience in Technical systems administration, software engineering, digital forensics, security engineering or privacy engineering.Preferred qualifications:Master's degree in Computer Science.Experience with Python, Go, C/C++ and/or Java.Understanding of legal, information security and privacy frameworks, (e.g., ISO 27001 and Safe Harbor Frameworks).Ability to lead teams in ambiguous situations through influence and non authority.Excellent organizational, prioritization and multitasking skills.Exceptional communication skills and a data-driven analytical approach toward problem-solving challenges.About the jobIn this role, you will work on security and privacy. You will be on the front lines of security and privacy incidents, setting the tempo and driving resolution. You will set the bar for excellence in rapid response and protection of user information.Behind everything our users see online is the architecture built by the Technical Infrastructure team to keep it running. From developing and maintaining our data centers to building the next generation of Google platforms, we make Google's product portfolio possible. We're proud to be our engineers' engineers and love voiding warranties by taking things apart so we can rebuild them. We keep our networks up and running, ensuring our users have the best and fastest experience possible.ResponsibilitiesCoordinate and deliver resolution on a diverse range of incidents.Analyze root cause, trends, and systematic issues.Upgrade the security and privacy of Google products and services.Develop excellence in Incident Management tools and infrastructure, and prepare teams across Google through learning and training.Manage relationships across the company (e.g, Legal, Engineering, Communications, etc).Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form.To all recruitment agencies: Google does not accept agency resumes. Please do not forward resumes to our jobs alias, Google employees or any other organization location. Google is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.To learn more about COVID vaccination requirements for US Google workplaces, read our Vaccination Entry Policy.

Name: Security Engineer - Incident Response
Description: Want to be part of the best tech companies on the planet? Amazon is one of the most recognizable brand names in the world and we distribute millions of products each year to our loyal customers.Amazon is seeking qualified Security Engineers to join our innovative, high energy Information Security team and work within the Security Incident Response Team (SIRT) in Australia.SIRT Security Engineers respond to security events, conduct analysis of threats such as malware and intrusion attempts, and provide security services to safeguard highly sensitive data.With your technical expertise, you will be solving security challenges at scale, working to protect the applications powering the most sophisticated e-commerce platform ever built.We value broad and deep technical knowledge, specifically in the fields of forensics, malware analysis, network security, application security, cryptography, and security intelligence.Key Job Responsibilities: Responding to security incidents, and coordinating a cohesive response involving multiple teams across Amazon.Providing security engineering solutions and support during customer-facing incidents, proactively considering the prevention of similar incidents from occurring in the future.Assisting in the development of pragmatic solutions that achieve business requirements while maintaining an acceptable level of risk.Identifying and recommending solutions that improve or expand Amazon’s incident response capabilities.Working alongside and mentoring Information Security engineers to improve security, reduce and quickly address risk.Evaluating the impact of current security trends, advisories, publications, and academic research to Amazon, coordinating response as necessary across affected teams.Keeping your knowledge and skills current with the rapidly changing threat landscape.Participating in a follow-the-sun on-call rotation. What are we looking for?  BS in Computer Science, Information Security, or equivalent professional experience.5 years of demonstrated experience in areas such as incident response, systems security, network, and/or application security.Excellent written and verbal communication skills with the ability to adapt messaging to executive, technical, and non-technical audiences.Understanding of best practices in security engineering, including secure development, cryptography, network security, security operations, systems security, policy, and incident response.Technical depth in one or more specialties including: application security, infrastructure security, digital forensics, malware analysis, or some combination thereof.Understanding of security vulnerabilities, attacker exploit techniques, and methods for their remediation.The capacity and tolerance for context switching and interruptions while remaining productive and providing effective, safe guidance.Experience with common security monitoring, log analysis and forensic tools.Ability to work with a high degree of autonomy.Scripting skills (E.g: Python, Perl, Bash, PowerShell, etc.)What additional skills you can bring? Experience triaging and developing security alerts and response automation, conducting front-line analysis, and providing escalation support.5+ years of information security experience.Relevant industry certifications from SANS, ISC2, etc.Strong demonstrated knowledge of Unix tools and architecture.Experience working as part of a Computer Security Incident Response Team (CSIRT) or Product Security Incident Response Team (PSIRT).Familiarity/experience with AWS services and security concepts.Amazon offers great benefits including a competitive compensation and stock plan. We also look after our people with benefits including: subsidized private health and life insurance, commuter benefits and even an Amazon discount.We are committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, age, or other legally protected status.If you want to join us on our amazing journey in Sydney, Brisbane or Melbourne; Apply here:https://www.amazon.jobs/en/jobs/1884839/security-engineer-incident-response

Name: Azure Security Consultant

operations, expert adversary simulation & penetration testing capabilities along with leading governance, risk and compliance consulting, As our clients' cybersecurity partner of choice, we forge long Exchange Online, SharePoint and OneDriveBe a Subject Matter Expert (SME) for Microsoft cloud technologies.About YouThe ideal candidate will bring a thorough understanding of Microsoft cloud cloud environmentsThe ability to clearly communicate the reasoning behind specific configuration setsAchieved, or a vision to achieve, the following certifications:Microsoft 365 Certified: Security Administrator Associate (MS-500)Microsoft Certified: Azure Security Engineer Associate (AZ-500)Our Culture and ValuesLoop focuses heavily on our culture and values to create an enjoyable working recognising Loopies bringing enjoyment and laughter to our workdayLoopies focus on teamwork, working together to achieve our goals and helping out when someone is in need. We are always looking to share our ideas, thoughts and feelings.About the CandidateFor this role we value candidates with the following behaviours:Strong listening skillsStrong analytical skillsSelf-motivatedPersistenceSelf-awarenessHow to ApplyIf you're looking for a rewarding role with a fantastic business, apply now via SEEK with your CV or apply via https://www.loopsec.com.au/about/join-us

Name: Cyber Security Manager
Description: onPlatinum ICT – Cyber Security ManageronPlatinum ICT is a fast-growing company focused on providing ICT products, services and solutions around Australia, with locations on the Gold Coast, Brisbane and Sydney. We are energetic and dynamic in what we do across a wide range of business technology solutions - including cloud services, business grade internet, telephony, web and digital development, helpdesk support services and much more.onPlatinum are now seeking applications for a suitably qualified Cyber Security Manager to be based at either or Gold Coast or Sydney office.onPlatinum ICT goes by the philosophy of High Tech, High Touch and therefore is looking for an individual that possess both these qualities. About the opportunity:Analyse and identify security risks and opportunities in emerging technologies and frameworks, and recommend appropriate actions. Manage, respond to and coordinate detection, response and recovery actions to high-pressure situations to complex technical cyber security incidents to minimise the impact on the business. Develop and implement risk management techniques to design, deploy and operate cyber security systems and services to protect the delivery of practical ICT business solutions.Document and promote cyber security policies, procedures and standards that communicate risk management requirements that may be readily understood by personnel at all levels within the organisation. Assist in clients audits including GS007 and guidance with building controls for their GS007 requirements.Providing monthly reports on Security and Compliance to the Executive Management. Required Skills:Extensive experience in supporting environments as a security analyst / consultant. Tertiary education in business, finance, economics, IT, or relevant industry experienceExperience supporting an enterprise SIEM - monitoring, IR and across lifecycleExperience in managing and leading a managed security operation centre (SOC)CISSP, CRISC, CISM or other information security or compliance related certifications (e.g. Basel II, GS007, AS3402, ISO27001)Extensive experience in operational risk management roles.Experience in Cyber risk & controls functions. About you:  Excellent interpersonal skills, written and verbal presentation skills.Ability to work independently on multiple projects with minimal supervision.Excellent problem solving skills.Willingness to learn and grow within a supportive teamA positive and 'can-do' attitudeDrive to deliver outcomes for the organisationExperience with the tools and techniques used in security event analysis, incident response, computer forensics, malware analysis, or other areas of security operations. Advanced understanding of risk and control environments and associated frameworks with proven experience in operational and compliance risks.Experience in the cyber security controls of Microsoft on-premises and Microsoft 365 environments. Background security checks will be conducted on preferred candidates. On offer:Growing company with room for internal career growthRegular staff and social activities If this sounds like you, then we'd like to hear from you.   Please send a cover letter and resume outlining why you will be a great fit for our team.To be eligible for this position you must be an Australian Citizen, Permanent Resident or have full working rights.

Name: Senior Consultant - Cyber Security
Description:
Employer Value Proposition (EVP)
Looking to work for a multinational and well-known organisation, but don't want to get lost in the crowd? As a mid-tier firm, RSM has the perfect balance of providing exposure to a variety of clients and services, without overlooking an employee's career objectives and individual areas of interest. RSM offers the combined benefits of a big firm including extensive networks, training and career opportunities - within a highly supportive, people-oriented workplace. This combination provides a great environment to build skills and confidence. We help our people achieve to their best. RSM prides themselves on hiring and retaining employees by providing flexible work arrangements, regular and dedicated mentorship from senior management, and opportunities for future learning and training.
The technology team is a specialist team under the wider Risk Advisory Services cohort. You will be working closely with others within this specialist field, gaining exposure to numerous cyber security, information security and privacy related services. You will be provided with the opportunity to expand your knowledge and skillset with the dedicated support and guidance from both subject matter experts, as well as senior management.
Position Summary
Successful candidates will be responsible for effectively delivering engagements/projects and managing junior staff. You will be skilled and experienced at scoping, planning, delivery and reporting of IT general control reviews and keen to learn more about cyber security, information security and privacy related services.
Key Responsibilities:

Provide client management with guidance on IT risk management, particularly on application, database, operating system and network infrastructure controls. Help identify improvement opportunities for clients and write reports for clients with recommendations for identified findings.
Perform technology risk assessments, assess the effectiveness of processes/controls and make recommendations to improve the technology control environment.
Ensure completion of each assignment to a high-quality standard, within budget and on or before deadlines, while controlling the progress of other assignments.
Co-ordinate the engagement, liaise with client, mentor and coach the team, and ensure IT audit methodology compliance.
Work closely with other Risk Consulting and External Audit team members in delivery of reviews.
Assist partners and managers in business development activities.

 
Education Requirements:
 Essential

Tertiary qualification in Information Technology or Computer Science

 Desirable

Professional certification such as CISA, or other relevant IT certifications

Demonstrated Experience & Attributes

Minimum 3 years' experience in IT audit, internal controls or risk management.
Experience performing IT general controls, technology risk assessments, testing or auditing against technology standards or governance frameworks.
Knowledge of IT processes, project management, applications, databases, operating systems and network infrastructure to apply better practice guidance and identify opportunities for improvement.
Outstanding interpersonal and communications skills, able to communicate effectively in verbal and written format with technical and non-technical audiences.
Experience managing a client portfolio, able to provide first class service in response to client demands.
Strong attention to detail and prioritising skills, able to produce high quality work autonomously and as part of a team.
Interested in developing skills further and working on engagements related to cybersecurity or information security standards or governance frameworks.

How To Apply
To apply, please click on the Apply Now button, complete our online application form and upload your CV and cover letter.

Name: Junior Security Engineer
Description: The Infrastructure and Security TeamThe Infrastructure and Security Team protects our users' data, our users' clients' data, and our team’s data. Join us as our Junior Security Engineer and you will play an active role in improving our security posture! Junior Security EngineerWe are looking for a Junior Security Engineer to grow our small and passionate team. You will report to the Infrastructure and Security Team Lead, and be an active member of the wider Engineering Team.This is a great opportunity for someone who is looking to get started in the security space and would like to play an active role in improving our security posture!You will assist in day-to-day operational support and maintenance of the Accelo infrastructure code including development, bug fixing, testing, quality assurance, etc within the team. The role will be focused on learning the Accelo business, organisation, product, code, tools, and practices. What you will doProactively improve our Web Application Firewall rulesHelp to answer security and compliance questions from auditors and our customersWork on strategic compliance initiatives like obtaining ISO 27001 certificationImprove observability with system and application dashboardsWork alongside product developers to remediate any security issues in the productSupport work on small activities within the team which may form part of a broader project in the teamInternally auditing system and data configurationsLearning the Accelo business, organisation, product, code, tools, and practices. Who you areYou are aligned with Accelo’s values of Care, Serve, Drive, Integrity, and FulfilmentYou are a team playerYou are detail-orientedYou have a passion for security and technologyYou are always interested in learningYou have excellent communication skills to communicate with all stakeholdersYou have an undergraduate understanding of computer programming and languagesYou enjoy continuous improvement, making things a little better every dayYou work well with others who know a lot about their code and systems You will stand out if you have experience withCompliance, security, or data management systemsAutomating with scripting languagesWorking in public cloud environments, particularly AWSDeveloping software as part of a modern engineering team Life at AcceloWe’re creating a space and platform that empowers people to be people - creative, resourceful, and passionate about their work. Founded in Wollongong, NSW, Accelo is a venture-backed vertical SaaS company with a mission to help service businesses succeed. With more than 100 employees across 6 countries in 4 offices, we are a global team made up of passionate and caring people driving this mission and vision forward.  We love unlocking the potential of people to do the work they love by building powerful software solutions through connectedness and collaboration. Like our customers, we too are engineers, creatives, customer support specialists, and big dreamers. We speak different languages, have varied backgrounds, think differently, and live differently, but we have five very important values in common:  We CARE about each other, our clients, and our mission.We choose to SERVE each other, our clients, and our communities.We have an uncommon DRIVE to do important and difficult things with excellence.We act with INTEGRITY and authenticity in all that we do.We seek personal FULFILMENT through our workWhy you will love it hereFlexible working arrangementsExtensive learning opportunities and $2,500 Professional Development stipendVibrant, fun-filled, and modern office is minutes from the beach, cafes, shopping centres, and restaurantsAccess to an Employee Assistance Program for coaching and wellness check-insYearly travel credit to enjoy the experience of your choiceLarge kitchen/dining area fully stocked with the snacks, fresh fruit, and drinksWe are committed to hiring a diverse workforce as it helps us make better decisions, think differently, and better serve our global clients

Name: Security Engineer (Cloud)
Description: About the role  The Security Cloud Engineer has responsibility towards enhancing the cyber security maturity and capabilities of HammondCare. Work to ensure all controls and processes are operational and adhere to ISO 27001 standards, maintain and operate managed security services.  Overall a key contributor of all cyber security services including hands-on security tools, security architecture consultancy and assisting in building security with external vendors.  The position will also be responsible to mentor technical staff, SME on our Azure and AWS tenant environment, and any technical incident management practices.  Key Focus Areas Be part of a new establishing dynamic security team with the emphasis of Azure security, security remediation and identity management.Lead the technical development, management, and execution of rebuilding our IAM platform using Microsoft native tools.Cyber Security Operations Services to HammondCare including but not limited to Cyber Advisory, Identity and Access Management, Data Loss Prevention, Infrastructure Security, Security Incident Management, Vulnerability Management, Penetration Testing, Risk Mitigation, Threat Intelligence, Threat Hunting, and application security consulting.Team player and ability to use a pragmatic risk based lens.About youBachelors degree in IT related discipline with 10 years post graduate experience or equivalent relevant industry experienceMore than 7 years of experience in Cyber Security as a security analyst, security architect, or security leadMore than 3 years of experience in working with Security Operations Centre, in-house, outsourced, or hybrid modelExperience in security technologies, architectures, and framework (e.g. NIST, ISO 27001)Lateral thinker and specialist in cloud security practices with an emphasis on identity.Demonstrated experience with managing and ensuring the timely response and investigations of security events andDesirableCISSP or equivalentBenefitsFinancial - including salary packaging optionsHealth and Wellbeing - including Employee Assistance ProgramBlended learning programs - eLearning and face to faceReward and Recognition ProgramCultureHammondCare is committed to creating an inclusive workplace that promotes and values diversity and inclusion. We strive on creating an equal employment environment where everyone from any background can be themselves.  We believe your job should be rewarding and the ability to make a difference every day is a great place to start.  All short-listed applicants will be asked to consent to a criminal record check and provide evidence of Influenza and COVID vaccinations

Name: Security Vetting Analysts – Level 6
Description: ASIS is Australia’s overseas secret intelligence collection agency. Its mission is to protect and promote Australia’s vital interests through the provision of intelligence services as directed by the Government. Its work can involve collecting intelligence in relation to national security, international relations and economic issues. It also contributes to Australia’s coordinated national efforts against terrorism, proliferation of weapons of mass destruction, and transnational issues such as people smuggling.Security Vetting Analysts make assessments and recommendations about an individual’s suitability to hold a Positive Vetting security clearance in accordance with minimum standards set by the Protective Security Policy Framework (PSPF), and other policies and guidelines.Outlined below are the key areas of responsibility for the Security Vetting Analysts: - Manage, to completion, the vetting security clearance process for allocated cases within specified benchmark timeframes;- Research, organise and conduct interviews;- Perform detailed analysis and assessment and make recommendations in high level written report form;- Develop and maintain effective relationships with key internal and external stakeholders;- Contribute to shared knowledge with personnel security and vetting groups;- Undertake interstate travel as required.The position has conditions of service similar to those in the Australian Public Service, including superannuation.Citizenship: To be eligible for engagement, applicants must be Australian citizens.Security Assessment: The successful applicant will be required to undergo and maintain a high level Security Clearance.Please Note: ASIS does not provide feedback to unsuccessful applicants.To apply go to asis.gov.auAll applications for employment with ASIS are handled in the strictest confidence.  It is essential that you maintain a similar level of confidentiality and that you not discuss your application with others.Applications close Monday 18 July 2022.

Name: Security Operations Specialist- Insurance
Description: A leading insurance company is seeking a Cyber Security Operations Specialist.The team work remote and open to interstate workersThis is a newly created role within a small security function within the organisation where you will have loads of scope in the role.Responsibilities:Configure and troubleshoot security infrastructure, devices, and platforms issues/problems/changes.Enhance, implement, monitoring, and maintaining security operational productsDevelop technical solutions and new security tools to help mitigate security vulnerabilities and automate repeatable tasks.Ensure that the company knows as much as possible, as quickly as possible about operational incidents relating to security platformsKey Skills / Experience:3 Years Enterprise Security Experience.Proven work experience as system security operations engineerExperience with network security and networking technologies and with system, security, and network monitoring toolsExperience supporting and managing cloud environments, specifically Azure and Office365 platform and tools.Relevant exposure to Vendor products might include:Vulnerability Management Platforms (e.g., Qualys, Nessus)Cloud security platforms Azure, Office365 security toolsData Loss Prevention (DLP) toolsCloud security toolsFirewall auditing tools e.gPhishing simulation toolIf interested please respond ASAP with your latest resumeIMPORTANT: By submitting your email address and any other personal information when you APPLY to a job, you consent to such information being collected, held, used and disclosed in accordance with our COLLECTIONS NOTICE and PRIVACY POLICY.http://www.bluefinresources.com.au/privacy-policy [link removed]

Name: Cyber Security Manager
Description: Company description:What makes us, usEstablished in 1840, we're Australia's first member-owned wellbeing company, delivering health, wealth and care services to more than 700,000 Australians. Today, while we've grown to a company of more than 7000 employees, our focus remains the same as it was 180 years ago — to deliver Real Wellbeing for our customers, members and the community.We support your Real Wellbeing so you can better support our members' and customers' wellbeing journeyThere are four key attributes that set us apart: Good people: We strive to set ourselves apart through the capability, warmth and expertise of our people. Wellbeing experts: Our breadth of capability enables us to provide smart solutions and services across all domains of wellbeing. Long-term commitment: As a member-owned company, we've been focusing on long-term outcomes and single-minded dedication to our members and customers since 1840. Driving positive impact: Everything we do is focused on making a positive difference at a personal, community and societal level. These pillars are infused with our values of bold, warm and honestJob description: Our opportunityThe Cyber Security Manager (Identity & Access Management) plays a critical role to ensure that the identity, privilege and access management platform operates efficiently, adequately address security risks and maintain the integrity of IT operations to support Australian Unity business.This role also manages the BAU operations and services for the IAM platform and will lead a team of technical analysts to maintain the day to day running of IAM services, incidents and managing the application onboarding program and coordinate the quarterly release cycles.This role has both a business and technology focus, engaging the business to understand IAM needs and implementing this in the IAM enterprise solution. This will involve engaging with technology support and delivery teams and service provider/s for the BAU operations of IAM and to ensure that technical changes made align with recommended industry and vendor platform practices.What you will do Operate and maintain a secure and reliable IAM platform that delivers 99.9% uptime Establish IAM standards and procedures that meet regulatory and internal policies requirements Support Australian Unity business platforms and enabling units in the management of user provisioning and de-provisioning, re-certification of entitlements and compliance/audit reporting Manage the IAM enhancements and defects backlog and implement quarterly release cycles Maintain efficient day-to-day operations of the IAM platform and services. Participate in identifying requirements and assisting the solution design for the IAM solution, as part of the quarterly release cycles. Drive continuous and measurable process improvements and capability uplifts to deliver an effective and efficient onboarding program What we are looking forFundamentally, we are searching for a professional who will join us in striving to live our values of bold, warm and honest, in everything we do.Additionally we are also looking for; Demonstrated experience and capability in leading a team and managing an application development lifecycle that includes requirements gathering, system analysis, development, testing and production release Demonstrated experience in operating and supporting an Identity and Access Management application system; SailPoint knowledge and experience would be well regarded Relevant skills, experience and demonstrable knowledge and understanding of Identity and Access management concepts, process and industry practices Hands on experience with configuration of user access certifications within SailPoint IdentityIQ (IIQ) and execution of the certification campaigns including data reconciliation and reporting is highly desired Applicable tertiary qualifications with a minimum of 3 years' experience in information security, identity and access management, risk, compliance or audit related discipline. Demonstrated ability to influence others, drive cultural change and gain support for relevant initiatives. Excellent stakeholder management, communication, and problem-solving skills Our BenefitsYou will enjoy a range of great employee benefits and rewards including: Competitive Remuneration and variable bonus A range of attractive product and service discounts from Australian Unity's Retail and Wealth Management portfolio - including health insurance and banking products Flexible Working Arrangements including Work-From-Home days with a real work-life balance Available access to LinkedIn Learning courses through our great Learning platform Additional paid Wellbeing and Volunteer leave days yearly Where to from here?Please contact Richard Maher, Talent Acquisition Practise Lead, for a confidential discussion or more details - rimaher@australianunity.com.au [link removed].Please note that all Australian Unity employees must be fully vaccinated for COVID 19. Australian Unity is an Equal Opportunity Employer, and we encourage applications from all members of the community, including people of Aboriginal and Torres strait Islander descent, culturally and linguistically diverse backgrounds and, mature aged people.

Name: Cyber Security Architect
Description: Brighter Futures Start hereAs Australia's biggest and most loved retailer, we've been brightening up everyday life for families for over 50 years. At our stores, distribution centres, and offices in Australia and New Zealand. All around the globe. Our diverse and inclusive 47,000 strong team come together for a common cause. Giving families easy access to our on-trend products and incredibly low prices - it's the heart of everything we do.As a leader in the retail market, we're optimistic about our future and yours. We're relentless in our pursuit for results, but changing at a rapid rate, giving you challenging work that you'll be proud of. We celebrate your uniqueness and individuality. Because at Kmart it's not just what you do, it's who you are that makes every day living brighter.Join the teamOur team at Kmart have a permanent opportunity for a Cyber Security Architect - we are looking for individuals who are passionate about security and technology! This might be the perfect opportunity for you.To be successful in this role you will have experience in the following: Experience working within Digital Transformation, Cloud Migration or Emerging Technology tech strategies You have 2 or more years of cybersecurity and/or security architecture experience Cloud Security Knowledge, with a major Industry Cloud provider (AWS, GCP or Microsoft Azure) Experience working in a complex environment that has a wide array of technologies at different stages of lifecycle Security experience across Application Development  SABSA Foundation or above knowledge desirable Broad knowledge and collaborative experience working with multiple stakeholders, including other domain architects, enterprise architecture, project delivery and/or cybersecurity teams. Have worked with reference architectures from vendors, and presented cyber architectures to technical and business audiences. Have written or contributed to high level designs and detailed designs for cyber related solutions Essential ability to work with diverse stakeholders, driving win-win outcomes to the business and technology Solid experience and knowledge working with several types of security controls, tools and services Benefits we'll offer you: A dynamic learning and support program Competitive remuneration Flexible working through our Flex Where, Flex When, Flex Well policy A discount card for Kmart, Target, Officeworks and Bunnings, plus other benefits An inclusive, fun recognition program A bonus program (where eligible) Development opportunities across Kmart Group (comprised of Kmart, Target and Catch) as well as the broader Wesfarmers Group.  Wesfarmers Share Plan access (where eligible) We're here to make everyday living brighterFrom humble beginnings in Burwood East, Victoria, in 1969, we're now an essential part of 300 communities, and proud of it! From bedding to apparel to kitchenware and beyond. We're designing and creating the products people reach for every day. In-store, online, or Click & Collect - getting the products we love into the hands of happy customers is what we aim to do best. From the remote outback to coastal towns and big cities, and everywhere in-between. We're progressive in our pursuit to create seamless customer journeys for satisfied shoppers.A place you can belongAt Kmart, we celebrate the rich diversity of the communities in which we operate and are committed to creating inclusive and safe environments where all our team members can contribute and succeed. We believe that all team members should feel valued, respected and safe irrespective of your gender, ethnicity, indigeneity, religious beliefs, education, age, disability, family responsibilities, sexual orientation and gender identity and we encourage applications from all candidates.We believe that everyone should have the opportunity to do well when applying or working at Kmart, therefore we encourage you to share any feedback by emailing diversity@kmart.com.au [link removed] if you would like any adjustments.If you would like to explore a career with Kmart and this sounds like the perfect role for you - apply now!Phone screening and interviews will occur prior to the closing date of this advertisement. Candidates interested in this position should apply directly to this advertisement as we are not accepting applications from recruitment agencies. As part of our recruitment process, we will be conducting Pre-Employment Checks with our successful candidates - this will include a police check.  Talent Acquisition will provide further updates to candidates as they progress through our recruitment process.

Name: EOI - Expression of Interest - TSPV Professionals
Description: Cleared ICT are currently looking to speak to professionals who hold a TSPV clearance, for long term contract and permanent opportunities, within the national security and intelligence space.  Whether you are thinking of discharging from the forces, working within the APS or simply looking for a change of environment, get in touch to discuss what opportunities we are currently recruiting for. If you fall within one of the following categories and hold the appropriate clearance, get in touch to find out more.Software EngineeringTesting + AutomationSystems Administration / EngineeringInformation SecurityIntelligence AnalystsCloud + InfrastructureProject ServicesArchitectureEven if you are not ready for a move right now but would still like to have a conversation about opportunities in the future, feel free to reach out for a confidential discussion.  At Cleared, we provide tailored recruitment solutions to individuals seeking their next opportunity and to organisations searching for talent within Defence Industry, Intelligence and National Security.

Name: Cyber Operations and Information Security Manager
Description: What we can offer youAt Specsavers we promise to make you feel good, cared for and smart. Being Great Place to Work accredited for the last two years, this is a great opportunity to join us as we continue our path to not just be great but be the BEST place to work!We are well known for valuing our people and providing a supportive, driven and inclusive culture. Beyond that, we also have a range of different benefits within the support office, that include:Quarterly Bonus Scheme Two free pairs of glassesOn site free parkingBirthday leave, Volunteer leave, Paid Parental leaveHealth & Wellbeing programsFully funded Social Club – provides a wide range of activities throughout the year. The role & teamAs the Cyber Operations and Security Manager you will join our Global Threat, Vulnerability and Response (TVR) team and you will be responsible for the provision of Information & Operational Security Services for Specsavers within the APAC region. Reporting directly into the Head of Information Security (who is based in the UK) you will be responsible for the day-to-day monitoring, response, and management of key security systems such as intrusion detection, network behavioural analysis, and vulnerability management as well as day to day information security management and interaction with the business and IT teams.Forming part of the wider strategic vulnerability management program you will focus on the reduction of technology and information risk to Specsavers. It requires a broad knowledge across all aspects of these services, i.e. technology, process and governance.  It also requires an ability to balance a hands-on approach to incident management where necessary.  The skills we are looking forExtensive experience in a Cyber Operations environment Very Strong knowledge of configuration management, change control/problem management and leading risk assessments Deep understanding of Security Tooling including: SIEM (we use Splunk)Vulnerability Management Email Gateways (we use Proofpoint)Endpoint Protection (we use Cortex XDR)Firewalls (we use Palo Alto and Cisco Meraki)Ability to maintain composure and continue to function effectively under pressureExperience providing direction, leadership and mentoring as required to other team membersWell versed with Microsoft 365  Predominately standard business hours however there will be regular weekly calls to the UK outside standard hours (usually evenings) About UsAt Specsavers we believe a diverse, inclusive and flexible culture enables our people to bring their whole selves to work and be proud of doing so. When it comes to flexibility, we understand that one size doesn't fit all. Our flexible working at Specsavers enables us to work in ways that support our lifestyle to help us balance our career with the other important things in life.Creating a great place to work for our people is pinnacle to us and along with our Behaviours is at the core of everything we do, ensuring our people feel good, cared for and smart. We like to think it’s a fun and positive place to work – why not have a look for yourself https://join.specsavers.com/au/department/support-office/  Applicants for the role are required to have current working rights as per, relevant government legislation.

Name: Senior Cyber Operations Specialist
Description: The Role:Looking for a Senior Cyber Operations Specialist to join a reputable and well respected organization, based in Brisbane. In this role you will be responsible for the security around the business operations of a large corporate environment. You will be managing enterprise technology, improving overall security posture, conducting security training, support the resolution of security incidents and dealing with senior stakeholders.Main Responsibilities:    Work with SOC, SIEM and SOAR tools Align the business with security frameworks Assist and support the creation of security policies Provide recommendations of overall security posture Document technical processes and standards Apply & maintain specific security controls  Respond to security breaches in line with security policies Work alongside Architects to develop end-to-end security solutions Conduct vulnerability scanning or penetration testing  Key Skills Required:    5+ years of Cyber Security experience Previous experience working for an enterprise organization  Experience with SOC, SIEM and SOAR tools Experience with Tenable, Helix or FireEye Experience with firewalls, WAFs, IDS/IPS and PKI Understanding of GRC frameworks - ISO27001, ISM and PCI-DSS Excellent stakeholder engagement skills   What's in it for you?  Reputable and global organization Great location / WFH flexibility Career progression / training provided Work/life balance  Endless company perks! Social and friendly work culture

Name: Senior Endpoint Security Engineer
Description: DXC Technology (NYSE:DXC) - where brilliant people embrace change and seize opportunities to advance their careers and amplify customer success.  People are the heart of our business. We support each other and work as a team, globally and locally to deliver excellence for our customers and colleagues. We live in more than 70 countries, speak multiple languages and work with over 6,000 customers on almost every continent. We use the power of technology to deliver mission critical IT services that move the world. DXC.com An exciting opportunity now exists for a Senior Endpoint Security Engineer who is an Australian Citizen (due to customer requirements). You will be responsible for projects and BAU activities for security solutions with a focus on endpoint products.  Using your existing skills and experience you will also mentor staff in products that you are more experienced in.  You may also become the go-to person for one or more accounts/technologies.  Your manager will look to you for advice on how improvements in process can be made.The immediate team you will be working with is currently across 5 different states/territories of Australia, with a mix of experience from university graduates to IT veterans.  You will also be forming part of the wider DXC Managed Security Services family.We welcome applications from suitably qualified applicants across Australia. security toolsMentor and train junior members around processes and procedures, including ITILKeeping up to date with new & emerging technologiesDrive innovation, automation, and improvementsRespond and resolve break/fix incident, problem, change, and service requests within SLAsManage workload and ensure assignments are completed on timeSolution design, management, and implementation of various sized projectsDemonstrate a passion for Cyber SecurityPerform after hours changes and participate in an oncall/standby rosterWork within a team To be considered for this role, you must possess the following skills & experience:Anti-virusApplication ControlMulti-Factor AuthenticationPublic key infrastructureData Loss PreventionXDR/EDR solutionsA solid understanding of Microsoft Windows desktop and server operating systemsKnowledge of the CIA triad in a security contextAbility to adapt quickly and learn how to support/troubleshoot various platformsAbility to logically approach a problem from definition through to resolutionAbility to liaise and troubleshoot with 3rd partiesExperience in medium to large enterprise or corporate environmentAbility to resolve issues & handle conflicting priorities in a dynamic environmentStrong written and verbal communication skillsWork with minimal supervisionA positive attitude, a passion for Cyber Security and a mindset that can adapt easily to changeAustralian Citizenship with the ability to gain Australian Federal Government Security Clearance To put you above the rest you will have one or more of the following desirables:An understanding of change management process and compliance experienceUnderstanding of ITIL frameworkUnderstanding of the Australian ITSM and Essential 8Certification in industry recognized technologies eg Comptia Security+, ISC2 SSCP, ISC2 CISSP, Microsoft SC-200 or AZ-500Palo Alto TrapsTrend Micro Apex OneTrend Micro Deep SecurityCarbon Black endpoint productsAirlock whitelistingMicrosoft security products including Microsoft Defender for EndpointsMcAfee endpoint security productsSymantec endpoint security products (SEP, DCS, VIP)Symantec Data Loss PreventionUnix/Linux skillsService NowScriptingOnly candidates able to gain or currently holding a current Australian Federal Government Security Clearance at NV1 will be considered for this role.   DXC Culture & BenefitsDXC Technology is dedicated to ‘putting its people first’. We offer competitive remuneration; benefits, training and career opportunities and a culture that demonstrates our employees are our priority. Some of our benefits include but not limited to:DXC UniversityEducation AssistanceReward & RecognitionStaff Referral ProgramNovated LeasingHealth Insurance (discount program)Volunteer Days / Emergency Services We are an Equal Opportunity EmployerDXC is proud to be an equal opportunity employer and we welcome submissions from people from all walks of life. We celebrate our diversity and recognise it is the unique contributions of our people that give us our edge. We stand by the ‘bring your whole-self to work’ philosophy. It is our inclusive culture that powers our results, and our company grows only if our people grow.Accommodation of special needs for qualified candidates may be considered within the framework of the DXC Accommodation Policy. In addition, DXC Technology is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodation to support qualified individuals with physical and mental disabilities.

Name: Senior Consultant - Digital Forensics & Incident Response
Description: Job DescriptionWith PwC, you’ll ignite a meaningful career while being supported by a flexible working culture, innovative learning and development opportunities and progressive policies and benefits, such as 18 weeks paid parental leave for mums, dads and foster carers (no minimum service!) What will you create? You’ll help Australian businesses, not-for-profits and governments create value and improve the way they work. From digitising healthcare, to creating smarter cities and igniting our start-up industry, together we build trust in society and solve important problems. Cybersecurity & Digital Trust builds trust in Australian organisations by securing their digital future and developing the nation's leading cybersecurity workforce. As a Senior Consultant in our Defensive Security team your impact will be seen by:Conducting cyber detection and response including incident response, threat intelligence, hunting and security monitoringDeveloping cyber intelligence assessments and briefs for both technical and business stakeholdersDeveloping internal tools and procedures to contribute to the team’s knowledge base;Reporting and presenting to both technical and business stakeholders About you You have a background in cyber security with experience in incident response, threat intelligence, threat hunting, or security operations and are able to independently manage engagement delivery. You have a strong grasp of technical/business writing and have the ability to train and mentor junior members. As a bonus, you may hold security related certifications such as CISSP, CISM, ITIL or GIAC. You may also hold relevant vendor certifications.   Passionate about being at the forefront of change, you’re ready to help our Consulting team deliver practical advice that speaks straight to the heart of client business issues and deliver innovative results. You’re collaborative and enjoy working in an innovative environment. You’re a problem solver by nature and want to join a firm that values the kind of people who reimagine the possible for their clients and stakeholders. Most importantly, you act with integrity and show care for the people you work with. Life at PwC  Our culture and benefits are something we’re proud of, and also the reason we’ve been named LinkedIn’s #1 Australian workplace. With PwC, you’ll belong to an inclusive community where differences are both embraced and the underlying driver in everything we create together.  We empower you with the technology, coaching, flexibility and trust needed to make a meaningful difference, while supporting you in bringing your whole self to work each day. We’re committed to building and maintaining a diverse workforce because we know it’s only by working together that we can realise the potential of our people, clients and society around us. We’re living this commitment through initiatives including our Reconciliation Action Plan to increase Indigenous employment and employee-led diversity networks promoting cultural, disability, LGBTI and gender equality. At our core we’re a people business, which means you’ll be supported not just in your professional development but your personal growth as well.  Paul Bui is the Recruitment Manager for the role. As the team experience high volumes of applications, we appreciate your patience to allow for a timely and fair process for all.  Location: Flexible (any major city) We welcome the opportunity to speak to candidates about our value proposition and recognition and reward approach. The minimum full time salary for this role is $77,000.00 including 10% Superannuation,  however will be determined based on the skills and experience that the candidate brings.#LI-PWCLMT PwC is committed to the health, safety and wellbeing of our people, as well as visitors to our offices and events.PwC has introduced a COVID-19 Vaccination policy that requires all staff, contractors, clients and visitors to be fully vaccinated before they can access our offices, attend client sites, undertake work-related travel, or attend work-related events, subject to limited exemptions. For more information: https://www.pwc.com.au/about-us/notices/coronavirus.html

Name: Australian Cyber Security Centre -Customer Engagement Officer
Description: About Us  Finite Recruitment is your award-winning Technology, Digital, Risk & Business Transformation Recruitment Partner.  About our Clients  This client is a Federal Government Client, charged with Defending Australia and its interests.  About the Role  You will be managing diverse stakeholder groups to understand, analyse and map/model business processes. Collecting and analysing performance and other data to inform business analysis. Providing advice to the project team on business analysis processes and methods. You will use Human Centred Design and User Based Design techniques in presentation of analysis  About you  You must be able to gain a NV1 Security clearance  You will have a minimum of 5 years' experience in Business analysis, with advanced desktop software skills (such as word, excel, PowerPoint and Visio). You will be able to produce high quality documentation. You will also be highly organised a strong communicator and able to work as a productive member in a large team  Next steps  Apply now to have a confidential discussion with our consultants about your next career opportunity.

Name: IT Business Anlaysts
Description: IT Business Analysts  Initial 12 month contract with a possible extension up to 24 months Offices located in Canberra, Brisbane and Melbourne Baseline clearance or ability to obtain Multiple positions available  Our Federal Government client is seeking experienced IT Business Analysts who can commence in early JulyAbout the role:  Elicitation and definition, business process reengineering and process mapping Facilitating workshops Technical writing and producing high quality documentation including requirements, guidelines, and operation procedures Deliver multi-faceted artefacts for government programs and/or projects  Ideally you will have:  5+ years’ experience in an IT Business Analyst role working in the IT and/or Cyber Security industry Experience working in the Cyber Security field, with a strong understanding of the Australian Cyber Security Centre’s (ACSCs) Information Security Manual (ISM), particularly the Essential 8 Mitigation Strategies Experience working on Cyber Security (preferred) projects and in program management in multi IT vendor arrangements Strong business stakeholder experience, particularly with cyber security, risk and compliance Exceptional communication skills, both written and verbal Confident presentation skills to peers and senior management  How to apply:    To apply, click the Apply Now button and send your up-to-date resume, for a confidential discussion call us now on 1300 111 365.    Applications received after submission may be considered for similar roles.    If this job isn't quite right for you but you are looking for a new position, please contact us for a confidential discussion on your career.    Reference: 1254796

Name: Security Technology Adviser
Description: Company description:Queensland Rail's purpose is to provide a customer-focused, safe, reliable, on-time, value for money rail service that benefits the community, supports industry and is integrated with the public transport system. The organisation's vision is connecting communities through a modern, world-class rail service.Job description:Our Security Infrastructure and Compliance team plays a critical role in ensuring the security and protection of QR's customers, employees and assets by providing strategic and operational advice on electronic security system requirements. The team now has a rare opportunity for an experienced Security Technology Adviser to join them. The primary purpose of this varied role is to provide strategic and operational technology advice on the electronic security systems options to support the ongoing security of our rail network and for numerous different projects. This will involve amongst other things, researching a range of potential technology options, engaging vendors to conduct trials, assessing trial outcomes and providing advice on suitability. This entails liaising with a range of internal and external stakeholders to provide advice and written reports, so a combination of security systems knowledge and excellent communication skills is vital. Key responsibilities include:•    Provide expert advice and assistance to security team members and business leaders in relation to technical and operational issues associated with electronic security systems•    Research, analyse and recommend security system developments and products in order to mitigate identified security risks•    Monitor operational and technical performance and integrity of electronic security systems and proactively recommend designs and submissions for future upgrades•    Consider legislative, organisational and contractual obligations in the development of security technology related plans and procedures Key requirements include:•    Sound technical knowledge of electronic security systems including protective security, access control, CCTV, perimeter detection and radar (essential)•    Sound understanding of security risk management and how it applies to mass passenger transport.•    Excellent written and spoken communication and relationship management skills•    Innovative and proactive approach to protective security•    High levels of initiative and ability to work autonomously•    Solid analytical and problem solving skills If you would like to couple your electronic security systems knowledge with your communication skills to make a contribution to our network, we would love to hear from you. Position Description Contract type: Permanent, full timeSalary range: $113,638 + superIn addition to an attractive superannuation scheme, Queensland Rail also offers free train travel to and from work on duty days and a healthy work/ life balance. The recruitment and selection process for this position will require the successful candidate to satisfactorily undertake a National Police Check, NHS Category 3 Health Assessment and an alcohol and other drug screen. Please apply by clicking onto the "Apply" button by 11:59pm (GMT+10:00 Brisbane) Wednesday 13th July. IMPORTANT INFORMATION FOR CURRENT QUEENSLAND RAIL EMPLOYEES:You must apply for vacancies via the internal People Connect solution - Click here  for more informationExternal applicants applying for roles within Queensland Rail will be subject to Alcohol and Other Drugs pre-employment testing. The recruitment and selection process for this position might require shortlisted applicants to undertake psychometric assessment, pre-employment health assessment and background checks that might also include criminal history and credit checks.  Queensland Rail embraces diversity and equal opportunity in a serious way.  We have built the foundation for diversity in the areas of gender balance, First Nations Peoples, Youth, Disability and Multiculturalism. We continue to establish and integrate key programs such as QRWomen, Graduate and Apprentice Programs, Work and Welcome, Returned to Work processes, Employee Assistance Program, as well as Queensland Rail First Nations and LGBTIQ+ Staff Reference Groups.To learn more about this Queensland Rail career opportunity please contact the team with your specific enquiry on 1800 115 000 or email qrcareers@qr.com.au.  Please do not email your application. We can only accept applications received via our website.

Name: Cybersecurity Business Analyst
Advertiser: Talent – SEEK Recruitment Agency of the Year | 7 Time Winner
Description: Company   Australian flat product steel producer with resources coming in from New Zealand, Pacific Islands, North America, and Asia.   Requirements4  years as a Business Analyst, including practical experience working with Cyber Security projects and stakeholders.Strong knowledge of Cybersecurity best practice and industry recognised standards from a business, technical and operational perspective – NIST Framework.Experience and knowledge across IT Security disciplines.Strong background in facilitating project inception and requirements workshops with multiple stakeholders.Vendor and stakeholder management experience with the ability to empathise with customer situations, working towards building and maintaining effective relationships.Excellent communication, business engagement and collaboration skills and experience.Proven analytical skills, including a thorough understanding of how to interpret customer business needs and translate them into application and operational requirements.Interested? Push the "APPLY NOW" button or alternatively email your best CV to wes.elsayed@talentinternational.com

Name: IT Change & Communications Analyst
Description:
Campus Location: North Sydney, Australia | Brisbane, Australia | Melbourne, Australia
Job No: APTAV116066#004

Join a University ranked in the top 2% worldwide and bring your change expertise to a significant cyber security project
Full time, fixed term role (8 months) based at the North Sydney, Brisbane or Melbourne campus

About ACU:
Australian Catholic University (ACU) is an inclusive community which welcomes students and staff of all beliefs. ACU has over 2,500 staff supporting more than 34,000 students across eight campuses - Ballarat, Brisbane, Canberra, Melbourne, North Sydney, Strathfield, Blacktown and Rome. As valued members of our community, all staff members are expected to have an understanding of ACU's mission and values and to demonstrate an active contribution to them.
About Information Technology:
Operating within ACU's Corporate Services Portfolio, Information Technology Directorate is a strategic partner in delivering technology enabled change and excellent IT services to support learning, teaching, research and business functions across ACU. The Directorate is led by the Chief Information Officer (CIO) and three Associate Directors; comprising of: Innovation & Transformation, Enterprise Services, and Client Services.
About the role:
Bring your significant change management and communications expertise to this role to increase the success of key IT projects at ACU, which include but not limited to: a high impact Cyber Security Project (Multi-Factor Authentication for Students). More specifically the role entails:

Change and communications strategy for projects
Developing project communications materials
Collaborating with project teams on change and communication best practices
Managing relationships with project senior stakeholders
Problem-solving and designing interventions to facilitate change
Reporting and data metrics.

You will need to have:

Significant experience working in a change management capacity with complex, organisation-wide projects, including assessing change impact, and designing and executing effective change management plans to mitigate risk.
Experience and skills in designing and creating effective communications materials and tailored strategies for different stakeholders.
Highly effective stakeholder management skills including at senior levels of the organisation.
Ability to work independently under limited supervision while maintaining close partnership with project manager and IT Change Manager.
Creative and insightful approach to change management, able to demonstrate out-of-the-box thinking and identify opportunities to further deliver project outcomes.
Demonstrated ability to lead change by displaying openness and resilience, inspiring others to change and acting to make change happen.
Exposure to Prosci framework advantageous but not required.

What we Offer:

The University pursues an excellence agenda and offers an environment where staff are welcomed and safe, and valued through development, participation and involvement.
A competitive remuneration package (HEW 8 classification).
17% employer superannuation contributions to eligible continuing and fixed-term staff (we provide choice of fund in accordance with relevant legislation, with the University’s nominated default superannuation provider as UniSuper).
Annual leave loading of an equivalent to 17.5% of four weeks’ salary pro rata payable, dependent on your commencement date.
As an ACU staff member, you will have access to generous working conditions and benefits which include but not limited to: Staff Rewards; Flexible Working Arrangements; a variety of leave provisions (recreation, personal, parental, compassionate etc); and salary packaging.

How to Apply:
Obtain the Position Description from the website. Applicants are expected to address all selection criteria listed in the position description and outline how they would support the mission of the university. To apply for this role click the 'View Position Description and Apply' buttons above or below. Visit Hints and Tips on how to apply.
General enquiries can be sent to Rebecca Newton, IT Change Manager, Information Technology at: Rebecca.Newton@acu.edu.au
Candidates must hold Australian work rights to apply for this position. For permanent/ continuing roles, applicants must have permanent work rights.
Equal Opportunity and Privacy of personal information is University policy. For more details visit: www.acu.edu.au/careers
Find out more information on the benefits of working at ACU at: www.acu.edu.au/about-acu/careers-at-acu/why-work-at-acu
ACU is committed to diversity and social inclusion in its employment practices. Applications from Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people, people with disabilities and people from culturally diverse groups are encouraged.
Previous applicants need not re-apply
Advertised: 21-JUN-2022
Applications close: 05-JUL-2022 at 11:59pm AUS Eastern Standard Time

Name: Security Business Analyst | ISM Compliance
Description: Summary:  6 month contract opportunity for an experienced Security Business analyst with ISM experience with experience working with in an enterprise environment.  Bullet Points:  Daily Rate: $950-$1000 | Duration: 6 months with possibility of extension. Location: Australia Wide | ASAP Start | Must have Australian work rights Remote / WFH opportunity with flexibility  About the company:  We have partners with a national retail organization specializing in logistics to assist in their search for a Security Business Analyst to join their team on an initial 6-month contract.  About the role: The Security Business Analyst will be responsible for the ISM (Information Security Manual) compliance, working with delivery teams to ensure and remediation work required for ISM compliance is define and prioritised. The Security BA will also be responsible for championing the business security assessment and data protection governance (DPG) processes and assist the delivery teams with any queries and challenges that may arise.    Responsibilities:   Support the Program in assessing the solution for ISM (Information Security Manual) / IRAP compliance in collaboration with the internal compliance teams. Sourcing artefacts from internal project. E.g., Artefacts that can be used as evidence to support or verify the ISM security control. Verify that the artefacts are current and if not then determine what needs to be done to reach currency. Drive the importance of ISM into Delivery Leads and Teams. Where ISM gaps exist, highlight to Delivery Teams how the gaps need to be addressed.  About you: To be successful in this role you should have experience in a similar role within an enterprise environment. You should have experience in the following areas:  Experience leading and overseeing the implementation of ISM security protocols Experience sourcing artefacts to verify ISM security protocols have been met Experience managing teams and ensuring all teams are adhering to ISM outlines Ensuring all teams are compliant with ISM and push back when necessary  How to Apply This role is being managed by Kathryn Dickinson. For more information, please contact Kathryn directly on 0479109549 or to apply please send your CV to kdickinson@launchrecruitment.com.au  Launch Recruitment Launch Recruitment is a candidate-focused, IT recruitment company that listens, cares and is driven to make a long-term positive impact on your career and life. Our deep knowledge of the Australian IT landscape and our long-term relationships with strong and innovative companies mean your goals and abilities can be perfectly aligned to the best positions sought out, just for you.

Name: Security Vetting Analysts – Level 6
Description: ASIS is Australia’s overseas secret intelligence collection agency. Its mission is to protect and promote Australia’s vital interests through the provision of intelligence services as directed by the Government. Its work can involve collecting intelligence in relation to national security, international relations and economic issues. It also contributes to Australia’s coordinated national efforts against terrorism, proliferation of weapons of mass destruction, and transnational issues such as people smuggling.Security Vetting Analysts make assessments and recommendations about an individual’s suitability to hold a Positive Vetting security clearance in accordance with minimum standards set by the Protective Security Policy Framework (PSPF), and other policies and guidelines.Outlined below are the key areas of responsibility for the Security Vetting Analysts: - Manage, to completion, the vetting security clearance process for allocated cases within specified benchmark timeframes;- Research, organise and conduct interviews;- Perform detailed analysis and assessment and make recommendations in high level written report form;- Develop and maintain effective relationships with key internal and external stakeholders;- Contribute to shared knowledge with personnel security and vetting groups;- Undertake interstate travel as required.The position has conditions of service similar to those in the Australian Public Service, including superannuation.Citizenship: To be eligible for engagement, applicants must be Australian citizens.Security Assessment: The successful applicant will be required to undergo and maintain a high level Security Clearance.Please Note: ASIS does not provide feedback to unsuccessful applicants.To apply go to asis.gov.auAll applications for employment with ASIS are handled in the strictest confidence.  It is essential that you maintain a similar level of confidentiality and that you not discuss your application with others.Applications close Monday 18 July 2022.

Name: Cyber Assessor / Writer (NV1+)
Description: Are you an up-and-coming Cybersecurity Assessor  / Analyst / Technical Writer with strong documentation skills?Do you have the drive and ambition to succeed in conducting pre-IRAP assessments for a mission-critical Defence program?THE OPPORTUNITYOur client is a Big 4 Consulting Firm engaged in the delivery of a key program for Defence - and has a requirement for an experienced Cybersecurity Assessor / Technical Writer.RESPONSIBILITIESIn this role, you'll be responsible for performing pre-IRAP-based Security Assessments and ICT Systems Accreditation documentation for a key Defence Program. MUST HAVEMinimum NV1 Australian Defence Clearance (ESSENTIAL)5 years of ICT experience in large-scale programsSound understanding of Cyber Security principles & architecturesFamiliarity with Defence Security FrameworkDemonstrable experience in documentation and compliance assessmentsExcellent written & verbal communication skillsKeen and willing attitudeSuit ex-ADFThis is an exciting and challenging Career Milestone opportunity, with great potential for learning and development.If you're interested and would like to find out more, feel free to contact Stan Relihan on 02 6172 0081 for a confidential discussion.Alternatively, you can submit your details by clicking the 'Apply Now' button below.NOTE: Due to the security requirements of this role, ONLY Australian Citizens holding a valid NV1 (or higher level) Australian Defence Security Clearance can be considered. NO EXCEPTIONS
