Name: Cybersecurity Lead
Description: Company description:IOOF Holdings Limited is an Australian financial services company which offers a range of products and services including financial advice, superannuation, investment management and trustee servicesJob description:Cybersecurity Lead  Lead, Manage and Support a team of cybersecurity professionals through next-phase objectives Hybrid Working Opportunity (WFH + Office) Play a key role in the future of work framework across IOOF  IOOF is one of Australia's leading Wealth Management organisations, undertaking a rapid and exciting transformation. We are a strong and resilient business and despite the current climate, are investing in supporting our people to onboard and connect them remotely. It is in this context that we are looking for experienced Cybersecurity Lead. The RoleThe role will support our Advice division, IOOF's AFSLs and IOOF's subsidiary businesses, in creating awareness, knowledge and understanding of the requirements to protect against cyber threats and meet their obligations as set out in the Cyber Security Standard and other supporting materials. Key Responsibilities: Play a key role in developing the in-house approach to Cyber assessments and implementing across the Advice businesses and subsidiaries Assess existing applications, technologies and solutions that store or contain client sensitive data Review, validate and confirm required actions/ follow up actions to be taken by a practice to increase cyber resilience Supporting the AFSL and their practices with any potential cyber related attacks or incidents Assess new practice cyber resilience prior to appointment to one of our AFSL Assist in the development and implementation of cyber security initiatives, plans, practices & procedures and incident response & analysis Responsible for ensuring the content on the Licensee Intranets under Cyber Resilience remain current and up to date Co-ordinate and/or provide the necessary internal staff training on Cyber best practice (Licensee RBMs, PCs etc)  To Be Successful in This Role You Will Possess: Formal qualifications and/or Certifications in cyber security (eg. CISSP, CSX Cybersecurity fundamentals, CISM, CRISC, SANS certifications, ISO27001 practitioner etc) Knowledge of Risk management fundamentals Information security implementation experience with a strong knowledge and understanding of cybersecurity standards such as NIST, ISO27001 etc.  Benefits In return, we offer development opportunities at an ASX top 200 company A professional, supportive and friendly culture A range of corporate and lifestyle benefits  The BusinessIOOF is one of Australia's leading wealth management organisations, undertaking a rapid and exciting transformation. The IOOF group has been helping Australians secure their future since 1846. During that time, we have grown substantially to become a leading provider of quality financial services. We now manage and administer more than $200 billion of client monies and are listed on the Australian Securities Exchange in the ASX top 200 (ASX:IFL). To ApplyPlease submit your resume with a covering letter by clicking on "Apply Now". Applicants will be required to provide evidence of their eligibility to work in Australia, and at a minimum be required to undertake police and basic credit checks as a condition of employment. Please note that applications from agencies will not be considered at this time. IOOF is an inclusive and equal opportunity employer. We encourage applications regardless of race, ethnicity, age, religion, gender, national origin, disability status, or any other characteristic protected by law. If you need assistance or an adjustment during the application process because of a disability, it is available upon request. Given IOOF is currently undergoing an Organisational Design process, please be aware that it is anticipated that organisational change will occur.

Name: Cyber Security Architect
Advertiser: Talent – SEEK Recruitment Agency of the Year | 7 Time Winner
Description: A leading Financial Services provider is seeking a Cyber Security Architect to come on board and assist in the delivery of a critical program for an initial three month contract. Joining an in-flight Open Banking program, the successful candidate will be responsible for utilising their strong cyber security architecture experience to assist in defining and designing modern authentication / tokenisation / cryptography for API gateways. This is an urgent requirement with candidates available to commence immediately highly desirable.To be successful in this role you will need:Tertiary qualifications and/or relevant industry certifications (i.e. CISSP)Strong experience working as a Cyber Security Architect within large complex environments (preferably Financial Services)Previous experience working on Open Banking / CDR programs is highly regardedDemonstrated experience designing solutions for cloud platforms (AWS preferred)Good understanding of information security / architecture / risk frameworks such as SABSA, NIST 800-53 and/or TOGAFProven knowledge and experience with modern authentication / tokenisation / cryptography / OpenID ConnectStrong stakeholder engagement skills, with a proven ability to negotiate and influenceExcellent verbal and written communication skillsAn attractive daily rate is on offer for the right candidate. To be considered for this exciting opportunity, please apply online now!

Name: Intelligence Analyst
Description: This role supports this mission through the operation of our Security Operations Centre (SOC). The SOC operates on a 24/7/365 basis and acts as a central command and information hub built on actionable intelligence. It monitors, detects, and analyses local and global risks, with a particular focus on client needs. The team is also responsible for crisis management, acting as the first point of contact for clients and staff in emergency response scenarios.We are looking for an Intelligence Analyst to support our business, operations, SOC and clients. The role requires the multi-tasking of client-facing service provision, intelligence and investigative demands, threat detection, analysis, alert-issuing (local and global) and crisis management. The Intelligence Analyst will monitor a wide range of sources including technical platforms, OSINT, underground forums, social media, and dark and deep web data to identify and investigate threats. The findings of these investigations will be captured and disseminated in intelligence products. The Intelligence Analyst will also liaise with stakeholders in order to conduct operational planning and to fulfil client security needs.What you’ll do:The Intelligence Analyst will be responsible for:Responding to client requests and distributing them to the relevant internal teams.Monitoring, tracking, and analysing imminent threats domestically and internationally and alerting stakeholders on rapidly developing situations. Implementing crisis management processes when needed.Producing risk assessments and updates on global and local risks. Investigating and analysing profiles to determine potential fixations on clients, sentiment, capabilities, and criminal intent.Maintaining a deep understanding of threat actor groups, campaigns and tactics, techniques, and procedures.What we’re looking for:Passionate and self-motivated and can effectively prioritise, manage deadlines and understand new ideas and concepts.Keen interest in threat analysis.Tertiary qualification in International Relations, Law, Political Science, Global Security Studies, National Security, and/or related area.Knowledge in Open Source Intelligence (OSINT).Good understanding and expertise in local and global safety and security threat landscape.Strong interpersonal skills, including accuracy in information relay.High-level written and verbal communication skills.High proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite.Demonstrated ability to work in a team and alone.Adaptable, flexible, and well organized.Ability to perform well in a dynamic environment.The Intelligence Analyst will work on a roster covering 24/7/365. Regular night shifts are required for this role.

Name: Security Architecture Lead
Description: About Us:We’re known for being the country’s most popular rewards program, making the everyday worth more for millions of Aussies. But 27+ years' of success and growth doesn’t happen by keeping up the status quo.All the things that make working at Flybuys different as usual – these aren't just values we talk about. They’re built into everything we do, every day. We are a truly flexible and digital first workplace and we help you fit work and life around one another, whether we are talking about the work location, device of choice or working times.Your Team:Our amazing Security Team have put in a lot of work over the past couple of years to lay the foundations for further growth. With several newly created positions recently added, we've more than doubled the team this year already!But we're not looking for more of the same. Our day-to-day is made stronger when we surround ourselves with people who are different, like you.We work really hard to build teams that support each other, collaborate together and provide you with the chance to really spread your wings.We’re making a big investment in security. This is your chance to join an expanding team, be part of an exciting journey where we will be bringing on new security technologies in a 100% cloud environment, and influence the direction of the Security team overall.Your Role:This newly created permanent role will give you the chance to build a capability and leave a legacy with a team that has been carefully set up for success.Do you enjoy mentoring? You're direct reports are highly skilled in what they do, so supporting and advocating for what they need to achieve goals is key. We're also keen to add and develop more junior team members as we continue to expand.There is no typical working week at Flybuys. But here are some of the things you might be working on, day-to-day;Lead the development and implementation of secure design patterns and architectures that are aligned to Flybuys security policies, standards, and regulatory requirements.Manage a team of technical experts delivering services to our partner business units.Assess and understand the current security architecture landscape.Provide input into the roadmaps that achieve the targeted state.Partnering across the business to provide security consulting services.Integrate with security team's other key programs: Application Security, Governance Risk & Compliance, Operations, Privacy, Security Culture & Awareness, Program Delivery.Continuous improvement of our security services providers as required.Your Ideal Skills & Experience:Demonstrated experience building a security capability (not just operating within the confines of an existing one)Experience leading, managing and developing a high performing team.Able to work with and communicate with technical teams, business management and non-technical stakeholders.A deep knowledge of security risk management, technologies, attack techniques and defences.A proven background in architecting, designing, and building security solutions for business and technology initiatives.Familiarity with threat modelling, MITRE ATT&CK/D3FEND, NIST CSF, and ISO27001 and related methodologies or frameworks.The ability to negotiate and affect change through influence in a complex organisation.Ability to coordinate across multiple activity streams, delivering impactful results in line with objectives of the security program.We value ways of working that work for everyone, and use our different strengths to make us stronger. We work hard to make sure everyone’s voice is heard and respected equally, regardless of identity, background, position, ability or lifestyle.So whether you’re an earlybird list maker, a night owl coder, a brainstorm chaser or a PowerPoint proof-reader, we want you to Be You, With Us. To ensure the safety and wellbeing of our employees and the community in which we operate, Flybuys (Loyalty Pacific) has introduced a Vaccination Policy which requires all persons entering a Flybuys (Loyalty Pacific) workplace, attending a Flybuys (Loyalty Pacific) work-related event, or entering other premises to undertake work on Flybuys (Loyalty Pacific)’s behalf to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 or to hold a valid exemption (and to provide evidence of the same).It is also a condition of employment that successful applicants provide evidence of compliance with Flybuys (Loyalty Pacific) Vaccination Policy and to undergo a National Police Check prior to commencing.

Name: Information Security Consultant
Description:
Believer in basics? Protect, Detect and Respond...
 
A company with mastery in achievement, believing that they must inspire a commitment to security rather than merely describing it, is on the hunt for a Security Consultant - Cyber Services.
 
As a Security Consultant in the Cyber division, this role will require you to undertake security architecture and consulting support across a broad range of client engagements. You will collaborate with Cyber’s Assurance and Managed Services teams to develop creative and innovative security solutions.
 
Must-haves…
 

3+ years as a security consultant / security architect (or equivalent)
Experience in Financial Services, Public Sector and Medium to Large enterprises
Relevant security certifications such as CISSP, CISA, CISM, SABSA, GIAC
Experience in security assessments
Provision of security guidance, advice and input into both Agile and Waterfall style projects
Experience in a range of consulting and architecture activities throughout the life of application and infrastructure development projects

 
Note: The role is restricted to Australian Citizens or Permanent Residents only
 
Sweet perks…
 

Public holiday swaps to support family responsibilities and diversity with religious holidays
Parental, caregiver leave policies and flexible working
Organisation-wide mentoring program, and an emerging leader’s development program
3 x paid volunteer days, novated leasing, and employee discounts
Access to our wellbeing platform providing exercise programs

 
 "A cyber security renaissance that promotes cyber hygiene and a security centric corporate culture!” – J.Scott
 
Would you be able to make this happen? Then apply for this role or for more information, call Hannah on 0416 494 105 or email hannah@theonset.com.au.

Name: Research Associate in Cyber Security
Description:
UNSW Canberra is a campus of the University of New South Wales located at the Australian Defence Force Academy in Canberra. UNSW Canberra endeavours to offer staff a rewarding experience and offers many opportunities and attractive benefits, including:

     One of Australia’s leading research and teaching universities
     Strong commitment to staff development and learning
     Strong commitment to work life and family balance
     Generous superannuation opportunities

At UNSW, we pride ourselves on being a workplace where the best people come to do their best work.
The School of Engineering and Information Technology (SEIT) offers a flexible, friendly working environment that is well-resourced and delivers research-informed education as part of its accredited, globally recognised engineering and computing degrees to its undergraduate students. The School offers programs in cyber security, computer science, information technology and electrical, mechanical, aeronautical, and civil engineering as well as aviation, to graduates and professionals who will be Australia’s future technology decision-makers.
This research position will develop novel cyber risk assessment methods using machine/deep learning algorithms in the internet of things and combat systems. The successful applicant will pursue method development, implementation and evaluation in various internet of things-based combat testbeds.
About the Role:
Role:                                Research Associate in Cyber SecuritySalary:                             Academic Level A $99,325 - $106, 237 plus 17% Superannuation        Positions:                        2 x Full time 35hrs per weekEmployment type:          Fixed Term appointment for 2 yearsEligibility:                       Ability to obtain and maintain a baseline security clearance
About the Successful Applicants
To be successful in this role you will:              

Hold a PhD (or close to completion) in cyber security, computer science, information technology, engineering or a relevant area/ discipline that complements the breadth of expertise of the School.
Proven ability to conduct high-quality research, development of Internet of Things security, cyber risk assessment, and machine/deep learning applied to cyber security.
Demonstrated knowledge of and experience with high-level programming languages such as Python, R, C, C++.
A demonstrated ability to conduct innovative and independent research.
A record of papers in high quality journals and/or conferences of high ranking in the field.
Ability to conduct high quality teaching in a university environment and willingness to undertake teaching duties as required.
Excellent interpersonal, oral, and written communication skills appropriate for interacting effectively team members, collaborators, and colleagues across the faculty.
Demonstrated ability to work as a member of a multidisciplinary team showing initiative and taking direction as appropriate to the situation.
Demonstrated ability to complete tasks within agreed time frames, with suitable supervision.
Has Knowledge of health and safety responsibilities and the ability and capacity to implement required UNSW health and safety policies and procedures.

In your application, please upload a 2-page pitch addressing the Skills and Experience outlined in the Position Description. In order to view the Position Description – please ensure that you allow pop-ups for Jobs@UNSW Portal.
Eligibility:
The position is located in Canberra, ACT. The successful candidate will be required to work from the UNSW Canberra campus. 
To be successful you will hold Australian Citizenship. Visa sponsorship is not available for this appointment.
The successful candidate will need to have the ability to obtain and maintain a minimum baseline security clearance.
The successful candidate will be required to undertake pre-employment checks prior to commencement in this role. The checks that will be undertaken are listed in the Position Description. You will not be required to provide any further documentation or information regarding the checks until directly requested by UNSW.
For further information about UNSW Canberra, please visit our website: UNSW Canberra
Contact:Dr Nour Moustafa, Senior LecturerE:  nour.moustafa@unsw.edu.au P: 0416817811
Applications Close: Sunday, 17 July 2022 11:30pm AEST
Find out more about working at UNSW Canberra
At UNSW Canberra, we celebrate diversity and understand the benefits that inclusion brings to the university. We aim to ensure that our culture, policies, and processes are truly inclusive. We are committed to developing and maintaining a workplace where everyone is valued and respected for who they are and supported in achieving their professional goals. We welcome applications from Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people, Women at all levels, Culturally and Linguistically Diverse People, People with Disability, LGBTIQ+ People, people with family and caring responsibilities and people at all stages of their careers. We encourage everyone who meets the selection criteria and shares our commitment to inclusion to apply.
       Any questions about the application process - please email unswcanberra.recruitment@adfa.edu.au

Name: DevSecOps Engineer, x15ventures
Description: A little about x15ventures  x15ventures is building the next generation of solutions for 15 million customers, by unlocking new value from CommBank's assets through partnership with the tech and innovation community. Backed by CommBank, we operate within a dynamic start-up like environment, leveraging the best of both worlds. Our approach is flexible and agile enabling us to deliver disruptive ideas at pace.  Where do you fit?  We are looking for an experienced DevSecOps Engineer to support the x15ventures business and catch security vulnerabilities before they make it into a software build. The DevSecOps Engineer will implement a shift left approach to cyber security assurance for x15 and its ventures. In this role you will report to the x15 Head of Security. You will contribute significantly to the cyber security program for x15 and all its ventures and be responsible for key security deliverables across our portfolio as we grow and innovate.  Why x15ventures? We offer flexible work options to support your well-being in the roleThe opportunity to grow and evolve an exciting purpose driven venture and have a positive impact on customers and the wider communityWe believe family comes first and pay generous equal parental leave - understanding there's more to life than workWe celebrate an authentic team culture and promote collaboration and innovationYou can choose your own adventure, with amazing development and career progression programs to help you grow!We support hybrid working and have a beautiful base at South Eveleigh - a brand new state-of-the-art precinct that is part of Sydney's wider technology community.In this role you will Implement a software composition analysis (SCA) solution across a heterogenous code environment based on GitHub.Use static analysis tools and code review to identify vulnerabilities.Implement a security training program based on Secure Code Warrior.Promote a culture of security within venture technology teams.Improve the SDLC by integrating security into the design and architecture of our technology stack.Triage and assist with development and testing of patches for findings from penetration tests, red team exercises, and bug bounty programs.We are interested to hear from people who have experience in Experience in a DevSecOps Engineer role and experience working on cyber security programsTertiary qualifications in a relevant field would be highly regardedSubject matter expertise in secure coding, software composition analysis, code review, and SDLCExperience with the .NET framework, Javascript/Typescript, GitHub, and Snyk would an advantageExperience with iOS and Android mobile app development would be an advantageExcellent communication and interpersonal skills to collaborate and influence a diverse range of stakeholdersAbility to solve problems and deal with ambiguity (no precedent or policy - yet); manage difficult issues while keeping an eye to the futureStrong knowledge of industry standards and exposure to the FSI regulatory environment would be an advantageThe health and safety of our people, customers and communities is our number one priority. This means that we require all of our employees to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19. Please speak to us if you have any questions about this based on your individual circumstances. Whether you're passionate about customer service, driven by data, or called by creativity, a career here is for you. Our people bring their diverse backgrounds and unique perspectives to build a respectful, inclusive and flexible workplace. One where we're driven by our values, and supported to share ideas, initiatives, and energy. One where making a positive impact for customers, communities and each other is part of our every day.Here, you'll thrive. You'll be supported when faced with challenges, and empowered to tackle new opportunities. We really love working here, and we think you will too.We're determined to make a real difference for Australia's first peoples. We encourage all interested applicants to apply. If you're already part of the Commonwealth Bank Group (including Bankwest), you'll need to apply through Sidekick [link removed] to submit a valid application. We're keen to support you with the next step in your career.

Name: Head of MDR
Description: About the company One of Australia's leading MSSP companiesVery strong technical capability within the team and organisationCulture of training and developmentAbout the role  This role is responsible for running the growing team of SOC analysts, currently 12 but constantly growing. You will have direct reports of 3 - the Principal or Senior Analyst from each pod and split your time between technical escalations, team management, service improvements and training.  They run a multi vendor environment so they are less concerned about your specific tool experience, much more interested in how you solve problems.  If you are looking to step up from a lead or Principal Analyst role into a head of role, this could be a great opportunity to do that.  Culture / Benefits Very flat structure, very much an environment where you can make a differenceNo micro-management, you will be given enough rope so to speakIndustry leading investment in training courses and certificationsHybrid working environment with some client facing workSydney or Melbourne location preferredDuties Leadership of a team of 10-15 SOC analystsAct as technical escalation pointClient facing engagement and interactionService improvement and likely input into future tech choices and directionSkills and experience Previous experience in a hands-on security analyst roleLeadership experience of a SOC teamExperience with enterprise environments - this could be in MSSP or internal rolesBroad exposure to security tools and technologiesIndustry certifications are a nice to have but not a requirementAustralian PR or Citizen

Name: Security Engineer, Detection
Description: At Google, we have a vision of empowerment and equitable opportunity for all Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples and commit to building reconciliation through Google’s technology, platforms and people and we welcome Indigenous applicants. Please see our Reconciliation Action Plan for more information.Minimum qualifications:Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience.Experience in coding and scripting using Java, Python, Go, C, C++, or similar.Preferred qualifications:Experience analyzing the security of systems (pen testing, Web Application security testing, vulnerability scanning, threat modeling, etc.).Experience responding to security issues, looking at security alerts, front-line analysis and response.Experience working with malware analysis, including investigations of botnet and rootkit behavior.Expertise with signals development and threat hunting/modeling.Expertise in leading analysis of large data sets and intrusion detection systems.About the jobOur Security team works to create and maintain the safest operating environment for Google's users and developers. Security Engineers work with network equipment and actively monitor our systems for attacks and intrusions. In this role, you will also work with software engineers to proactively identify and fix security flaws and vulnerabilities.The Detection team develops and maintains the signals, tools and infrastructure that we use. As part of this team, you'll build advanced and novel detection mechanisms, develop systems to automate remediation, conduct threat hunting, and perform network and systems forensics as well as malware and indicator analysis. You'll be responsible for managing all malicious activity on Google's networks. We perform deep analysis of threats on our corporate, production, and acquisition environments.At Google, our users come first, and the Systems Infrastructure team is at the heart of that promise. We build the technologies that transform the way we think about doing business. Whether working on our cloud systems, researching the latest in computer technology or keeping Google's internal systems humming, Googlers and users alike rely on us to keep things running. We're back-end experts: protecting your privacy and ensuring your security.ResponsibilitiesParticipate in a 24/7 global operation that identifies and responds to security events on Google networks.Perform investigations on a wide variety of events from various sources to determine whether they pose a threat.Participate in resolving large-scale security incidents.Work with teams from around Google to discover new detection capabilities and logging sources.Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form.To all recruitment agencies: Google does not accept agency resumes. Please do not forward resumes to our jobs alias, Google employees or any other organization location. Google is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.To learn more about US requirements around COVID vaccination requirements for Google workspaces, read our Vaccination Entry Policy.

Name: Digital Skills Cadetship Program
Description: Kickstart your career in IT - APPLY NOW for the Digital Skills Cadetship Program !!!  The Digital Skills Cadetship Program is your gateway to an exciting career in the information technology sector. This is an amazing opportunity funded by the Department of Education, Skills and Employment supporting innovative pathways to careers in Cyber Security, Data Analytics and Cloud-based computing.  This 12-week program is specifically designed for women who are: Returning to the workforce from an extended breakFrom an under-represented group, such as newly arrived migrants, refugees, Aboriginal and/or Torres Strait Islander people, and the culturally and linguistically diverseTransitioning from underemployed industries affected by COVID-19, and other circumstancesSimply looking towards a new careerYou don't need to have any pre-existing IT experience to participate**This role is a special measure under Section 7D of the Sex Discrimination Act 1984 (Cth) intended to increase the percentage of women in the digital skills industry.**  Benefits of becoming a Cadet: Working towards Microsoft credentialsObtaining specialised micro-credentials in cyber security, data analytics or cloud-based computingGaining access to industry-led mentoring and support servicesBeing paid, full-time employment for the duration of the CadetshipYour participation may lead to further employment in IT, or related learning or training, depending on your situation.There may even be an opportunity for you to continue working for your Employer as a permanent team member at the completion of your Cadetship.Working with MEGT, our partners and leading Registered Training Organisations, you'll gain valuable on-the-job experience, while learning and working towards the below qualifications in cyber security:  Micro-credentials: Introduction to Cyber Security, Contribute to cyber security threat assessments, Cyber breach simulation, cyber crisis management.  Microsoft Certification: Microsoft Office Specialist- Word, Excel and PowerPoint and Security compliance and identity fundamentals.  Interested?  Hit APPLY NOW! OR for any further questions, please contact 134 767 to speak with our Digital Skills Cadetship Recruitment team.  By submitting your application, you are providing your consent for your personal information to be shared with the partners involved in the Digital Skills Cadetship Program.  MEGT (Australia) Ltd is a Child Safe and Equal Opportunity employer committed to child safety and providing a work environment that values diversity and inclusion.  *Employers may require that you provide proof of your vaccination status as a condition of employment*

Name: Communications + Change Manager (Cyber)
Description: Communication + Change Manager (Cyber Awareness)Permanent$180,000 packageEntertainment industrySydney (WFH + Office) The official title is Cyber Resilience Awareness and Change Manager, where you will be responsible for the effective delivery of cyber awareness services to our well-known client. You will work towards delivering engaging and relatable cyber content to audiences across the group and develop new initiatives to improve our cyber resilience. Please note, the technical information will be given to you - the main essence of this role is the communications.No two days will be the same in this dynamic role, however your key responsibilities will involve:Designing and delivering the cyber awareness and change planCreating the communication strategyDefining the audience profiles and identify the most successful approach to delivering learning content through a wide range of mediumsCreating meaningful dialogue with the business to raise awareness on cyber security and work on projects and initiatives to drive thisServe as a trusted advisor that can clearly articulate our client's security policies, standards, and guidelinesTheir benefitsDiscounts across award winning restaurants and accommodationDiversity & Inclusion areas of focus include Multicultural, Gender, Aboriginal & Torres Strait islander and LGBTQI+Both parental and secondary carers leave available to all employeesLifestyle discounts including gym memberships and laundry servicesFREE buffet meal with a new menu every day$10 staff parking every day including weekends and late nightsCareer development, training, and courses via The AcademyThey are an Employer of Choice for Gender Diversity awarded by WGEATo be successful in this role you will have:Demonstrated experience in delivering communications, training and learning content (preferably in cyber security but not mandatory)Proven experience with preparing and delivering engaging presentations for any audienceA strong passion and interest in the cyber security space (industry experience is preferred)Confident in working with relevant stakeholders, building those relationships and ensuring you've got all the information for the communicationsAbout usOur client's vision is to be Australia’s leading integrated resort company. Attracting 18 million guests each year, with properties across Sydney, Brisbane and the Gold Coast are world class tourist destinations that offer visitors a diverse selection of award-winning restaurants, bars, cafes, accommodation, and entertainment options.Our cultureThey are committed to creating a diverse, equitable and inclusive workplace that we know will contribute to exceptional experiences for our guests, a great place to work for our team members and positive outcomes for our communities. We welcome applications from all cultures, ages, religions, genders, LGBTIQ+ people, Australia’s First Nations Peoples, and people with disabilities. We offer a range of flexible working options for team members to find the balance between work and life that’s right for them and their unique wellbeing needs.  APPLY NOW!

Name: Information Security Lead
Description: The Organisation:    FourQuarters Recruitment has been exclusively engaged to recruit for this leading product company with very aggressive growth plans. This organisation has offices in both the US and Australia.   They are happy for this role to be based in either Australia or New Zealand. Fully remote.    They have recently closed series B funding of $70m AUD and have plans to scale their business to 200 seats by the end of 2022.    Their culture operates like a start up, even though they have been around for close to a decade and, as they grow their footprint, their plan is to purchase further businesses and MNA options. The Role:    You will be the first dedicated in-house Security Lead, owning their entire program of work and reporting to senior management.    The business is currently undergoing SOC 2 reporting, so your task will be to continue pushing this forward and evolve the cyber function.     At a high level your responsibilities will include:  Own and drive the information security program of work Threat Modelling exercises to identity risks Drive the discovery and remediation towards ‘shift left’ with developers, infrastructure, cloud teams Develop security policies, communication and drive remediation from start to finish Vendor risk assessments for third party solutions Own security awareness and education program Threat Intelligence Information security controls, compliance and audit etc for their AWS & GCP environment Reporting to senior management  Your profile:  Deep exposure to Information Security and architecture practices Practical understanding of security related technology, trends and threats; A good breath of knowledge around information security industry standards (ideally SOC 2 or ISO 27001K) Practical experience developing security policies, principles, standards and procedures; Demonstrated experience in a progressively responsible security, risk or compliance role Practical experience managing cloud security in AWS or GCP from a GRC perspective  Advantageous  Technical security background Software developer turned security professional Experience working in a software business during heavy growth periods Desirable to possess certifications such as CISM, SABSA, CISSP or CRISC  Remuneration - $160k - $180k+Super (AUD) Apply:    Please submit your CV or for further questions call James Soo (0466 663 363) or send an email to jsoo@fourquarters.com.au

Name: Senior Security Specialist
Description: Senior Security Specialist                                 Permanent Opportunity | Brisbane New opportunity for an experienced Cyber Security Specialist within an Australian industry-leading band. You will be working within an innovative fast-paced team environment that encourages learning and excellence with a highly professional global team. The role involves analyzing, designing, and documenting infrastructure solutions with a security focus.Key Skills:  Demonstrated experience in Cyber Security toolsets and methods to detect, analyze, track, and mitigate vulnerabilities and exposures. Extensive experience in Cyber Security incident response techniques and processes. Cloud experience-Desirable Familiar with security technologies Service Now, SOC, SIEM, SOAR  Company Benefits:  Discounts on health insurance, gym memberships, travel, and retail Free financial services  Company stock options  Career growth programs  Modern office  Flexible working environment   If you have gained experience in the above and are ready for your next project, please forward your updated CV to Pooja Deshmukh at pdeshmukh@attributegroup.com.au, so we can discuss it in more detail.  We can only consider applications with full working rights in Australia.

Name: Kubernetes Platform Engineer - Cyber Security
Description: Our client in the Cyber Security sector are searching for a tenured Kubernetes Platform Engineer to join the team on an initial contract basis for 12 months. Fully remote work, with occasional travel to offices in Canberra required.What's on offer?:Fully remote work flexibility, with requirement to travel occasionallyCompetitive and negotiable day rates availableInitial 12 month contract with opportunity for extensionWhat's required?:Experience with Kubernetes at the infrastructure level, in Designing, Automating, Securing, Updating, Migrating and Maintaining Kubernetes clusters.Experience with Kubernetes distributions that can be utilised in on-premise environments, ideally with kubeadm, K3s or Rancher Kubernetes.Experience securing Kubernetes, including, creating network policies, enforcement of policies via admission controllers, container image scanning.Linux Administration experience (Red Hat Enterprise Linux, Ubuntu or Debian)Sound experience in IaC pipelines and automation utilising continuous integration/delivery toolingExcellent client communication skillsNV1 Clearance RequiredFor more information, or for a private and confidential conversation with our recruitment team, apply today!

Name: Security Assessment Team Lead
Description:
The Banking & Financial Services Security and Fraud Prevention team defends Macquarie’s retail banking and financial services business. The team ensures the confidentiality, integrity and availability of Macquarie’s systems and information.
Join our Cyber Security Services team as Security Assessment Lead where you will be responsible for leading a team of Security Assessors in identifying company-wide technical information security risks, conducting risk assessments, and making recommendations to improve project and organisational security postures.
As part of the Cyber Security Services team you will act in the Security Assessor role whilst leading a team of several Security Assessors.
Key Responsibilities:

Lead and mentor a team of several Security Assessors


Follow existing security assurance processes
Interact with technical development teams to understand the business objectives and technical solution in scope of assessment
Where applicable, work with Security Architects to understand the threat model and control requirements, or where there is no Security Architect engagement, be able to perform some level of threat modelling based on existing security patterns, standards and guidelines to identify areas of concern
Review the implementation of key controls via design and configuration reviews and vulnerability scans (Static/Dynamic Application Security Testing, Software Composition Analysis, Infrastructure vulnerability scans) 
Liaise with security testing teams to help shape testing scope and consume the output of security tests 
Author assessment reports based on Macquarie guidelines

Beneficial experience that you will bring:

5+ years experience in security assessment roles
3+ years security experience in large enterprises, preferably in global financial services
2+ years experience leading small teams
current or previous experience in configuring, operating, and designing security solutions for business and technology initiatives
familiarity with SABSA, NIST 800-53, Open FAIR, MITRE ATT&CK/D3FEND, and related methodologies or frameworks
demonstrable experience working with public cloud (AWS and/or GCP), containers, Kubernetes, web applications, microservices and related technologies
experience with security engineering, infrastructure-as-code, CI/CD, automation, and application development desirable
familiarity working within an Agile environment
demonstrates a sound understanding of vendor technologies and roadmaps, and remains current with key IT industry themes and emerging trends
excellent written and oral communication skills, with ability to communicate effectively about abstract and complex topics to a range of audiences.

To join a high performing Cyber team, apply online now or for more information visit www.macquarie.com/careers [link removed]
About the Banking and Financial Services Group
Banking and Financial Services (BFS) comprises Macquarie’s retail banking and financial services businesses, providing a diverse range of personal banking, wealth management, business banking and vehicle finance products and services to retail clients, advisers, brokers and business clients.
Our commitment to Diversity, Equity and Inclusion 
The diversity of our people is one of our greatest strengths. An inclusive and equitable environment enables us to deliver innovative and sustainable outcomes for our people, clients, shareholders and communities. From day one, you'll be encouraged to be yourself and supported to perform at your best. If our purpose of ‘empowering people to innovate and invest for a better future’ is as inspiring to you as it is to us, please apply. With the right technology, support and resources, our people can work in a range of flexible ways.
We are committed to providing a working environment that embraces and values diversity, equity and inclusion. We encourage candidates to speak with a member of our recruitment team if you require adjustments to our recruitment process to support you, and the type of working arrangements that would help you thrive.

Name: Ping Engineer - 22062022
Description: At Q1, we work with 17 of the ASX top50 and also a number of large global enterprises and consultants. You will be joining one of the big 4 banksExperience:  Promote usage of the Identity and access management platform and its benefits to the organisation Promote understanding and visibility of our IAM capabilities map, solution designs, and integration standards for all IAM activities aimed at enabling self service, re-use and complexity reduction for the organisation Provide business context and assist with the development of platform and architecture strategy for Identity and Access Management Assist the Integration of IAM systems with in-house applications, third party applications and SaaS applications for provisioning, identity authentication, and developing connectors between IAM tools and system Identify and action key IAM risks in ICT Infrastructure  Kind regards Q1 Team

Name: IT Business Analyst
Description: About the TeamThis team is responsible for setting the Cyber Security Strategy and delivering multiple Cyber Security projects to proactively protect the IT environment. Working closely with the Cyber Governance and Operations branch, our client's objective is to meet the community's expectations and ensure that our digital services are accessible, reliable, and secure. They work on change initiative projects that improve, modernise, and build new capability to ensure that the governance and operational teams are able to establish and apply sufficient risk tolerance while driving improvements for compliance, controls, detection, responses, and visibility functions to manage cyber risk posture.About The Role We are seeking experienced IT Business Analysts or Senior IT Business Analysts who have worked on IT or cyber security programs that required the interpretation of security operations and the changing of processes and technology to meet new capabilities. The role will perform business analysis and process review to identify and develop business and functional requirements specifications. Business Analysts may be allocated to other projects as required to support ad-hoc analysis or process modelling tasks.This role will require working closely with both the Program Manager and the IT Project Managers and will engage with a number of key project stakeholders and understanding of integration architecture technologies. Our Ideal Job Seeker5+ years' experience in an IT Business Analyst role working in the IT and/or Cyber Security industryExperience working in the Cyber Security field, with a strong understanding of the Australian Cyber Security Centre's (ACSCs) Information Security Manual (ISM), particularly the Essential 8 Mitigation StrategiesExperience working on Cyber Security (preferred) projects and in program management in multi-IT vendor arrangementStrong business stakeholder experience, particularly with cyber security, risk, and complianceExceptional communication skills, both written and verbalA pragmatic approach to delivery methodology versus meeting delivery milestonesAbility to respond to change with flexibility and adaptabilityDemonstrated experience facilitating workshopsDemonstrated experience in technical writing and producing high quality documentation including requirements, guidelines, and operation proceduresExperience delivering multi-faceted artefacts for government programs and/or projects Please note - Candidates will need to have the ability to obtain a Baseline Security Clearance or already hold one. WHAT TO DO NEXT?Apply online or email your resume to stefanie@zancott.com.  Indigenous and Torres Strait Islander people are encouraged to apply.Only shortlisted candidates with the required experience will be contacted directly.  To keep up to date with exciting opportunities at Zancott, please follow us on Facebook and LinkedIn.

Name: Research Scientist & Engineer in AI & Cybersecurity - Multiple Opportunities
Description: Job description: Acknowledgement of Country  CSIRO acknowledges the Traditional Owners of the land, sea and waters, of the area that we live and work on across Australia. We acknowledge their continuing connection to their culture and pay our respects to their Elders past and present. View our vision towards reconciliation.     CSIRO's Data61 is hiring   In 2021 Data61 embarked upon an ambitious hiring campaign. At its core, we recognised a unique opportunity to grow our capacity for innovation by increasing our diversity and attracting world-class talent, great minds, skills, opinions and experiences. This has been hugely successful to date. In 2022, we are entering the 3rd stage of our campaign and seeking to attract more amazing, brilliant, and diverse professionals to our ranks.    We have a range of exciting opportunities available for Research Scientists and Engineers, People Leaders, and individuals who are passionate about science and engineering in the digital and data sciences. We also have a range of opportunities available to graduates; to be considered for our graduate program you will have completed at least an undergraduate degree with first-class Honours (H1 or HD) not less than three years ago.  How we can thrive together to solve Australia's data-driven challenges   Data61 are at the digital and data heart of Australia's national science agency - CSIRO    Working collaboratively with the largest group of digital technology researchers in Australia    A unique opportunity to seamlessly work across disciplinary boundaries and make an impact at a national scale!      In 2021 CSIRO's Data61 embarked upon an ambitious hiring campaign. At the heart of it, we recognized a unique opportunity to greatly increase our diversity, attracting talent from around the world, great minds, talents, skills, opinions, and experiences. This has been hugely successful. We are now entering the 3rd stage of our campaign and seeking to attract more amazing, brilliant, and diverse professionals to our ranks.   We have a range of exciting opportunities available for Research Scientists and Engineers, People Leaders, and individuals who are passionate about science and engineering in the digital and data sciences. We also have a range of opportunities available to undergraduates; to be considered for our undergraduate program you will have completed at least an undergraduate degree with first-class Honours (H1 or HD) not less than three years ago.    This is a fantastic opportunity if you want to actively take part in world-class research outcomes to deliver novel cyber security solutions that will educate and protect Australian communities.    Working within our cyber security domain teams offers countless opportunities to be at the forefront of Australia's research and see your contributions make a meaningful positive impact across our nation! The opportunities that we are offering We have a number of indefinite opportunities available for Research Scientists and Research Engineers within our Cyber Security portfolio at Data61. Locations available across Sydney, Melbourne, Brisbane, Canberra or remote where requirements can be met. Apply now to register your interest to join Data61 as part of a multi-disciplinary research team that will lead world-class cyber security research.  Life at CSIRO's Data61 Data61 is at the forefront of digital science and innovation. Data61 is guiding first class novel research as well as working across disciplines and sectors to apply technologies and deliver impact.    Our cyber strategy is based around the themes of building trustworthy and resilient cyber systems, risk-based cyber approaches, shared awareness, as well as strengthening the human and social dimension of cyber security. We are seeking you to join us and be a crucial member of our cyber security division. We have a wide range of research opportunities that include:   Human centric security, AI collaboration to develop security solutions and invisible security.  Security automation to counteract advanced malicious cyber actors using Machine Learning.   Data privacy and confidentiality.      We are committed to continuously building a diverse, inclusive, and flexible working environment where all our people feel supported to do their best work and feel empowered to let their ideas flourish.  About You  We're interested in hearing from people who can demonstrate the following:  A PhD in a relevant discipline area, such as computer science, data sciences, cyber security, information technology, communications engineering, software engineering or applied mathematics.  A demonstrated high quality research publication history in peer reviewed conferences, journals and/or reports within the field of AI and cyber security, and/or data privacy.   Experience in applying research outcomes to solve industry problems, preferably in the area of human centric security, cyber security, data privacy or artificial intelligence/machine learning.  Proactive and adaptable mindset to handle or direct research initiatives (ranging from undefined to perfectly defined requirements), and an ability to navigate around that and work collaboratively with the client.   Strong oral and written communication skills to produce high calibre research papers, interact with external clients/stakeholder, and internal collaboration.       CSIRO is an Equal Opportunity employer working hard to recruit world-class talent that represents the diversity across our society.  Who is eligible to express their interest  To be considered for this role, you must be an Australian Citizen, Permanent Resident or either hold, or be able to obtain, a valid working visa (visa sponsorship may be provided to eligible candidates). The successful applicant will be required to obtain and provide a National Police Check or equivalent.  Where to from here!  If you are interested in opportunities within Data61's Cyber Security division, and meet the above candidate requirements, please apply to register your interest! If you prefer to have an informal chat before putting in your EOI (Expression of Interest), you can contact Careers.Online@csiro.au. Aboriginal and/or Torres Strait Islander candidates, are also welcome to contact our Indigenous Talent lead at IndigenousCareers@csiro.au for more information.    Who will view my EOI: Data61 Research Directors, Group Leaders and Talent Acquisition are partnering together to review your expression of interests. We are excited to hear from you and will be in touch with you over the coming weeks where there is a potential match to an opportunity that may be your future role!    Reference: 74837

Name: Security Support Engineer
Description: Founded in 2014, and listed on the ASX since 2015, Superloop’s purpose is to enable better internet for Australian homes and businesses, by enabling challenger retail brands (including our own Superloop and Exetel brands) to take a larger share of the market, leveraging Superloop’s Infrastructure-on-Demand platform. Superloop operates in three segments of the market: consumer connectivity, business network and security solutions, and wholesale connectivity, all of which leverage Superloop’s investments in physical infrastructure assets including fibre, subsea cables and fixed wireless, as well as Superloop’s software platforms. Hundreds of thousands of homes and businesses rely on Superloop and Exetel everyday for their connectivity needs.Visit www.superloop.com to learn more.Our IT Security Support Engineers are responsible for providing level 2/3 support to our customers of our cyber-safety products. The Security Support Engineer provides a hybrid of systems and networking expertise to ensure timely resolution of technical issues, implementation of our cyber-safety products, proactive consultation, and continued high quality services to our customers. CyberHound, is a Next Generation Firewall that is one of the most advanced sets of multi-layered ‘defence in depth’ security platforms to deliver reliable cybersecurity for schools. Our platform assists to secure a network as well as protect it from ransomware, malware, zero-day threats, phishing and more.This platform sets the benchmark for K12 security coupled with the extensive set of additional features that are part of our Advanced Threat Protection Suite – ensuring peace of mind for school communities.Visit www.cyberhound.com to learn moreWhat will you do?Receive and manage security support queries and issues, providing technical expertise and timely resolution. Update and maintain internal knowledge bases to facilitate a better understanding of recurring issues. Build, image and configure cyber-safety hardware for customers. Contribute to product documentation and identify areas to improve the customer experience. Liaise with our sales team to qualify customer requirements and product specifications, and process technical orders.  Assist with software testing and quality assurance. Proactively monitor, action, manage and resolve alerts. Who do we want to apply?The successful candidate will have:Strong networking knowledge, in areas such as switching and routing. Broad technical knowledge (including TCP/IP, DNS, HTTP, SMTP, POP3, IMAP, XMPP). Familiarity with wired and wireless networking, centralised authentication systems (Active Directory, eDirectory, Open Directory), operating systems (Windows client and server, OS X, iOS, Android and Linux), VMware, Hyper-V, and server hardware. General understanding of MS Office tools, G Suite, hardware, and CRMs (Salesforce). Knowledge of server authentication integration (e.g. AD and/or RADIUS). Experience with network firewalls, and; Ability to diagnose issues through troubleshooting and investigation, and provide an excellent customer experience.  What can we do for you?As we grow and evolve, we want you to as well. We’re progressive. We understand that life exists outside of work which is why we have a flexible approach to the way we work. We’re innovators. Innovation is part of our identity, which is why we celebrate the uniqueness of yours. We’re easy-going. We pride ourselves on creating a fun, casual and relaxed environment. Ditch the corporate attire if you want to - embrace it if that’s your thing. What matters most is that you’re comfortable when you come to work. We welcome diversity. We encourage and seek out diversity of backgrounds and opinions, because we know differences challenge us and help us grow.We give back. In addition to annual and sick leave, we give you the opportunity to spend some paid time away from work doing something meaningful with five personal development days per year. You can use these to help out in the school tuckshop, attend training for your own personal development, or lend a hand to a meaningful charity if you would like to. We stand by our product. We’re confident we have the best connectivity product on the market so we offer our employees free connection to our home broadband service. You have an opportunity to be part of the next exciting part of our journey. What are you waiting for?

Name: Senior Lecturer / Associate Professor in  Cyber Security and Behaviour
Description: Full-time, ongoing Position Parramatta South Campus  About Western Western Sydney University is a modern, forward-thinking, research-led university, located at the heart of Australia’s fastest-growing and economically significant region, Western Sydney. The University is ranked in the top two per cent of universities worldwide, and as a research leader, over 85 per cent of the University’s assessed research is rated at ‘World Standard’ or above. The University’s clear mission is to create thriving communities by producing successful graduates and impactful research with a clear mission to create thriving communities by producing successful graduates and impactful research, driven by four values of boldness, integrity, fairness and excellence. The School of Social Sciences offers both undergraduate and postgraduate programs, including research programs that combine advanced academic knowledge with real-life training to suit a range of career needs and interests in the following disciplines; Geography and Urban Studies, Anthropology, Sociology, Criminology, Policing, Cybersecurity and Behaviour, Humanitarian and Development Studies, Social Work, Heritage and Tourism, Counselling and Art Therapy. The School offers a vast array of professional accredited programs across campuses in Penrith, Liverpool and Parramatta. The School is committed to the provision of high quality, flexible education. It supports students to maximise their success, promote human rights and expand global reach and reputation. The School and the University has an important role working with Greater Western Sydney communities to ensure the region plays its part in the national and international community. As an institution which is globally relevant, the School strives to offer students life-enhancing international experiences and contribute to and recognise the value of the diversity and multicultural richness of the local communities of Greater Western Sydney. About You and the Role The School of Social Sciences seeking to recruit a Cyber Security and Behaviour with an extensive experience.The Senior Lecturer / Associate Professor will be expected to make a substantial contribution to:• The teaching of cybersecurity and behaviour, cybercrime and policing, curriculum development and quality improvement.• The supervision of masters and higher degree research students.• The research direction of the School and specifically the Criminology and Policing work group including participation / leadership in the Western Centre for Cybersecurity Aid and Community Engagement, regular publication in high impact national and international journals in cybersecurity, cybercrime, criminology, criminal justice and social sciences, and the acquisition of competitive external research funding.The position is based at the Parramatta South campus but multi-campus activities requiring travel between campuses may be required.  Benefits and PerksRemuneration Package: Academic Level C $155,383 to $178,242 p.a. (comprising Salary of $131,433 to $150,971 p.a., plus Superannuation and Leave Loading) Academic Level D $185,857 to $204,133 p.a. (comprising Salary of $157,479 to $173,100 p.a., plus Superannuation and Leave Loading)• 17% Superannuation contributions • Salary Packaging options and a range of other benefits  For further information on this position, please read the attached Position Description.   Position Enquiries: Professor Brian Stout, Dean, School of Social Science, email - b.stout@westernsydney.edu.au Closing Date: 8:30pm, Tuesday 12 July 2022  Please note: all applications must be received through the Western Sydney University career portal to be considered for this position

Name: Security DevOps Engineer
Description: Who we are, and what we’re doing:It’s not often you can genuinely say an organisation is changing the world for the better.As one of Australia’s most innovative and awarded energy technology companies, however, that’s exactly what we’re doing. We’re helping grids all over the world adapt to a renewable energy future. The challenges are many, and they’re complex, but the rewards are (quite literally) a better future for us all.Established in 2014, we continue to work on a variety of cutting-edge projects with clients of all sizes, and now we’re seen as a leading innovator in the energy sector. Our solutions have been adopted all over Australia, and with accelerating global traction, we’re now on the cusp of enormous growth.It’s an exciting time, in an exciting space, and if you’d like to join us for the ride you’ll be working with some of the best minds in the industry. Learning and growing alongside a friendly, ambitious team of engineers, software developers and sales & marketing professionals.And while our aim is to change the world, we know we can only do that by changing our people along the way. So we’ve created an environment that is challenging, dynamic and supportive, with ample opportunities to advance your personal, and professional development. This allows us to promote from within, a behaviour we’ll continue whenever possible. We’ve grown to a team of 42 in recent years, and now we need smart, switched on people with the right attitude to help us solve ever more complex problems. Headquartered in Newcastle, we’d love you to join us in the office a couple of days a week, however we’re happy to accommodate post-pandemic arrangements. So wherever you happen to be, wherever you prefer to work from, we’ll figure it out for sure.In short, if you like what we do, and the feeling is mutual, then we’ll always find a way.So, do you want to help us change the world? Read on, let’s see if we can work it out.-------------------------------------------------------------------------Job Title: Security DevOps EngineerThe qualities you’ll bring to the team:Along with the technical skills outlined below, you’ll enjoy working as part of a multi-disciplined, highly effective team and your enthusiasm will be reflected in those around you. You’ll be able to communicate your ideas effectively, and negotiate with colleagues to find the best way forward. You’ll bring exceptional time management and planning skills to the table, and eventually you’ll build rapport with everyone in the business. You’ll be comfortable taking the initiative, using big picture perspective to guide your decisions, and you’ll have an eye for detail and quality.------------------------------------------------------------------------- What we’ll bring to the table:If you think you’d like to join us, then we’d love you to stay as long as possible, so we’ve developed a range of benefits to make it extremely hard for you to even consider leaving.Competitive financial packageIf you’re good at what you do, you deserve to be rewarded for it. You’ll receive a competitive fixed remuneration, discretionary bonuses, annual salary review and a competitive superannuation plan.Flexible working policyBecause it’s 2022, so long as the work gets done, we’re pretty flexible.Parental, exam, study and annual leave.Paid leave for a range of circumstances.Personalised career development & trainingThe key to our success is the ongoing development of you, so you’ll be engaged in an annual personal development planning process, along with online and face-to-face training. And as we always try and promote from within, there’s talent and succession planning too.Wellbeing programs and toolsWe’re focused on balanced, effective innovation and creativity, not productivity at all costs.Burnout is the last thing anybody wants.Giving back to the communityYou’ll have the chance to engage in community programs and charities.Personal assistance programsConfidential help with personal and work-related issuesFully supported entry level positionsFormal graduate program, apprenticeships and internships, with the aim of growing your skills, talent and expertise from the ground up.------------------------------------------------------------------------- Job RequirementsMust haveA Bachelor of Engineering Degree in Electrical, Software, Computing, Mechatronics, or a similar degree such as Mathematics or Information Systems. Also, knowledge of software engineering using a high level language and structured implementation / design approaches, with skills in the following SecOps ProcessesKubernetes Security Management Good, but not essential:Software Revision Management Systems such as “git”Ticketing and/or Work planning systems such as JIRAWiki documentation systems such as ConfluenceExperience with implementing or operating with ISO 27001Experience with implementing or operating with SOC 2 Must be grounded, but not essential to have it allTechnical knowledge of:Linux / Unix Operating SystemsTCP/IP CommunicationsModbus, DNP3, IEEE 2030.5 or similarConcurrent, Parallel, and Distributed SystemsDatabase Systems-------------------------------------------------------------------------Your previous work experience:For the Mid-level roleThree to five years’ experience in a similar technical capacity. For the Senior roleSix to ten years’ experience in a similar technical capacity.You’re also expected to have well developed leadership, mentorship and coaching skills.-------------------------------------------------------------------------The application process:We’re not mucking around here. There’s a lot to be done and we want to get on with it. So we have an Agile recruitment process where we’ll interview you first, then ask you to solve some problems, follow it up with a final interview and then a solid job offer.There’s no boards to face. No panels to deal with. So if, like us, you just want to get on and do the work, use the email below to send us your resume and a covering letter.job.d549n@switchdinptyltd.recruitee.comWe look forward to hearing from you.

Name: Incident and Problem Lead
Description:
Contribute to challenging and meaningful work that makes a difference and creates an impact on the Australian people 
Work with some of the best delivery, architecture, risk, infrastructure and operations, innovation, development and security teams in the country
Foster a value-driven culture of collaboration, reliability, security, service and career development

Do work that makes a difference
Technology is an inherent part of enabling the Reserve Bank of Australia’s policy and operational objectives. With the country depending upon our systems being secure, highly resilient and efficient, you will work within the Bank’s Information Technology (IT) department, and experience the capability-building opportunity to work with Australia’s most critical core banking and payments platforms.
Your team 
Within the Information Technology (IT) department, you will manage a collaborative team of Analysts actively working across BAU rollouts, to transform and develop the core IT functions that support the Reserve Bank's policy, operational and corporate objectives.
Reporting to the Head of Service Management, and working closely with other Team Leads, this is an excellent opportunity for you to be part of a high performing team, working alongside experienced people who are passionate about protecting the security and stability of our technology estate. We are innovative, curious and strongly believe in delivering value and efficiency through our work.
Your background
We are seeking an experienced Incident and Problem Lead to manage and support the Incident and Problem Management practices and reporting including the IT Service Management System to meet the business requirements for the Bank.
To be successful in this critical role you will: 

ITIL Certified
2-3 years’ experience managing a team in incident management and related processes
Demonstrated experience in managing and developing problem and incident management frameworks, preferably in a large organisation
Understanding of end-to-end processes relating to Incident Management
Demonstrated experience in Root Cause Analysis
Have experience in building high reliability operating culture and performance
Exceptional interpersonal skills to collaborate, influence and partner effectively with key stakeholders across the Reserve Bank and externally
Be an energetic strategic thinker who has considerable attention to detail
Have a curious and accountable mindset
Relevant degree qualifications/ industry experience

Your development & career 
An opportunity to remain hands-on with the latest technologies while also feeling the security of an organisation-based role.  
With continued focus on on-the job learning, work for an organisation that truly makes a difference to the Australian people. Aligned to industry best-practice, you are encouraged to develop your skills both internally and externally, through mentoring, training and formal qualifications. The Bank offers development and career opportunities in a collaborative environment that supports people’s growth, wellbeing and promotes flexibility.
Why the RBA?
The Reserve Bank pursues national economic policy objectives and undertakes a range of associated activities in financial markets and banking. It also issues Australia's banknotes and operates infrastructure critical to the payments system, all of which contributes to the welfare of the Australian people.
Our people have a critical role to play in achieving these objectives, whether directly or in a supporting capacity. As a values-driven organisation, our people conduct themselves with a high degree of integrity, while striving for excellence in the work they perform and the outcomes they achieve. We encourage intelligent inquiry, we treat one another with respect, while promoting the public interest in our efforts. 
Your application should include a resume detailing your experience and qualifications.
The Reserve Bank of Australia is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive workplace and encourage applications from experienced candidates seeking workplace flexibility.

Name: Cyber Security Manager
Description: NTD Pty Limited is the next major player in the Australian Online Sports Wagering industry. Backed by a sophisticated group of high-profile private and institutional investors, led by an Executive team with demonstrable experience leading hyper-growth technology businesses, NTD Pty Limited is poised for significant growth. Leveraging their unrivalled connections at the highest levels of Australian business, sports and racing, they will soon be synonymous in the psyche of Australian consumers.  Role Description:A broad opportunity exists to influence and lead our Cyber Security posture from the earliest stage of the business. The role requires the combination of the strategic thinking required to identify risks and develop policy and procedures to address those risks, with a hands on approach that allows the procedures to be implemented and any security issues arising to be addressed timely. The role will be well supported by the Executive to invest in tools and technologies to address security risks and to assist with the management of our various integrated technology providers, and with our growth plans it is expected that the team will expand in the near term.Responsibilities:Cyber security policy and structure development and implementation.Third-party vendor security assessment, monitoring and management.Incident response.Vulnerability assessment, management and continuous improvement.Email security.Data loss prevention.Device, identity and access management.Qualifications & Education:Relevant tertiary degree3+ years in Cyber Security  How to apply:If you think you’d be a great fit, please click “apply” with a CV and detailed cover letter indicating why this job posting caught your attention and how your skills and experience are a fit for this role.
