Name: Information Security Senior Consultant - Web Application Firewall
Description:
How will I help?
Responsible for advising business and Customer Service and Technology units on Information Security for enterprise wide and complex initiatives, to facilitate compliance with the Westpac Group Information Security Framework and target risk position for information security.
Key responsibilities:
Monitor and advise management of emerging security issues, threats, and trends, including impacts of changes to legislation, to provide visibility and assurance to executive stakeholders about the information security state of the Group
Liaise effectively with Westpac’s business partners and third-party service providers as required to ensure that Westpac continues to be protected against current and emerging threats
Review suitability of security product against business needs and implement into existing environments without interruption to services, and identify and advise on requirements for business processes, applications, and products to ensure that Westpac continues to be protected against current and emerging threats
Provide input into response by Partners to any published Urgent Security Memos
Maintain an up-to-date knowledge of Information Security trends and threats
Provide input into the development of information security strategies by providing analytics, research advice and on technical issues to ensure the long-term benefit of shareholders, customers, employees, and community stakeholders
Provide support in the definition and development of improvement ideas


What’s in it for me?
You will play an important and significant part in the future of a business that has been around for 200 years. Our vision is to become one of the world’s great service companies. So, we will back you in the development of your career, with internal career prospects and flexible working. You will also be backed by a fantastic team of people in a can-do, supportive structure. 

What do I need?
Manage and run Web Application Firewall control for the enterprise
Experience in application security, information security, risk management, audit, or equivalent role
Good understanding of information security best practice standards and guidelines (e.g. ISO 27001)
Working knowledge of regulatory frameworks related to information security
Experience in an IT operational, security operations, support, application development or customer service role
Excellent communication skills
A keen analytical approach when solving problems and attention to detail
Exposure to one or more of the following technology areas will be highly regarded: 
	
DevOps, Automation, APIs
Web application security
Scripting programming languages (preferably Python3)




What’s it like to work there?
As well as competitive remuneration and a great culture, joining the Westpac family means you will get some of the best banking, wealth, and insurance benefits in the market. 
We back our employees by helping them work towards industry-recognised qualifications, using online learning, training modules and career planning tools for you to grow with us. We will even pay you to do volunteer or community work.  
As an equal opportunity employer, we are proud to have created a culture and work environment that values diversity and flexibility – and champions inclusion.

How do I Apply?
Start here. Just click on the APPLY button.
As part of our commitment to creating a diverse and inclusive workplace, this role is open to experienced candidates seeking a discussion around workplace flexibility. We invite candidates of all ages, people with a disability and Indigenous Australians to apply.
The Westpac Group has implemented an Entry to Workplace Policy that requires employees and others entering our workplaces to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 by relevant dates set out in the policy (subject to applicable medical exemptions). Our employees are required to comply with the policy regardless of whether they are in customer-facing or non-customer-facing roles (as employees in non-customer-facing roles are required to attend the workplace under our Hybrid Working Strategy). Further, the Westpac Group is required to comply with State/Territory issued public health orders/directions which require relevant workers to be vaccinated against COVID-19 to enter workplaces.
By applying for this role, you acknowledge that you are aware of our Entry to Workplace Policy, and if you secure employment with us, you will be required to comply with the policy.

Name: Security Applications Services Lead
Description: This is a newly created role to ensure a standard level of quality and processes in the way blueAPACHE delivers and supports our security applications to our managed services clients. The ideal candidate is well-versed in current and emerging security applications across identity management, vulnerability management, and threat detection.Your initial focus will be on establishing our systems, processes and documentation for the security services, as well as taking ownership of the service catalogues we sell. This will include:Ensuring support readiness for our security application servicesProviding guidance and mentorship to our operational teamsAssisting with training and certification pathsIdentifying and addressing gaps in our capability; andActing as the highest point of escalation for any security application related issuesOnce the governance and processes are established, the role will move into a combination of maintaining the existing processes, adding new services, and focusing on revenue generation through working with our sales and accounts teams to provide technical presales services into our client base.Requirements: The ideal candidate has previous experience working with an IT&T Systems Integrator, Managed Services Provider, or similar organisation. You are a specialist in security products in either a pre-sales or delivery capacity. Skills and experience include:Working experience in Microsoft and other Key Security Domains:IAM - AD-DSAzure AD (Conditional Access, MFA, SSO)Threat Protection – Microsoft 365 Defender SuiteIdentity Platforms (CyberArk, ADFS, Azure PIM etc.)Information Protection - Cloud App Security, MIP, DLPMicrosoft Security & Compliance CentreSecurity Management - Sentinel, Azure Security Centre, Rapid7 SIEMStrong understanding and demonstrated experience in the use of following technologies.Vulnerability Management (Rapid 7, Tenable, Qualys etc.)Application Whitelisting (Airlock, Microsoft Defender, AppLocker)Email, Web & AV Security Apps (Mimecast, Trend, Defender ATP, Symantec etc)Hybrid and Multi-CloudAccess & Privilege Cloud Platforms (CyberArk)Understanding of industry compliance and security standards such as PCI DSS, ISO 27001, NIST CSF and APRA CPS 234.A current Azure Security Engineer or M365 Security Administrator certification is mandatory. Benefits: This is a great opportunity to take ownership of blueAPACHE's security application services within the managed services team, and will appeal to someone who wants to:Take responsibility for the application security space;Transform and build the framework around applications security delivery;Work very closely with the vendors and the market to be really up to date with latest application security products; andSupport the corporate vision of being the best managed services provider. Founded in 1998, blueAPACHE is trusted to deliver business-critical IT (on-premise and IT as a service) to some of Australia's most successful organisations. We have a solid reputation for innovation and customer focus, helping a broad range of clients achieve their unique strategic and operational objectives. Our technical excellence has recently been recognised by being named ARN Mid-Market Partner of the year, for 2019, 2020 and 2021. For more information please contact Jenni Nelson, Manager - People and Culture, 03 8696 9365. PLEASE NOTE: All offers from blueAPACHE are subject to police clearance checks.

Name: Practice Lead Security - SaaS Product
Description: Full time, permanent and contract opportunities availableGreat company culture where customers come firstFlexible, hybrid working arrangementsAbout us:Genie Solutions is a high-growth technology company and a trusted name in Practice Management Software for Medical Specialists around Australia. At Genie Solutions we embrace diversity and equal opportunity in a serious way. We are committed to building a team that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills.We pride ourselves on making Genie Solutions a great place to work and offer flexible hybrid working hours, an in house wellbeing coach, reward and recognition programs…and much more!About this Opportunity:This is a fantastic opportunity to be the subject matter expert in security related design and operations of our products and services. Using your skills and experience in secure software development and general Cybersecurity, you will lead and champion security and maintain a proactive, security first culture. Key ResponsibilitiesMentor, advise, and train Product Delivery Group teams on security best practices in a cloud-based SaaS environment.Create and rollout an application threat modelling approach usable by agile delivery teams as part of product design through to delivery.Working with DSO, IT, and the group CISO, provide guidance and training on secure data management and security best practices in a Genie Solutions context.Drive the deep embedment of automated security testing into all aspects of the SDLC including CI/CD pipelines for our products to maintain a secure supply chain.Support our ISO27001 compliance and ISMS operations. Skills & ExperienceThe ideal candidate will have skills in and knowledge of security control frameworks, various toolings for security and dependency scanning in CI/CD pipelines and knowledge of AWS Security and Governance services.You will be very familiar with the industry standards and guidelines regarding secure web application development such as OWASP, AWS Well Architected Security Pillar as well as the ability to communicate security related priorities with product development activities.If you're keen to develop your expertise within the health tech industry, send through your resume!

Name: Security Lead
Description: An exciting opportunity for a Security Lead with cyber security experience to join a progressive organisation that offers diverse roles and learning opportunities. This is a great opportunity for someone looking to join an exciting business that operates in an agile and collaborative way.    A bit about our opportunity The Security Lead is accountable for defining the cyber security strategy and managing its implementation to protect the company from security threats and bad actors. You will ensure Information Security practices and controls are aligned to business criticality and information sensitivity of IT systems.    In this role, you will:  Provide expert guidance and counsel on cyber security, operational and strategic risk management to key business stakeholders including the Executive Leadership team and board. Work closely with the Chief Risk Officer and M&A team in assessing cyber risk. Develop the cyber security strategy that is aligned to priorities and strategic objectives. Design, implement and maintain cyber platforms and processes Develop, implement, and maintain a governance program across cyber, data and technology risks. Facilitate information security risk assessment and risk management processes across Steadfast entities. Conduct investigations after breaches or incidents, including impact analysis and recommendations for avoiding similar vulnerabilities. Create and oversee information security awareness training programs with defined metrics to track competency and effectiveness across different audiences. Develop timely and actionable cyber security reporting and controls.  If this sounds like you, then send your CV and covering letter via the following email address: iain@hatchtalent.com.au

Name: Senior Security Architecture Analyst
Description: Senior Security Architecture Analyst, Sydney and Regional NSW, Ongoing and Temporary  The Department of Customer Service (DCS) is looking for X2 Senior Security Architecture Analysts to join our growing team!  BenefitsFantastic Ongoing and 12-18month Temporary OpportunitiesClerk Grade 9/10 - $113,343 - $124,901 per annum plus Super.Excellent career development and training opportunities.About Us DCS is transforming the way NSW Government agencies interact with customers. We are passionate about putting the customer at the centre of everything we do and adopting new technologies to make government work better. DCS is a service provider and regulator, focusing on delivering first-class customer service, digital transformation, and regulatory reform to create better outcomes for the people of NSW.  This is an exciting opportunity to work in a newly created role within our Cluster Chief Information Security Office. The role sits in Cyber Architecture, Consulting and Engagement function with broad exposure across the Cluster. The role will ensure that fit-for-purpose and risk-based recommendations are incorporated in assessments, design reviews and consultations based on the Security Reference Architecture and Framework.  Your responsibilities will include:Responsible for supporting the development of Security Architecture capability and to work with the relevant stakeholders to ensure the appropriate security controls are implemented.Create and lead the implementation of testing frameworks across the DCS Cluster.Review, document, provide recommendations and undertake risk assessment on security controls, solutions and outsourced services based on best practices and DCS security reference architecture.Report on changes to or the development of security capability to ensure the capability is documented in the DCS Security Reference Architectures.Provide expert input to the strategic direction of technology investments to assist in the development of the information security architecture and roadmap as well as maximise value for return on investment.Provide architecture leadership, and ensure alignment of the solution to Enterprise Security Architecture strategy and standards to support Cloud infrastructure (IaaS, PaaS and SaaS)About you:Collaborative professional and effective communicator comfortable working with internal and external stakeholders to drive the security capability within large scale environments.3+ years' experience and sound understanding of cyber security controls and the development of security capabilities within a Security Reference Architecture.Solid knowledge and understanding of security and industry standards or frameworks including SABSA, ISO-27000 series, NIST and ISMS.Understanding of security principles for Cloud technologies including but not limited to Azure and AWS environments.Understanding of security technologies including Application Whitelisting, Privileged Access Management and Cryptography.Committed to a Growth and Learning mindset.If you want to be part of this forward thinking, innovative team that thrive in challenging the status quo, we would love to hear from you!  What we need from you:  To start your journey towards becoming our Senior Security Architecture Analyst please click on the link below and attach your resume (max 5 pages) and cover letter (max 2 pages).  A talent pool may be created from this recruitment process to fill future ongoing and temporary opportunities  Salary Grade 9/10, with the base salary for this role starting at $113,343 base plus superannuation  Click Here to access the Role Description. For enquiries relating to recruitment please contact Nicole Turner via nicole.turner@customerservice.nsw.gov.au.  Based on our current Work, Health and Safety (WHS) requirements, and in line with our Mandatory Vaccination Policy, it is a condition of engagement for a role within Service NSW/Department of Customer Service that staff be fully vaccinated against COVID-19. Successful applicants will be required to provide proof of their COVID-19 vaccination status or have an approved medical contraindication certificate. Any relevant medical circumstances impacting on the ability to obtain a COVID-19 vaccination will be considered. These requirements apply to both internal and external preferred candidates and must be completed prior to commencing in the position. If you have a medical contraindication which may prevent you from complying with this requirement, please contact nicole.turner@customerservice.nsw.gov.au to discuss your circumstances.  Closing Date: Monday 27th June 10am  Working at Department of Customer Service  The Department of Customer Service (DCS) is a great place to work! Our values of accountability, trust, service, and integrity drive our initiatives and culture. We support innovative programs in areas as broad as digital government, consumer protection and major public works. We are an inclusive organisation that celebrates diversity and flexible work practices and believe our people are our greatest asset.  Visit our Careers site to find out what it means to work for us.  Our Commitment to Diversity, Inclusion & Flexibility  We are committed to diversity, inclusion, and new ways of working.  The Department of Customer Service serves all the people of NSW and we want to reflect that diversity in our people. We welcome and encourage applications from people with disability, Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples, culturally and linguistically diverse groups, the LGBTIQA+ community, veterans, carers, refugees, people in regional NSW and people of all ages. We strive to be an inclusive workplace where all our people can bring their authentic selves to work without judgement.  We understand that there are different ways of getting the job done and offer flexible working arrangements where and when possible.  If you do require an adjustment during the recruitment process, please notify us on your application form or contact the recruiter via nicole.turner@customerservice.nsw.gov.au

Name: Digital Skills Cadetship Program
Description: Kickstart your career in IT - APPLY NOW for the Digital Skills Cadetship Program !!!  The Digital Skills Cadetship Program is your gateway to an exciting career in the information technology sector. This is an amazing opportunity funded by the Department of Education, Skills and Employment supporting innovative pathways to careers in Cyber Security, Data Analytics and Cloud-based computing.  This 12-week program is specifically designed for women who are: Returning to the workforce from an extended breakFrom an under-represented group, such as newly arrived migrants, refugees, Aboriginal and/or Torres Strait Islander people, and the culturally and linguistically diverseTransitioning from underemployed industries affected by COVID-19, and other circumstancesSimply looking towards a new careerYou don't need to have any pre-existing IT experience to participate**This role is a special measure under Section 7D of the Sex Discrimination Act 1984 (Cth) intended to increase the percentage of women in the digital skills industry.**  Benefits of becoming a Cadet: Working towards Microsoft credentialsObtaining specialised micro-credentials in cyber security, data analytics or cloud-based computingGaining access to industry-led mentoring and support servicesBeing paid, full-time employment for the duration of the CadetshipYour participation may lead to further employment in IT, or related learning or training, depending on your situation.There may even be an opportunity for you to continue working for your Employer as a permanent team member at the completion of your Cadetship.Working with MEGT, our partners and leading Registered Training Organisations, you'll gain valuable on-the-job experience, while learning and working towards the below qualifications in cyber security:  Micro-credentials: Introduction to Cyber Security, Contribute to cyber security threat assessments, Cyber breach simulation, cyber crisis management.  Microsoft Certification: Microsoft Office Specialist- Word, Excel and PowerPoint and Security compliance and identity fundamentals.  Interested?  Hit APPLY NOW! Name: Senior Manager - Secure Configuration
Description: About the Business Technology team is responsible for the world leading applications of technology and operations across every aspect of CommBank from innovative product platforms for our customers to essential tools within our business. We also use technology to drive efficient and timely processing, an essential component of great customer service.  The Cyber Security division protects the bank and our customers from theft, losses and risk events, through effective and proactive management of cyber security, privacy and operational risk. The Vulnerability Management team is responsible for identifying vulnerabilities through network-based vulnerability scanning and ensure vulnerability remediation through assessment and reporting.  Do work that matters:This key position is tasked with the leadership of the Secure Configuration Management function within the Cyber Attack and Vulnerabilities Assessments team. You will:Lead the team to deliver on the strategic roadmap; translates roadmap into key deliverables to enable effective execution.Build strategic relationships and partnerships, as well as foster a collaborative environment that supports the achievement of deliverables.Develop and maintain a high performance team culture, through visible leadership, coaching and mentoring of the team.Champion secure configuration with all levels of stakeholders throughout the organisationProactively manage risk, internal, and external obligations and responsibilities.Own and manage the control framework; ensures the framework meets obligations and mitigates riskEvaluate policies, guidelines and standards; make suggestions on improvementsManage and control budget, look for opportunities to optimise expenses in line with organisational policy.Actively contribute to the Cyber community; sharing knowledge and expertise.Analyse industry trends and apply knowledge of the industry to guide changes to policies, guidelines and standardsWe're interested in hearing from people who have:Proven experience in cyber security ideally with experience and knowledge in the field of Secure Configuration and/or Vulnerability Management.Strong understanding and experience with ITILStrong understanding of compliance and regulatory policies including CPS 234, RITS, SWIFT CSP and PCI DSS and how they relate to vulnerability and configuration management obligations.Understanding of the ASD Essential 8 and the mapping of the VM and SecCM control requires to achieve higher level maturities thereof.An understanding of security controls and how they align with the strategic goals.A strong understanding of system security principles, including both technical security and secure design.Proven stakeholder management and influencing skillsExperience in large complex environments, ideally in the financial sectorThe ability to convey complex technical information to non-technical peopleThe ability to lead a team of technical SME's and foster an environment of continuous improvementA formal education or certification in information security, information technology, risk management or equivalent discipline .The health and safety of our people, customers and communities is our number one priority. This means that we require all of our employees to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19. Please speak to us if you have any questions about this based on your individual circumstances. Whether you're passionate about customer service, driven by data, or called by creativity, a career here is for you. Our people bring their diverse backgrounds and unique perspectives to build a respectful, inclusive and flexible workplace. One where we're driven by our values, and supported to share ideas, initiatives, and energy. One where making a positive impact for customers, communities and each other is part of our every day.Here, you'll thrive. You'll be supported when faced with challenges, and empowered to tackle new opportunities. We really love working here, and we think you will too.We're determined to make a real difference for Australia's first peoples. We encourage all interested applicants to apply. If you're already part of the Commonwealth Bank Group (including Bankwest), you'll need to apply through Sidekick [link removed] to submit a valid application. We're keen to support you with the next step in your career.

Name: Senior Advisor, Information Security Assurance
Description:
Nearly created position allowing you to make your own mark within the Finance and Business Services team.
Be a vital part of the project by creating a positive security culture, improving information security and maturing the protective information security capability.
3 years fixed term - $103,920 to $125,735 + super & benefits.

About North East Link
North East Link is the biggest ever investment in Melbourne's north-east - changing the way people move around Melbourne.
Victoria's longest road tunnels will fix the missing link in our city's freeway network, take 15,000 trucks off local roads a day and slash travel times by up to 35 minutes. We'll also complete the Ring Road in Greensborough, overhaul the Eastern Freeway, build Melbourne's first dedicated busway and the North East Trail - more than 34km of walking and cycling paths.
About the Opportunity
Be part of a transformative infrastructure project for Victoria, with an exciting role in the North East Link Program's Finance and Business Services!
The Senior Advisor, Information Security Assurance is a newly created position at NELP. You will advise and support internal and external stakeholders to protect confidentiality, integrity and availability of the information that we use to deliver the project.
Reporting to the Manager, Audit and Compliance, you will play a vital role in providing assurance in relation to the security of NELP's information assets, supporting a cultural shift to recognising information security as a necessary element of the organisation's operating environment and day to day activities. 
About You
You have:

Great critical thinking and problem-solving skills and have experience conducting project assurance reviews in a complex environment.
Exceptional skills in analysing and interpreting large datasets using Microsoft Office.
Have a Bachelor (or higher) qualification in Business Systems or a related discipline.

Benefits
Our commitment to creating a workplace that inspires you, engages you and grows you is strong - we want you to be a powerful contributor to this wonderfully diverse and dynamic organisation. Our offering continues to grow but here is what we already have in store for you:

Leave loading - 17.5% payment on top of your base salary when you take annual leave
Flexible work arrangements available (including ability to purchase additional leave)
Team benefits discount card at a variety of restaurants and cafes
Salary sacrifice of additional superannuation contributions and novated vehicle lease arrangements
Access to discounted public transport

How to Apply
If this sounds like the opportunity for you, apply now! Applications must include a cover letter and resume. Please note it is not a requirement to respond to the Key Selection Criteria separately, but applicants should outline their relevant experience in their cover letter.  All interviews will be conducted virtually. For a confidential discussion contact Talent Acquisition Partner Catherine Michalik on Catherine.michalik@northeastlink.vic.gov.au.  
Applications close at 11:59pm on Thursday 7 July 2022.
Our advertisement is only intended for individuals interested in employment with NELP. Recruitment agencies need not contact.
We believe in inclusiveness, diversity and equality and are committed to ensuring that our workplaces are a reflection of the Victorian community. We recognise the benefits that a diverse and inclusive culture brings for our employees and in turn, encourage talented people from all backgrounds, abilities and identities to apply to our vacancies. We strongly encourage Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islanders, people with a disability and others from under-represented backgrounds to apply.

Name: Cyber Security Solution Architect (IDAM and PAM)
Description: About the roleThis role develops, communicates and maintains the approach taken by the organisation for enterprise-wide cyber security architecture and security solution design and architecture.This is through:Development of solution design for security servicesDevelopment of security patterns and standardsProvision of cyber security advice and consultancy services to all areas of the businessPerforming risk assessment for business engagementsInput into strategies and roadmapsMinimum Role Accountabilities:Influence/Impact: Key Stakeholder engagement and conflict resolutionLeading & Developing: Exhibit influencing and mentoring skills over a wide range of stakeholders in technical and non-technical rolesDifficulty: Resolving complex problems and understanding the trade-offs of security risk vs operational and cost issuesPlanning Focus: Operational planning for area of accountabilityDirection: Broad direction and guidance from senior managementAccountabilities: What I may be expected to do when I come to work in this role:Security Solution Design and Architecture for deployment of cyber services such as identity and access management domain including IAM, PAM authentication.Developing cyber security patterns and standards in various disciplines for consumption by wider OT & ICT teams.Supporting the development of the organisation's Cyber Security Technology Reference Architecture.Develop security tooling strategies for Cyber Security services and work closely with OT and ICT Strategy and Architecture to progress the strategy.Provide expertise, leadership, guidance and support to technical and business project teams in the development, communication and full lifecycle management of enterprise aligned cyber security architectures.Promoting a proactive focus on security architecture through early intervention in technology project lifecycles; ensuring projects maintain an enterprise-wide viewAssessing and managing complex security risks including those presented via new solutions or incidents, investigations and remediation actions.Providing training, guidance, governance and information tools to support effective security architecture such as policies, processes, application references models, guidelines and artefacts.Coaching and influencing stakeholders in different areas of the business to improve cyber security outcomes.Perform other duties and responsibilities as may be directed by your manager, in line with the Work Level Standards for this role. Minimum Occupational Capability Requirements:  Essential: The Knowledge, Skills, Accreditations, Licencing and/or Authorisations, you must have in this role to be safe and effective:Relevant tertiary qualifications (e.g. computer science or IT degree), industry certifications (e.g. CISM, CISSP, TOGAF, GIAC) and/or relevant industry experience.Significant experience in shaping and driving the security design and deployment of cyber services and solutions in the following areas: Cyber services related to identity and access management domain including IAM, PAM authentication etc. [Must Have]Cyber services related to data security, web security services etc.Microsoft Azure cloud security and resilience architecture,Knowledge of Operational Technology Security architecture and modelsDemonstrated ability to lead and influence other senior technical and business staff, without these people being direct reports.Experience in developing, communicating and maintaining cyber security architectures, roadmaps, policies and standards.High level written, verbal communication and interpersonal skills.Proven technical and interpersonal skills are required to develop sound communications options.Ability to affect change through technical leadership.Flexibility to work in a dynamic environment. For more information or a confidential discussion, please contact Eugene on 0282672467 quoting reference 247466.  To apply please click the 'Apply Now' button.
