Name: Security Manager
Description: ABOUT THE ROLEServicing corporate, governmental, and non-governmental clients globally, International SOS, a pioneer & leader in International Health & Security Risk provides tailored support through our 27 Assistance Centres worldwide.As a Security Manager, Information & Analysis and Assistance, you will be responsible for the day-to-day direction, guidance and analytical line for all internal and client-facing deliverables. Additionally, you will be responsible for the day-to-day security case management direction, supervision and guidance for the Australia, New Zealand and Pacific Islands region.RESPONSIBILITIESSupervise the Information & Analysis and Assistance global capabilities delivered out of Sydney, providing guidance on reports and cases for the team of Security Specialists.Act as a regional analytical lead for the Australia, New Zealand and Pacific Islands region and will work closely with other Lead Security Analysts and relevant Medical I&A leads on issues of overlap.In collaboration with the Content Services professional community shape how Information & Analysis should be delivered and presented to clients in an audience-centric way across the multimedia digital space.  Collaborate with relevant stakeholders across the Assistance Centre, Flight Desks Travel Advisors, Content Services & Medical I&A professional communities to ensure comprehensiveness of output and overall economy of effort.Provide on-the-job training and support for the Security Specialists, covering both a regional and a global remit. Contribute to ensuring International SOS has a best-in-class security I&A and Assistance capability by participating in projects relating to functional enhancements, such as intelligence collection tools and trainings. EXPERIENCEMinimum 5 + years’ experience in Security Intelligence analysis and production analysis and production including a period specialising in a specific geographic region in a relevant sector such as: private sector risk management, military, government, NGO, journalism; relevant academic studies.Experience on the ground in the Australia, New Zealand and Pacific Islands region.International work experience in challenging, remote or hostile environments, is desired.Crisis Management experience is desired.Public speaking, client-facing presentation and/or media experience, is a desired.SKILLS & KNOWLEDGEStrong knowledge of political and security landscape within Australia, New Zealand and Pacific Islands and global security issues.Excellent written and verbal communication skills including ability to explain complex situations to non-expert audiences.Experience in planning and managing security assistance operations.Experience in conducting profile specific security risk assessments.Ability to critically analyse multiple streams of information under time pressure and produce actionable insights.Knowledge of all stages of intelligence cycle including multi-source direction and collection.QUALIFICATIONSMaster’s degree (or relevant professional training) in a field related to security intelligence, international politics, international relations or similar.

Name: Senior Specialist, Vulnerability Tools & Assessment
Description: Company description:READY FOR ANYTHINGAt IAG, we live and work by our purpose to make your world a safer place. We are motivated by a unique culture that celebrates honesty, creativity, empathy, equity and collaboration. We call it the IAG way, and it means we all share a 'ready for anything' mindset that sets the tone for positive actions and positive outcomes. We put heart into everything we do which guides us to create amazing things for our customers, our people and our communities. We're brimming with ideas, ambition and a readiness to apply bold thinking and risk awareness to make a difference where it matters most. As the largest general insurance group in Australia and New Zealand, we own some of the region's most trusted brands, including NRMA Insurance, CGU, SGIO, SGIC and WFI. We are ready for anything.Job description:   Role- Senior Specialist - Vulnerability tools and Assessment Location-Australia Permanent Opportunity  The Role In this role you will help to protect IAG's digital and information assets by assuring authorized and secure utilization of infrastructure and application resources by managing vulnerability and configuration compliance scanning and associated processes.A major sophisticated cyber-attack against IAG could have a catastrophic impact on the business, and this team is one of the main lines of defense against such an attackThis role will see you utilise your passion for cyber security to make our world a safer place. Key Responsibilities:  Own and deliver Vulnerability Management and Cloud Posture services end to end. Ensure that infrastructure is scanned for vulnerabilities and compliance validation, that scanning coverage and implementation is optimised and that the service is running. Work with various stakeholders to ensure that remediation management is functioning through assisting with prioritisation, identifying orphan assets, assisting remediation teams by providing vulnerability information etc. Update and maintain operational dashboards that highlight service status and coverage. Work with the broader assessment team to improve and deliver security assessment services Deliver all stages of the technical assessment lifecycle and contribute to the maintenance of technical assessment policies, standards and procedures. Document the findings resulting from technical assessments within work tracking solutions for orchestration for remediation. Identify practical improvements to processes that would improve agility and allow greater utilisation of self-service capabilities.  Skills & Experience:  Extensive experience with vulnerability management solutions e.g., Tenable Security Centre, Qualys, BURP enterprise ect. Thorough understanding of Cloud and other Security Standards / Frameworks e.g., CIS Benchmarks, NIST CSF, ISO 27001, PCI-DSS, CVSS Understanding of CIS Benchmarks related to Infrastructure configuration Exposure to and familiarity with ticketing solutions e.g., ServiceNow, Jira etc. Application development exposure in one or more of the following: SQL, PHP, Python, HTML, JavaScript, PowerShell, GoLang (Go) Advanced Excel skills including Excel programming and data modelling Technical understanding of applications developed in web technologies such as HTML, JavaScript, Java/J2EE, ASP/.NET, PHP, Rest APIs, AngularJS, NodeJS, Bootstrap etc. Experience of conducting Vulnerability Assessment of Web Applications within cloud environments (e.g., AWS/Azure etc.). Tertiary qualification in Information Technology, Engineering, Computer Science or equivalent experience.  Ready for anything? Let's talk. Click ‘Apply' and start your career conversation with Talent Acquisition!   Applications close on 01 July 2022.  IAG rewards and recognises its people with generous benefits, career development opportunities and real work-life balance. Employees also enjoy 13% superannuation, up to 50% insurance discounts, flexible work and leave options, generous parental leave and return to work programs, various corporate partner discounts and a people-focused culture that celebrates achievements big and small.  Creating a workforce that actively embraces diversity, inclusion and a sense of belonging is key to our success. We believe in treating everyone fairly which means that inclusion, removing barriers, striving for equity and embracing diversity are woven through our values and behaviours.  We encourage applications from all backgrounds and communities and are committed to providing a work environment that enables you to thrive, whatever your circumstances. If we can provide support with access requirements, alternative work arrangements please advise us via your application. IAG has committed to the reconciliation movement in Australia for First Nations people and focus on providing a safe and supportive work environment for all our employees. More information on our Reconciliation Action Plan can be found on our company website.

Name: Security Compliance Officer
Description: Employer of Choice – 7 years in a rowPublicly listed, leading Australian IT companyToowong based – flexible working optionsThe Role New and exciting opportunity to join Data#3 in the capacity of Security Compliance Officer within our Services business.Reporting to the General Manager of Services, you will be responsible for the overall compliance requirement and certifications for Quality Assurance, Workplace Health and Safety and Cyber Security. What will I be doing? Ensure the Services business operations comply with applicable Company Quality Assurance and WHS policies and procedures.Maintain the processes and governance over WHS obligations for ServicesSupport and guide the implementation of security initiatives to improve overall security within the Services line of businessWork side by side with the Data#3 Corporate Information Security team and the Security Committee to ensure consistency of approach in relation to the management of information security in ServicesDeliver ongoing training to Services staff on WHS and security processes and practicesConduct regular audits to confirm QA, WHS and security policies and processes are complied with across the Services line of business. Prepare reports of findings and recommendations to managementManage security related certifications applicable to the Services line of business (eg. ISO27001, SOC2/3)Lead a virtual team of QA subject matter experts across the Services business to ensure the accuracy of QA processes and procedures is maintainedContribute to Professional and Managed Services new business pursuits across areas of expertiseWhat experience will I need? Proven experience in a Compliance role within Professional and/or Managed Services, or similar, environmentHigh level verbal and written communication skills with the ability to effectively liaise with internal and external stakeholders, across all levels of seniority  Possess the skills, and traits necessary to being successful in a senior role such as professionalism, a sense of urgency, and a dedication to continuous improvementEffective negotiation and problem resolution skills to achieve a win/win situationKnowledge of the ISO framework, ISO 27001 & 27002 standards, SOC 2/3, Risk Management ISO 31000 standardIn order to be successful in this role, you must hold a current security clearance issued by the Australian Government Security Vetting Agency or have the ability to obtain a clearance. About Data#3 Our vision is to harness the power of people and technology for a better future.Founded in 1977, Data#3 is an award-winning, publicly listed IT company that partners with world-leading technology vendors to deliver innovative technology services and solutions. Data#3 reported revenues of $1.6 billion in the 2020 financial year and has more than 1,200 employees across 12 locations in Australia and Fiji.For more details on why Data#3, head over to our Careers site at https://www.data3.com/careers/. What Employment Benefits will I receive? Underpinned by our core business values, Data#3 permanent staff have access to a wide range of activities and benefits, including but not limited to:Income ProtectionCommunity Service LeaveNovated LeasingFlexible workingFor our extensive list of benefits, refer to: https://www.data3.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/D3_Staff_Benefits_Final.pdf  Please note that Data#3 will request as part of the recruitment process, reference checks and verification of your right to work in Australia. You may also be required to undertake background checks and police checks for security clearance pertaining to specific job requirements.Data#3 may require you to be fully vaccinated for COVID-19, in order to perform this role.Ref No. KAWI108507

Name: Multiple Opportunities on Offer
Description: Company DescriptionAre you passionate about creating a culture of innovation?  Do you want to work on large-scale enterprise and mission IT solutions that solve our customer’s most demanding data analytics, cyber security, logistics, training, operational and intelligence challenges?Leidos is responsible for the ongoing support and uplift of two of Defence’s largest classified networks.  In partnering with the Chief Information Officer Group (CIOG), Leidos helps meet the needs of Defence’s end users, applications owners, and Defence project teams in one of Australia's largest and most complex IT environments.From building and operating on premise platform solutions to integrating with commercial cloud providers, the Leidos team helps deliver best-practice end user environments, with a comprehensive array of products and services and leading edge cyber security. Driven by an ever increasing commitment towards Evergreening the environment and exploiting the benefits that automation can bring, means that we have increasing need for skilled resources.   From Project Management and Architecture, to hands on Systems Engineering and IT Administration and support roles the program offers tremendous large scale ICT experience and career opportunities.   About UsLeidos Australia is a large scale systems integration company, committed to delivering trusted solutions that help to safeguard Australia. With over 20 years’ local experience and the backing of a 39,000 global network, we currently number 1,400 employees mainly in Canberra and Melbourne.We’re growing fast and are building a business that is focused and fit for the future. Change and innovation are central to the way we work, and we thrive when developing unique, practical solutions to seriously complex challenges.Job DescriptionMultiple Opportunities with Leidos AustraliaLeidos Australia has a number of available positions available, including an amazing opportunity to join our engagements with the Department of Defence, supporting Australia and its national interests, both locally and overseas. We are currently seeking individuals for the following roles:Cyber EngineersSecurity Operations Analysts (Entry Level Positions available)Governance, Risk and Compliance Analysts/SMEsSecurity Architect / McAfee/ SplunkSolution ArchitectsEngineers – System/Test/SecurityTechnical Writers / Document ControlDatabase Specialists – Oracle / Microsoft SQLData ScientistService Delivery MangerService Now ConsultantBusiness Analyst – Customer Experience/ Activity Directory / Identity ManagementQualificationsAbout You and What You'll BringWe are particularly interested in individuals with Australian Government Security Clearances at the Baseline level and above.In this role you will become a part of Leidos’ strong international heritage. We provide Security Operations Capabilities to two of the biggest Australian Federal Government agencies, and three of the top four largest US Federal Agencies. Within Australia we have a burgeoning community, and as a member of our team you will have access to excellent training and development opportunities, and join a new team doing interesting work that matters.Additional InformationWhat You'll LoveAt Leidos, we’ve built our business on the ability to Redefine Possible and the same applies to your career. We proudly embrace diversity and support our people at every stage of their Leidos journey in terms of inclusion, accessibility and flexibility. We are a family inclusive workplace and look forward to welcoming you and supporting you grow, learn, and develop the skills required to meet your potential. At Leidos you’ll enjoy 12 weeks’ paid parental leave as a primary carer, dynamic working arrangements (acknowledging that flexibility can be different for various individuals depending on the work, the customer, the project, and the individual needs of team members – but can include flexible leave and work options), discounted health insurance, novated leasing and more. Foster your career through complete access to learning and development and mentoring opportunities, we have a strong track record of internal promotion and career transitions.  Join a company who acknowledges “People First”.Applicants may also need to meet International Traffic in Arms Regulations (ITAR) requirements. In certain circumstances this can place limitations on persons who hold dual nationality, permanent residency or are former nationals of certain countries as per ITAR 126.1.

Name: Cyber Security Systems Engineer
Description:
SYPAQ is an industry leader in C5ISREW and autonomous systems integration, product development, and consulting services, with established engineering teams across projects in Canberra, Melbourne, Adelaide, Sydney, and Brisbane. Our rich history of collaborating with the Australian Defence and National Security community continues to deliver a true sovereign industrial capability through advanced engineering and technology services and solutions.


SYPAQ is seeking a highly skilled Cyber Security Systems Engineer. This position will see you working on Model Based System Engineering approach to threat modelling and risk assessment on large Defence Capability Projects. This will include system analysis and engagement to generate an initial model in a Model Based System Engineering (MBSE) tool. And, maintenance of that model as the capability progresses through the phases of the One Defence Capability System.

 
Responsibilities:
Underlying system analysis and understanding to generate initial models of capability systems in an MBSE tool (This will be supported with training in specific tools and plug-ins used). And, maintenance of this model across the life of the capability;Threat analysis and understanding to generate initial threat sets from generic to advanced. And, maintenance of these threat sets across the life of the capability;Regular stakeholder engagement across Defence to validate and update the underlying models and threat sets;Assisting in the development of security artefacts (e.g., Security Risk Management Plans and Statements of Applicability) and model outputs (e.g., Attack Trees and Risk Assessment Tables) in support of capability decision points and reviews;Assisting in the conduct of Table Top and wargaming exercises; Assisting the Capability Manager and Delivery Group in understanding and managing the risks of implemented technology through improved transparency and guidance on effective control implementation; andAssisting the Capability Manager and Delivery Group in managing cyber risks in a transparent and robust wat that enhances their ability to meet Capability objectives, stakeholder expectations, and compliance obligations.


What we are looking for:Essential:

	
Current NV1 security clearance;Current or ability to obtain current AGSVA NV2 security clearance;
Highly Desirable:
	
Experience or qualifications in Systems Engineering;Experience or familiarity in Cyber Security or System Safety with a willingness to undertake work in Cyber Security;
Desirable:
	
Experience or familiarity with Model Based Systems Engineering;Experience or familiarity with threat modelling;Experience or familiarity with Risk Management.


 
Please follow the links to apply direct, for a confidential discussion contact Mark Pengilly on 0419 814 728 or email: MPengilly@SYPAQ.com.au. Visit our corporate website for other opportunities with SYPAQ www.sypaq.com.au/careers-portal
 
SYPAQ’s Culture

We take pride in being a 100% Australian family owned business delivering world leading solutions to our clients locally and internationally. Our culture and values are important to us, hence we encourage people with the same vision to discuss how we can jointly achieve your personal and professional goals as part of our team.
 
We strongly believe in our VALUES, they underpin everything we do:
See something. Do something!Achieve more together – share success.Be Courageous – be innovative! See the opportunity, manage the risk.Strive for excellence – master your craft.We are family – we value honesty, respect, and compassion.
 
Staff Benefits
Generous professional development and study optionsLoyalty leave schemeADF reserve leaveFlexible work arrangementsReferral bonusesSalary sacrifice and novated leasing
 
Queensland License: LHL02458-W2B3Z
Victorian License: LHL 03075
ACT License: LHL 00000102

Name: Senior Product Security  Engineer
Description: Be a part of a high profile Security ProgramJoin one of the most advanced Cyber Security teams in AustraliaThe Cyber Security Team protects the bank and our customers from theft, losses and risk events, through effective and proactive management of cyber security, privacy and operational risk. The Digital Assurance team is responsible for vulnerability assessment, penetration testing, and ethical hacking services. The team provides security leadership and expertise through direct interaction with business stakeholders to enable innovation to the Group and its customers.  Your contribution  You will be responsible for delivering Product Security services to our key delivery streams. Providing technical consulting, application security and penetration testing activities designed to ensure that the bank maintains its risk and security posture at desired levels, you will be responsible for communicating security issues to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.  Do Work that Matters Work closely with scrum teams and project managers to provide penetration testing and application security services. This will include delivering targeted web application, mobile application security tests, source code review and analysis.Document and report results and scope of assurance activities to our customers, including project managers, service owners, developers and risk managers.Champion security initiatives and new ways of working to ensure systems in the portfolio continue to be safe, sound and secure. This will involve pitching security initiatives, and assisting in the implementation of industry leading secure development practices such as code scanning and bug bounties.Provide subject matter expertise to key stakeholders, including pro-active efforts to reduce the likelihood that vulnerabilities ship in our retail products before go-live.Your experience Demonstrated experience as a Penetration Tester/Application Security Specialist/Product Security Engineer at a senior level.Exposure in code review to assist with proactively reducing vulnerabilities before code is deployed.Have a sound understanding of web and mobile application vulnerabilities identification, penetration testing processes and methodologies.Have worked in (or with) development teams.The health and safety of our people, customers and communities is our number one priority. This means that we require all of our employees to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19. Please speak to us if you have any questions about this based on your individual circumstances  Sounds like you? Apply now to take the next great leap forward in your career Whether you're passionate about customer service, driven by data, or called by creativity, a career here is for you. Our people bring their diverse backgrounds and unique perspectives to build a respectful, inclusive and flexible workplace. One where we're driven by our values, and supported to share ideas, initiatives, and energy. One where making a positive impact for customers, communities and each other is part of our every day.Here, you'll thrive. You'll be supported when faced with challenges, and empowered to tackle new opportunities. We really love working here, and we think you will too.We're determined to make a real difference for Australia's first peoples. We encourage all interested applicants to apply. If you're already part of the Commonwealth Bank Group (including Bankwest), you'll need to apply through Sidekick [link removed] to submit a valid application. We're keen to support you with the next step in your career.

Name: Senior Security Specialist
Description: About the CompanyDavidson Technology are currently supporting a large Queensland Government Agency that delivers high-quality ICT services to the public safety agencies for a safe and secure Queensland.  Due to ongoing need, we are seeking a Senior Security Specialist for a 12-month contract role, with potential for extension. About the RoleIn this role, you will be responsible for high-level security design, configuration and implementation of security infrastructure in a fast-paced project environment.  You will deliver implementation and migration of specialist security products, provide expert strategic, tactical and operational advice, technical support, and contribute to security standards and procedures within the cyber security team and other groups within the organisation.You will also work across time-bound projects assessing, testing, deploying and migrating foundational cyber security capabilities, or providing security expertise across a broad range of business ICT projects. You will also work closely with project and BAU teams, comprised of cyber security response and design specialists, project teams, and technical and business stakeholders.About YouTo be successful in this role, you will be able to demonstrate:3+ years of experience in Cyber Security response, operations, projects or design, in an enterprise-level organisation.Experience delivering security aspects of small to large, and/or complex, technical projects.Experience planning, leading and proactively delivering security aspects of projects, including detailed security designs and the configuration, development, testing, and deployment of security-related technologies.Experience implementing, testing, and troubleshooting with:Traditional and software defined networkingEnterprise Firewalls and Load BalancersInternet access and proxy-based servicesModern web and email content filtering security servicesEndpoint Detection and Response (EDR) technologiesPublic Key InfrastructureManaging complex Microsoft Windows Domains and ForestsDomain Name System (DNS)Self-motivation, enthusiasm, and strong interpersonal skills.Ability to apply existing cyber security tools and technologies to new environments.Ability to provide expert advice that ensures the confidentiality, integrity, availability, accountability and compliance of assets (eg QGEA IS18, ISO 27001, and other security standards)Additional experience in the below would be highly desirable:Security Incident ResponseOperating and maintaining common log correlation and Security Incident and Event Management (SIEM) platformsCloud Access Security Brokers (CASB)Secure Access Service Edge (SASE)Cloud-based solutions and services, such as Amazon Web Services (AWS) and Microsoft AzureData Loss Prevention (DLP) servicesVulnerability ManagementThe BenefitsThis role offers you the opportunity to join a dynamic team finding innovative solutions which directly contribute to positive community outcomes. You will receive a daily rate of $1,013.69 + Superannuation, an initial contract to 30 June 2023 and potential for further extension. Our client offers a supportive and people-focused work environment that supports work-life balance and flexible hybrid work options, offering a split between work from home as well as Brisbane CBD.Next StepsTo apply, click the link and upload your current resume in Microsoft Word format only (.doc or .docx). If you would like to have a confidential discussion, please contact Owain Thomas - 0433 297 975, quoting ref no. JO-2206-111151.Want to know more about Davidson? Visit us at www.davidsonwp.com

Name: Senior Manager, Cyber Recovery Planning
Description: Your business:  The Technology division delivers the Group's information technology and banking operations functions to ensure the highest levels of customer service through world-class process excellence and technology innovation. Cyber Security protects the bank and our customers from theft, losses and risk events, through effective and proactive management of cyber security, privacy and operational risk.  Your new team:  You will join a growing team that develops strategic plans and guides the organisation in recovery from a major cyber incident. You will ensure that recovery processes are communicated and approved across recovery stakeholders and various business units.  You will work with Group Technology and Business Units to understand the implications that major cyber incidents have on our customers and the Group. As part of the Cyber Recovery Planning Team, you are accountable for ensuring effective recovery strategies are in place in the event of a major incident, and help strengthen the organisational-wide belief that everyone is accountable for cyber security.  Your impact and contribution:  As the Senior Manager, Cyber Recover Planning, you join the Cyber Recovery Planning Team, a part of the wider Cyber Resilience & Recovery division. In this role you will be the vital link to key business units, recovery stakeholders, and executive leadership in consulting on complex major cyber incident recovery plans, initiatives, and services.  You will enhance, measure, and monitor the Commonwealth Bank's Group's cyber resilience to ensure the Group can recover from major cyber-driven attacks. By joining one of Australia's largest cyber security practices, you will work with cutting-edge technology and guide large-enterprise initiative rollouts across Commonwealth Bank's future major incident recovery plans.  This also includes: Liaise with business units and technology executives to ensure that the group has robust and ready cyber recovery playbooks, strategies, policies and procedures. Work closely with the Crisis Management, Service Continuity Management, Business and Operational Resilience teams to validate and enhance the mechanisms needed to recover from a major cyber incident, such as alternative communication mechanisms, incident coordination playbooks, and technology assets. Coordinate cyber crisis scenario walkthroughs and exercises to enhance cyber recovery preparedness.. Work with our subsidiaries, suppliers, and partners to understand the impact of a major cyber event on their businesses, the flow-on impact to the Commonwealth Bank Group, and ensure that continuous improvement processes exist to prepare both them and us for high-impact cyber-attacks. We are interested in people who:  Are an SME on technology risks and recovery from incidents who wants to develop their career through working closely with key business units and executive stakeholders across the Commonwealth Bank technology risk management landscape. Through your expertise and past experiences you will be proficient in major incident recovery, business continuity and cyber resilience. A passion for cyber security, major incident response & recovery and being part of a rapidly developing, exciting and critical function within the Group. Experience in cyber incident response or business resilience/crisis management experience with a strong interest in cyber security. Experience in helping lead an organisation through a major technology crisis. Excellent stakeholder management experience and are self-driven. Contribute to defining metrics that measure overall enterprise, as well as individual Business Unit cyber recovery readiness, and work to continuously improve cyber resilience readiness. If this sounds like fun, and you have skills and experience needed for such a role, then we'd love to hear from you!  The health and safety of our people, customers and communities is our number one priority. This means that we require all of our employees to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19. Please speak to us if you have any questions about this based on your individual circumstances. Whether you're passionate about customer service, driven by data, or called by creativity, a career here is for you. Our people bring their diverse backgrounds and unique perspectives to build a respectful, inclusive and flexible workplace. One where we're driven by our values, and supported to share ideas, initiatives, and energy. One where making a positive impact for customers, communities and each other is part of our every day.Here, you'll thrive. You'll be supported when faced with challenges, and empowered to tackle new opportunities. We really love working here, and we think you will too.We're determined to make a real difference for Australia's first peoples. We encourage all interested applicants to apply. If you're already part of the Commonwealth Bank Group (including Bankwest), you'll need to apply through Sidekick [link removed] to submit a valid application. We're keen to support you with the next step in your career.

Name: Cybersecurity Manager
Description: Company description:Deloitte Services Pty LtdJob description:Do you thrive on developing creative and innovative insights to solve complex challenges? Want to work on next-generation, cutting[1]edge products and services that deliver outstanding value and that are global in vision and scope? Work with other experts in your field? Work for a world-class organization that provides an exceptional career experience with an inclusive and collaborative culture? What will your typical day look like?The Cybersecurity Lead will report to the Global Cybersecurity Leader. You will focus on ensuring all business-related software, infrastructure, cloud and Regional Data Center (RDC) migration projects and solutions within Global Technology Services (GTS) and Member Firms include security by design in line with Deloitte Global cybersecurity policies and standards and identified cybersecurity risks. This is achieved with executing the Secure Systems Development Lifecycle (SSDLC) and other risk assessment/analysis processes across GTS and member firms.  Contribute to and execute the Secure Systems Development Lifecycle (SSDLC), including functional and non-functional cybersecurity requirements for all new applications and infrastructure projects. Understands the impact these security controls have on the respective organizations and their ability to effectively deliver client services   Support application and infrastructure GTS and member firm projects migrating to regional data centers (RDC) and cloud environments   Develop business acumen and subject matter expertise based on assigned lines of business, supporting Center of Excellence (CoE) integration and the delivery of world-class customer experience   Perform in-depth vulnerability management analysis and remediation prioritization for Global Digital Application Studios (GDAS) and member firms   Understand design patterns and reference architectures to support cybersecurity solutions and requirements are designed and incorporated into detailed architecture documents   Collaborate with the Global Architecture team for continuous process improvement supporting the transformation to agile methodologies   Contribute to the development and implementation of reporting metrics demonstrating Cybersecurity value and risk reduction across the organization   Integrate threat modelling and attack frameworks such as MITRE into the risk assessment/SSDLC process   Use SSDLC and agile methodologies to identify and incorporate cybersecurity requirements into application development, on[1]prem migrations, cloud-based environments, other technologies such as RPA, containerization, IOT and infrastructure projects   Support review of, and documents new and updated applications and systems from a cybersecurity assessment perspective with a focus on applications, internal RDC migrations, SaaS, Cloud, COTS, and infrastructure implementations as required by the TOM and SSDLC   About the team At Deloitte, we expect results. Incredible—tangible—results. And Deloitte Global professionals play a unique role in delivering those results. We reach across disciplines and borders to serve our global organization. We are the engine of Deloitte. We develop and implement global strategies and provide programs and services that unite our network. In Deloitte Global, everyone has opportunities. We see the importance of your perspective and your ability to create value. We want you to fit in—with an inclusive culture, focus on work-life fit and well-being, and a supportive, connected environment; but we also want you to stand out—with opportunities to have a strategic impact, innovate, and take the risks necessary to make your mark. Enough about us, let's talk about you. You are someone with:   At least 5 years of combined experience in engineering, solution design, and risk assessment in a cybersecurity context   At least 2 years holding a management and leadership role   Proven track record of the following in a highly complex, global organization:   Supporting implementation of security requirements within the systems development lifecycle (SDLC)   Demonstrated knowledge of securing applications and infrastructure systems (secure coding methods, WAF, application gateways, firewalls, servers, virtualized technologies)   Securing cloud-based environments and understanding risks associated with cloud-based solutions hosted in M365, Azure, AWS and GCP     Experience with applying secure application design principles to prevent application specific security defects based on OWASP Top 10 vulnerabilities   Experience with identity management and federation technologies and concepts   Excellent interpersonal and collaborative skills, with ability to communicate technical information, security topics, policies and standards as well as risk-related concepts to technical and nontechnical audiences at various hierarchical levels   Familiarity with network protocols, GWAN and WAN technologies and fundamental networking skills (TCP, IP, IDS/IPS, virtualization, etc.)   Bachelor's degree: degree in computer science, cybersecurity, other technology-related fields, or equivalent education-related experience   Why Deloitte? At Deloitte, we create positively differentiated work experiences that enable our people to feel valued and achieve their full potential. Deloitte Australia opens the door to a career that can cross borders virtually and physically across Asia Pacific to gain experience and access projects beyond Australia's borders. We value difference, and embrace people with diverse backgrounds, experiences, gender identities, abilities and thinking styles. Knowing that people work best in a variety of ways, we are happy to discuss alternative arrangements if the working pattern you are looking for is not specifically indicated.  We're committed to continually building a safe and respectful workplace, where all our people feel appreciated and accepted. Through the creation of endorsed employee-led diversity networks which promote cultural, disability, LGBTI+, Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people and gender equality, we're leading the way to shape an environment where everybody can thrive.  We are proud to have been recognised for our efforts in inspiring change and accelerating progress - check out our careers site for recent recognition in this space. Next Steps Sound like the sort of role for you? Apply now.

Name: Research Scientist & Engineer in AI & Cybersecurity - Multiple Opportunities
Description: Job description: Acknowledgement of Country  CSIRO acknowledges the Traditional Owners of the land, sea and waters, of the area that we live and work on across Australia. We acknowledge their continuing connection to their culture and pay our respects to their Elders past and present. View our vision towards reconciliation.     CSIRO's Data61 is hiring   In 2021 Data61 embarked upon an ambitious hiring campaign. At its core, we recognised a unique opportunity to grow our capacity for innovation by increasing our diversity and attracting world-class talent, great minds, skills, opinions and experiences. This has been hugely successful to date. In 2022, we are entering the 3rd stage of our campaign and seeking to attract more amazing, brilliant, and diverse professionals to our ranks.    We have a range of exciting opportunities available for Research Scientists and Engineers, People Leaders, and individuals who are passionate about science and engineering in the digital and data sciences. We also have a range of opportunities available to graduates; to be considered for our graduate program you will have completed at least an undergraduate degree with first-class Honours (H1 or HD) not less than three years ago.  How we can thrive together to solve Australia's data-driven challenges   Data61 are at the digital and data heart of Australia's national science agency - CSIRO    Working collaboratively with the largest group of digital technology researchers in Australia    A unique opportunity to seamlessly work across disciplinary boundaries and make an impact at a national scale!      In 2021 CSIRO's Data61 embarked upon an ambitious hiring campaign. At the heart of it, we recognized a unique opportunity to greatly increase our diversity, attracting talent from around the world, great minds, talents, skills, opinions, and experiences. This has been hugely successful. We are now entering the 3rd stage of our campaign and seeking to attract more amazing, brilliant, and diverse professionals to our ranks.   We have a range of exciting opportunities available for Research Scientists and Engineers, People Leaders, and individuals who are passionate about science and engineering in the digital and data sciences. We also have a range of opportunities available to undergraduates; to be considered for our undergraduate program you will have completed at least an undergraduate degree with first-class Honours (H1 or HD) not less than three years ago.    This is a fantastic opportunity if you want to actively take part in world-class research outcomes to deliver novel cyber security solutions that will educate and protect Australian communities.    Working within our cyber security domain teams offers countless opportunities to be at the forefront of Australia's research and see your contributions make a meaningful positive impact across our nation! The opportunities that we are offering We have a number of indefinite opportunities available for Research Scientists and Research Engineers within our Cyber Security portfolio at Data61. Locations available across Sydney, Melbourne, Brisbane, Canberra or remote where requirements can be met. Apply now to register your interest to join Data61 as part of a multi-disciplinary research team that will lead world-class cyber security research.  Life at CSIRO's Data61 Data61 is at the forefront of digital science and innovation. Data61 is guiding first class novel research as well as working across disciplines and sectors to apply technologies and deliver impact.    Our cyber strategy is based around the themes of building trustworthy and resilient cyber systems, risk-based cyber approaches, shared awareness, as well as strengthening the human and social dimension of cyber security. We are seeking you to join us and be a crucial member of our cyber security division. We have a wide range of research opportunities that include:   Human centric security, AI collaboration to develop security solutions and invisible security.  Security automation to counteract advanced malicious cyber actors using Machine Learning.   Data privacy and confidentiality.      We are committed to continuously building a diverse, inclusive, and flexible working environment where all our people feel supported to do their best work and feel empowered to let their ideas flourish.  About You  We're interested in hearing from people who can demonstrate the following:  A PhD in a relevant discipline area, such as computer science, data sciences, cyber security, information technology, communications engineering, software engineering or applied mathematics.  A demonstrated high quality research publication history in peer reviewed conferences, journals and/or reports within the field of AI and cyber security, and/or data privacy.   Experience in applying research outcomes to solve industry problems, preferably in the area of human centric security, cyber security, data privacy or artificial intelligence/machine learning.  Proactive and adaptable mindset to handle or direct research initiatives (ranging from undefined to perfectly defined requirements), and an ability to navigate around that and work collaboratively with the client.   Strong oral and written communication skills to produce high calibre research papers, interact with external clients/stakeholder, and internal collaboration.       CSIRO is an Equal Opportunity employer working hard to recruit world-class talent that represents the diversity across our society.  Who is eligible to express their interest  To be considered for this role, you must be an Australian Citizen, Permanent Resident or either hold, or be able to obtain, a valid working visa (visa sponsorship may be provided to eligible candidates). The successful applicant will be required to obtain and provide a National Police Check or equivalent.  Where to from here!  If you are interested in opportunities within Data61's Cyber Security division, and meet the above candidate requirements, please apply to register your interest! If you prefer to have an informal chat before putting in your EOI (Expression of Interest), you can contact Careers.Online@csiro.au. Aboriginal and/or Torres Strait Islander candidates, are also welcome to contact our Indigenous Talent lead at IndigenousCareers@csiro.au for more information.    Who will view my EOI: Data61 Research Directors, Group Leaders and Talent Acquisition are partnering together to review your expression of interests. We are excited to hear from you and will be in touch with you over the coming weeks where there is a potential match to an opportunity that may be your future role!    Reference: 74837

Name: Security Penetration Tester Lead
Description: BE PART OF OUR EVOLUTION          Smart. Insightful. Curious. We are intensely committed to helping our customers navigate complexity and harness the power of technology to achieve great things. Our culture of collaboration and community empowers our team to strive to be the very best at what we do and grow beyond expectations. We love what we do and are proud of how we get things done together. ABOUT THE ROLE         Leading a small team, working with project stakeholders to identify assets and define penetration test scopes - evaluating the breadth and depth on which testing should take place.You will be executing or driving penetration test engagements in a team to identify vulnerabilities and weaknesses that could impact the client. Also, you will be providing Quality Assurance reviews for testing scopes and reports from your peers to ensure high quality and accuracy of testing.Highly desirable requirements  Prior enterprise experience Prior experience with leading a Security Penetration Testing Team Security Certification including OSCP 8+ years experience that covers at least 5 of the following:    Web Application Security Testing Thick Client Security Testing Mobile Application Security Testing Infrastructure Security Testing Network Penetration testing (Internal and External) Security Configuration Review Application Remediation Services/Vulnerability Management   Desirable requirements  Consulting experience At least 2 years experience in Source Code Review in Enterprise Languages including Java, C#, Node.js Security testing in the following areas:  Social Engineering/APT security testing Physical Security Assessments Mainframe Security Testing    WHAT WE CAN OFFER YOU  Paid parental leave Reduced corporate healthcare rates Quarterly guaranteed variable pay Quarterly career progression reviews - we do not limited our employees to the usual once per year reviews! Regular Lunch & Learn sessions Wellbeing and mental health sessions Join a high performing and collaborative team Exposure to the latest tools and technology and the opportunity to work with a variety of tier one clients Team building, fun activities and social events - COVID permitting Free ongoing training and development to help you reach your full potential  HOW TO APPLYSubmit your interest by applying now or contact our Talent Acquisition Partner, Charlee Jane - charlee.jane@ampion.com.au for more information on a career with Ampion.

Name: Coordinator
Description: Coordinator - Cyber Security NSW  About the Role  Cyber Security NSW is looking for a Coordinator to join our Infrastructure Security team in Sydney.  We are looking for candidates with strong organisational skills who have experience providing both administrative assistance and reporting for the activities of technical teams.  Key accountabilities include:Provide reporting and develop metrics on a range of BAU activities and small projectsProvide administrative support services to enable the Infrastructure Security team to complete tasksPrepare and collate information for presentations and briefsDevelop and maintain stakeholder relationships across the Cyber Security NSW branchUphold and adhere to security practices to maintain the security of Cyber Security NSWAbout you  Must have Australian citizenship with (or willing and able to obtain and maintain) baseline clearance or higher (Australian permanent residents or visa holders will not be accepted).  To be successful in the role you will:Be reliable, flexible and hardworking, with the ability to coordinate multiple small projectsPossess excellent organisational and communication skills, both written and verbalProactively manage own workload and tasksBe willing to work flexibly during critical eventsBe able to engage with technical staff and internal stakeholdersHave experience developing reporting metrics, scorecards and dashboardsHigh level of proficiency in Office 365 and common project management softwareAn understanding of IT processes and interest in Cyber Security would be highly regardedHave the ability to obtain and maintain a baseline security clearance and willingness to undergo a police checkAbout Cyber Security NSW Branch:  The Cyber Security NSW is a whole-of-government function located within Digital.NSW in the Department of Customer Service. We are responsible for ensuring a cyber safe NSW. The protection of our systems and digital information is vital because of the many essential services NSW Government provides including health, emergency services, and transport. Furthermore, the exciting digital transformation being undertaken across NSW Government requires similarly enhanced cyber security capabilities. At the centre of this exciting and growing cyber capability, Cyber Security NSW is working across NSW Government to:Create a whole-of-government integrated approach to managing cyber risk and responding to cyber security threatsIncrease cyber skills and awarenessUnderstand the risks from cyber threats to our digital information and systemsSet cyber security standardsEnsure we are prepared if a damaging cyber incident occursOur benefits include:Our flexible working policyDiscounted Gym Memberships and Employee Assistance ProgramsAnnual Leave Loading, development opportunities, training and much more!Salary Grade 7/8, with the base salary for this role starting at 99,431 base plus superannuation  Click Here to access the Role Description. For enquiries relating to recruitment please contact Caitlin Birrell via caitlin.birrell@customerservice.nsw.gov.au.  Based on our current Work, Health and Safety (WHS) requirements, and in line with our Mandatory Vaccination Policy, it is a condition of engagement for a role within Service NSW/Department of Customer Service that staff be fully vaccinated against COVID-19. Successful applicants will be required to provide proof of their COVID-19 vaccination status or have an approved medical contraindication certificate. Any relevant medical circumstances impacting on the ability to obtain a COVID-19 vaccination will be considered. These requirements apply to both internal and external preferred candidates and must be completed prior to commencing in the position. If you have a medical contraindication which may prevent you from complying with this requirement, please contact caitlin.birrell@customerservice.nsw.gov.au to discuss your circumstances.  Closing Date: Wednesday 15th June 2022 at 9:59am  Working at Department of Customer Service  The Department of Customer Service (DCS) is a great place to work! Our values of accountability, trust, service, and integrity drive our initiatives and culture. We support innovative programs in areas as broad as digital government, consumer protection and major public works. We are an inclusive organisation that celebrates diversity and flexible work practices and believe our people are our greatest asset.  Visit our Careers site to find out what it means to work for us.  Our Commitment to Diversity, Inclusion & Flexibility  We are committed to diversity, inclusion, and new ways of working.  The Department of Customer Service serves all the people of NSW and we want to reflect that diversity in our people. We welcome and encourage applications from people with disability, Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples, culturally and linguistically diverse groups, the LGBTIQA+ community, veterans, carers, refugees, people in regional NSW and people of all ages. We strive to be an inclusive workplace where all our people can bring their authentic selves to work without judgement.  We understand that there are different ways of getting the job done and offer flexible working arrangements where and when possible.  If you do require an adjustment during the recruitment process, please notify us on your application form or contact the recruiter via caitlin.birrell@customerservice.nsw.gov.au

Name: Security Support Engineer
Description: Founded in 2014, and listed on the ASX since 2015, Superloop’s purpose is to enable better internet for Australian homes and businesses, by enabling challenger retail brands (including our own Superloop and Exetel brands) to take a larger share of the market, leveraging Superloop’s Infrastructure-on-Demand platform. Superloop operates in three segments of the market: consumer connectivity, business network and security solutions, and wholesale connectivity, all of which leverage Superloop’s investments in physical infrastructure assets including fibre, subsea cables and fixed wireless, as well as Superloop’s software platforms. Hundreds of thousands of homes and businesses rely on Superloop and Exetel everyday for their connectivity needs.Visit www.superloop.com to learn more. Our IT Security Support Engineers are responsible for providing level 2/3 support to our customers of our cyber-safety products. The Security Support Engineer provides a hybrid of systems and networking expertise to ensure timely resolution of technical issues, implementation of our cyber-safety products, proactive consultation, and continued high quality services to our customers. CyberHound, is a Next Generation Firewall that is one of the most advanced sets of multi-layered ‘defence in depth’ security platforms to deliver reliable cybersecurity for schools. Our platform assists to secure a network as well as protect it from ransomware, malware, zero-day threats, phishing and more.This platform sets the benchmark for K12 security coupled with the extensive set of additional features that are part of our Advanced Threat Protection Suite – ensuring peace of mind for school communities.Visit www.cyberhound.com to learn more What will you do?Receive and manage security support queries and issues, providing technical expertise and timely resolution. Update and maintain internal knowledge bases to facilitate a better understanding of recurring issues. Build, image and configure cyber-safety hardware for customers. Contribute to product documentation and identify areas to improve the customer experience. Liaise with our sales team to qualify customer requirements and product specifications, and process technical orders.  Assist with software testing and quality assurance. Proactively monitor, action, manage and resolve alerts. Who do we want to apply?The successful candidate will have:Strong networking knowledge, in areas such as switching and routing. Broad technical knowledge (including TCP/IP, DNS, HTTP, SMTP, POP3, IMAP, XMPP). Familiarity with wired and wireless networking, centralised authentication systems (Active Directory, eDirectory, Open Directory), operating systems (Windows client and server, OS X, iOS, Android and Linux), VMware, Hyper-V, and server hardware. General understanding of MS Office tools, G Suite, hardware, and CRMs (Salesforce). Knowledge of server authentication integration (e.g. AD and/or RADIUS). Experience with network firewalls, and; Ability to diagnose issues through troubleshooting and investigation, and provide an excellent customer experience.  What can we do for you?As we grow and evolve, we want you to as well. We’re progressive. We understand that life exists outside of work which is why we have a flexible approach to the way we work. We’re innovators. Innovation is part of our identity, which is why we celebrate the uniqueness of yours. We’re easy-going. We pride ourselves on creating a fun, casual and relaxed environment. Ditch the corporate attire if you want to - embrace it if that’s your thing. What matters most is that you’re comfortable when you come to work. We welcome diversity. We encourage and seek out diversity of backgrounds and opinions, because we know differences challenge us and help us grow.We give back. In addition to annual and sick leave, we give you the opportunity to spend some paid time away from work doing something meaningful with five personal development days per year. You can use these to help out in the school tuckshop, attend training for your own personal development, or lend a hand to a meaningful charity if you would like to. We stand by our product. We’re confident we have the best connectivity product on the market so we offer our employees free connection to our home broadband service. You have an opportunity to be part of the next exciting part of our journey. What are you waiting for?
