Name: Senior Security Architect (Cyber)
Description: About usTransport for NSW keeps our State moving by providing safe, integrated and efficient transport systems. We put our customers at the centre of everything we do - and we do a lot. We connect people, communities and industry and manage how they use our road, rail and maritime networks and services, and even active modes like walking and cycling. The work we do connects the journeys you take every day.We are a state government organisation made up of more than 28,000 people and we're in the middle of delivering the largest transport infrastructure program in Australia's history. We work across planning, policy and procurement, harnessing data and technology to develop smarter and more adaptive transport solutions.That means job opportunities in metropolitan and regional areas right across NSW - you have the chance to be part of creating a lasting legacy that will benefit generations to come.  Work with one of the largest technology teams in the government sector    Be part of a $700m annual investment for progressive technology projects   Join our team and be part of our exciting business transformation    About IT at TfNSW TfNSW's IT group provides the tools, information and services that enable 30,000 employees to deliver a smart and efficient transport network. We bring the future to our people by delivering innovative solutions and minimising business disruptions, building an engaged and connected workforce through tech-enablement. This is an exciting time to join the team, with a committed annual investment of $700m for progressive technology projects including bots, apps, AI solutions, autonomous 3D mapping drones, cybersecurity and transforming cameras across our network. The opportunity Right now we have 2 new permanent, full time opportunities for Senior Security Architects (Cyber) to join our Transport Cyber Defence Team. In this highly collaborative role you will primarily develop security solutions for designated business units within the context of the overall architecture frameworks.The role partners with Project Managers, the Cyber Advisory team and key peers and stakeholder across the business to ensure effective delivery of security and technology solutions.The role acts as an important link between the business units and IT in ensuring that security solutions are designed to meet business/user requirements while also aligning to the overall IT architecture and security frameworks. Please click here to view a copy of the role description. You will:  Identify, develop and design security solutions and options for internal customers in both a project and BAU context.   Contribute to the development of security architecture patterns and ensuring alignment with the Enterprise Architecture framework and other groups across the cluster.   Provide comprehensive technical reports defining and describing the business security architecture, and the relevant methodologies and activities required for maintenance and support.   Manage complex and sensitive consultations with diverse stakeholders, within agreed timelines, varying expectations, viewpoints and interests.   About youYou are a highly collaborative professional with expertise in delivering Security Architecture solutions, business and systems requirements, and technical design and analysis in a complex and maturing technical environment.You understand business needs through your excellent stakeholder engagement, relationship building and influencing capabilities.  Analytical, pragmatic and innovative, you able to navigate and prioritise a multitude of stakeholder expectations and perspectives and are at home working in a complex and demanding matrix, organisation.You put people at the centre of every decision you make, and draw satisfaction from the knowledge that you're making a real difference working on services that connect people and communities in NSW.You can manage multiple requests and engagements concurrently, and are adept at context switching, prioritisation and working with customers to meet their needs and expectations in terms of timing and quality. Salary and BenefitsThis is a Transport Senior Service TSSM level role.For more information on employee benefits click here. How to applyTo apply for this position, please answer all questions within the online application process and submit a resume.   Applications Close: 11.59PM Wednesday 29th June 2022 We are the community we serveWe are committed to being an inclusive, diverse and flexible workplace where differences are valued. We welcome people of all backgrounds, experience and abilities.We enable our people to work in ways that work for them. Working virtually and from different locations including regional locations, staggering work hours and job sharing are just some of the ways our people can work flexibly.Please contact the Talent Specialist below if you require any adjustments to be made to how you interact with us throughout the recruitment process or would like to discuss flexible work options. ​For any enquiries, please email Christine Stenzel at CHRISTINE.STENZEL@TRANSPORT.NSW.GOV.AU. We're certified as a Family Inclusive WorkplaceOur flexible work practices and policies for parental leave, employee and family wellbeing and family care enable us to provide genuine support for our people to thrive at work and at home.Working with Transport gives you access to a range of benefits that help you balance work with the things that matter to you. Look through our Employee Benefits Guide to learn more. Apply today to register your interest!Find out more about Transport for NSW at https://www.transport.nsw.gov.au/about-us.Take a look at our application tips video series for plenty of great information on navigating and acing the application and recruitment process here at Transport. Our COVIDSafe Measures PolicyAll Transport for NSW workers are required to have: appropriate evidence of being fully vaccinated with a TGA approved COVID-19 vaccine; or an approved medical contraindication. You will be required to show proof of your COVID-19 vaccination status or apply for a medical exemption prior to securing this role.

Name: Information Security Lead (DLP)
Advertiser: Talent – SEEK Recruitment Agency of the Year | 7 Time Winner
Description: OpportunityFantastic long term, ongoing day rate contract (market rate). Initial 2 years approved (12   12) with ongoing potential. Can be based in either Canberra, Geelong or Richmond Victoria. Join a large nationally distributed IT Group in a Federal Agency. Hybrid work from home base/work from home (3 days in office preferred).RoleThis is a federal Executive Level 1 (EL1) involving people management and leadership of the Information Protection or DLP Team, reporting to the Director. The role will be responsible for leading the development of the Department's Data Loss Prevention (DLP) Strategy and delivering the capability to implement the plan alongside external consultants / vendors in a 'Shared Services' model. DutiesSubject Matter Expertise in Data Loss Prevention and Information SecurityDevelop the Information Protection Strategy and support DLP toolsDLP Reporting and SMEEnsure IP/DLP Tool approach supports DLP Strategy, ISM and PSPFLead the Information Protection teamAttend Change Management ITIL boardsEnsure the DLP Strategy is in line with ICT Strategy and Enterprise Risk Work Plan, work closely with ICT and CRO   vendors RequirementsTertiary qualifications in IT and Information SecurityKnowledge of the Australian Cyber Security Centre (ACSC) Information Security Manual (ISM)Experience developing Data Loss Prevention (DLP) Strategy and implementation5  years in Cyber Security, ideally with some state or federal government experience (private sector considered)Experience with DLP Products and Tooling (eg Endpoint, McAfee, Symantec, Forcepoint, Digtial Guardian, Trend Micro)Cloud (Azure, AWS)Splunk CertificationsPeople leadership and project management skills or ability to mentor, coach and drive a small teamAustralian Citizenship is MANDATORY for this federal government agency.Baseline Clearance highly regarded ApplyKylie.McManus@talentinternational.com // 0408 388 680 // 03 9236 7725

Name: Corporate M&A Lawyer
Description: Skills & experienceYou will be a Corporate/M&A Lawyer at the Senior Associate level who would like to take advantage of this "once-in-a-generation M&A and transactional cycle - the M&A boom. RoleWill see you work directly with a Partner who has an in-house and investment banking background - and likes to make a real difference.This role requires expertise in advising clients with strategic corporate advice in relation to mergers and acquisitions, capital raisings, corporate restructures and making investments in Australia. There are 11 partners in the Corporate Group of this full-service commercial firm and you will have an exposure to a number of them (with expert partners in each field).BenefitsA $10,000 sign-on bonus; working with a law firm that has a second-to-none culture; clients trust this firm with their M&A projects, commercial negotiations and corporate and governance issues; friendly and supportive team; high profile deals.To find out more about this opportunity, please contact in strictest confidence Belinda Fisher 9216 9016, 0419 238 458. Alternatively email your CV to belinda@bplr.com.au.

Name: Security Consulting Manager
Description: We are looking for AU Citizens who can apply for clearanceWe Believe in Better! We are a global information technology company that builds high-performance, security-centric solutions that can help change the world. Our vision is to enhance people's lives through secure, reliable advanced technology.At Unisys, we believe in better!  Here, you have the opportunity to learn new skills, apply your expertise, and solve complex problems with cutting edge technologies and solutions. You are part of a global diverse team that supports you, drives change, and consistently delivers successful results.Our associates are at the forefront of everything we do, driving our clients' successes while giving back to communities and making this world a safer and more secure place to live and work.  Our success is a direct result of the work of our people who live and breathe our Core Beliefs. Simply put, we believe in better lives.  Join us!What success looks like in this role The Security Consulting Manager plays a crucial role in maintaining a secure client environment and in meeting our contractual requirements. In this client-facing role, you will need to be involved in all aspects of the client engagement, from the design of the solution to the implementation phases of the project You will mainly be involved in overseeing information security issues in the steady-state delivery of large Enterprise engagements.You will deliver value to client engagements by:Maintaining a Security Risk Register, that maintains the up-to-date status of all risks within the scope of the services to be delivered for projects and BAU operations, the impact on business from those risks, and agreed mitigations/controls to manage those risks.Documenting and articulating business requirements and leading the evaluation of the functionality, costs, and benefits of potential business solutions to meet those requirements.Monitoring and reporting on the remediation activities to mitigate the risks as part of projects or BAU operational reports.Maintaining a fit for the purpose set of security standards that are applicable for applications (e.g. NIST/OWASP Top 10), infrastructure, and Operations.Validating and updating the risks progressively through periodic tests designed to maintain their currency from changing business operations or technology landscape efficiently and effectively.Raising incident reports as and when security incidents get reported via Unisys SOCs, and working with client IT Operations Lead to implement mitigations/controls in a timely manner.Providing security requirements for any new solutions), and verifying that the solution components or designs meet those requirements efficiently and effectively, working closely with the technical teams.You will be successful in this role if you have:Ideally, you will have an NV1 Security Clearance or be able to obtain one.Minimum Bachelor’s Degree (Specialization in Info Security is required).Background in GRC and consulting/advisory interest is highly considerable.Working on the Project Delivery is highly advantageous.Years of proven experience in the Information Security domain.Strong stakeholder management and rapport-building skills.Demonstrated experience in reporting to CISO/senior security leadership is highly advantageous.Adept at understanding the overall security/threat landscape and proposing solutions to mitigate risks from this environment.Excellent understanding of tools and processes used for strengthening information security posture (Infrastructure Security devices – IDS/IPS, FW, VPN; ISO 27001 controls).Excellent verbal, written, and presentation skills and ability to work with virtual teams.Must have a good understanding of IT infrastructure architecture.Must be an intelligent, articulate, and persuasive individual who can serve. as an effective advisor to the senior client security leadership.Able to communicate security-related concepts to a broad range of technical and non-technical staff and drive security across multiple teams.Security certifications required – CISA, CISM, CISSP, ISO 27001 - LA, LI, CGEIT, etc.We provide:Exciting opportunity for someone who’s looking to expand their GRC knowledge.Great platform for someone who is motivated to move into a leadership role.Opportunity to work with a great team in supportive work culture. Please click on the "Apply Now" button below to submit your application.Unisys is an equal-opportunity employer and fosters an inclusive culture that embraces differences and diversity. We welcome applications from all sections of society.

Name: Senior Product Security Engineer
Description: Be a part of a high profile Security ProgramImplement best practice in to developmentSecure the financial well-being of millions of AustraliansThe Cyber Security Team protects the bank and our customers from theft, losses and risk events, through effective and proactive management of cyber security, privacy and operational risk. The Digital Assurance team is responsible for vulnerability assessment, penetration testing, and ethical hacking services. The team provides security leadership and expertise through direct interaction with business stakeholders to enable innovation to the Group and its customers.  Your contribution  You will be responsible for delivering cyber security assurance services for our key customer channels (including Netbank, CommBiz, CommSec, CommSee, and the CommBank Mobile App). Providing technical consulting, application security and testing activities designed to ensure that the bank maintains its risk and security posture at desired levels, you will be responsible for communicating security issues to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.  Your responsibilities Perform security assurance functions for our retail business unitWork closely with scrum teams and project managers to provide appropriate security assurance methods for continuous code and technology changes in your portfolio. This will include delivering targeted web application, mobile application security tests, source code review and analysis.Facilitate and scope more detailed penetration testing activities and when required refer projects to other specialist cyber security teams.Document and report results and scope of assurance activities to our customers, including project managers, service owners, developers and risk managers.Champion security initiatives and new ways of working to ensure systems in the portfolio continue to be safe, sound and secure. This will involve pitching security initiatives, and assisting in the implementation of industry leading secure development practices such as code scanning and bug bounties.Provide subject matter expertise to key stakeholders, including pro-active efforts to reduce the likelihood that vulnerabilities ship in our retail products before go-live.Your experience You will have performed a similar role either as an App Sec Engineer or Pen Tester in proactively reducing vulnerabilities before code is deployed, including code review, vulnerability and dependency management. This could be from a penetration testing, application security, or product security role.Have a sound understanding of web and mobile application vulnerabilities identification, penetration testing processes and methodologies.Have worked in (or with) development teams.Experience in at least one of Android, iOS, and ASP.NET.The health and safety of our people, customers and communities is our number one priority. This means that we require all of our employees to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19. Please speak to us if you have any questions about this based on your individual circumstances. Whether you're passionate about customer service, driven by data, or called by creativity, a career here is for you. Our people bring their diverse backgrounds and unique perspectives to build a respectful, inclusive and flexible workplace. One where we're driven by our values, and supported to share ideas, initiatives, and energy. One where making a positive impact for customers, communities and each other is part of our every day.Here, you'll thrive. You'll be supported when faced with challenges, and empowered to tackle new opportunities. We really love working here, and we think you will too.We're determined to make a real difference for Australia's first peoples. We encourage all interested applicants to apply. If you're already part of the Commonwealth Bank Group (including Bankwest), you'll need to apply through Sidekick [link removed] to submit a valid application. We're keen to support you with the next step in your career.

Name: Senior Associate, Cyber, Emerging Tech and Transactions
Description: We are seeking a Senior Associate to join our premier Band 1 TMT Corporate team in Melbourne, Sydney or Brisbane.In this role you will work closely with Partner Cameron Whittfield and other leading Partners across our national corporate group.Cameron has over 25 years' experience working extensively for clients in Australia and internationally on technology-related legal issues. Cameron specialises in cyber / information security (and incident response), emerging technologies (including blockchain and AI solutions) and technology transactions. Your day could typically involve:Acting as lead associate on client matters, including drafting and negotiating the preparation of proposals, estimates and pitches.Being part of the cyber leadership team, developing firm strategies and client support programs, advising legal teams, commercial clients, C-suite and directors.Advising on data security, cyber and technology transactions, including managing cyber incidents and cyber resilience, as well as supporting all practice groups and industries on "all things cyber".Working closely with other legal teams across the firm to deliver an integrated service to our clients.Project managing client matters to ensure that key deadlines are met, including working closely with other legal teams across the firm to deliver an integrated service to our clients.Managing and building external client relationships, including assisting with business development activities for key existing clients and new clients.Mentoring junior associates in the team, and assisting with providing training to junior associates both in the team and across the firm. To be successful in this role, you will:Have an unrestricted Australian or New Zealand practicing certificate.5+ years' private practice or similar experience in TMT specifically advising on data security, cyber and / or technology transactions. However, we are open to considering candidates with more or less experience.Interest in TMT and the intersection of emerging technologies, the digital economy and the law.Excellent attention to detail and drafting and negotiation skills.Advanced legal skills, including complex drafting, negotiation and project management skills; good people management and business development skills and a track record of leading transactions.Full understanding of law firm profitability and key drivers for financial efficiency; and ability to manage costs and budgets.An eagerness to create an exceptional experience for our clients and value empathy, simplicity and commerciality as we do. What we offer:The opportunity to partner with prestigious clients based in Australia and globally on some of the largest, most strategic and most complex matters, and develop deep expertise across a range of sectors, as well as opportunities to collaborate on cross-border matters with our global network. We also encourage your involvement in our various networks, pro-bono legal offerings, learning and development initiatives and innovation groups such as the Digital Law Group and our Alternative Legal Services (ALT) practice group.We recognise that the success of our business and our clients' businesses relies on the skills, knowledge and ideas of all our people. We are dedicated to creating an exceptional experience for our clients and we value empathy, simplicity and commerciality.We understand that you have commitments and personal interests outside of work and we strive to create a working environment based on mutual trust and respect, in which you can perform at your best whilst maintaining sustainable balance across your life.People join us to develop their careers and themselves. To support this we provide contemporary tailored learning programs, regular career conversations and a culture of feedback.At Herbert Smith Freehills we value flexibility. For most roles, we work an average of 60% of the time in the office, taking into consideration individual, team, client and learning needs.To view our benefits in Australia paste the following link in your browser: https://sites-herbertsmithfreehills.vuturevx.com/20/21553/landing-pages/benefits-in-australia.pdf [link removed]  The team:We have one of the largest TMT practices in Australia, bringing together lawyers who advise on matters relating to telecommunications, technology, commercial intellectual property, outsourcing, media and broadcasting, privacy, e-commerce and transitional services. The team also advises on related M&A matters. Our experience and advice spans TMT in its widest sense.Working closely with our telco team, we have a leading cyber, privacy and data protection practice, advising on all aspects of privacy law, information regulation, regulatory compliance matters, data breaches, cyber security, information security, subject access requests, employee monitoring and surveillance, data retention, and compliance with international data protection requirements.Data protection and privacy: we work on many transactions involving the transfer, sharing, mining and analysis of a wide variety of data sources, which inevitably introduces complex data protection issues, from compliance with privacy law to the consideration of multi-jurisdictional data protection requirements. We help clients manage risk appropriately in any endeavours involving the commercialisation of data and acting in compliance with the relevant data protection laws.Cyber and Data Security: full life cycle support: our global and highly experienced, cross-practice team advises on cyber and data security issues wherever they may arise, and simultaneously across multiple jurisdictions where an incident requires it. We are one of the few elite firms with a full-service international TMT practice. HSF places TMT at the heart of its strategy: we want to invest in our TMT team to consolidate on its recent success and to build for the coming years' successes. Our TMT team works hard to originate the majority of its work, as well as supporting other practice groups.Our TMT team has been growing year-on-year. We are now a national team of 6 partners and we continue to grow at all levelsWe are a high-performing team that rewards hard work, initiative and curiosity. We are also a team without siloes: all of our Solicitor and Senior Associates can expect to work across the whole range of TMT matters, and our partners regularly pitch and deliver work togetherHerbert Smith Freehills is proud to be awarded Most Innovative International Law Firm, Asia Pacific (Financial Times Awards 2019 & 2020) and Winner of the Minds Count Annual Award for Best Mental Wellbeing Initiative 2019. This vacancy is being managed directly by Herbert Smith Freehills Recruitment team. We will contact our preferred agency partners should we require additional assistance. Thank you. For any questions please contact Chantel Forster, Recruitment Manager on chantel.forster@hsf.com

Name: Cyber Security Manager
Description:
Insurance for Individuals
Since Youi emerged in Australia in 2008 we have built a strong brand through awesome customer service, tailoring products to individuals and challenging our competitors to do better. We value both our people and technology, and our IT department of more than 150 passionate Youiers is testament to us taking our tech and business growth seriously. With over 1,700 employees, and gross written premium exceeding $1billion, we have ambitious goals to keep growing and continue delivering awesome insurance solutions across new products and distribution channels, backed by industry leading customer experience.
 
About the Role
The Cyber Security Manager is responsible for managing and developing the cyber security teams and other resources required to achieve the desired tactical and operational outcomes of the cyber security function – in line with the Cyber Security Strategy and Youi’s relevant frameworks and policies.
The Cyber Security Manager deploys the necessary resources to support system and/or data owners in ensuring that information systems are maintained in a secure manner and data is adequately protected.
It is an exciting time to be joining our growing IT function as well as play a pivotal part in supporting the strong growth at Youi.
 
Key Duties:

Collaborate with senior leadership on Youi’s tactical cyber security planning and execution Maintaining an understanding of Youi’s cyber security capability maturity at an appropriate frequency
Contributing to the formulation of Youi’s cyber security strategy, frameworks and resulting cyber security plan (also known as Cyber Roadmap)
Enabling cyber security teams to deliver the defined outcomes of their respective roles
Appropriately managing workload and skills uplift through appropriate prioritisation, delegation and escalation
Developing cyber security staff to provide subject-matter expertise for the delivery of security solutions
Hiring, training, development, performance management and annual performance reviews of direct reports
Cyber security compliance obligations – monitor and report against Youi’s cyber security regulatory obligations, standards, and policy compliance.
Responsible for the execution and delivery of Cyber Security Operations activities in line with organisational requirements
Cyber security incident detection, response, and recovery
Managed partner performance management, detection and response, and enhancement
Responsible for the execution and delivery of Application and Infrastructure (Systems) Security activities

 
About You

Degree in technology or a related field, or equivalent work- or education-related experience.
Professional security management certification is desirable, such as Certified Information Systems Security Professional (CISSP), Certified Cyber Security Manager (CISM) or other similar credentials.
Minimum of seven to ten years of experience in a combination of risk management, cyber security and IT jobs (at least five must be in a leadership role).
Should understand and articulate the impact of cybersecurity on business and be able to communicate this to senior stakeholders.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills, interpersonal and collaborative skills, and the ability to communicate cyber security and risk-related concepts to technical and nontechnical audiences at various hierarchical levels, ranging from board members to technical specialists.
Sound knowledge of business management and a working knowledge of cyber security risk management and cybersecurity technologies.
Up-to-date knowledge of methodologies and trends in cyber, business, DevOps, and IT.
Knowledge and understanding of relevant legal and regulatory requirements, such as: Payment Card Industry Data Security Standard (PCI DSS), APRA Standards, Australian Privacy Principles.

 
Culture & Benefits
We are well known for our awesome culture and working environment and award-winning employee experience programs. Combine that with smart casual dress code, Sunshine Coast location, career progression opportunities and onsite cafes, it’s no wonder why our people love coming to work every day!
How to Apply
If you wish to be part of a highly motivated team focused on outcomes, please "APPLY NOW".

Name: IT Change & Communications Analyst
Description:
Campus Location: North Sydney, Australia | Brisbane, Australia | Melbourne, Australia
Job No: APTAV116066#004

Join a University ranked in the top 2% worldwide and bring your change expertise to a significant cyber security project
Full time, fixed term role (8 months) based at the North Sydney, Brisbane or Melbourne campus

About ACU:
Australian Catholic University (ACU) is an inclusive community which welcomes students and staff of all beliefs. ACU has over 2,500 staff supporting more than 34,000 students across eight campuses - Ballarat, Brisbane, Canberra, Melbourne, North Sydney, Strathfield, Blacktown and Rome. As valued members of our community, all staff members are expected to have an understanding of ACU's mission and values and to demonstrate an active contribution to them.
About Information Technology:
Operating within ACU's Corporate Services Portfolio, Information Technology Directorate is a strategic partner in delivering technology enabled change and excellent IT services to support learning, teaching, research and business functions across ACU. The Directorate is led by the Chief Information Officer (CIO) and three Associate Directors; comprising of: Innovation & Transformation, Enterprise Services, and Client Services.
About the role:
Bring your significant change management and communications expertise to this role to increase the success of key IT projects at ACU, which include but not limited to: a high impact Cyber Security Project (Multi-Factor Authentication for Students). More specifically the role entails:

Change and communications strategy for projects
Developing project communications materials
Collaborating with project teams on change and communication best practices
Managing relationships with project senior stakeholders
Problem-solving and designing interventions to facilitate change
Reporting and data metrics.

You will need to have:

Significant experience working in a change management capacity with complex, organisation-wide projects, including assessing change impact, and designing and executing effective change management plans to mitigate risk.
Experience and skills in designing and creating effective communications materials and tailored strategies for different stakeholders.
Highly effective stakeholder management skills including at senior levels of the organisation.
Ability to work independently under limited supervision while maintaining close partnership with project manager and IT Change Manager.
Creative and insightful approach to change management, able to demonstrate out-of-the-box thinking and identify opportunities to further deliver project outcomes.
Demonstrated ability to lead change by displaying openness and resilience, inspiring others to change and acting to make change happen.
Exposure to Prosci framework advantageous but not required.

What we Offer:

The University pursues an excellence agenda and offers an environment where staff are welcomed and safe, and valued through development, participation and involvement.
A competitive remuneration package (HEW 8 classification).
17% employer superannuation contributions to eligible continuing and fixed-term staff (we provide choice of fund in accordance with relevant legislation, with the University’s nominated default superannuation provider as UniSuper).
Annual leave loading of an equivalent to 17.5% of four weeks’ salary pro rata payable, dependent on your commencement date.
As an ACU staff member, you will have access to generous working conditions and benefits which include but not limited to: Staff Rewards; Flexible Working Arrangements; a variety of leave provisions (recreation, personal, parental, compassionate etc); and salary packaging.

How to Apply:
Obtain the Position Description from the website. Applicants are expected to address all selection criteria listed in the position description and outline how they would support the mission of the university. To apply for this role click the 'View Position Description and Apply' buttons above or below. Visit Hints and Tips on how to apply.
General enquiries can be sent to Rebecca Newton, IT Change Manager, Information Technology at: Rebecca.Newton@acu.edu.au
Candidates must hold Australian work rights to apply for this position. For permanent/ continuing roles, applicants must have permanent work rights.
Equal Opportunity and Privacy of personal information is University policy. For more details visit: www.acu.edu.au/careers
Find out more information on the benefits of working at ACU at: www.acu.edu.au/about-acu/careers-at-acu/why-work-at-acu
ACU is committed to diversity and social inclusion in its employment practices. Applications from Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people, people with disabilities and people from culturally diverse groups are encouraged.
Previous applicants need not re-apply
Advertised: 21-JUN-2022
Applications close: 05-JUL-2022 at 11:59pm AUS Eastern Standard Time

Experience and skills in designing and creating effective communications materials and tailored strategies for different stakeholders.
Highly effective stakeholder management skills including at senior levels of the organisation.
Ability to work independently under limited supervision while maintaining close partnership with project manager and IT Change Manager.
Creative and insightful approach to change management, able to demonstrate out-of-the-box thinking and identify opportunities to further deliver project outcomes.
Demonstrated ability to lead change by displaying openness and resilience, inspiring others to change and acting to make change happen.
Exposure to Prosci framework advantageous but not required.

What we Offer:

The University pursues an excellence agenda and offers an environment where staff are welcomed and safe, and valued through development, participation and involvement.
A competitive remuneration package (HEW 8 classification).
17% employer superannuation contributions to eligible continuing and fixed-term staff (we provide choice of fund in accordance with relevant legislation, with the University’s nominated default superannuation provider as UniSuper).
Annual leave loading of an equivalent to 17.5% of four weeks’ salary pro rata payable, dependent on your commencement date.
As an ACU staff member, you will have access to generous working conditions and benefits which include but not limited to: Staff Rewards; Flexible Working Arrangements; a variety of leave provisions (recreation, personal, parental, compassionate etc); and salary packaging.

How to Apply:
Obtain the Position Description from the website. Applicants are expected to address all selection criteria listed in the position description and outline how they would support the mission of the university. To apply for this role click the 'View Position Description and Apply' buttons above or below. Visit Hints and Tips on how to apply.
General enquiries can be sent to Rebecca Newton, IT Change Manager, Information Technology at: Rebecca.Newton@acu.edu.au
Candidates must hold Australian work rights to apply for this position. For permanent/ continuing roles, applicants must have permanent work rights.
Equal Opportunity and Privacy of personal information is University policy. For more details visit: www.acu.edu.au/careers
Find out more information on the benefits of working at ACU at: www.acu.edu.au/about-acu/careers-at-acu/why-work-at-acu
ACU is committed to diversity and social inclusion in its employment practices. Applications from Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people, people with disabilities and people from culturally diverse groups are encouraged.
Previous applicants need not re-apply

Name: Change Manager/Analyst
Description: The Company   This world class organisation’s brand is synonymous with innovation and excellence. Based in Newcastle, they are recognised globally as leaders and they are committed to an ongoing investment in the very latest technology to deliver innovative and value-adding solutions.    The Opportunity As the Change Manager/Analyst you will drive and coordinate major organisational change management activities end to end to support business transformation. There are two opportunities with this organisation – one working alongside the Cyber Security Program Team and one working with HR system implementation program, this will include engagement with business leaders to ensure strategic outcomes and benefits are delivered. You will work with key stakeholders in the organisation and set out a vision for the future that provides challenging but realistic objectives to address change and maximise outcomes. You will need the ability to work across a range of stakeholders including field services, engineers and corporate services while translating the change for all to understand, engage and come on the journey. There are two 6-month contract engagements located in Newcastle with a hybrid work environment.    Skills and Experience  Degree in Business Management, Information Technology, Change Management or Psychology; or demonstrated experience Extensive change management/analysts experience in large organisations Ability to develop, coordinate and deliver on a change plan including communication plans, training plans, impact assessments, stakeholder matrix and business readiness Proven experience with using a recognised change management methodology/ies and tools within an enterprise scale environment. Desirable: qualifications in Project and Change Management (PROSCI) Demonstrable understanding of project and program management disciplines, with the ability to forecast, plan, integrate, govern and track change management programs including resources and budget Ability to evaluate proposed change management activity timelines to minimise change saturation Superior people management and interpersonal skills in communicating, influencing and negotiating change management outcomes with customers, stakeholders and sponsors  In this dynamic environment you will be presented with an outstanding opportunity to work with an organisation evolving in a changing ecosystem. You will enjoy the chance to lead, collaborate and build strong relationships across the business. How to Apply  This is an exciting opportunity to work with a reputable brand and be rewarded with competitive market rates. Please contact Jacinta John on 0422 336 535 for a confidential discussion or apply with your CV.    If this is not the right role but you are keen on exploring opportunities in Newcastle, please call me directly to discuss the market.

Name: Test Analysts
Description: Test AnalystCanberraNV1 Clearance requiredBe apart of the Australian Government's operational response to cyber security incidents. organise national cyber security operations and resources. encourage and receive reporting of cyber attack and cyber security incidents.The Test Analyst’s major responsibilities include:Conduct software development and infrastructure integration testing where CI/CD technologies are employed.Conducting test analysis, test design, test execution and test reporting activities.Analyse and report on test activities and outcomes and raise, prioritise, and manage defects.Identify test process improvements and contribute to testing standards and definition of best practice.Communicate and report testing related risks and issues to the Test Manager, SCRUM Master and Product Owner.Broad experience in testing complex integrated solutions comprising bespoke components with numerous system interfaces, including testing security use-cases and testing system infrastructure (e.g. network components, gateways, firewalls etc.)Experience operating as a hands-on Test analyst within an agile scrum context using Atlassian stack test design, execution, and reportingFor further information, please contact Amelia Edge on (02) 6113 7533

Name: Test Analyst
Description: FiniteFinite is an Australian owned award winning independent ICT recruitment company that currently supplies to many of the country's largest banks, telecommunications, commercial and State and Federal Government organisations. Finite has offices in Sydney, Melbourne, Brisbane, Canberra, Adelaide, Perth, Auckland and Wellington. The roleOur Federal Government client requires a Test Analyst to work in its dynamic technical team to deliver ICT software, infrastructure and services to host cyber security capabilities in support of its cyber security mission. The successful applicant will demonstrate an understanding of the ICT software & systems development cycle and infrastructure testing with an emphasis on test planning, test analysis, test execution and outcome reporting. The person will have broad experience in testing complex integrated solutions comprising bespoke components with numerous system interfaces, including testing security use-cases. They will be comfortable operating as a hands-on Test Analyst within a SAFe context using the Atlassian stack for test design, execution and reporting.The successful applicant must be a motivated self-starter with strong technical abilities and initiative. They will operate as a peer in a high performing technical team, and require strong organisational skills and attention to detail, and be comfortable working in a dynamic and agile environment.The Test Analyst's major responsibilities include:o Conduct software development and infrastructure integration testing where CI/CD technologies are employed.o Conducting test analysis, test design, test execution and test reporting activities.o Provide input and support to the Test Manager (e.g. to Test strategy/planning).o Analyse and report on test activities and outcomes and raise, prioritise and manage defects.o Identify test process improvements, and contribute to testing standards and definition of best practice.o Communicate and report testing related risks and issues to the Test Manager, SCRUM Master and Product Owner.o Take responsibility for the integrity of testing.o Work under broad direction as a motivated, self-starter.Key knowledge or experience required include:o Broad experience in testing complex integrated solutions comprising bespoke components with numerous system interfaces, including testing security use-cases and testing system infrastructure (e.g. network components, gateways, firewalls etc.)o Experience operating as a hands-on Test analyst within an agile scrum context using Atlassian stack test design, execution and reporting.On boarding is in Canberra, noting there may be a requirement for short term occasional travel within Australia. Australian citizenship and current NV1 clearance are essential for this role. How to apply:Please hit the apply button or for more information contact Fred at the Finite Group on 0402 299 590.Finite actively encourages applications from Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people.

Description: Be a part of a highly organised Federal Government Agency as a Test Analyst. Name: Service Desk Analyst
Description: Company DescriptionIntroductionsAt Leidos we bring together science, engineering and technology to deliver smart solutions to our customers’ most complex challenges. Great ideas are our currency and every person here is encouraged and enabled to be curious, open-minded and confident in bringing theirs to the table - to be inspired by what they can achieve and the impact they can have.Job DescriptionYour New RoleReporting into the Service Delivery Manager for a project in the Cyber space, this role's primary focus is to maintain the smooth operation of multi-user computer systems, including coordination with network administrators. We have an opportunity for a Service Desk Analyst with a range of experience, including:Providing Level 1 hardware, software, telephony and peripheral products support to end usersFacilitating the efficient and productive use of equipment and systemsUsing the computerised call tracking system to monitor and act on service calls referred  to provide documented solutions to hardware and software support callsContributing to the development of procedural and instructional documentation for reference by end users to improve their understanding of the operational protocols in useExperience troubleshooting complex customer issues and escalating to second level teams for both Leidos and the commonwealth where necessaryMaintaining IT documentation including network and user details and documenting records of actions takenAvailability to work between 7am and 7pm, including OT as requiredAbility to create, update and maintain technical documentation.Please note the successful applicant must be an Australian citizen hold a current NV-1 or NV-2 level Australian Government Security Clearance.QualificationsAbout You and What You'll BringA can-do approach to your work, ideally you will have experience in: ITIL - Change, Incident and Problem ManagementExperience using a service management tool such as Service Now or HB Service ManagerExperience providing support in a level 1 and 2 support service desk roleCustomer service Windows admin, including Active DirectoryExperience with Tanium, AWS, ExchangeDefining problems, collecting data, establishing facts, drawing valid conclusions and preparing appropriate reportsDetecting, isolating and resolving automated information system problemsProviding support onsite across different locations within Canberra.Additional InformationWhat You'll LoveAt Leidos we look after our staff. Flexible working practices, great team building initiatives, consistent learning and development opportunities, employee discounts and excellent exposure to a variety of technologies and projects are just some of the perks. We are growing and evolving, so it’s an exciting place to be. Our diverse employees support vital missions for government and commercial customers. Qualified women, minorities, individuals with disabilities and protected veterans are encouraged to apply. Leidos is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

Name: Public Relations and Communications Specialist
Description: Melbourne or Sydney Based-Mimecast is looking for a public relations and communications specialist to harness our voice in the APAC cybersecurity market and to spread the word about Mimecast, help build our brand, power our narratives, and deepen our existing engagements across audiences. You will be responsible for executing the PR and communications plans for Mimecast in Australia, New Zealand and ASEAN markets. The person in this role will report to a Senior Manager out of the Johannesburg office who manages the PR programme in APAC and other regions. Being cross-functional must be in your DNA. Together with the APAC Senior Manager, and you will work closely with the global PR and social media team, global analyst relations director, local marketing and sales teams, and the entire corporate marketing team to help build our brand through PR in the region. Responsibilities: Position Mimecast as a high-impact leader and innovator in cybersecurityWork with the senior manager to develop the PR and Communications plan for the Australia and New Zealand business and target markets in ASEAN. Work in collaboration with global and local marketing team members for the execution of PR activities and campaigns.Development and execution of PR activities through the use of national, regional and global thought leaders through continued relationships with publicationsWrite and/or assist with local press releases and other PR contentWork closely with the PR Agencies in Australia and Singapore Supporting regional and global communications under the direction of the Senior PR ManagerHelp increase Mimecast’s share of voice, power of voice and brand presence in front of key audiences in APAC, through proactive media/ PR / social media / analyst outreach and elevation of executive leadershipCreate interesting and engaging content for social channels, provide local content for social calendar Develop and use the current measurement tools to measure share of voice / power of voice, sentiment, website traffic, etc. Provide required reporting inputs to monthly marketing and quarterly reviewSupport the global analyst relations program, under the guidance of the global Analyst Relations Director with day-to-day program execution specific to the APAC region, including regular analyst engagements via ongoing inquiries, briefings, advisory and relationship building with a set of target analysts.The ideal candidateMinimum of 5 years relevant experience in marketing/communications, PR, media relations, social media or another related fieldBachelor’s degree or diploma in a relevant field or equivalent work experienceProven expertise working on marketing and PR campaignsHave a fundamental understanding of the technology environment and software productsExceptional written and verbal communication skills and a proven marketer with creative skillsExperience working with various social media platforms and measurement platformsAbility to convey complex, technical content in clear, concise and compelling languageExperience working with analyst firms (preferable) Why join us? We’re fast thinking. We go big to reach our cyberattack-disrupting goals. And we do what we need to protect the world of business from getting important (and potentially compromising) data stolen. We never leave anyone behind. We deliver quickly – and outstandingly. We’re big on honesty because it makes us better. We’re empowered by our mission. And if cybercriminals have a good day, we work twice as hard to make the rest of their days a nightmare. That’s The Mimecast Way.Other perks of joining the team!Free leave days between Christmas and New YearsFlexible working arrangements supporting work-life balance  Paid Parental Leave Program Employee Assist Support Health Insurance reimbursement Corporate Social Responsibility (CSR) program that supports global and local initiatives via fundraising, volunteering and community engagement, with 5 paid volunteer days per year & donation matching DEI StatementCybersecurity is a community effort. That’s why we’re committed to building an inclusive, diverse community that celebrates and welcomes everyone – unless they’re a cybercriminal, of course.We’re proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer, and we’d encourage you to join us whatever your background. We particularly welcome applicants from traditionally underrepresented groups. We consider everyone equally: your race, age, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, ability, marital status, nationality or any other protected characteristic won’t affect your application.

Name: IT Operations Analyst
Description: IT Operations AnalystExcellent opportunity to join the ARA Technology team in our North West Sydney office.We are currently looking for an IT Operations Analyst who will be responsible for providing high quality level 1 & 2 technical support to internal customers using a range of desktop, server, mobile and cloud IT services across multiple business sites. Key responsibilities include:Troubleshooting level 1 & 2 end-user incidents within agreed SLA.Maintaining the user lifecycle from onboard through to offboard.Maintaining and administering user access.Maintaining IT security policy across the user base.Installing, configuring and maintenance of desktop, mobile hardware and software.Logging/recording of incidents and requests into the ITSM platformSupport of IP telephony and video conferencingSupport of mobile servicesActive participation in incident and problem management activitiesProvide support to the IT Infrastructure team on project activities as directed. Sometimes afterhours and weekends. Occasional interstate travelMaintaining the accuracy of IT documentationContribute to the continuous improvement of processes and servicesParticipate in alternating shift rosterTo be successful for this position you MUST have the following:Minimum of 3 years’ experience in an IT Operations/Service Desk technical support roleStrong troubleshooting skills, ability to quickly resolve end-user technical issuesExcellent customer service and communication skills (verbal and written).  Practice active listening skills to better engage with customers.Strong working knowledge of Microsoft technologies including Active Directory, Microsoft 365, Azure, RDS, Office, Windows 10. Microsoft SharePoint administrator experience would be an advantage.A keen awareness for identifying potential operational and cyber security risksMultitasking skills – the ability to work on multiple incidents simultaneously and prioritise themStrong network troubleshooting skills; DNS, DHCP, VPN, WiFi. Monitoring. Cabling and Patching. Ability to identify and resolve end-user connection issues.Positive ‘can-do’ attitude with the ability to work as a team and under pressure when requiredTertiary qualifications in relevant IT disciplinesCurrent driving license and your own transport The ideal candidate will be passionate about learning and collaborating with team members not only in the ARA Technology stack but also across wider ARA’s business units.What's on offer:Opportunities for professional and career development.Employee Assistance program.

Name: Data and Business Intelligence Specialist
Description: Do you get excited about complex data, unique visualisations and exploring data to find solutions to real world client problems?Do you want to work in cyber within a well respected scale up?Is working with high profile government clients and major players in the sovereign cyber industry thrilling to you? Salary $120-$140k + super  FifthDomain is seeking a Business and Data Intelligence Specialist to help our high profile government and commercial clients gain data based insights on their cyber team’s strengths and opportunities for improvement. About FifthDomain FifthDomain is a young and ambitious Australian scale-up tackling the global cyber skills shortage. We create cutting-edge virtual learning environments that deliver hands-on training and competitions for cyber operators.Our technology platform delivers critical and up-to-date cyber security content and practical training exercises in a safe virtual environment.Recent client feedback includes: “Keep up the great work, it's always an excellent engagement with Fifth Domain” Why join our team?  We are proud of our people and our culture, and want to make sure anyone who joins the team will thrive.  If the following benefits sound like somewhere you would like to work, get in touch!No cyber experience required, jump-start your career in the cyber industryMeaningful work which contributes to solving one of the biggest security challenges of our time - the global cyber skills shortageDiverse and inclusive team environment – come to work and be yourselfSunny office in Braddon with easy access to public transport and parking optionsHybrid working optionFast paced, casual, flexible scale-up environment - we don’t take ourselves too seriously!Minimal bureaucracy and hierarchy - transparent leadershipRecent staff feedback includes:“6 weeks in and I feel so welcomed”“Just love this company and the people here”FifthDomain is culturally and linguistically diverse. First Nations, LGBTQIA+, people with disabilities and neurodiverse applicants are always encouraged.About the Role We are looking for a Data and Business Intelligence Specialist who can translate our client’s business problems into analytics that our data scientists and engineering team can build upon.  You will work closely with both our clients and our SOC experts and Business Analysts to design insights and analytics gathered from user and customer requirements. You will provide data collection requirements for our platform ensuring the data is in the format required to generate insights. You will also build prototype insights in Amazon Web Services (AWS) QuickSight to report and test with our clients. You will also design explanatory reporting for each of the insights and general documentation for platform users.  You need to be able to gain and maintain a BASELINE clearance to be successful in this role. Key Responsibilities: Translating cyber workforce skills and performance needs into analytics Designing data collection requirements, analysis and visualisation designs, and explanatory reportingCollaborating with Security Operation Center (SOC) experts, Business Analysts and Data and Software Engineers to understand workforce performance data requirements and our platform’s data collection requirementsBuilding analytics in QuickSight, drawing upon multiple data sources, to client deadlinesCreate and deliver presentations to clients on developed analyticsIdentify trends and insight commentary of performance data to inform the business decisionsDesign and develop data models for insights and machine learningSkills and experience: Ideally you will have the following skills and experience.  If you have some of these, but not all - that’s ok, we would still love to hear from you! Experience analysing complex data from various sources in different formats, identifying patterns and producing meaning insights from the dataExperience using platforms such as Tableau, AWS Quicksight, Power BI; capability to translate data into visualisations and infographicsExperience translating client requirements into data collection requirements, and explanatory reports of data visualisationsExcellent communication, presentation and stakeholder management skills, as you will be working closely with clients and our teams to understand information requirements to ensure solutions meet all parties needsExcellent analytical, problem solving and research skillsAbility to operate independently and identify business opportunities for data analyticsExperience working with a Software Engineering teamExcellent written and interpersonal skillsAbility to think on the move and work within dynamic timeframes Behavioural Competencies Applying Expertise & Technology Learning & Researching Planning & OrganisingAnalysing Adapting & Responding to ChangeTick some of these boxes but not all?  We would still LOVE to hear from you!

Name: Business Analyst
Description: Phriendly Phishing trains, nurtures and helps organisations create long lasting employee behavioural change. We’re an Australian-based company which provides security awareness and phishing simulation training solutions as we teach employees how to identify and respond to common, costly and difficult to detect security threats. Our training programs are measurable, scalable and can be used by anyone in your organisation regardless of technical expertise. We’ve joined forces with CyberCX, a leading independent cyber security services organisation in Australia and New Zealand. CyberCX has united the country’s most trusted cyber security companies (like Phriendly Phishing) to deliver the most comprehensive end to end cyber security services offering to Australian enterprises and governments. We’re a unified team of highly qualified, certified and skilled professionals working together on the same mission: to protect and defend Australian organisations from cyber threats. The role   You’ll be responsible for ensuring that we are commercially successful by maintaining a focus on profit and loss, quality assurance across deals, internal management of sales pipeline, liaising with other sales teams and financial management colleagues, and directly supporting the Phriendly Phishing leadership team on reporting to the business. Build dashboards and reports that communicate the results of analytics, including labour dashboards, reporting decks, building KPI metrics and build out daily cashflow analysis and extract, analyse, manipulate, and communicate large data sets to assist in decision-making. You’ll also be tasked with conducting analysis such as variance analysis, financial investigations, balance sheet and cashflow analytics, reviewing historical data, and OPEX analytics as well as assisting with month end tasks as needed and support building the operational processes and capabilities to ensure confident commercial growth, with a focus on the profit and loss. Other key areas of responsibility also included:  Preparing regular Financial and statistical reports for Regions and Functions Working on greenfield projects as required, create new models and engage in innovation, and improve transparency for the Regional Leads Contributing, developing and establishing business processes i.e. commissions and invoicing  About you (preferred qualifications, experience, and attributes) You hold a bachelor’s or master’s degree in Business Administration, Accounting, Finance, Economics or a related field with a few years’ experience in the full range of financial accounting activities. Additionally, you also possess the following;  Skills in forecasting Experience in complex data analysis, and communication of financial information to stakeholders in a way that tells a story Advanced Excel skills and data manipulation ability exposure and or an interest in BI will be highly regarded Able to effectively explain financial terms, processes, and metrics to those with a non-finance background Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, and the ability to build sustainable solutions and processes to meet complex operational problems Strong attention to detail and deadline-focused Strong relationship-building and communication skills, with an ability to build relationships with stakeholders across multiple levels SAAS background highly regarded  What's in it for you?    Attractive salary, employee benefits package and perks (who doesn’t love a day off on their birthday!) Once-in-a-career growth opportunities – unique chance to be part of a high-growth business Work with cyber security thought leaders to deliver world-class services A dynamic, independent, hybrid working environment where you’re given flexibility to do your best work.

Name: Senior Business Intelligence Analyst
Description: Working on challenging and exciting initiativesWitness the landscape shift from Legacy and cloud platform and be part of the journeyJoin and shape a growing Data Warehousing Team in Jetstar TechnologyFull time permanent opportunity based at our head office in CollingwoodJetstar thrives on innovation. We're always looking for proactive professionals to help our business work smarter and more efficiently. You will be encouraged to think innovatively whilst developing and maintaining best practice. It’s an exciting time for the Jetstar Technology team as we evolve with our business and ever-changing industry. The team is accountable for architecture, information management, cyber security, infrastructure and IT operations. We also provide service management functions through managed services arrangements and service provider contracts. Jetstar Technology works across the whole Jetstar business to plan and implement the organisations IT strategy, enhance and maintain our IT services, and ensure seamless and people-focused implementation of new systems.Our Senior Business Intelligence Analyst will take ownership for leading the Business Intelligence Analyst practice, working as part of an Agile BI delivery team to facilitate the end-to-end capture and delivery of information solutions at Jetstar!Key responsibilities of the role include:Conduct and Lead Business Requirement gathering sessions to collect in depth firsthand business problemsCreate scope for Project and necessary artefacts required. Set the correct timelines and expectations after discussion within the teamSound stakeholder management and Business engagement skillsDevelop proof of concept BI models and prototypes to prove solution feasibilityPreferable experience on MSBI StackUndertake detailed research and analysis and translate requirements into accurate epics and user stories with acceptance criteriaEstablish the tools, templates and procedures required to provide a high level of support BI Analysts at JetstarBe the first point of User Acceptance testing before handing it over to businessPartner effectively with our stakeholders to elicit and document business objectives, processes, scope and specific use-cases that will drive product developmentActive participation in product backlog prioritization and product planning processesLead the acquisition and profiling of new data sources Act as a member of the Agile delivery team, supporting the technical and architecture functions with respect to core solution development, coordination of acceptance testing and release management.To be considered for this role you will have:Bachelor degree in Computer Science or related Information Technology discipline (preferred)Certification or comparable experience in an Agile environment (Scrum/Lean)Hands On experience on MSBI StackExperience in generating detailed BRD, LLD and HLD artefactsKnowledge on Cloud technologies(AWS, Redshift etc) will be added advantageExposure to structured and unstructured data technologiesExperience in data testing, reference data management and data quality processesExperience working in an outsourced/offshore BI development environmentApplied understanding of Agile methodologies and ways of working.Our CultureJetstar is alive with a sense of adventure. Day in and day out, our teams search for new places to fly, new ways to add value and new ideas to improve performance. If you love the road less travelled, you’ll love working here because ours is a team who innovate every day, thrive on delivery, support each other and celebrate our successes. You’ll be supported to challenge, anticipate and explore while you work will connect people and enrich lives. We encourage diversity and aim to create an environment where our employees feel valued, respected and enabled.Applications close on the 8th of JulyPlease note: Applications will only be considered for candidates who have the right to work in Australia / New Zealand without restriction or sponsorship.

Name: IT Support Analyst (POS, AV, IT)
Description: IT Support Analyst at Sydney ZooLocated in the heart of Western Sydney, Sydney Zoo strives to showcase a broad range of native and exotic animals using technology and advanced exhibit design, with a strong focus on animal welfare, conservation, and educating our visitors about animals and their habitats. Environmental and social awareness play a vital role in our message that highlights the indigenous culture and human influence on the environment. The PositionThis is an outstanding opportunity to be part of an exciting new zoo in the role of IT Support Analyst, utilising your skills in an area that you are genuinely passionate about. This role will commence as soon as possible. The IT Support Analyst will be responsible for working collaboratively with other members of IT to manage Sydney Zoo’s key POS, AV, and IT systems effectively, acting as the first point of call for all issues and requests.  Skills, Knowledge, and Relevant ExperienceRecent and relevant commercial experience in ITIL Service Desk responsibilitiesRecent and relevant commercial experience in POS system administrator duties or POS subject matter expert responsibilitiesAbility to demonstrate ease of resolving any 1st level IT issues and requestsAbility to troubleshoot hardware, software or network related problemsUnderstands the escalation process between 1st level and 2nd level and above IT issues and requests to be able to hand over and oversee resolution from start to endExperienced in working with IT vendors collaboratively towards an expected outcomeExperienced in building and maintaining documentation for key business systems, processes, procedures, and any other relevant materialExperienced in working with multiple stakeholders both internal and external to gather business requirements in order to propose a solution to resolve expected business outcomesStrong verbal and written communication skills, including the ability to speak and write for non-technical audiencesStrong problem-solving skills with the ability to find creative solutions to unique problemsAbility to demonstrate experience practicing ITIL Service Desk principlesAbility to demonstrate responsibilities managing a POS systemAbility to demonstrate juggling multiple streams of work and projects without impacting BAU responsibilitiesAbility to demonstrate working with vendors collaboratively to deliver projects and other initiativesDESIREABLEExposure to change management and process implementation will be highly regardedExposure to the ITIL framework and best practices will be highly regardedExposure to IT governance and Cyber Security principles will be highly regardedExposure to EFTPOS systems will be highly regardedExposure to AV systems will be highly regardedRelevant tertiary qualifications in Information Technology and/or a related discipline or equivalent experience will be highly regarded Why should you join the Zoo Crew?By joining the exciting Sydney Zoo Crew, you will not only be in close proximity to some of the most incredible animals native to Australia and across the world, but you will also join an amazing team of dedicated people! Our team are passionate, devoted, and heavily inspired by Sydney Zoo’s values and mission to deliver a world-class visitor experience that encourages the community to make a difference, and all with a smile! We are very proud of our diverse team of staff that represent all the different backgrounds and cultures that call Western Sydney ‘home.’ We love the individuality across our team of people as much as we love the collection of animals we so proudly care for. Whether you are looking for your first job, wanting to jump back into the workforce, or simply need a stimulating change to shake up your career, we encourage you to take the next step and join in our vision to make a difference. Sydney Zoo is committed to providing a positive workplace and fostering employee engagement and wellbeing. We know how important it is to recognise and thank our staff for making Sydney Zoo great and we do this by providing our team with free annual flu vaccinations, workplace massages, monthly staff BBQs, training opportunities, and fulfilling fundraising events, just to name a few! If you would like to become part of an amazing team that does all of this and so much more, then look no further… Sydney Zoo is for you! ApplicationsPlease apply directly via the Sydney Zoo Website Careers Page https://sydneyzoo.com/about/careers. Applicants will be required to provide a current resume and a covering letter outlining your ability to meet the above selection requirements. Applications close 9am Monday, 11th July 2022. Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people and people with disability are encouraged to apply for all Sydney Zoo positions. If you require assistance, please be sure to contact us by email to careers@sydneyzoo.com or by phone to 1800 843 966. Sydney Zoo is a fully COVID-19 vaccinated workplace. We will require proof of your vaccination status prior to commencement. Please contact us for general enquiries, including if you have any queries regarding our policy or to obtain a copy of the Sydney Zoo Vaccination policy. Please direct any requests for further information to careers@sydneyzoo.com. Sydney Zoo is committed to the principles and practices of Equal Employment Opportunity and Cultural Diversity.

Name: Business Analyst
Description: Are you looking to join an award-winning, exciting company with big vision, awesome values and interesting projects?Vibrant, fun and innovative team cultureFull-time position, based in DulwichEnjoy a challenging role, rewarded with a competitive salary package About the CompanyBlackbird IT is not your typical IT company, offering traditional IT services. Everyday you’ll be working to empower people and business to soar beyond the clouds! Blackbird IT provide outcome focused, tailored solutions to Corporate, Education, Government and Not for Profit clients. They are all about revving up people’s intellectual horsepower so they can focus on deep and meaningful work. Their approach, no matter who the client, is requirements analysis. They don’t lead a discussion with product or services; initial engagements are all about determining what a client needs and just as importantly, does not need. Put simply their goal is to be recognised as number one for clients to work with and staff to work for. With a team of 45 employees, Blackbird IT is dynamic, entrepreneurial, fast growing IT company, with a fun working environment and award-winning culture. As a values driven organization to be a fit for this role, you must be passionate about their Company Values of Fulfilment (feedback & affirmation, wellbeing, enjoyment & celebration), Comradeship (trust and respect, knowledge sharing & mentoring, communication & transparency) and Pursuit of Excellence (not accepting mediocrity, humility, growth & progression). Who you areYou get a kick out of building relationships, adding value and solving problems. You already have a good network of organisations that you know and can tap into and get excited when you can see opportunities for growth for the organisation to establish and improve existing frameworks to further grow the Blackbird Advisory offering. Picture yourself in the roleIf you were working in this role here are some of the things you would be doing…Working with current and new Blackbird Advisory clients to deliver Business Analytical services.Conducting gap analysis and risk assessments for clients.Running technology road map client workshops.Providing assistance in documenting and executing road maps.Identifying business improvement opportunities for the organisation based on hearing regular pain points from clients that naturally compliment the capabilities and services of the organisation.  Developing project plans and monitoring performance.Communicating back your insights and plans to cross-functional team members and management to ensure everyone is on the same page.Reviewing ways to continually streamline processes and reduce delivery of service costs by automating/templating or eliminating tasks.Continually reviewing solutions to ensure they are meeting client needs and requirements.Updating, implementing and maintaining procedures where applicable. ‘What you look like’ to set you up for successTo smash your goals, you will need to have a blend of awesome relationship building skills mixed with a natural analytical way of thinking to be able to explain difficult concepts to non-technical users. Some other criteria that will help your success include:          A minimum of 5 years of experience in business analysis or a related field.Strong interpersonal and communication skills.Exceptional organisational and priority settings skills.Able to develop on-going rapport with clients and develop strong, trusted professional relationships.Demonstrates problem solving abilities and initiative.Able to understand basic IT concepts.Presentation skills.Able to perform in high pressure situations.Exceptional analytical and conceptual thinking skills.The ability to influence stakeholders and work closely with them to determine acceptable solutions.Excellent documentation skills.Experience creating detailed reports and giving presentations.Competency in Microsoft applications including Word, Excel, Project and Outlook.A track record of following through on commitments.A history of leading and supporting successful projects. Looked on favourably:A bachelor’s degree in business or related field or an MBA.Experience with ISO 27001 compliance requirements.Understanding of Essential 8 cyber security principles. What can the Company offer?A genuinely fun and supportive work environmentSuper cool offices to work from and people to learn fromBB Social club, including monthly activities and annual family dayCompetitive SalaryChallenging and diverse workload  Sound like you?If you answered yes, please click the apply now button and submit your application by providing a cover letter which highlights your experience relevant to the areas covered under ‘What You Look Like’ along with your resume (please combine your cover letter and resume in one document), and answer the screening confirmation questions relevant to this position. For more information, you may contact Kerri on 0402701772.

Name: Service Desk Analyst
Description: About The CompanyAC3 is an Australian owned IT Multi-Cloud Solutions Provider with offices in Sydney, Melbourne and Auckland. We provide specialist design, implementation & management services, with over 700 customers across AUS & NZ, across both private and government sectors.Our expertise:- Cloud and infrastructure- Cyber security- Software and data integration.We've been growing extensively over the recent years, won exciting projects and are looking for more awesome tech lovers to join our family!About The RoleThe Service Desk Analyst will join our friendly and professional Service Desk team, providing high quality service both internally and externally to our clients. You will have the opportunity to demonstrate sound technical knowledge alongside your exceptional customer service skills, providing the best customer experience possible.Further responsibilities include:    Providing Level 1 & 2 technical support either by phone, email, face-to-face or remotely. Troubleshoot software and hardware issues in a Windows based environment Escalate issues to other teams where appropriate Perform user account administration maintaining user access in the various Systems and Software Updating clients on progress during problem resolution. Maintain Knowledge base to facilitate prompt resolution of incidents Working as a part of the after hours on-call rotation (paid on top of your salary)  Essential Experience  2+ years experience working in a Service Desk support role, ideally within a Managed Services environment Experience providing support in a Windows based environment: Active Directory, Windows 8/10, Office Suite, Office 365 Experience working with ticketing systems such as ServiceNow, Heat, Remedy, Zenworks or Connectwise Exceptional communication and customer service skills (clear and concise communication skills a must!)
