Industry certifications a plus (ITIL, Microsoft, etc.)  Benefits  Join a fast growing organisation with an awesome culture - ranked 4th Best Place To Work in Australia 2021! Work for a ServiceNow Elite Partner, AWS Premier partner and Microsoft Gold and Tier 1 CSP partner Strong focus on upskilling with trainings and certifications paid for Work from home and out our office in Sydney's CBD $60k base + super + 3% yearly variable reward + $600 per year phone allowance + additional training & certifications + additional pay for rotating on-call roster ASAP start  CultureAs 4th on Australia’s Best Places to Work list, it’s clear that culture is a top priority at AC3, and we approach business with family values.We keep it simple and live by our four ways of being:  Own It: If I say I’m going to do it, I do it. And I give it my all. Better It: I take the current status quo and make it better. Brave It: I listen, say what needs to be said, and do the right thing. Especially when it’s tough. Enjoy It: I take my work seriously, but don’t take myself too seriously.  We’d love for you to experience the AC3 way for yourself!Note: All positions at AC3 must undergo a criminal background check

Name: Technical Business Analyst
Description: The Client An award-winning Wealth Management Fund helping thousands of Australians provide for their futures. Our client is looking to overhaul their service delivery to provide greater outcomes for their current and future members. The RoleAs a Technical Business Analyst, you will be providing your expertise and proactively engaging with product owners, internal and external stakeholders from feature inception to delivery, into production. You will be tasked with facilitating various workshops in order to gather key requirements, transforming them into Epics and User stories for the feature team's benefit. To be successful in the role you will need the following skills and experience: -Technical project experience (Integration, Network, Data Centre, Cyber Security, Monitoring, etc);Strong requirement gathering skills; ability to confidently lead technical workshops;Strong Agile Development Tools such as Jira & Confluence;Exposure to ITIL;Excellent documentation and presentation skills;Excellent stakeholder engagement skills;Superannuation/Financial industry experience The Benefit This is a great client with a really good culture. You will be joining team of like-minded individuals in the Wealth Management & Superannuation sector who support and collaborate with one another to expand on pre-existing knowledge. Finite Recruitment specialise in Technical Business Analyst positions. If you are interested in this role, or any related opportunities, please apply or contact Nicole Taylor for a confidential discussion on (03) 9617 3905.

Name: Desktop Support Analyst - $450 per day Inc Super
Description: Join a leading multinational in clean energy and a pioneer in the deployment of smart grids, at the service of society and people.    Summary:  Triage issues and service requests from the business to diagnose and determine the source of problems and classify their level, priority, and nature.  Delivering excellent customer experience through interaction with end-users face-to-face, over the phone, by e-mail, or remotely (Level 2). Identify recurring problems and make recommendations for technical solutions. Liaise with Global (Spain) Corporate IT service desk as required. Induct new starters in the basic use of ICT equipment and default applications. Assist in the documenting of procedures, standards, staff How-To guides and best practice configurations.  Responsibilities: Australian Service Desk   Responsible for the initial triage of tickets raised in the Australia Service Desk, monitoring and reporting on the progress of service requests. Ensure support is carried out in accordance with agreed SLAs. Take ownership of user problems and be proactive when dealing with user issues.  Incident & Request Management   Provide Level 1 and 2 Support to staff with network, hardware, software and application problems. Manage escalations internally and/or to 3rd party service providers.  EUC (End User Compute) Management  Responsible to install, configure, test, maintain and troubleshoot the Laptop and Desktop fleet, Mobile Devices and other ICT equipment as needed. Participate in hardware and software reviews and recommend purchases.  Core Microsoft System Management  Support and maintenance of Azure, Office 365, Active Directory, SCCM, SharePoint/OneDrive, Teams and InTune. and WSUS Maintain inventory of installed and licensed software, assign ICT hardware and active Australian users.  Essential Experience Required:  Experience in an ITIL environment. Demonstrated experience operating in a Microsoft Windows environment. Knowledge in supporting the EUC fleet (laptops, desktops, and mobile telephony). Knowledge in supporting the Office365 environment including portal administration and synchronisation between the Microsoft on-premise and cloud environments. Knowledge in Microsoft Exchange, SharePoint/OneDrive, Teams, WSUS, Active Directory, DNS, DHCP. Experience in SCCM, building packages and updating SOE. Knowledge in Networking and Cyber Security. Experience in VMware, CrowdStrike. Experience in ITNow, Manage Engine Service Desk. Spanish (beneficial)  On Offer:  Competitive daily rate Potential for permanent conversation Workplace flexibility An impressive office space located between Circular Quay and Wynyard station  If you are interested in this opportunity, please "APPLY" for the role and submit a copy of your CV. Please take time to fill in the selection criteria as part of your application and please understand that ONLY shortlisted candidates will be contacted for discussion regarding their application responses but please rest assured, your application will be considered and assessed by a real person

Name: Financial Systems Analyst
Description: EARN $100 - $134k pa Package | Base + Super + Accom + Car + Phone Established & Globally Recognised NFP Charity Organisation  Work with Cutting Edge Technologies in this Fast-Paced Rewarding Role 24-Month FT Contract | Based in Wahroonga with Hybrid Work Considered     About The Company    Our client is an internally managed service provider to many entities within their group across the South Pacific region. It hosts and supports multiple services ranging from core business functions (i.e. administration, accounting, payroll) through to aged care (i.e. resident management) and education (i.e. learning management, student records). The employer drives innovation and develops customised software to support the needs of clients whilst promoting a high cyber security resilience.  About The Opportunity  Reporting directly to the Senior Manager (Digital Transformation) the main objective of this role will be to assist with business analysis, technology and process modelling for the selection, solutions design, systems implementation, systems administration (configurations and troubleshooting), and support; across the various finance-related systems. This includes finding and promoting process improvements and maintaining systems and user documentation for training and support. Day-to-day priorities will be assigned under the supervision of the senior accounting systems analysts and will depend on focal projects at times.  About You   The successful candidate will have:   2+ years of experience in accounting financial systems analysis and accounting information systems or a related field Tertiary degree in accounting, information technology or equivalent Excellent documentation skills, experience creating detailed reports and giving presentations Advanced technical skills, particularly with data modelling and Excel   You will also have:   Professional and friendly communication skills for technical and non-technical audiences The ability to work as a team player or alone and achieve high outputs with minimal supervision Excellent planning, organisational, and time management skills Strong interpersonal skills Exceptional analytical and conceptual thinking skills    What's in it for You?   Work with an Established NFP Charity Organisation  Work with Cutting Edge Technologies | Rewarding Role Ongoing Training & Development | Career Progression Great Team Environment | Supportive Leadership  Full-Time Role Monday - Friday with Flexible Hours  24-Month Contract with View to Expand Based on Funding Based in Wahroonga with Hybrid Work Considered  Opportunity to Travel within Australia & the South Pacific  Immediate Start Available for the Right Candidate   Apply today and don't miss out on starting this opportunity as soon as possible!    The Next Step of your Application (Please Read) You will need to submit your resume, cover letter (optional) and answer some role-specific screening questions to be considered for this role. This is an opportunity to impress the employer and set your application apart from the rest! Please do not copy and paste your resume. Your application will be reviewed and we will contact you via email if you progress to the next stage.    Please take a look at our other vacancies here: https://recruitshop.applynow.net.au/

Name: Data Business Analyst
Description: We have an exciting opportunity for a Data focused Business Analyst/Project Manager to deliver our Privacy and Data Governance (P&DG) programs of work (capability/platforms/policy implementation) across the enterprise. This role is integral to the uplift of Privacy & Data Governance as it focuses on the delivery and operationalisation of varied components of the P&DG frameworks. This role is also critical in supporting the business by enabling the delivery of various components of the privacy program as well as the data governance program, which falls outside of the regular operational paradigm. A vital part of the role will be developing strong working relationships with stakeholders across the business to ensure the effective operationalisation of initiatives.This is a terrific career opportunity for someone who wants to further their privacy and data governance, operationalisation and management skills. It would particularly suit someone who:  has the ability to work autonomously, manage stakeholders, and deliver on multiple streams of work simultaneously   has experience working in a project environment, is delivery focussed, and experienced in an agile methodology   has the ability to communicate difficult and abstract concepts to stakeholders of varying levels of maturity   has had exposure to data governance    has experience working/delivering projects involving a significant privacy components or has experience in data privacy PIA's, policies & standards   has experience of working in projects involving important data governance/management components   has experience of working across technology, and cyber security teams   A day in the life of a Data Governance & Privacy Enablement Officer @ Endeavour Group...   Lead requirements gathering sessions, document business needs, validate and prioritise requirements against strategic goals and project objectives   Facilitate process review, documentation and re-engineering to meet project and team strategy, organise and manage small projects and enhancement work efforts   Manage the end to end delivery of the strategic programs by working alongside other members of the data governance and privacy team, work to uplift the group-wide Endeavour data culture and capabilities.   What you'll need to succeed   At least five years experience in a data and or privacy-related analyst role within a large organisation or consulting firm   Delivery experience as a lead or membership of project teams   Stakeholder management across business units   Experience in implementing frameworks, policies, processes, and transformational agendas in large organisations   Privacy, Data and analytics project delivery experience.   The Perks! Everyday Rewards Card which gives you access to exclusive employee discounts across Woolworths, BIG W and Endeavour Group brands (BWS, Dan Murphy's, etc) as well as discounts at our ALH Venues Training and development - we pride ourselves in helping you realise your potential and give you the opportunity to be innovative An exciting career - as our business grows, so do the opportunities for our people! Headspace days - no meetings company wide Flexible working arrangements are encouraged and our norm!   Grow with Endeavour Group Endeavour Group comprises a diverse range of drinks and hospitality businesses including BWS, Dan Murphy's, ALH Hotels and Pinnacle Drinks. We are focused on growing and transforming our businesses to meet the changing needs of customers and we're driven by a culture that puts our customers and team first.  As an inclusive, team-first company, our people are at the core of everything we do. We care deeply about creating a workplace where our team members feel valued, respected and empowered. We are committed to providing equal opportunity regardless of gender identity, ethnicity, disability or sexual orientation. At Endeavour Group we value flexibility, and encourage our team members to work in ways that meet their work/life commitments and support their wellbeing.  We work hard to create a safe and inclusive environment for all, and most importantly, we're all about creating a more sociable future - for our customers and for each other. We'd love to hear from You If you meet a number of the requirements, but not all, we encourage you to submit your application.  You can learn more about working with us on LinkedIn  [link removed]or via www.wowcareers.com.au #LI #work180 Our Talent Acquisition Team and Hiring Leaders kindly request no unsolicited resumes or approaches from Recruitment Agencies. Endeavour Group is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.

Name: Junior Business Analyst
Description: Join a fast growing multi-billion-dollar organisation who stays at the forefront of the ever-changing technology landscape through innovation and end-to end ICT solutions. We are currently recruiting someone of high calibre who is passionate, ambitious, and talented to join our team.  We are offering a fantastic opportunity for a highly motivated individual to join our team as a Business Analyst based in Oakleigh South. As a leading ICT solutions providers and trusted partner of choice in Australia and New Zealand, we are committed to the development of our staff, offering progressive career paths, and a supportive working environment.   About the role:Reporting to the Management Information Systems Manager, your main responsibilities will be:  Project management – independently handle projects or coordinate with other team members to deliver results Participate in B2B E-Commerce website, Cloud business portal and EDI scoping, development, testing and maintenance using latest technology and API Liaise with internal and external stakeholders to gather and communicate business requirement Perform cost-benefit analysis to identify possible improvement to efficiency. Review Change Requests and develop technical specification, manage relevant resource and control timeline and outcome Participate in ad hoc analysis and projects. Provide Help Desk Support to internal staff within Synnex Occasional work on weekends, after hours, and Public Holidays   About you:The ideal candidate will be a team player with excellent interpersonal skills who is willing to contribute to the department goals and willing to participate in additional training and demonstrate the methods learnt to other team members.  Degree in IT or equivalent Minimum 2-3 years’ experience as a Business Analyst Strong technical experience – Experience as a developer or test analyst prior to working as a Business Analyst is essential   Demonstrated skills in SQL language with SQL Server & Oracle Demonstrated knowledge of Systems Development Life Cycle and Agile methodologies Knowledge in Cloud technology is preferable Experience in managing system development related projects A proven understanding of business concepts and processes Experience in developing user requirements, functional requirements and user stories Experience in requirements traceability, test case development and delivering test cycles Experience with ERP system, Microsoft Dynamic CRM and EDI support is desirable Knowledge of cyber security and related security measurement is desirable General familiarity with Windows administration, networking, programming languages and databases preferred Sound communication, organisation and project coordination skills Strong analytical and problem-solving skills   Person Specification  Using innovative and lateral thinking skills to resolve problems and produce solutions Ability to understand user requirements and assess impact on other operation units Ability to prioritize and carry out activities in order to produce quality deliverables within deadline, independently or within a team Ability to provide detailed report in a professional manner and meaningful format to supervisor(s) on various matters Ability to communicate efficiently and effectively with supervisor(s), colleagues and third-party service providers Continuously seek improvement via research or further study Flexible attitude that is prepared to assist other team members in delivering timely results   What's in it for you?  We encourage and support our team members to grow through a fantastic training platform and support provided to boost your career RDO's available Free On site Parking available Option for novated car leases  Employee Assistance Program  Fun engaging work environment - Year round events with the opportunity to meet and engage with the team through Christmas parties, trivia nights, virtual cooking classes, fitness challenges, yoga classes, community fundraisers and fun-runs to name a few!   Successful applicants must have full working rights in Australia to apply. So, if you possess a high level of energy and enthusiasm, then we want to speak to you! This is a fantastic opportunity to work with a market leader in a secure, supportive team and dynamic environment.  If this job isn't quite right for you, but you are looking for a new position, please contact the HR department at recruitment@au.synnex-grp.com for a confidential discussion on your career and our opportunities available.Apply now for this fantastic opportunity!

Name: Technical Business Analyst
Description: COMPANY BACKGROUNDOperating as part of a wider commercial group, this brand has had a hugely successful last few years. They are continuing to innovate and are looking to bring in a Technical BA to support a number of key streams of work within the cyber security / data privacy space.KEY RESPONSIBILITIES  Technical responsibilities including working across large scale security and privacy data sets Work closely with developers and solution architects to break down issues and create solutions that work for all parties Partner with senior internal and client stakeholders to achieve key outcomes Leading Agile delivery practices to support a high performing team Supporting testing, training and implementation activities to ensure successful delivery of the solution Collaborating with digital teams to ensure tech specifications match up accordingly  SKILLS AND EXPERIENCEOur client is looking for an experienced Technical BA with a strong track record supporting technical teams. You will be a capable and experienced BA who alongside a strong technical background will ideally have experience working on data privacy / cyber security projects although this is not considered mandatory  CULTURE AND BENEFITSWorking in an agile environment, you will be part of a collaborative / high caliber team. Whilst there will be busier times, this company offers excellent work / life balance as well as various personal development opportunities

Name: Data Governance and Audit Analyst
Description: We're currently working with a gold-tier employer that is a retail giant known for providing real value and innovative customer experiences. Currently, they growing their e-commerce platform, using data and analytics to help make informed strategic customer and business decisions.  We are looking for an enthusiastic Data Governance & Audit Analyst to work with various departments and teams to harness information and supply audit details to different internal groups. Not only will you be driving improvements in this division, but you will be responsible for growing their existing system in place and driving exciting new initiatives.  RESPONSIBILITIES:  Managing the data governance lifecycle and audit requirements from internal and external audit groups. Driving improvement around technology change management. Working with the cyber security team to prioritise security improvements. Implementing new and improving existing data governance and controls. Work with various stakeholders and teams to improve the privacy and security of the organisation’s ecosystem.    SKILLS REQUIRED:  2+ years experience in audit/data governance roles. Demonstrated experience with governance controls. Strong communication & stakeholder management skills. Implementing data governance frameworks, policies, and processes. Working with large data sets and performing data extracts,  BENEFITS:  Growth and development opportunities Competitive 12-month contract rate Fantastic Workplace Culture Flexible Remote Working (Australia-Wide)  How to apply: Click apply or submit your CV to Jasmine McCrudden - jasmine@sustainrecruit.com #LI-JM2

Name: Application Support Analyst
Description: Yellow Brick Road which is an ASX-listed Australian financial services company with a growing network of branches across Australia. Founded by Executive Chairman Mark Bouris, it is a challenger brand to the big 4 banks and has a strong entrepreneurial culture.Due to the growth of the business we have a number of exciting opportunities available including the role below.APPLICATION SUPPORT ANALYST - SYDNEY CBDAbout the role:                      Hybrid working environment ( Office and Home)Reporting to the Application and Development Manager, the Application Support Analyst will support our suite of business applications used by our mortgage brokers and head office staff. This role will broadly work across, the development, implementation, and support of applications and services.In addition, this role will work closely with business stakeholders in ensuring that technology is used as an enabling in support business operations and strategies Primary Responsibilities:Daily operational support of business applications Support of business processes and data flows Liaise between key business stakeholders and IT development team members to  bridge gaps between stakeholders and the development team in relation to business requirements Testing of enhancements and new features Create business requirements for proposed projects and provide support in the application of Use Cases, Process Maps, Data Flow Diagrams, and Wire frames Lead requirements gathering sessions, stakeholder interviews, group sessions, user observations, and/or SME meetings Potential after hours and weekend work required Qualifications/Experience: At least 3 years’ experience supporting business and enterprise applications Previous mortgage or financial industry experience highly desirable Relevant industry experience or tertiary education - highly regarded Capabilities: Excellent knowledge of client/server application stacks MS SQL Server scripting IIS, Windows Server, SQL Server Experience with delivering software application onboarding, support and training Cyber security best practices Up-to-date scripting knowledge – PowerShell, Python Agile methodology Broad working knowledge working with SaaS products MS Office 365, Atlassian cloud (Jira, Confluence) Azure or AWS experience - highly desirable Experience with SalesTrekker or Loanworks – highly desirable Our office:Newly refurbished office in the CBDExcellent training provided and career opportunitiesFlexible working arrangements within a hybrid Office /Home structureSocial ,fun environment This role is immediately available -we are interviewing now.Please note ,due to the anticipated high volume of candidates, if you have not heard from us within 10 days unfortunately we will not be progressing your application further.

Name: Cloud Billing Specialist
Description: About The Company  AC3 is an Australian owned IT Multi-Cloud Solutions Provider with offices in Sydney, Melbourne and Auckland. We provide specialist design, implementation & management services, with over 700 customers across AUS & NZ, across both private and government sectors.Our expertise:- Cloud and infrastructure- Cyber security- Software and data integration.We've been growing extensively over the recent years, won exciting projects and are looking for more awesome tech lovers to join our family!About The Role  Our Cloud Billing Specialist plays a vital role supporting our Head of Hybrid Cloud by acting as a liaison between key internal teams to ensure the accurate & efficient billing of our customers, and ensuring our platform costs match up with customer revenue numbers.This role would be ideal for a motivated Resource or Project Coordinator with some billing or financial analyst experience and has an interest in technology.The opportunity is a full-time position and can work from home and out of our Sydney CBD office. Further responsibilities include:  Assisting the Head of Hybrid Cloud in producing financial forecasts, budgets & reports for the Hybrid Cloud business Ensuring correct rebates are applied and accurate invoices are produced relating to the goods or services provided to customers Working with internal teams to reconcile supplier bills Reconciling costs and ensuring these correlate with revenue and rebates Assisting with P&L management of the Hybrid Cloud Practice Work with internal teams to ensure resourcing meets customer requirements  Essential Skills & Experience  2+ years experience with billing management or financial analysis  Previous experience working with and IT MSP or ISP would be a significant advantage Good experience with Excel and PowerBI Exposure to ServiceNow, Netsuite and Microsoft Dynamics (or related products) would be ideal too Strong communication & interpersonal skills with a proven ability to manage multiple stakeholders at a time Highly motivated individual with a strong desire to learn & grow  Benefits    Join a fast growing organisation with an awesome culture - Recently ranked 4th in Australia's Best Places To Work! High focus on upskilling employees with certifications paid for Work alongside some of the brightest minds in the industry, growing your knowledge in technoilogy Work from home and our office in Sydney's CBD Flexible work arrangements offered (mix of in office and work from home Salary package of $75k + super + 5% variable reward + training & certifications ASAP start    Culture  As number 4 on Australia’s Best Places to Work list, it’s clear that culture is a top priority at AC3, and we approach business with family values.  We keep it simple and live by our four ways of being:  Own It: If I say I’m going to do it, I do it. And I give it my all. Better It: I take the current status quo and make it better. Brave It: I listen, say what needs to be said, and do the right thing. Especially when it’s tough. Enjoy It: I take my work seriously, but don’t take myself too seriously.    We’d love for you to experience the AC3 way for yourself!  Note: All positions at AC3 must undergo a criminal background check

Name: Test Analyst
Description:
Great opportunity if you are interested in the world of cyber and have a passion for developing enterprise wide solutions. Our client is a federal government agency is seeking a Test Analyst with a NV-1 Clearance for a 12 month contract period with the potential for 12 month extension. The location for the role is in Canberra.
     Role Overview
This is a unique opportunity to contribute to building Australia’s cyber awareness and resilience. The client requires a Test Analyst to work in its dynamic technical team to deliver ICT software, infrastructure and services to host cyber security capabilities in support of its cyber security mission. The successful applicant will demonstrate an understanding of the ICT software & systems development cycle and infrastructure testing with an emphasis on test planning, test analysis, test execution and outcome reporting.
The candidate will have broad experience in testing complex integrated solutions comprising bespoke components with numerous system interfaces, including testing security use-cases. They will be comfortable operating as a hands-on Test Analyst within a SAFe context using the Atlassian stack for test design, execution and reporting.
The successful applicant must be a motivated self-starter with strong technical abilities and initiative. They will operate as a peer in a high performing technical team, and require strong organisational skills and attention to detail, and be comfortable working in a dynamic and agile environment.
 
The Test Analyst’s major responsibilities include:

Conduct software development and infrastructure integration testing where CI/CD technologies are employed.
Conducting test analysis, test design, test execution and test reporting activities.
Provide input and support to the Test Manager (e.g. to Test strategy/planning). 
Analyse and report on test activities and outcomes and raise, prioritise and manage defects.
Identify test process improvements, and contribute to testing standards and definition of best practice.
Communicate and report testing related risks and issues to the Test Manager, SCRUM Master and Product Owner.
Take responsibility for the integrity of testing.
Work under broad direction as a motivated, self-starter. Key knowledge or experience required include:
Broad experience in testing complex integrated solutions comprising bespoke components with numerous system interfaces, including testing security use-cases and testing system infrastructure (e.g. network components, gateways, firewalls etc.)
Experience operating as a hands-on Test analyst within an agile scrum context using Atlassian stack test design, execution and reporting.

 
       * Must have Negative Vetting Level 1 *
 
       Essential Criteria-

Take responsibility for all aspects of the fundamental test process; i.e. analysis, design, execution, reporting and assisting the test lead with monitoring and reporting.
Experience in the verification of ICT infrastructure (physical and virtual), CI/CD developed solutions and client and server software.
Experience in maintaining the integrity of testing and coordinating the execution of these activities.
Demonstrated understanding of security testing and fundamental system security principles.
Experience in conducting test activities within a SAFe Agile methodology.
Experience in verifying non-functional requirements (Load, Performance, Reliability, Compliance).
Experience using Jira and Confluence for test artefact design and management.

For more information please contact Akki Suvarna on asuvarna@talentstreet.com.au or call 0450 097 277

Name: Senior IT Analyst
Description: Who are we?eStore Logistics is the market leading eCommerce and omni-channel third-party Logistics provider (3PL). We are a tech enabled logistics leader, having a strong reputation as the trusted fulfilment partner for our clients which include Australia’s largest pure play online retailer, Australia’s largest online furniture retailer, more than 10 of Australia’s top 50 eCommerce businesses and many iconic retailers which have a retail store and eCommerce presence.We are a team of energetic professionals with a key focus on rapid growth and expansion, through investing in and empowering our people to achieve excellence. The business is rapidly expanding and currently has eight fulfillment centers (FC) across Australia. eStore Logistics has recently introduced Australian-first goods to person picking technology that utilises autonomous mobile robots at its Victorian sites and continues to cement itself as a market leader in the 3PL space. Our business is growing super-fast and that's why we need your help.What are we looking for?To support business growth, we are looking for a full-time Senior IT all rounder who possesses excellent technical and analytical skills to join the team at our site in Truganina to support IT systems and infrastructure.What will you do?Take ownership and manage IT systems improvement projects Administer and manage IT Security and Compliance solutionsMaintain and improve eStore’s security systems and security-related documentation including SOP’s, formal security policies and disaster recovery plansPerform and manage cyber security awareness and phishing simulations and appropriate user training Keep stakeholders informed by maintaining technical knowledge of current IT security landscape and evaluating trendsMonitoring and actioning of alerts to ensure potential incidents are eliminated Maintaining and provisioning various devices including Windows CE7 and Android Portable Computers; Windows PCs and Laptops; and PrintersMaintain Asset Management Compliance for the businessCreation and maintenance of system knowledge base articles for training and troubleshooting and creation of service request cataloguesApply system updates and patch deployments for critical systems and end user workstations/peripheralsOther responsibilities:Timely resolutions and escalations of incidents originated from service desk queue including recording, tracking and documenting all requests and incidentsWorking with external managed services providers on server operating system, backup, infrastructure, system updates and security issuesProviding after hours, weekend, public holiday and on-call support as requiredAssisting in new warehouse fit outs and relocations as required, including local and interstate travel to warehousesWhat skills will you have?Relevant tertiary qualification2 to 5 years’ experience in a technical IT support roleITIL foundation certificate highly regardedExperience working with ManageEngine Desktop Central and Service Desk Plus highly desirableExcellent written and verbal communication skillsA strong customer service ethic, with excellent interpersonal skills and the ability to communicate effectively with your client groupDemonstrated ability to be self-motivated, organized and effectively solve problems.Strong analytical, problem solving and time management skillsAdditional requirements:Prepared to undertake any additional training to complement the operation.Australian citizenship or permanent residence.Australian Driver’s license and own vehicle.Why eStore Logistics?We are an exciting business with a lot of opportunities to gain exposure within a rapidly changing industry. This is a role you can really own and add value to the organisation. This role will give you the opportunity to build on, improve and create frameworks across IT functions, giving you the freedom to make your mark. As the company grows, this position will have many opportunities to grow with us. How to ApplyIf this sounds like you, please press the ‘Apply Now’ button.We can't wait to meet you!

Name: Service Desk Analyst - Permanent Role - Full-time
Description: About Us:Digital61 provides delivery excellence for our customers. As such, we are looking for team members who are committed to quality, are outcome focused, are naturally inquisitive and have a growth mindset. Every Digital61 team member works with the customer at the centre of everything that they do. We need people who are committed to growing their skills and who are continuously innovating and improving the way our customers do business. Our company is committed to helping you broaden your skills and achieving industry certifications in your chosen technical specialty.If you’re tired of being a number, then come and work for a local Australian owned SME that cares about each staff member. One where you can have coffee with the owners any time you want.The RoleDo you have a passion for delivering excellent customer service? Tired of working in a Call Centre? Looking for more opportunity to expand your IT skills? Want to build a career in supporting cloud technologies?Digital61 are looking for Service Desk Analysts who are experienced in Service Desk, and who are looking to supercharge their IT career.Applicants should be highly motivated with a thirst for learning and a willingness to pursue certification in Microsoft products and Cloud technologies.  While the role is predominantly resolving phone based IT queries and requests, staff will have the opportunity to undertake non-phone activities and work as part of a small team to achieve great customer outcomes.Experience and SkillsApplicants should have: Outstanding customer service skills.Experience performing Service Desk duties.Excellent phone manner with great written communication skills.Experience supporting Office and Office365.Good general networking knowledge.Active Directory/user administration skills.Willingness and a desire to learn.QualificationsCertificate IV in an IT related area (e.g. networking, cyber security); orCurrent Microsoft certifications; orUniversity Degree; orEquivalent experience in an enterprise Service Desk role.Clearance RequirementsTo be considered for the role, you must:Be an Australian citizen; andHave an active Baseline AGSVA security clearance (or higher) or at least the ability and willingness to obtain and hold one.Please note:Only suitable candidates that meet the above criteria will be contacted.Digital61 does not accept or appreciate unsolicited calls or applications from recruitment agencies.

Name: Test Analyst
Description: Our large government client is seeking a Test Analyst for a unique opportunity to contribute to building Australia’s cyber awareness and resilience. Our client requires a Test Analyst to work in its dynamic technical team to deliver ICT software, infrastructure, and services to host cyber security capabilities in support of its cyber security mission. The successful applicant will demonstrate an understanding of the ICT software & systems development cycle and infrastructure testing with an emphasis on test planning, test analysis, test execution and outcome reporting. As the successful candidate you will have broad experience in testing complex integrated solutions comprising bespoke components with numerous system interfaces, including testing security use-cases.  This role will see the successful candidate comfortable operating as a hands-on Test Analyst within a SAFe context using the Atlassian stack for test design, execution, and reporting. The successful applicant must be a motivated initiative-taker with strong technical abilities and initiative, along with the ability to operate as a peer in a high performing technical team, and possess strong organisational skills, attention to detail, and be comfortable working in a dynamic and agile environment.  The Test Analyst’s major responsibilities include:Conduct software development and infrastructure integration testing where CI/CD technologies are employed.Conducting test analysis, test design, test execution and test reporting activities.Provide input and support to the Test Manager (e.g., to Test strategy/planning).Analyse and report on test activities and outcomes and raise, prioritise, and manage defects.Identify test process improvements and contribute to testing standards and definition of best practice.Communicate and report testing related risks and issues to the Test Manager, SCRUM Master and Product Owner.Take responsibility for the integrity of testing.Work under broad direction as a motivated, self-starter.Key knowledge or experience required include:Broad experience in testing complex integrated solutions comprising bespoke components with numerous system interfaces, including testing security use-cases and testing system infrastructure (e.g., network components, gateways, firewalls etc.)Experience operating as a hands-on Test analyst within an agile scrum context using Atlassian stack test design, execution and reporting.Working ArrangementsSuccessful candidates will normally work 5 days per week (estimated 40-hour week).On boarding is in Canberra, noting there may be a requirement for short term occasional travel within Australia.Successful applicants are required to undertake an Organisational Suitability Assessment (OSA) during the first year of their engagement.Location of work: Canberra, ACTLength of contract: 12 monthsContract Extensions: 2 x 6 monthsSecurity Requirements: Due to the nature of this role, we require a minimum-Security Clearance of Negative Vetting 1 (NV1).  How to Apply:Please upload your resume to apply. Please note you will need to complete selection criteria to complete this application process. We will be in touch with instructions for suitably skilled candidates.Applications close Friday 1 July 2022.For further information please contact Vicky on 0480 002 459.

Name: Service Desk Analyst
Description: About usFounded in 2014, Penten is a multi-award winning global technology leader in cyber solutions for government and defence. Our mission is to deliver new Defence and security technologies for the future fight. We work with exclusive clients to solve the hardest cyber challenges of tomorrow, and support complex transformations in the digital age. We have a rapidly growing team, led by a passionate executive team with extensive expertise in cyber security, ICT, engineering, communications and Defence.About the roleWe are looking for service desk analysts (level 1) who will be providing technical assistance for our suite of products. There are both short term contracts and ongoing opportunities available. You will be responsible for answering queries and addressing initial system and user issues in a timely and professional manner. Your role will also include training users on basic system and device functions, understanding and proactively maintaining daily system performance and IT maintenance tasks associated with networked devices and applications.Key Responsibilities:How you communicate in this role is important, we value how we treat our clients and you will be engaging with them on a regular basis, you will be:An initial customer support agent for many end-user queries.A resolver of service incidents, aiming to minimise disruptions, and meet agreed performance targets.Developing, editing, and maintaining IT support documents.Pursuing improvement processes to better support end-users and the company service objectives.Configuring and supporting client smart phones.Work through client questions, troubleshoot, monitor the gateway and other tasks as requiredAbout youYou will need:High level communications skills and be customer focusedExperience in IT Service Desk operations and incident management processes Experience in troubleshooting network environments and supporting mobile devices and applications.Be reliable, honest and enthusiasticTo take initiative and have the ability to problem solveAbility to write work instructions, processes and SOPs for the teamProvide high quality customer service and incident management for productsWork under minimal supervision and manage rapidly changing prioritiesBe part of a 24x7 shift roster which requires weekend and night workAn active Negative Vetting Level 2 (NV2) Security ClearanceOur Culture What’s important to us is pretty simple: you, the work we do and who we do it for.  We know that the job you do is only part of who you are, so in the time you spend with us you will feel connected, empowered and enabled. You’ll find a place where your opinion matters, your contribution is valued, and your uniqueness is celebrated. A workplace that is diverse, equitable and inclusive, representative of various backgrounds, perspectives and skills. As for the work you will do? It is important, exciting, challenging and consistently ground-breaking, helping to shape a safer future for all of us. You’ll build things that didn’t exist, and you’ll do it at pace, with plenty of space to collectively test, fail and reflect.  And the learning never stops, with formal and informal professional and personal development only ever a conversation away. Due to the sensitive nature of what we do, a positive security culture is essential, but this doesn’t stop us from having fun. When you join us, you will find a workplace that is energetic, friendly, rewarding, exciting, supportive and only mildly obsessed with cake. Benefits We know that everyone has diverse needs and circumstances, which is why we make it easy to access a range of generous and personalised benefits. These are designed to support your unique life stage, responsibilities, aspirations, and ways of working - ensuring you can achieve your best in a way that works for you.  26 weeks paid parental leave, inclusive of all genders, locations, family structures or circumstances Unlimited sick, carers and domestic violence leave, because the health and safety of you and your loved ones comes first Unlimited reservists leave to support your military commitments Learning and development opportunities to help you grow professionally and personally. Free onsite parking at our premises in Braddon Penten embraces diversity and equal opportunity in a serious way. We are committed to building a team that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. The more inclusive we are, the better our work will be.For more information or assistance with the application process, contact Kirsty Spence, People Partner on 0477684479 or via email: pentenhr@penten.com

Name: Multiple Test Analysts NV1
Description: 12 Month Contract + 2 x 12 Month Extension Option NV1 Clearance Required $110 - $130 per hour Inc Super Our Client, a large Federal Government Agency located in Brindabella Business Park in Canberra is seeking to engage multiple Test Analysts to join their team for a long term contract opportunity.  This is a unique opportunity to contribute to building Australia’s cyber awareness and resilience. Our Client requires a Test Analyst to work in its dynamic technical team to deliver ICT software, infrastructure and services to host cyber security capabilities in support of its cyber security mission. The succesful candidate will have the following:Demonstrated understanding of the ICT software & systems development cycle and infrastructure testing with an emphasis on test planning, test analysis, test execution and outcome reporting. Broad experience in testing complex integrated solutions comprising bespoke components with numerous system interfaces, including testing security use-cases. Comfortable operating as a hands-on Test Analyst within a SAFe context using the Atlassian stack for test design, execution and reporting. A motivated self-starter with strong technical abilities and initiative. Operate as a peer in a high performing technical team, and require strong organisational skills and attention to detail, and be comfortable working in a dynamic and agile environment. The Test Analyst’s major responsibilities include: Conduct software development and infrastructure integration testing where CI/CD technologies are employed. Conducting test analysis, test design, test execution and test reporting activities. Provide input and support to the Test Manager (e.g. to Test strategy/planning). Analyse and report on test activities and outcomes and raise, prioritise and manage defects. Identify test process improvements, and contribute to testing standards and definition of best practice. o Communicate and report testing related risks and issues to the Test Manager, SCRUM Master and Product Owner. Take responsibility for the integrity of testing. Work under broad direction as a motivated, self-starter. For a copy of the full position description including application instructions, please get in touch with Alison at the Recruitment Hive by clicking the Apply for this Job button, or calling (02)6299 1006.Please note this opportunity requires a minimum NV1 Clearance to apply.

Name: Change Analyst
Description: Join a large global organisation that has been around since the eighteen hundreds! An innovative company that takes care of its staff whilst striving for greatness. Contract role until January 2023 with the view of extension $800-960 per day + superThis position is part of the Identity and Security Program Management team and plays a key role in ensuring the program’s success. The role will assist the Program OCM Lead to execute change management and operational readiness strategies and plans.The key outcomes expected from this contractor are:  Work closely with Program Management team and OCM Lead to support the delivery and coordination of organisational change and operational readiness activities of the Identity and Security Program and key projects Build and maintain strong relationships with key stakeholders  Assist and support communications across program and in-flight projects for consistency Drive deployment and change adoption into the organisation Closely collaborate with OCM teams from related in-flight mobility projects to develop centralised program view of change impacts and key stakeholders  Key Consultant Criteria:  Change management experience including change management planning, benefits realisation, change adoption, change impact assessment, business readiness Excellent planning and organising skills in managing and executing multiple concurrent workstreams of change with ability to set priorities and meet deadlines to ensure timely delivery of business outcomes.  Highly Desirable skills/specialities:  PROSCI Change Management certification or similar qualification Experience with IT Service Management and/or Cyber security projects  This position is an immediate start and requires checks to clear before they can start on-site.Next Steps This is for an immediate start so do not delay APPLY now below, or email krystal@nbridge.com.au for further information.Krystal Aul | 0403 320 891Suite 604, 3 Spring Street, Sydney, NSW, 2000For this and other opportunities please visit http://www.northbridgerecruitment.com/“We encourage people with disabilities and from other diverse backgrounds to apply. We do not discriminate based on disability.”Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted. SPONSORSHIP IS NOT AVAILABLE for this role. Australian PR or Citizenship is required

Name: Application Security Engineer
Description: Application Security EngineerMelbourne$170k   Super2 days in office and 3 remote.Having closely partnered with a Service-based Software Company, Opus can present a great opportunity for an Application Security Engineer to join the expanding cyber security team.With a newly appointed Security Director in place and growth across all tech departments ongoing, right now is the best time to join the team as one of their first major Security hires.As the Application Security Engineer you will work closely with the Product Engineering & Architecture teams and must be able to demonstrate how you have previously played a seminal part in developing and automating a secure, robust software development function. You must be comfortable building standards around vulnerability scanning, monitoring, logging, emerging application security threats and vulnerabilities as well as implementing solutions to fix these weak points.Key Responsibilities:Work with the Architecture team to design new solutions and provide technical security inputSecure coding and secure code reviewSecurity tooling for CI/CD pipelines and initiatives such as securing IAC, SLSA.Performing technical risk assessments to identify vulnerabilities and areas of concern with the software products, and assessing these products against industry standards such as OWASP ASVS.Support the GRC Analyst when responding to audits including PCI DSS, SOC-2 and ISO 27001.This company have a great benefits package, including, but not limited to: 25 days holidays, weekly team lunches, a dedicated Fun Advisory Board, massive flexibility around your personal and family life, funky office setting complete with table tennis and games consoles!My client is reviewing C.Vs this week, and I have interview availability over the next 2 weeks. To be considered please get in touch.Laurie Culas laurie.culas@opusrs.com.auApplication Security Engineer - Melbourne. $170k   Super.

Name: Technical Business Analyst - Privileged Access Management (PAM)
Description:
Exciting opportunity for an experienced Technical Business Analyst to join a diverse and innovative team responsible for developing and maintaining systems that underpin our Privileged Access Management (PAM) processes and controls.
You will join our Privileged Access Management (PAM) team, which is part of the broader Identity and Cyber Security department within the wider Technology division.  The department is focused on preparing for, protecting against, and responding to Cyber Security events.
Your key responsibilities will include:

Gather, validate and document business requirements, user stories and delivery tasks
Collaborate with Product Owners to discover and understand customer needs and challenges, and support increment planning activities
Analyse data and create visualisations to support business decisions and identify improvement opportunities
Identify business impacts, risks, issues and dependencies of existing and proposed solutions
Help Product Owners to measure and communicate value delivered, as well as, support business transition and change management activities

You will bring the following technical experience:

Experienced in working as a Business Analyst on technical projects in an Agile environment
Highly analytical and strong problem solving skills, with good attention to detail and proficient in gathering and documenting requirements
Excellent communication (both written and verbal) and relationship management skills to influence and negotiate with diverse stakeholders.
Adept in engaging, collaborating, and communicating with both technical and non-technical colleagues, across different offices and time zones
Self-managing, proactive, able to work with minimal supervision
Positive attitude and highly self-motivated, with a strong drive to succeed and deliver at a high quality
Familiarity with PAM and/or Identity Access Management (IAM) domain and concepts is desirable.
Knowledge or experience with PAM products (e.g. CyberArk, BeyondTrust, HashiCorp) is desirable.

To join our passionate technology team, apply online via the link. 
Find out more about Macquarie careers at http://www.macquarie.com/careers [link removed] 
About the Corporate Operations Group
The Corporate Operations Group brings together specialist support services in Digital Transformation & Data, Technology, Operations, Human Resources, Business Services, Business Improvement & Strategy, and the Macquarie Group Foundation. We deliver service excellence to ensure Macquarie is open for business, deliver on transformational change, invest in our people and have deep relationships with our customers.
Our commitment to Diversity and Inclusion 
The diversity of our people is one of our greatest strengths, and in combination with our inclusive environment, it enables us to deliver innovative and sustainable outcomes for our people, clients, shareholders and communities. From day one, you'll be encouraged to be yourself and supported to perform at your best. If our purpose of ‘empowering people to innovate and invest for a better future’ is as inspiring to you as it is to us, please apply. With the right technology, support and resources, our people can work in a range of flexible ways.
We are committed to providing a working environment that embraces and values diversity and inclusion. We encourage candidates to speak with a member of our recruitment team if you require adjustments to our recruitment process to support you, and the type of working arrangements that would help you thrive.

Name: ServiceNow Business Analyst
Description: AC3 are currently hiring a ServiceNow Business Analyst to join our growing ServiceNow practice. AC3’s ServiceNow practice is a true success story within the business having grown from 0-35 people in the last 3 years.AC3 is a company built on Culture and this is backed up by being awarded #4 Best Place to Work in 2021. Despite the challenging conditions we are proud to say we didn’t make anyone redundant and continued to grow.Culture is key and this is best described by our company values:Own it - If I say I’m going to do it, I do it. And I give it my allBetter it - I take the current status quo and make it better. Brave it - I listen, say what needs to be said, and do the right thing. Especially when it’s toughEnjoy it - I take my work seriously, but don’t take myself too seriously.Benefits  Fully Flexible working environment (WFH, WFO, even work from overseas when visiting family) Family friendly work culture Genuine investment in training and development  About UsAC3 is an Australian and New Zealand IT Managed Services Provider (MSP), working across Cloud, Infrastructure and DevOps, Cyber Security, Apps and Data and ServiceNow.350 people, $200m revenue, and we are proud to say we didn't make anyone redundant throughout COVID and we have continued to grow.Fully flexible working environment, we have offices in Sydney, Melbourne, or Auckland.About you  At least eight years’ experience in a business analysis role within IT Service Management (ITSM) Proven ability leading in large scale transformation in the Public/Private Sector or large commercial enterprise. Broad experience executing projects under various project methodologies (Agile, Waterfall, Hybrid, vendor frameworks etc.) Extensive experience in IT Service Management, ServiceNow and/or other ITSM applications Proven ability to contribute to business cases, undertake research and evaluate balancing/competing options to provide business recommendations. Experience in contributing to solution design with Engineering & Solution Architecture functions for complex solutions Experience in contributing to inform organisational change management efforts  If you like what you read and you're looking for a new challenge we would love to hear from you.

Name: Combat Systems Operability Functional Analyst
Description: About usSaab Australia is a defence, security and cyber solutions provider, specialising in the development and integration of major defence and security systems. For over 30 years in Australia, we have built a reputation for delivering complex systems integration projects that provide proven and advanced capabilities to keep us ahead of today's challenges. From combat, communications, security and underwater systems, to mixed reality, cyber security and deployable health solutions, our extensive portfolio of products and services provide high-technology solutions for defence forces and civil industries across the globe. Apply today to join our crew and deliver solutions with purpose.  The roleAs part of Saab's role on the Hunter Class Frigate Program, the Combat Systems Operability Functional Analyst will play a key role in furthering the development of the Hunter Class Combat System. This will entail analysis of Royal Australian Navy (RAN) requirements and Navy Mission Essential Tasks against Hunter Class Frigate (HCF) design solutions, compartment physical arrangements and system configurations is required to support delivery of Operability Statements (OPSTATs). Further, the successful candidate will:Conduct role and activity analysis of RAN requirements and Navy Mission Essential Tasks to inform system design solutions and physical implementation.Identify and describe the relationships between operational activities and system engineering solutions, system functions and physical locations of equipment within compartments,Provide SME support to IPT Model Based System Engineering personnel in the development of CS architecture diagrams and use cases,Author the modification of T26 OPSTATs to correctly describe the Evolutions, Systems and Compartments on the HCF,Author new Combat System OPSTATs to correctly describe the Evolutions, Systems and Compartments on the HCF,Attend Working Groups and engage with HCF engineers to provide SME advice and identify and document key System and Compartment features of the HCF for inclusion in OPSTATs, andAid the interactive design reviews of compartments highlighting features and ensuring consistency with the content of the OPSTAT and the compartment design.Conduct Visualisation Suite presentations to Commonwealth representatives and other key stake holders to demonstrate design elements which support operational outcomes. Flexible work arrangements such as hybrid work from home / office, 9 day fortnight and part time (0.8 FTE minimum) will be considered for this role. About youYour skills and experience will include:Considerable experience as a Combat System Operator/Supervisor/Manager in the RAN.Considerable operational experience with Maritime combat systems.Proven ability in internal and external stakeholder management, including with the customer (CASG, DST Group and RAN).Demonstrated knowledge of RAN operations and doctrine.Demonstrated knowledge in at least one of the CS domains, e.g. Air Warfare, Surface Warfare, ASW, etc.Demonstrated user/operator knowledge of the sensor/weapon fit on RAN Major Fleet Units.As Defence security clearance is required for this role, applicants must be Australian citizens and eligible to obtain and maintain an NV1 clearance.  Culture and benefitsWe employ over 600 Australians and are committed to fostering a culture of excellence and enriching the employee experience. By joining Saab, you'll be a part of a collaborative and supportive organisation, where your professional growth and work-life balance are emphasised. You'll work within an innovative and vibrant workplace, while having the opportunity to develop a long-term, fulfilling career. For further information about at career at Saab, visit the page adjacent: https://www.saab.com/markets/australia/careers/saab-life [link removed]  ApplicationsClick 'Apply' to submit your CV and cover letter in support of your application. You may contact our careers team at careers.mailbox@au.saabgroup.com for a copy of the full position description. Kindly observe that this is an ongoing recruitment process and in exceptional circumstances, the position might be filled before the closing date of the advertisement. We encourage applications as early as possible to avoid disappointment. Saab Australia is an Equal Opportunity Employer and encourages Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islanders to apply. We also welcome applications from individuals with culturally diverse backgrounds.   Saab Australia is a proud supporter of the Veterans' Employment Program and welcomes the interest of ex-service members, veterans and their families.

Name: Principal Business Analyst, eHealth Queensland
Description:
The role: Cyber Security Program require a Principal Business Analyst to lead, manage and undertake the review, gap and impact analysis, documentation of current state and future state business processes, services and roles and lead the establishment of the new service, including support and transition to business-as-usual within a large and complex Information Management (IM)/Information Communication Technology (ICT) environment, ensuring the delivery of valued, integrated and effective business solutions to program/project(s).
Are you right for this role?To be successful in this role, you must have demonstrated experience leading and managing business analysis activities within IM/ICT projects preferably in the health care industry.
You will also have proven experience leading business process modelling activities for large organisations, preferably using Business Process Modelling Notation (BPMN). A high level of knowledge of and the ability to provide advice on the application of appropriate business analysis techniques, methodologies and tools preferably aligned with Business Analysis Body of Knowledge Version 3.0 (BABOK) is essential.
You will have the proven ability to lead, manage and mentor a multi-disciplinary team, developing effective working relationships with team members and stakeholders including mentoring other business analysts within the organisation. Proven effective consultation, facilitation, written and oral communication skills for use in a project environment is essential.
About Digital Solutions Delivery Branch- eHealth Queensland:The Digital Solutions Delivery Branch is Queensland Health's trusted partner and advisor for digital health project delivery excellence. The branch includes three units;

Digital Solution and Technology
Digital Health and Business Solutions and
Digital Solution Delivery Services.

The core function of the branch is to ensure successful delivery of major IT projects and initiatives to our customers across Queensland Health for the benefit of all Queenslanders. This function is absolutely critical to eHealth Queensland realising its overall vision, which is to 'advance healthcare through digital innovation'.
As an integral part of our professional project delivery team, each branch team member puts the customer at the centre of everything they do and to actively seek out solutions that will help eHealth Queensland deliver on its targets.
eHealth Queensland is one of the largest Information Communication Technology operations in the state. It is responsible for ensuring the smooth operation of information systems and technologies so that Queensland Health employees and health providers have access to information that supports the delivery of health care.
Benefits of working with eHealth Queensland:By joining eHealth Queensland, you will work within a fast-paced, challenging and supportive environment where every employee plays a critical role in our ongoing success.
You will enjoy a variety of benefits, including:

Competitive salary + generous superannuation and leave loading
Flexible working arrangements
Diverse work culture
Career training and development

To apply for this exciting opportunity, submit your resume and cover letter (maximum two pages) online today.

Name: Business Analyst
Description: The Company    This world class organisation’s brand is synonymous with innovation and excellence. Based in Newcastle, they are recognised globally as leaders and they are committed to an ongoing investment in the very latest technology to deliver innovative and value-adding solutions.    The Opportunity    The Business Analyst is responsible for liaising between ICT and the business units to identify and analyse opportunities for improvement in processes and systems. They provide an end-to-end business analysis function and support the delivery of projects across the organisation. All while ensuring outcomes are fit for purpose and support the operational and corporate needs of the business.    You will plan and facilitate workshops with stakeholders and SMEs to identify requirements and develop technical and functional specifications. The role will require you to support the assigned project activities through end-to-end delivery within specified timelines and budgets while reporting on issues and risks. Critical to this role will be your ability to evaluate information, prioritise, communicate with stakeholders, support change activities and act as the liaison between the business units, technology teams and support teams.    There are multiple contract opportunities, 6-12 months offering likely extensions. Projects include:  Digitalising transactions Data and integration People, process and system transformation within a HR environment ERP development and implementation Cyber/Security  Skills and Experience   Demonstrated ability to apply solutions to business problems proactively identifying improvement opportunities to add value to business operations Experience working in an agile environment Proven experience working within an organisation that has a customer-focused operation or a complex organisation and partnering with the business to deliver solutions Strong communication and interpersonal skills with the ability to engage with stakeholders, users and the vendors to ensure accurate and timely delivery of an organisational critical piece of work Excellent attention to detail and time management skills that allow you to work with flexibility yet manage priorities and meet deadlines  In this dynamic environment you will be presented with an outstanding opportunity to join leading employers in the Newcastle region. You will enjoy the chance to collaborate with some extremely talented individuals and as such a desire to build strong relationships. A real passion for communicating across the business will be pivotal to your success in this role.  How to apply  This is an exciting opportunity to work with a reputable brand and be rewarded with competitive market rates. Please contact Jacinta John on 0422 336 535 for a confidential discussion or apply with your CV.    If this is not the right role but you are keen on exploring opportunities in Newcastle, please call me directly to discuss the market.

Name: Digital Technology Specialists | Multiple Positions
Description: Help us make a differenceCan digital technology specialists change lives? Yes they can. Albury Wodonga Health is looking for various specialists to deliver the solutions we need to improve the digital infrastructure of our organisation; infrastructure that is crucial to the work of our medical staff and contributes to the care we provide to our patients. Our aim is to be a digitally enabled health service, guided by Victoria’s digital health roadmap. You will be a key part of that plan as we look to optimise and transform the information and systems essential to our health service and the people who rely on them every day.As a key member of our team you will work collaboratively to provide high level digital expertise and advice in your specialty, help mentor junior and new staff and drive digital optimisation and transformation for our health service.Better yet, it is also a great career move as you join a thriving organisation that has big plans for the future. Outside of work, you will enjoy the fabulous region of Albury Wodonga, a picturesque regional location with big city perks.Available PositionsWe are keen to hear from digital technology professionals with suitable experience to apply for roles in the Information Management and Performance team;Service delivery technicians and management roles; management and delivery of IT end user services to enable AWH to get the most out of the infrastructure and application portfolio and enable a responsive, positive and inclusive user experience.Infrastructure technicians, leads and management roles; elevate and empower digital workplace services to enable new ways of work through adoption of digital workplace technologies.  Plan and perform the design, installation, and connectivity of computer systems and network infrastructure to meet service levels.Application specialists; implement, maintain and administer computer applications and clinical and corporate software to meet AWH’s needs including partnering with clinicians and corporate staff and external vendors to ensure we maximise our investment.Business analysts; engage with business leaders, clinicians and knowledge workers and system users to understand how changes to processes, services and software can deliver required organisational outcomes.  BA’s are the human factor in translating user requirements into system requirements and shaping the design and implementation of the requirements.Business Intelligence Engineers; provide research, data sourcing, analysis and report compilation support to stakeholder groups in the development and monitoring of organisational performance indicators.IT project/program coordinators; Using your IT technical skills to coordinate ICT contribution to health service projects, risk management, work with PO to identify demand and contribution and develop RFQ and RFP and scope documentation.Clinical informatics; to provide guidance from the clinical perspective within the digital technology team; to be the clinical interface into ICT to assist to deliver strategies that include redesigning workflows and digital optimization and transformation and ensuring optimal use of the existing platforms. Solutions architects; detailed solution architectural design at a system, product and/or technology level. Translation of requirements into a solution vision, high-level business and/or IT system specifications, and a portfolio of implementation tasksCyber security technician; improving the resilience of the health service through your previous experience in IT infrastructure and/or applications. Support the development and implementation of the health service’s cyber security controls, information security strategy and remediation plans.Digital enablement lead; driving adoption of digital workplace technologies to increase workforce digital dexterity and productivity. Focus on workplace enablement processes ensuring that employees have the motivation, permission and knowledge to fully exploit IT-supplied technologyWeb developer; Develop / design and maintains web based forms and workflows to assist in the capture and management of critical information. Using JavaScript best practices to build eForm solutions, with a focus on user and patient needs, with a focus on security and accessibility. Cloud engineer; identify, design and implement opportunities in cloud solutions and services.  Drive cloud adoption through enablement for the health service and reduce risks presented by current architecture.Business Intelligence Engineers; provide research, data sourcing, analysis and report compilation support to stakeholder groups in the development and monitoring of organisational performance indicatorsWhy you should join the Albury Wodonga Health TeamWe're the largest regional health service between Melbourne and SydneyIt's a great career move to Australia's only cross-border health serviceWe offer attractive remuneration packages with excellent benefits, including salary packaging, novated leasing and wellbeing programsYou'll enjoy wonderful employee benefits and development opportunitiesWe offer generous relocation and resettling supportBuild a life you love outside of work in the idyllic Albury Wodonga regionUse your skills to make a difference to the lives of our medical staff and our patientsAbout UsOur team of nearly 3,000 staff supports a population of 250,000 people throughout North-East Victoria and Southern NSW. AWH is a dynamic organisation undergoing significant growth, including the development of new state-of-the-art Emergency and Mental Health facilities as well as master planning for a new world-class regional hospital.Contact Name: Tanya Finnen Email: Tanya.Finnen@awh.org.au
