Name: Security Consultant
Description:
Your career with Accenture Technology

Interesting projects and new technologies
Work and learn from the best people everyday
Be yourself at work

Accenture Technology
Within Accenture Technology you will make solutions real and deliver business outcomes. We help clients become more successful by helping them improve their capabilities and effectiveness. We are constantly innovating and generating new ideas with the goal of helping clients identify the technologies and operations they need to differentiate and win in the marketplace. 
Organizations around the world rely on Accenture’s   Managed Security Services to build and sustain a resilient incident management program. We offer the global presence and scale to satisfy even the largest enterprises.
Every week, Accenture’s Managed Security Service: 

Analyze over 125 billion log entries
Identify over 62,000 potential security events
Escalate over 11,000 validated security incidents

Work as part of a world class customer focused team, protecting customers from threats through analysis of log data, providing clear, detailed and timely alerts that can be acted on.  The Security Analysis team delivers real time security monitoring, alerting and analysing logs from over 150 supported device types, while adhering to strict service-level agreements. We are the front line in protecting our customers.
Responsibilities         

Investigate attacks against customer networks
Monitor and analyze log data, network traffic and/or alerts generated by a variety of security technologies in real-time; escalate and explain validated security incidents to customers
Write up security incident reports detailing the threat, its characteristics, and possible remediation activities
Research new threats and ensure appropriate detection capabilities are in place to identify and respond to these threats
Routinely review security incidents and other customer deliverables for adherence to the established procedures and guidelines. Document, rectify, and provide feedback to other analysts as necessary
Ensure the quality and timeliness of the security incident detection and classification service
Ensure standards and procedures are adhered to within defined SLA’s
Articulate security issues to customers, both verbally and written
Identify opportunities for process improvement
Manage and track customer issues and requests
Support other teams as needed
Train Associate Security Analysts and Security Analysts
Support SOC Tours as required

Name: SIEM Engineer
Description:
An exciting opportunity to join BOQ Group (which includes Bank of Queensland, ME Bank and Virgin Money Australia) as a SIEM Engineer during our transformation journey on a permanent basis. By joining the digital bank of the future, you will be able to make a difference with integrity and empathy by developing and improving integration and automation of processes, adding significant value to our organisation. With exciting projects currently underway, you will be a key contributor to unique business development and change across BOQ Group.
As a SIEM Engineer, you will join a high performing team in the integration of security platforms. You will be involved in automating, monitoring and alerting to improve detection capabilities, further developing cyber dashboards by integrating and analysing various data sources.  
You will develop and implement seamless workflows of security analytics into operations by integrating security solutions into real-time monitoring as well as automating detect and response capabilities (SOAR). Furthermore, you will provide advisory services on security tools and technologies, collaborating with various teams across the organisation (e.g., Security Incident Response, Security Testing and Cyber Platform) to integrate these tools, looking for opportunities to automate processes.
This is a challenging and exciting role with a wide range of integration and automation opportunities and a variety of training to assist in your career development. BOQ Group has invested heavily in the latest cutting-edge security tools to support the business' rapidly evolving demand, where this role leverages many of these new resources. This includes Splunk Suite, with our Splunk environment being hosted in the cloud.
As a collaborative security professional, you must be able to work as part of a team and under limited supervision, inhibiting a can-do attitude, good communication and the drive to learn within our supportive environment. 
To be successful in this role, you will further be an SME in Splunk Suite. This refers specifically to how it is used, such as knowing what data is required to ingest from a security perspective and how to create queries and searches that are used for alerting. You will also have knowledge of how to review Splunk for best practice issues, supported by a background in a security detection and response function. Service Now experience is desirable, however not essential.
BOQ is one of Australia’s leading regional banks and provides a genuine alternative for Australian financial services customers and employees. Our purpose is to create prosperity for our customers, shareholders and people through empathy, integrity and by making a difference. Our ambition is to be known as the bold challenger bank; with multi-brands that are digitally enabled with a personal touch.
BOQ is passionate about providing opportunities for you to develop your career as we continuously adapt and deliver in a transformational and collaborative environment with a strong focus on community.
BOQ’s Inclusion vision is to foster a workspace that values and leverages difference and creates new possibilities, a place where our people feel confident to bring their best selves to work every day. We embrace difference and believe that our workforce should reflect the customers and communities that we serve.
In 2021 BOQ Group was awarded a Workplace Gender Equality Agency (WGEA) Employer of Choice for Gender Equality citation.
• Flexible working arrangements• Discounted financial products• Salary sacrificing options• Paid parental leave with no minimum• Paid volunteer days• Purchase annual leave• BUPA Corporate Plan• Employee Assistance Program (EAP)• A ‘zero tolerance’ to Domestic and Family Violence (DFV) with active support for employees experiencing DFV • Accessible work support through various practices, systems, office adjustments • Gym, shopping, technology and travel offers• 5 employee diversity network groups focusing on; First Nations Reconciliation Council, EPIC (LGBTIQA+), Multicultural, Gender and Early Career.
To apply for this role please follow the links or apply via our Careers Page.
The Bank of Queensland is committed to diversity and an inclusive workforce. Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander People are encouraged to apply.
If you are successful for a role with the Bank of Queensland, it is a condition of employment that background screening is completed to ensure that the Bank complies with its obligations under the Anti-Money Laundering and Counter Terrorism Financing Act. These checks may include, but are not limited to: identity, verification, reference checks, criminal background checks, immigration checks, verification of academic qualifications, bankruptcy checks.

Name: Vulnerability Analyst
Description:
Primary DetailsTime Type: Full timeWorker Type: EmployeeVulnerability Analyst
Location: Sydney, New South Whales
Type: Permanent, full-time position 
At QBE, our purpose is to enable a more resilient future.
We’re an international insurer and reinsurer with a local presence in 27 countries.
Leveraging our deep expertise and insights, QBE offers commercial, personal and specialty products and risk management solutions to help people and businesses manage risks, build strength, and embrace change to their advantage.
We’ve been cultivating resilience since 1886, when our founders started a marine insurance company in Townsville, Australia to give early pioneers a safeguard against uncertainty.
Today, we employ more than 11,600 people around the world, and our product portfolio includes property, motor, crop, energy, marine and aviation insurance.
The opportunity
QBE Insurance are seeking an experienced Vulnerability Analyst to be based in our Sydney office. This crucial role will support the Global Security Operations center in the continuous assessment, monitoring, analysis, prioritization and remediation of vulnerabilities. This is an exciting role in which the vulnerability analyst will ensure the effective and proactive identification and prioritization of vulnerabilities to minimize risks and protect QBE’s assets and services.
This will include:

Ensuring proactive identification of emerging vulnerabilities and determining the risk in QBE’s context.
Providing support for vulnerability management and other security operation projects.
Perform scheduled and on-demand scans, making risk-based recommendations on remediation.
Review the latest information from various sources to identify potential risks and vulnerabilities, carrying out assessment of the risks to QBE.
Provide incident response support when required.
Generate reports on the vulnerability status and remediation efforts.

Your story so far
Your story will include previous experience working in a vulnerability management role, scanning and patching systems or relevant security experience performing similar duties in a consulting or risk management team, an industry recognised security certification, analytical thinking, excellent communication skills – (both written and verbal), technical expertise of security solutions and technologies, demonstrated ability to make decisions on remediation and counter-measures, as well as the ability to maintain strong relationships with global security operations colleagues and other departments.
We are here to support you
We offer a range of benefits to help provide holistic support for your work life, whatever your circumstances. As an QBE employee you will have access to and benefit from:

‘Hybrid Working’ – a mix of working from home and in the office to enhance your work/life balance
Our ‘At My Best’ wellbeing program, including free holistic wellbeing coaching, nutritional, confidential counselling, financial and legal advice
12 weeks’ gender-equal flexible leave for all new parents, including paid super
The ability to maximize retirement savings through voluntary super contributions and company matching
Income protection insurance and reimbursed Death and Total Permanent Disability insurance premiums
Additional leave and support through QBE’s Family Domestic Violence First Responder Network
Discounts on insurance products, car hire, hotels, goods and services including benefits through our various sports and arts sponsorship partners

We value our employee’s experience with us and are proud to have been recognized for the following awards:

2021 LinkedIn Top Employer & HRD Employer of Choice
2020 Best Workplace Diversity & Inclusion and Excellence Award for Best Health & Wellbeing at the Australian HR Awards
Gold Employer status for 2019 & 2020 Australian Workplace Equality Index (AWEI) – the definitive national benchmark on LGBTI workplace inclusion!
Ranked 6th place in the AAGE Top Graduate Employers 2021 as voted by graduates
Top 20 Workplaces for Dads in 2019 and 2020 (HBF Direct Advice for Dads)

Join us
Click APPLY to submit your application. Successful applicants will need to complete work rights, police and credit checks through our online provider as a condition of employment.
QBE takes a risk and compliance approach to vaccination and strongly encourages our employees to be vaccinated. All roles in Victoria and Northern Territory require full COVID-19 vaccination and for vaccination status to be maintained in line with government requirements. Other roles may also require that full vaccination status be maintained. We will ask you to share your status as part of the application process. We won’t be able to progress with applications where candidates choose not to disclose their status for roles that require vaccination in line with our risk and compliance approach.
QBE recognise the value of diverse perspectives and experience. We are committed to an inclusive workplace where everyone feels valued and respected for who they are. If we can provide support with access requirements, alternative work arrangements or you would like to connect with one of our networks please contact us at recruitment@qbe.com.

Name: Cyber Security Advisor
Description:
At Bunnings, you’ll make an impact on the business and beyond.
At Bunnings, there’s so much going on behind the scenes that may come as a surprise. With millions of customer interactions occurring across our stores and online platforms, we’ve got so many opportunities to shape our trademark Bunnings experiences for our customers.
We are looking for a Cyber Security Advisor to join our Technology Team.
About the role:
As a Cyber Security Advisor at Bunnings, you will be responsible for identifying risks in applications, infrastructure and environments and providing recommendations on security standards and implementation of security controls for the wider Bunnings business.
What's involved:

You will assist in identifying threats and scope to perform regular security reviews and security testing.
You will provide effective and pragmatic cyber security guidance for key technology projects, to enable the organisation to innovate securely.
You will provide security guidance during the delivery of projects (including Agile Sprints).

Who we're looking for:
You will be an experienced Cyber Security expert with a broad understanding of many cyber security disciplines and frameworks. 
You are well versed in agile practices and enjoy staying at the forefront of industry trends, emerging threats and are passionate about research and expanding your knowledge on all things cyber. 
You’ll need: 

Experience in identifying and understanding cyber security risk, preferably in both Information Technology (IT) and Operational Technology (OT) contexts.
Understanding of how security vulnerabilities are exploited by attackers, the post compromise life cycle of an attacker and experience in developing novel methods for detecting and remediating compromise at different stages of an attack.
An understanding of the current threat landscape, response, and mitigation strategies used in cyber security.
Experience with SIEM technologies, Endpoint Security, Proxy, Firewalls, Vulnerability Management, and Access Control.
Solid understanding of security protocols, cryptography, authentication, authorisation and security.
Knowledge of security in the cloud.
Experience with gathering requirements and providing solutions for senior stakeholders, around information security solutions.
Expert knowledge in the areas of IS Governance, Risk Management or Technical Services.
Broad understanding of security architecture - supporting design and development of security.

You’ll be part of a workplace where you’ll feel like you belong.
There’s so much on offer when you’re part of the team. Our flexible and informal work environment helps bring balance between work and home. Then there’s the fun stuff like team discount at Bunnings and other Wesfarmers brands, incentives, discounts from corporate partners (such as private health insurance) and cost price food and drinks at the Bunnings café. We also offer 12 weeks paid parental leave, regardless of gender, and you will have the opportunity to create a real difference in your community and environment. Join us and experience Bunnings from the other side of the counter.
Please note that if your application progresses to the reference check stage, you may be required to submit a police check. If your search returns a criminal record, Bunnings will assess whether the record impacts your ability to perform the key requirements of the role.

Name: Cyber Protective Services Engineer
Description:
Great team culture
Opportunity to work on cutting edge technologies
Join LinkedIn #1 company to work

Do work that matters
The Cyber Protective Services group protects the bank and our customers from theft, loss and risk events, through effective and proactive management of cyber security, privacy and operational risk.
We provide security controls and services that are leveraged across the group.  The team is responsible for the stable delivery of effective security services and continuous assurance over enterprise security controls within the Bank and across its group entities.
We own and operate the Data Protection services to protect the group.  Our services protect over 10,000 servers across a range of different On-Prem, Private Cloud & Public Cloud environments, along with over 40,000 end user devices.
See yourself in our team
The Cyber Engineer will assess customer requests to deal with Incident/Problem/Service Request activities as well as participate in the implementation of complex changes. This role brings a shift left focus on delivering break-fixes as well as bringing productivity initiatives to the platform through automation and new ways of working.
The role also provides delivery governance, technical support and expertise to customers, responding to customer feedback in order to drive excellence, quality and performance. Major areas of focus include:

Active responsibility to improve application performance
Active responsibility to provide guidance on Operations engagement and Production stability
Accountability to analyse, review and support Service Delivery to meet the ongoing technology requirements for business, projects, and IT&T stakeholders

What you will need to exceed

Experience managing cyber technologies such as anti-malware, DLP, IDS/IDP etc
Strong customer service, stakeholder management and negotiating skills
A drive to standardise & automate where possible
Experience in Windows/Linux server administration across a hybrid cloud


If you're already part of the Commonwealth Bank Group (including Bankwest), you'll need to apply through Sidekick to submit a valid application. We’re keen to support you with the next step in your career.
We're aware of some accessibility issues on this site, particularly for screen reader users. We want to make finding your dream job as easy as possible, so if you require additional support please contact HR Direct on 1800 989 696.
Advertising End Date: 17/06/2022

Name: Security Operations Engineer
Description:
Will you actively create a healthier future for tomorrow?
At Medibank we’re encouraged to think big. We have a clear purpose to impact better health outcomes for our customers, patients and our community.
We celebrate diversity of thought because we want to make better decisions for our customers. As we work towards our goal of better health for better lives, we value the knowledge and contribution of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islanders. We are working hard to create an inclusive workplace and develop Indigenous careers.
About the role
Medibank maintains and operates several information security controls across the organisation, including but not limited to market leading EDR, firewalls, and a SIEM that is marching towards a fully implemented SOAR. To continue to be effective, these controls required ongoing development, maintenance, support and timely response to alerts generated from the systems.
As a Security Operations Engineer, you will contribute to our security posture through your involvement in and contribution to the implementation, maintenance and management of security controls, systems, process and infrastructure. With your developing knowledge in security technologies, information systems, processes and procedures, you will assist with maintaining and operating security technology, technical issues and incidents.
Security Operations Engineers will do the following to Improve the security and privacy of Medibank’s products and services, ensuring we protect our members and their private data:

Develop and triage security infrastructure alerts and incidents to prioritise investigation of those alerts and incidents.
Manage rulesets and configurations of systems that generate security event data, tune alerting and reporting of security event data sources to optimise systems and ensure they are stable and current.
Perform operational infrastructure investigations and triage on a wide variety of events from various sources to determine whether they pose a threat to Medibank systems stability, performance and availability.
Participate in an 24/7 on-call roster to responds to security and infrastructure events on Medibank systems.
Participate in enterprise-scale security and infrastructure incidents.

About you
You have a passion for information security and a history of contributing to the security community. You have a data driven analytical approach toward solving complex challenges and can analyse root causes, trends and systemic issues.
You have experience with TCP/IP and networking equipment such as switches, firewalls and routers. You have hands on experience managing Linux, and Windows environments as well as experience with one or more of Python, Perl, Bash, Go, C/C++ and/or Java.
A career with us
At Medibank, we believe work is something we do, not somewhere we go. Our modes of working – Collaboration, Connection and Concentration – help inform how your day is structured and where you choose to work will vary, depending on your role and requirements.
The wellbeing of our employees is our priority. We encourage you to talk to us about any adjustments or additional support you may require during the recruitment process, as well as how this role can be flexible for you. Virtual interviews are always on offer and will not adversely impact your application.
All employees who may attend a worksite or any face-to-face work-related activity will be required to be fully vaccinated for COVID-19 as a condition of employment.
We offer a range of great benefits such as subsidised private health insurance, rewards and discounts, and health and wellbeing initiatives. To find out more, click here.
To start small and impact bigger.

Name: Specialist Cybersecurity Program Administrator
Description:
The Specialist Cybersecurity Project Administrator will be responsible for performing the Project administration of all the Cybersecurity Project Initiatives from the global Cyber Security team, including subject matter experts and vendors. We are eager to engage with people who have a genuine interest in progressing a career within Cybersecurity and program delivery. Below are the key aspects of the role:

Oversee the delivery of project documentation including investment approval, project delivery, design and handover deliverables
Construct easy-to-digest snapshots, project schedules, dashboards, metrics and milestone status in various forms. Create and track complex statuses, updates, interactions and inter-dependence across multiple projects and teams
Provide information and technical support for the preparation, coordination, undertaking, and post evaluation of Program/Project management reviews, conferences and technical reviews. Perform work in accordance with the PDG procedures
Record incoming program office tasking and tracks responses. Update tracking documentation for tasking, correspondence, brief preparation, and monitor schedule of tasking, correspondence, and program briefs, to improve coordination and reduce response times
Maintain project schedules and coordinates calendars to accommodate program/project review meetings and will also act as the main SME/user for project related systems including SAP, Planview etc.

Name: Senior Consultant - Digital Forensics & Incident Response
Description:
Line of ServiceAdvisoryIndustry/SectorNot ApplicableSpecialismCybersecurity & PrivacyManagement LevelSenior AssociateJob Description & Summary
With PwC, you’ll ignite a meaningful career while being supported by a flexible working culture, innovative learning and development opportunities and progressive policies and benefits, such as 18 weeks paid parental leave for mums, dads and foster carers (no minimum service!)
What will you create?
You’ll help Australian businesses, not-for-profits and governments create value and improve the way they work. From digitising healthcare, to creating smarter cities and igniting our start-up industry, together we build trust in society and solve important problems.
Cybersecurity & Digital Trust builds trust in Australian organisations by securing their digital future and developing the nation's leading cybersecurity workforce.
As a Senior Consultant in our Defensive Security team your impact will be seen by:

Conducting cyber detection and response including incident response, threat intelligence, hunting and security monitoring
Developing cyber intelligence assessments and briefs for both technical and business stakeholders
Developing internal tools and procedures to contribute to the team’s knowledge base;
Reporting and presenting to both technical and business stakeholders

About you
You have a background in cyber security with experience in incident response, threat intelligence, threat hunting, or security operations and are able to independently manage engagement delivery. You have a strong grasp of technical/business writing and have the ability to train and mentor junior members. As a bonus, you may hold security related certifications such as CISSP, CISM, ITIL or GIAC. You may also hold relevant vendor certifications.  
Passionate about being at the forefront of change, you’re ready to help our Consulting team deliver practical advice that speaks straight to the heart of client business issues and deliver innovative results.
You’re collaborative and enjoy working in an innovative environment. You’re a problem solver by nature and want to join a firm that values the kind of people who reimagine the possible for their clients and stakeholders. Most importantly, you act with integrity and show care for the people you work with.
Life at PwC 
Our culture and benefits are something we’re proud of, and also the reason we’ve been named LinkedIn’s #1 Australian workplace. With PwC, you’ll belong to an inclusive community where differences are both embraced and the underlying driver in everything we create together. 
We empower you with the technology, coaching, flexibility and trust needed to make a meaningful difference, while supporting you in bringing your whole self to work each day. We’re committed to building and maintaining a diverse workforce because we know it’s only by working together that we can realise the potential of our people, clients and society around us.
We’re living this commitment through initiatives including our Reconciliation Action Plan to increase Indigenous employment and employee-led diversity networks promoting cultural, disability, LGBTI and gender equality. At our core we’re a people business, which means you’ll be supported not just in your professional development but your personal growth as well. 
Paul Bui is the Recruitment Manager for the role. As the team experience high volumes of applications, we appreciate your patience to allow for a timely and fair process for all. 
 Location: Flexible (any major city)
We welcome the opportunity to speak to candidates about our value proposition and recognition and reward approach. The minimum full time salary for this role is $92,000.00 including 10% Superannuation,  however will be determined based on the skills and experience that the candidate brings.

Name: Incident Response Specialist
Description:
Primary DetailsTime Type: Full timeWorker Type: EmployeeSecurity Incident Response Specialist
Full-time | Permanent | Sydney
Hybrid work from home and office  
Your part in a changing world
At QBE, our purpose is to enable a more resilient future.
We’re an international insurer and reinsurer with a local presence in 27 countries.
Leveraging our deep expertise and insights, QBE offers commercial, personal and specialty products and risk management solutions to help people and businesses manage risks, build strength and embrace change to their advantage.
We’ve been cultivating resilience since 1886, when our founders started a marine insurance company in Townsville, Australia to give early pioneers a safeguard against uncertainty.
Today, we employee more than 11,600 people around the world, and our product portfolio includes property, motor, crop, energy, marine and aviation insurance.
The opportunity
Sitting in the global technology team, the Security Incident Response Specialist will be a key member of our rapidly growing Global Security Operations team. This is a truly exciting hands-on technical role with wide exposure in an ever-changing environment. You will perform advanced analysis on the collection of cyber threats through modern attacking methods and techniques.  Some of your day-to-day responsibilities will include: 

Perform deep-dive incident analysis of various data sources by analysing and investigating security-related logs against medium-term threats and IOCs
Actively manage and apply the phases of Incident Response (preparation, identification, containment, eradication, recovery and lessons learned)
Perform advanced analysis on a collection of cyber threats using high-level proactive and reactive threat hunting methods
Executing vulnerability and web application assessments, providing analysis and recommendations
Making decisions on threats to QBE’s systems, assets, and business operations
Provide security guidance to technical and non-technical stakeholders
Liaising with senior leaders and executives on complex security matters
Delivering training to the wider QBE business in support of the QBE risk culture agenda
Managing business continuity plan and information backup procedures
Recommending initiatives to continually improve existing infrastructure
Supporting junior members of the team in an unofficial leadership capacity, sharing knowledge and best practice

Your story so far 
To be successful in this role you will be an experienced technology professional with excellent communication skills. You will be working in a similar role currently or have a strong interest in security within a large complex environment.  Understanding the tools, techniques, and procedures that modern attackers use to compromise organisations and knowledge of security frameworks and methodologies are critical. 
Some of the best bits
This role is part of a critical function for QBE and the work you complete will positively impact the entire global organisation. QBE offers you an environment to grow where new applications and features are continuously rolled out. Regardless of experience and level, any new addition to the Global Security Operations team will progress through a robust training and onboarding program to ensure best practice. Further study and formal training are also supported.
We are here to support you
We offer a range of benefits to help provide holistic support for your work life, whatever your circumstances. As an QBE employee you will have access to and benefit from:

‘Hybrid Working’ – a mix of working from home and in the office to enhance your work/life balance
Our ‘At My Best’ wellbeing program, including free holistic wellbeing coaching, nutritional, confidential counselling, financial and legal advice
12 weeks’ gender-equal flexible leave for all new parents, including paid super

Discounts on insurance products, car hire, hotels, goods and services including benefits through our various sports and arts sponsorship partners

Name: Business Information Security Officer
Description:
Line of ServiceInternal Firm ServicesIndustry/SectorNot ApplicableSpecialismIFS - Information Technology (IT)Management LevelDirectorJob Description & Summary
To solve important problems we need to aim for the inclusion of our diverse talent. We empower our people to use their creativity, authenticity and human differences to be the champions of change. We know that when people from diverse backgrounds and with different points of view work together, we create the most value - for our clients, our people and our society. If you don’t think you quite meet all of the qualifications, we’d still love to hear from you.  
About Us
Today’s world isn’t simple.The challenges facing business and society are complex. At PwC, we’ve created ‘The New Equation’ as our global strategy to address the breadth and complexity of challenges facing businesses and society. We’re combining everything we offer in new, creative ways. This builds trust, delivers sustained outcomes and helps clients solve their most important problems.
We know those challenges need to be looked at from a new angle. With your human ingenuity, passion and experience combined with the latest technology, these problems become easier to tackle. Together, we are a passionate community of solvers coming together in unexpected ways, creating new solutions for a new day.
We’re in the business of transformation. To transform the future, we're building a diverse, ambitious team who strive for imaginative ways of solving our clients' most important challenges. You'll get to work with the latest technologies, in an environment that empowers you to think differently.
Technology and Firm Operations bring this to life by enabling the business to achieve their tech-driven goals. The work undertaken here covers a range of areas from leading and supporting the firm through the build or adoption of new technology, to protecting against risk, and delivering valuable data insights that transform our tech capabilities.
How and where work gets done is being reimagined. It all adds up to The New Equation.
Responsibilities
As a Business Information Security Officer in our DigiTech team your impact will be seen by: 

Leading the Cybersecurity uplift roadmap and aligning to firm wide and global cyber priorities.
Identifying key risk, ensuring ownership, management and stakeholder management. 
Executing Threat and Risk assessments and driving maturity of controls.
Identifying key risks early in projects/development, reporting cyber security metrics and facilitating a Cyber Risk Committee.
Orchestrate the provisioning of central cybersecurity controls and ensure accountability early in the project and software development lifecycle.

Requirements
You have a background in Cyber Security and are skilled in various information security frameworks and extensive knowledge across a broad spectrum of security risk and mitigation strategies and hold an understanding of key interfaces/integrations.
Passionate about being at the forefront of change, you’re ready to help our Business Support team enable all areas of our firm to deliver meaningful value to clients.
You’re collaborative and enjoy working in an innovative environment. You’re a problem solver by nature and want to join a firm that values the kind of people who reimagine the possible for their clients and stakeholders. Most importantly, you act with integrity and show care for the people you work with.
Your New Benefits

Flexible daily working hours, we value work-life balance
Work overseas or interstate, we know how precious time is with your family and friends
Paid study (and leave!), we’ll pay all the costs and give you time off to study
No dress code, wear what makes you feel comfortable and dress for your day
Yearly bonuses, because who doesn’t love to be rewarded for great performance!
Health & fitness perks, like a wellness stipend and discounted memberships
Generous parental leave policy for mums, dads and foster carers

If you're looking for a team that values your work and solves meaningful problems - then apply now to be considered for the position!

Name: ICS analytics and cyber engineer
Description: Just imagine your future with us…Aurecon is committed to creating an inclusive culture that embraces diversity, equality, and inclusion – and we provide our people with flexible working opportunities.We believe diverse teams enable us to solve our clients' and society's most complex problems in unconventional and distinctive ways. We offer flexible working as it enables all of our employees to balance work and life in way that works for them.Aurecon is an Employer of Choice for Gender Equality, as awarded by the Workplace Gender Equality Agency (Australia), and are a founding member of The Diversity Agenda in New Zealand. We also have a Reconciliation Action Plan and hold Silver Employer status in the Australian Workplace Equality Index for LGBTI+ inclusion. Across our company, inclusive leadership is role modelled from the top and is an expectation of all.Our flexible way of working includes our YesFlex flexible start and finish times, work from home policy, part time and job share options. Aurecon also offers 14 weeks paid parental leave, two weeks paid partner leave, and other health services and benefits.If you think you’d be a good fit, we’d love to hear from you. We welcome people from all background and with diverse accessibility needs. We’re curious about your career path and how we can support you to be your best.The Role We have an exciting opportunity for an experienced ICS Analytics and Cyber Engineer. This role sits within our innovative digital team and will provide technical expertise and translation to integrate our data & analytics and cyber security offering within our client's systems.Here are the key things you will do to ‘bring ideas to life’.Work and learn at the intersection between cyber security, data science and critical infrastructure alongside experts on exciting projects across a wide variety of industriesDevelop, analyse and improve architecture, software, and operating methods to optimise industrial controls and analyticsAssist in the preparation of proposals by designing the methodology and approach to solve problemsCarry out research and proof of concept work (e.g. develop prototypes or investigate targeted topics in-depth) to unlock value for our clients and support Aurecon’s eminence and innovationOpportunities to specialise in cyber and/or advanced data analytics.What we are looking forRecent graduate from a cybersecurity programme or computer science programme with solid network security and admin foundationsComfort with ambiguity and complex open-ended problemsHigh level of energy and curiosity coupled with an enthusiastic, “can do” attitudeWe value the difference each team member brings, and we look for people who have had a broad range of experiences and a growth and learning mindset.About usWe’ve re-imagined engineering. Aurecon is an international engineering, design, and advisory company, but not as you know it!Drawing on our deep pool of expertise, we co-create innovative solutions with our clients to some of the world’s most complex challenges.We listen deeply and intently, which helps us see opportunities, possibilities and potential others can’t. Think engineering. Think again.Want to know more? You can learn more about what it’s like to work at Aurecon by visiting the careers section of our website.If you are intrigued or excited by what you have read, then we want to hear from you. Apply now!

Name: Technology Risk and Compliance Analyst
Description:
Job Requisition ID: 28244 

Work in a highly innovative and transformative business
Work-life balance with access to flexible work arrangements
Salary packaging – to suit your personal and financial circumstances

What will your typical day look like?
The Technology Risk and Compliance Specialist position exists to support the Firm’s technology standards programs, technology operating model, and associated risk management activities.  
Role Responsibilities

Managing compliance to Firm and Industry technology and Cyber Security standards
Risk Management treatment plan (Technology Risk Register) managing open risks to closure or acceptance
Managing any open audit findings through to closure by working with IT control owners     
Tracking Technology Operating Model compliance through key Gate Reviews (Plan, Deploy & Closure)
Actively ensure new regulatory trends and requirements are identified and addressed   
The position will require active engagement and influence on the quality of risk and compliance management across the Asia Pacific region within Deloitte Asia Pacific.

About the team
Quality assurance is an IT governance team that services internal and external facing service lines for Deloitte Australia. They ensure all Deloitte technology and information will be created, maintained and supported with a defined level of service and quality whilst complying with Global secure standards and processes that are continuously improved and streamlined.
Enough about us, let’s talk about you. 
At Deloitte, we’re all about disruption. Technology has radically transformed the way we live and the way we go about business. Amongst the disruption that emerging technologies bring, we take the reins and transform our business with innovative technology and tools. Our large (and ever growing) team of specialists are exposed to new challenges and opportunities day-by-day and are supported by the business from day one.
You are someone with: 

Excellent oral and written communication with ability to present, negotiate and interact at all levels, including business stakeholders, technical, management, and leadership
Possess a strategic mindset
Continuously improving the operations of your domain
Understanding and experience in Agile methodologies and practices
Demonstrated working experience of at least 3 years in a Technology Risk and Compliance practice
Experience or knowledge of ServiceNow Governance Risk and Compliance (GRC), ITSM, and ITBM applications
Experience with enterprise IT environments including hardware and software lifecycles, Cyber Security and Service Management 
Strong stakeholder management experience
Maintain knowledge on Industry trends and best practice

Desired:

Essential – demonstrable experience in managing compliance and risk workloads
Essential - excellent analytical, problem-solving, and communication skills
Essential - experience with Cyber and Security related processes and standards
Essential - experience in the management of Risk Treatment plans
Desired - Tertiary technology qualification

Why Deloitte? 
At Deloitte, we create positively differentiated work experiences that enable our people to feel valued and achieve their full potential. Deloitte Australia opens the door to a career that can cross borders virtually and physically across Asia Pacific to gain experience and access projects beyond Australia’s borders. We value difference, and embrace people with diverse backgrounds, experiences, gender identities, abilities and thinking styles. Knowing that people work best in a variety of ways, we are happy to discuss alternative arrangements if the working pattern you are looking for is not specifically indicated. 
We’re committed to continually building a safe and respectful workplace, where all our people feel appreciated and accepted. Through the creation of endorsed employee-led diversity networks which promote cultural, disability, LGBTI+, Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people and gender equality, we’re leading the way to shape an environment where everybody can thrive. 
We are proud to have been recognised for our efforts in inspiring change and accelerating progress – check out our careers site for recent recognition in this space.
Next Steps 
Sound like the sort of role for you? Apply now. 
By applying to this job, you will be assessed against the Deloitte Global Talent Standards. We’ve designed these standards to provide our clients with a consistent and exceptional Deloitte employee experience globally.
At Deloitte, we know we’re at our best when we look out for one another; prioritise respect, fairness, development and wellbeing; foster an inclusive culture and embrace diversity in all forms. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment regardless of their background, experience, identity, ability or thinking style, and if you need assistance or an accommodation during the application process for accessibility reasons this is available upon request. 
The preferred candidate will be subject to background screening by Deloitte or by their external third-party provider.

Name: Senior Consultant - Cyber Security Risk & Assurance
Description:
Australia- - Careers Senior Consultant
Cyber Security Risk & Assurance

Job no: 518432 Work type: Permanent Full Time Location: Melbourne, Geelong, Parramatta Division: Enterprise KPMG is one of the most trusted and respected global professional services firms. Through depth of expertise, clarity of insight and strength of purpose we help our clients solve complex challenges, steer change, strengthen, transition and grow.
We are looking for talented people who share our purpose of inspiring confidence and empowering change for our clients, our people and our communities. About the team  Our Technology Risk and Cyber team is growing to meet an increasing demand from a wide range of industries, dedicated to advising our clients about their potential cyber and technology risks and opportunities. We work as an integrated business and part of a larger multi-disciplinary team, making us stand out as a respected and leading professional services firm.
The team draws on a combination of professional, talented people, powerful KPMG methodologies, innovating capability and assets, and global resources to support our clients in achieving the right milestones.    As our team continues to grow, we are currently looking for exceptional talent at the Senior Consultant level to join our Sydney or Melbourne office.    We are seeking a Senior Consultant who is passionate about technology and cyber security, curious to ask questions and learn more, and who wants to work with a team who is fun, dedicated and supports each other.
You will work closely with our clients to evaluate their business strategy, understand their technology environment and provide advice and recommendations to enable them to improve their ability to prevent, detect and respond to cyber risks, threats and incidents. Your Opportunity   We are seeking a talented Technology and Cyber Risk Senior Consultant, with 3 to 5 years of experience, who is looking to take on some of the most complex and interesting business problems in the technology and cyber space. Your day to day activities will include:  Lead the delivery of cyber security reviews and technology risk & assurance services, including IT internal audits, service organisation controls reporting, IT risk assessments and IT project assurance reviews in multiple industries, to KPMG clients  Lead team in performing gap and maturity assessments between the security processes and operations of our clients against recognized global and domestic standards and regulations (e.g. ISO 27001, NIST CSF, APRA CPS 234, VPDSF, PSPF, etc.)  Lead with the development of the IT aspects of client audit plans and the scoping of individual IT audit projects and risk mitigation activities  Working with our clients to develop information security strategies, manage security uplift programs and provide advice to enhance existing cyber security arrangements  Leading and coaching the junior staff to deliver the appropriate outcomes  Support senior team members with day to day engagements with client, vendor and KPMG teams to ensure that all technology aspects of audit plans are delivered on time, on budget and in line with timelines  Support the KPMG Partner and Manager group in business development activities, including assisting with the development of proposals for new business  Stay up to date with developments in cyber space, technology, internal audit and IT risk management to ensure that KPMG’s approach remains fresh and at the forefront of industry thinking   You will have:  Impeccable written and very strong verbal communication skills.
The ability to prepare the very high-quality client-ready deliverables and present to the senior leadership team for review  In-depth understanding of Cyber Security maturity assessments against recognised global and domestic standards and regulations (e.g. ISO27001, NIST, ISM, PSPF, APRA CPS 234). A relevant tertiary qualification (such as Computing, Engineering, Information Systems, IT or related). High level of organisation and ability to manage conflicting deadlines, priorities and wide variety of work engagements.
   Ability to quickly build strong relationships and network with a variety of stakeholders both internal and external. Supporting the senior leadership team with business development activities, such as collaboratively developing proposals for new business. We encourage you to apply even if you don’t meet all the requirements.
We’re interested in hearing from you if you want to take your career in the direction of Tech. and Cyber risk, and have the aptitude for and are prepared to invest the time to learn. What can we offer you?
As you join our high-growth part of the business, we offer you a unique chance work in a social and dynamic team environment, work with high-profile clients, and provide active coaching and mentoring on engagements! As a leading global professional services firm, we are also dedicated to providing our employees with:  A culture focused on harmony, trust and collaboration   Opportunities to work on larger, diverse and more complex projects. Putting your skills and experience to the test!
Encouragement and support of ongoing learning and career development across the business. Because how you grow matters! Opportunities to collaborate and link across borders and globally with sector and technical experts in all parts of our business  Be involved in KPMG's support of numerous organisations in the areas of education, social inclusion and health including our Reconciliation Action Plan and Global Green Initiative.
Enjoy employee benefits including salary packaging options, employee discounts, reward schemes, and more!    The KPMG Difference   We believe diversity of thought, background and experience strengthens relationships and delivers meaningful benefits to our people, our clients and communities. We are consistently recognised as an employer of choice for women, and our inclusive culture promotes the development of our people irrespective of gender, ethnicity, generation, flexible work status, family circumstances, sexual orientation or disability.
What’s Next? If this sounds like an area you’re interested in or perhaps you would like to know more, please click apply!
This is a fantastic opportunity for enthusiastic individuals looking to take a leap and flourish within our consultancy as part of our Technology Risk and Cyber group.    KPMG – HOW YOU GROW MATTERS  Advertised: 23 Jun 2022 AUS Eastern Standard Time Applications close: 23 Jul 2022 AUS Eastern Standard Time Back to search results Apply now Share this: | More Search results Position Location Closes Senior Consultant

We are at the forefront of change, supporting our clients and communities across geographies and industries deliver their largest priorities. They may be educating the next generation, defending our country, financing our economy or delivering healthcare. As a Senior Consultant you will have had exposure to target operating model design and transformation, and/or experience within a project or consulting environment.

Name: GRC Officer
Description: Cyber Security AnalystDaily rate of $1000-$1150 inc superWork with an established and growing team of GRC professionals to enhance the cyber and governance capabilities for a federal government department with a national presenceAustralian citizenship required with ability to gain and obtain a security clearance About the company This Government agency was established to play an important role in developing the legislation, support layers and funding to support Australians living with a disability. Since their inception in 2010, they have grown in size, with public servants in most Australian states. Since 2021, there has been a growing demand and requirement to increase their cyber security resilience and have been building a team to support the security governance, detection and response to cyber incidence. About the role You will be working with a team of Cyber GRC professionals as part of the ICT governance capability. You will be supporting the ICT risk identification, assessment and management in a crucial role to improve the ICT security risk profile across the department. You will be involved in:Implementing strategies to reduce the technology risk, and implement policies for internal and external regulatory complianceEvaluate business and ICT riskDevelop IT security standards, policies and controls to manage risks to improve security positioningInvestigate information security risks and exception assessmentsDocumenting and reporting control failures and gaps, and support remediation and tracking activities in line with security best practice and technology advancements CultureTeam led by a reputable IT Security Manager with a track record of identifying and leading key security objectives, and supporting the technical security team to achieve outcomesGrowing team, with support and funding to continue on the security transformation journey How to apply If you think that you want to make a real impact for a leading company then APPLY NOW or call Phu on 0423 649 909 or phun@thenetworkit.com for a confidential chat.

Name: Marketing Coordinator
Description: About UsThe Institute of Data is a Professional Network of Data Scientists, Cyber Security Analysts and Software Engineers. In partnership with leading universities, the government of Singapore and thousands of employers, we transform careers for a data-driven world. The Institute of Data operates in the information technology sector. Demand for our graduates is driven by the technology recruitment needs of business. This demand, in the areas of Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning, Cyber Security and Software Engineering are more important to business now than ever before. Our courses are unlike those offered at traditional education providers. In only 3 months full time or 6 months part time we train people for jobs in tech with a 93% job success rate in 180 days. Beyond learning knowledge, process and skills, our students experience the effectiveness of practical training by industry experts – allowing them to confidently practice and work in the industry. About the RoleAs the Marketing Coordinator, you will help to generate relevant leads, via the Institute of Data’s marketing activities. You will get involved in our advertising helping to analyse and optimise Google and Facebook Ads. As well as help with events, written content and website management. The role will also require working with the wider marketing team to execute full-funnel marketing campaigns. Responsibilities:Working on Google Ads, Facebook Ads with campaign creation and optimisation across our paid media platformsCreation and scheduling of compelling digital content and posts across social platforms.Coordinate and promote events that are in person or via zoomExecute email marketing campaigns, scheduling and monitor performanceAssist with the management of internal email marketing automations and systemsEnsure the company website is maintained, working collaboratively with external partnersBasic design, video and brand styling activities adhering to the company’s brand guidelines Skills, Education and/or Experience:Degree in Marketing or related disciplineStrong written English Skills in long form and short form contentAnalytical and critical thinking skills. Curiosity is a big plus!Basic design skillsExcel/Google sheets spreadsheet skillsAbility to work with or learn quickly how to use marketing tools including Hubspot, Wordpress, Active Campaign and ZapierGoogle & Facebook Ads experience desirableWillingness to learn and support others as part of a dynamic teamRemuneration & BenefitsHybrid Work EnvironmentTeam EventsMentorship ProgramCareer ProgressionDiverse Team CultureHyper Growth Tech IndustryCompetitive rate based on experience

Name: IT Asset Management Analyst
Description:
Job Requisition ID: 27522 

Flexible work arrangements - work in a way that suits you best.
Rewards platform - your hard work won't go unnoticed at Deloitte. 
Training and development - at Deloitte we believe in investing in our best assets, the people! You will have access to world class training and funding towards industry and other professional certifications.

About the Role
Are you an experienced, passionate pioneer in technology – a solutions builder, a roll-up-your-sleeves technologist who wants a daily collaborative environment, think-tank feel and share new ideas with your colleagues - without the extensive demands of travel?  If so, consider an opportunity with the Extended Enterprise Risk Management Team. 
About our Extended Enterprise Team
Our Software Compliance and Advisory specialists assist clients in identifying, evaluating and mitigating the risks associated with their use of an external organisation’s intellectual property. Our specialists use an independent fact-based, approach to rapidly recover value for our clients, or provide software asset management (SAM) services to help clients control and maximise value from their software assets and future investments.
Work you’ll do  
As an Analyst within our team, you will: 

Conduct software vendor licensing research
Work collaboratively to complete Effective License Position (ELP) analysis for strategic software vendors using discovery and vendor tool data
Assist with Project Management activities to monitor progress of ELP  team tasks
Create materials for facilitating client meetings that will provide strategic recommendations related to the stakeholder engagement
Present ELP analysis findings
Use data to provide trend analysis and assist with determining potential future licensing needs
Advise best practices on point solutions for individual software vendors
Provide advisory and implementation services of SAM tooling solutions
Complete pricing analysis to determine potential cost to organization and assist with optimizing software spend
Determine and aid in managing the impact of software licensing on cyber security
Serve as first level of review for all analysis completed

About your Skills
We are seeking professionals with 1-2 years industry experience with the following skills/experience; 

Bachelor’s degree in Information Technology, Computer Science, Information System or Engineering
Proficiency in Excel
Experience in Software Licensing
Knowledge of the Software Lifecycle 
Experience in Software License Compliance Audit 
Project Management experience
Proficiency in Microsoft PowerPoint
Data Analysis experience 
Ability to maintain the required clearance for this role
Must be legally authorized to work in Australia without the need for employer sponsorship, now or at any time in the future 

Why Deloitte?
At Deloitte, we create positively differentiated work experiences that enable our people to feel valued and achieve their full potential. We value difference and embrace people with diverse backgrounds and thinking styles. Knowing that people work best in different ways, we are happy to discuss alternative arrangements if the working pattern you are looking for is not specifically indicated.
Next Steps
Sound like the sort of role for you? Apply now.
By applying to this job, you will be assessed against the Deloitte Global Talent Standards. We’ve designed these standards to provide our clients with a consistent and exceptional Deloitte employee experience globally.
At Deloitte, we know we’re at our best when we look out for one another; prioritise respect, fairness, development and wellbeing; foster an inclusive culture and embrace diversity in all forms. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment regardless of their background, experience, identity, ability or thinking style, and if you need assistance or an accommodation during the application process for accessibility reasons this is available upon request. 
The preferred candidate will be subject to background screening by Deloitte or by their external third-party provider.

Name: Assistant Trainer - Software Engineering
Description: About the Institute of DataThe Institute of Data is a Professional Network of Data Scientists, Cyber Security Analysts and Digital Marketers. In partnership with leading universities in Australia, New Zealand & America, the government of Singapore and hundreds of employers, we transform careers for a data-driven world.The Institute of Data operates in the information technology sector. Demand for our training products is driven by the information capability recruitment needs of business. These capabilities, in the areas of security, compliance, operational efficiency, growth and decision making are more important to business now than ever before.Our courses are unlike those offered at traditional education providers. With remote and in-person, you can up-skill from anywhere. Beyond learning knowledge, process and theory, you will experience the real power of practical training by industry experts – allowing you to confidently practice and work in the industry.About the Role We are looking for talented, motivated individuals to assist our lead trainer in the delivery of a number of cohorts between July & December. The course includes front-end development approaches (HTML, CSS, JavaScript), frameworks used to design and create interactive websites, RESTful API design, database design and the basics of full-stack development and deployment. Assessment in the form of labs and project work will also be developed. Students graduating from the course should then be well equipped to take on junior software professional roles effective in web development and related functions.Cohort Information4 July SE FT Cohort: Monday - Friday for 10 weeks4 July SE PT Cohort: Tuesday & Thursday 6-9pm & Every Second Saturday 20 Weeks4 July SE PT Cohort: Monday & Wednesday 6-9pm & Every Second Saturday 20 Weeks4 July SE PT Cohort: Tuesday & Thursday 4-7 pm & Every Second Saturday 20 WeeksKey Responsibilities:Work with the Lead Trainer to fill out and explain the content to teach it based on your industry experience and deep understanding of the concepts and develop assessments based on student professional profiles on which parts to expand. Review the labs ahead of time, so you can work with the Lead Trainer to link the labs to the presentation concepts while they are going through the slides. At times you will be required to give additional training to students that are finding the course challenging. It will be your responsibility to ensure that students have the best opportunity to to successfully complete the course. On a regular basis we ask students to complete surveys and provide feedback. These are valuable platforms to steer cohort success and we ask that Lead Trainer draw these surveys to the attention of students and encourage them to respond. Requirements:1+ years of commercial experience in software engineeringStrong competency with HTML, CSS, JavaScriptGreat interpersonal skills - Written & Spoken

Name: Test Analysts
Description:
12 months contract with 12 months extension options
Australian Capital Territory
Must have Negative Vetting Level 1 Security Clearance

About the Role:
SoftLabs is looking for someone who are interested in the world of cyber and have a passion for developing enterprise-wide solutions at their technology consulting based in Canberra.
This is a unique opportunity to contribute to building Australia’s cyber awareness and resilience. The ACSC requires a Test Analyst to work in its dynamic technical team to deliver ICT software, infrastructure, and services to host cyber security capabilities in support of its cyber security mission.
Responsibilities:

The successful applicant will demonstrate an understanding of the ICT software & systems development cycle and infrastructure testing with an emphasis on test planning, test analysis, test execution and outcome reporting
The person will have broad experience in testing complex integrated solutions comprising bespoke components with numerous system interfaces, including testing security use-cases
They will be comfortable operating as a hands-on Test Analyst within a SAFe context using the Atlassian stack for test design, execution, and reporting
The successful applicant must be a motivated self-starter with strong technical abilities and initiative
They will operate as a peer in a high performing technical team, and require strong organisational skills and attention to detail, and be comfortable working in a dynamic and agile environment

Capabilities:

Conduct software development and infrastructure integration testing where CI/CD technologies are employed
Conducting test analysis, test design, test execution and test reporting activities
Provide input and support to the Test Manager (e.g. to Test strategy/planning). Analyse and report on test activities and outcomes and raise, prioritise, and manage defects
Identify test process improvements and contribute to testing standards and definition of best practice
Communicate and report testing related risks and issues to the Test Manager, SCRUM Master and Product Owner
Take responsibility for the integrity of testing and Work under broad direction as a motivated, self-starter
Key knowledge or experience required include Broad experience in testing complex integrated solutions comprising bespoke components with numerous system interfaces, including testing security use-cases and testing system infrastructure (e.g. network components, gateways, firewalls etc.) 
Experience operating as a hands-on Test analyst within an agile scrum context using Atlassian stack test design, execution, and reporting

Essential Skills and experience:

Take responsibility for all aspects of the fundamental test process, i.e. analysis, design, execution, reporting and assisting the test lead with monitoring and reporting
Experience in the verification of ICT infrastructure (physical and virtual), CI/CD developed solutions and client and server software
Experience in maintaining the integrity of testing and coordinating the execution of these activities
Demonstrated understanding of security testing and fundamental system security principles
Experience in conducting test activities within a SAFe Agile methodology

Desirable skills:

Experience in verifying non-functional requirements (Load, Performance, Reliability, Compliance)
Experience using Jira and Confluence for test artefact design and management

Application Deadline: 05 July 2022
Expected Start Date: 09 August 2022
Job Types: Contract
Salary: As per Australian Market Standards
If you are interested in this position, please click Apply with your resume in WORD and send your details for review. If you wish to have a confidential discussion, call us on 1300 207 208 or 0482 693 975 for more information.

Name: Software Engineer Lead Trainer
Description: About the Institute of DataThe Institute of Data is a Professional Network of Data Scientists, Cyber Security Analysts and Digital Marketers. In partnership with leading universities in Australia, New Zealand & America, the government of Singapore and hundreds of employers, we transform careers for a data-driven world.The Institute of Data operates in the information technology sector. Demand for our training products is driven by the information capability recruitment needs of business. These capabilities, in the areas of security, compliance, operational efficiency, growth and decision making are more important to business now than ever before.Our courses are unlike those offered at traditional education providers. With remote and in-person, you can up-skill from anywhere. Beyond learning knowledge, process and theory, you will experience the real power of practical training by industry experts – allowing you to confidently practice and work in the industry.Job DescriptionWe are looking for talented, motivated individuals to lead the delivery of a number of cohorts starting July 4th. The course will include front-end development approaches (HTML, CSS, JavaScript), frameworks used to design and create interactive websites, RESTful API design, database design and the basics of full-stack development and deployment. Assessment in the form of labs and project work will also be developed. Students graduating from the course should then be well equipped to take on junior software professional roles effective in web development and related functions.24-week part-time course two evenings a week 6-9pm and ever second Saturday 1/day Australian & New Zealand times10 weeks full-time course 9am-1pm Monday to Friday Australian10 weeks full-time course 11am-3pm Monday to Friday New ZealandSkills and QualificationsBachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering or related disciplineMinimum of 3 years commercial experience as a software developer, preferably with exposure to full-stack development for web and mobileSubject matter expertise in JavaScript and related libraries for web development such as React, Bootstrap, Vue, Node, ExpressExperience in Database design including extensive knowledge of SQL and PostgresExcellent written & verbal communication skills including the ability to express technical material in an accessible way

Name: Course Advisor
Description: About Us The Institute of Data is a Professional Network of Data Scientists, Cyber Security Analysts and Digital Marketers. In partnership with leading universities in the US, Australia, New Zealand and the government of Singapore and hundreds of employers, we transform careers for a data-driven world. The Institute of Data operates in the information technology sector. Demand for our training products is driven by the information capability recruitment needs of business. These capabilities, in the areas of security, compliance, operational efficiency, growth and decision making are more important to business now than ever before. Our courses are unlike those offered at traditional education providers. With remote and in- person, you can up-skill from anywhere. Beyond learning knowledge, process and theory, you will experience the real power of practical training by industry experts – allowing you to confidently practice and work in the industry. About the Role An Institute of Data Course Advisor creates the first impression for the prospective students of our courses, which are delivered in partnership between The Institute of Data and our partners UTS and RMIT. As an Institute of Data Course Advisor, you will be responsible for contacting prospective students to actively qualify them through a consultative discussion. This position is a sales role that demands strong relationship building abilities over the phone. You will successfully convert qualified leads into enrolled students by utilising your strong knowledge of the Institute’s programs, and understanding of the student’s goals.  ResponsibilitiesCall inbound leads of potential students to qualify into enrolled studentsAscertain the student's goals through proper questioning, while guiding students into the best program that meets their needs.Confidently present program information, promote and sell products/servicesEstablish positive relationships with students to achieve or exceed pre-established established sales goalsCreate and maintains accurate contact history and necessary updates in the Customer Relationship Management System (CRM) to manage potential students during each stage within the enrolment cycle Sydney or Melbourne location preferred but open to anywhere in Australia. Skills & Attributes1 - 3 years’ sales experienceGoal oriented, ability to work in a fast-paced environmentHigh desire to aid in helping students achieve their professional goalsStrong customer service skillsExcellent written and verbal communication skillsAbility to work independently and to self-motivateExperience using a CRM system (hubspot or salesforce) - preferred Remuneration & Benefits Hybrid Work EnvironmentTeam EventsSales IncentivesCash BonusesMentorship ProgramCareer ProgressionDiverse Team CultureSupportive TeamHyper Growth Tech IndustryCompetitive rate based on experience +Commission with OTE $110K+

Name: Transfer Pricing Consultant
Description:
Australia- - Careers Transfer Pricing Consultant Job no: 518281 Work type: Permanent Full Time Location: Sydney Division: Deals Tax & Legal   Immerse yourself in an inclusive, diverse and supportive culture Thrive in a growing and dynamic team with opportunities to work with global multinational organisations as part of a national, regional and global service offering Highly qualified team to support your learning and development of commercial and technical skills Given the global nature of Transfer Pricing, opportunities to work in global teams advising multinationals KPMG is one of the most trusted and respected global professional services firms.
Through depth of expertise, clarity of insight and strength of purpose we help our clients solve complex challenges, steer change, strengthen, transition and grow in a rapidly evolving Australian and global transfer pricing landscape. We are looking for talented people who share our drive for inspiring confidence and empowering change for our clients, our people and our communities. KPMG's Global Transfer Pricing Services team has opportunities to join our National team as a Consultant in Sydney.
Your Opportunity As a member of our Global Transfer Pricing Services practice, your focus working as part of a team will be: Advising multinational clients across a broad range of industries and business models in Australia and globally to determine where value is created and how business activities should be rewarded, documented and reported in line with Australian and international regulatory requirements. Conducting financial, economic, value chain and benchmarking analysis to prepare transfer pricing documentation and assist clients to plan, support and defend their transfer pricing arrangements with respect to a wide range of transactions including IP and royalties, loans, services, goods and capital transactions.
Assisting our clients to complete their annual transfer pricing and Country-by-Country reporting requirements to the ATO. Supporting our clients to respond to transfer pricing reviews and audits by the ATO. Attending client and ATO meetings together with more experienced transfer pricing and tax specialists.
Developing your technical skills through on the job training as well as structured training on aspects such as Australian and global transfer pricing developments. Assisting clients implement, through the use of technology, operational transfer pricing models into ERP systems. Advising with respect to other key ‘arm’s length’ aspects such as arm’s length debt analyses.
Assistance with governance and other risk standards connected to transfer pricing. How Are you Extraordinary?
At KPMG, we believe diversity of thought, background and unique experience strengthens relationships and delivers meaningful benefits to our people, our clients and communities. Candidates should have the following preferred background and skills: At least 1+ years of transfer pricing experience in a Big 4 or mid-tier firm, the ATO or corporate environment.
A degree in Accounting, Economics, Commerce, Finance or Law, and/or undertaking/completion of the CA/CPA. A natural curiosity about business and solid advisory and compliance experience in transfer pricing in Australia. Strong technical analytical skills with a strong competence in Microsoft Office and Excel.
Self-motivation, proactiveness and the ability to work within a team. High attention to detail, and the ability to think analytically and critically. Strong interpersonal and communication skills.
What we offer you! Our people are focused on creating a diverse and dynamic environment that embraces and values differences. We value the variety of unique experiences, qualities and characteristics our people possess and we share and learn from each other.
We are proud to be consistently recognised as an employer of choice for women, and for our achievements in LGBT+ workplace inclusion. Our commitment to ‘Flexibility’ allows our people to manage the changing demands of work, personal or family life. Explore the links below to hear our people share their experience @ KPMG: Flexibility empowers wellbeing Flexibility enables contribution to the community Flexibility inspires technology & innovation Flexibility supports family
Make KPMG the clear choice for your career and be Extraordinary! Advertised: 04 May 2022 AUS Eastern Standard Time Applications close: 30 Jun 2022 AUS Eastern Standard Time
